key_value.45212: Plant the French flag (loaded in a Trade Cart) on the hill in Castillon (covered with flags).
key_value.45214: The Trade Cart carrying the French flag must survive.
key_value.45215: French soldier: The French Flag has been captured!
key_value.45216: La Hire: La Hire's sword not bloody enough.
key_value.45217: Josselyne:  Sweet Joan … I shall avenge thee!
key_value.45218: La Hire: It is a good day for La Hire to die!
key_value.45220: Jean Bureau: Mon dieu! I am undone!
key_value.45221: Josselyne: It is here that my tale will end …
key_value.45222: French soldier: My lord, perhaps we should defeat the Burgundians and establish our base in their old town. Just a thought.
key_value.45223: Burgundy: Retreat! We must abandon France to the French.
key_value.45224: British: Where is your precious peasant general now?
key_value.45225: British: Do I smell something burning?
key_value.45226: British: You are nothing without Joan. Prepare for battle. We come!
key_value.45308: Capture, and garrison in a Monastery, 4 of the 6 relics from the surrounding German duchies.
key_value.45309:
Because the Empire faces so many enemies, it would be wise to depose of one or two early before they become a real threat.

Remember, only Monks can transport and garrison relics.

Take care to have a Monk nearby to transport the relics you locate.

You can tell if an enemy Monastary has a relic garrisoned inside if the Monastery has a flag perched on top of it. The only way to recover relics inside an enemy Monastery is to destroy the Monastery.
key_value.45310: Capture 4 of the 6 relics from the surrounding German duchies.
key_value.45311: Teutonic soldier: By capturing all of the holy relics, you have reestablished your claim as Holy Roman Emperor.
key_value.45312: Teutonic soldier: Your Majesty, this way leads east to Hungary. We must be careful. There are Mongols in that direction!
key_value.45313: Teutonic soldier: Your Majesty, these Mongolian warriors say they will join our army for 200 gold.
key_value.45406: The German states of Bavaria and Saxony are 'feeding' the armies of Barbarossa and Henry the Lion. Defend the helpless feeders at all cost.
key_value.45407: Henry the Lion: Barbarossa, I have some unfortunate news for you. You see, it is I who should be Holy Roman Emperor! Kneel before the Lion!
key_value.45408: Teutonic soldier: Your Imperial Highness, Henry the Lion has sovereignty over a population of peasants. We should capture them, so that we are not dependent on our allies for supplies.
key_value.45411: Teutonic soldier: Your Majesty, the counties of Bavaria and Saxony will provide us with the resources needed to outfit the imperial army, but we must defend them from the Polish.
key_value.45506:
You are going to need villagers to provide a suitable offensive.

The town of Crema is providing Milan with supplies. Perhaps you should take care of them early.
key_value.45508: Teutonic soldier: The cathedral is ours. So then is all of Milan!
key_value.45509: Crema: The Germans have come down from the Alps. They're destroying our city!
key_value.45510: River Guard: Barbarossa now commands a massive navy. Stay alert lest he should attempt to cross the river.
key_value.45511: Milan: The forces of Frederick Barbarossa threaten our city. Send all available reinforcements!
key_value.45512: Teutonic soldier: We were supposed to make the cathedral our own, not turn it into a ruin! Now the Italians are sure to sympathize with the pope rather than our emperor.
key_value.45513: Carcano: Milan is destroying our fortress. We need help or we are doomed.
key_value.45605: Construct a Wonder within the city walls of Venice, Padua, or Verona.
key_value.45606: The Lombards have a head start on you, so build defensive structures until you can train an army.
key_value.45607: Teutonic soldier: Our fort is under attack by the Lombards!
key_value.45608: Henry the Lion: I will send my knights to assist you, though I fear they will be too late.
key_value.45609: Teutonic soldier: Now we will be forced to rebuild our forces before we can conquer Italy.
key_value.45610: Teutonic soldier: Thus shall the Lombard League realize the might of the Holy Roman Emperor!
key_value.45611: Construct a Wonder within the city walls of Venice, Padua, or Verona.
key_value.45612: Henry the Lion: Barbarossa, I do hate to strike you when you are down, but the Lombard League has agreed that I would make a better emperor. So sorry.
key_value.45706: At least 10 troops must survive to reach the Hospitaller camp.
key_value.45707:
There are few safe places to land along the Anatolian peninsula. Directly across from Constantinople is one of the safest landings.

Do not destroy any enemy ships that you might use—you are going to be unable to build your own. There will be many hazards along the journey. You may need to rely on new recruits in the surrounding areas to help replenish your war-beaten forces.

Advance slowly, scout ahead and protect your siege weapons and Monks.
key_value.45708: At least 10 troops must survive to reach the Hospitaller camp.
key_value.45709: Hospitaller: Welcome, Emperor Frederick. You may rest here with us before you continue your journey to the Holy Land.
key_value.45710: To force the Byzantines to surrender, threaten the Hagia Sofia Wonder by stationing troops next to it.
key_value.45711: Byzantine Emperor: Very well, Barbarossa, you have made your point. I will allow you to use my navy if you will take your looting Crusaders and leave.
key_value.45712: Paladin: Your Imperial Majesty, we must cross the Sea of Marmara to reach the Holy Land. There are two places where we might commandeer ships: the weak port of Gallipoli or the heavily fortified city of Constantinople.
key_value.45713: Byzantine Emperor: No, not more Crusaders! Emperor Barbarossa, I do not want that filthy army in my city. Turn back at once!
key_value.45714: Paladin: Your Imperial Majesty, if we want to use the Byzantine navy, we must invade Constantinople.
key_value.45715: Gallipoli: Of course you may use our transports, my Lord Emperor. But I fear Saracen warships rule the Aegean. You may lose many men.
key_value.45716: Frankish Axeman: How long has it been since we've been shipwrecked on this island? Mine axe craves a Saracen neck.
key_value.45718: Teutonic soldier: No, a Saracen ambush!
key_value.45719: Pikeman: Welcome to Gallipoli, Your Royal Highness.
key_value.45720: Hospitaller guard: The forces of Frederick Barbarossa! What happened? You look like hell! Head for the Castle. You can rest there.
key_value.45721: Teutonic soldier: The ground rumbles as if alive.
key_value.45723: Teutonic soldier: Up in that Seljuk fortress, I spy many onagers. If we could capture those, it would make this trek through the wasteland a bit easier.
key_value.45724: Seljuk Cavalry Archer: Spare us, Crusaders, and we will help you with your dirty work.
key_value.45725: Teutonic soldier: If only we had a way to knock down those trees …
key_value.45726: Seljuks: The Teutons are trying to land! Attack!
key_value.45805:
Deliver the body of Barbarossa (in the pickle barrel) to the Dome of the Rock in Jerusalem.

The pickle barrel must survive.
key_value.45806:
Use your available time to orchestrate an efficient attack. Position your pikes around elephants and your knights near siege weapons.

You can pass through Saracen and Persian gates so long as you are allied.

Invest heavily in siege weapons, particularly Capped Rams.

Convert Persian elephants to gain valuable assault units.
key_value.45807: Paladin: All we can do at this point is attempt to deliver the emperor's body to Jerusalem. The Saracens and Persians do not view us as a threat, so we should have 10 minutes to plan our attack.
key_value.45808: Deliver the body of Barbarossa (in the pickle barrel) to the Dome of the Rock in Jerusalem.
key_value.45809: Pickle Barrel: The emperor has reached Jerusalem … not in the manner he expected, but it is one final victory for Frederick Barbarossa.
key_value.45810: Saracens: I thought these German goats whipped. No matter. They will die as well as any Crusader.
key_value.45811: Teutonic soldier: Nine minutes to Saracen attack.
key_value.45812: Teutonic soldier: Eight minutes to Saracen attack.
key_value.45813: Don't Destroy the Dome of the Rock.
key_value.45814: Teutonic soldier: You have destroyed the most sacred site in the Holy Land!
key_value.45815: Teutonic soldier: Seven minutes to Saracen attack.
key_value.45816: Teutonic soldier: Six minutes to Saracen attack.
key_value.45817: Teutonic soldier: Five minutes to Saracen attack.
key_value.45818: Teutonic soldier: Four minutes to Saracen attack.
key_value.45819: Teutonic soldier: Three minutes to Saracen attack.
key_value.45820: Teutonic soldier: Two minutes to Saracen attack. We must hurry!
key_value.45821: Teutonic soldier: Almost there … just a little bit more …
key_value.45822: Richard the Lionhearted: These are my Teuton reinforcements? I had expected more. And where is Barbarossa? Alas, we shall do the best we can.
key_value.45905: Use the line of sight of your Light Cavalry to avoid unwanted encounters.
key_value.45906: Get your soldiers to the Mosque in Cairo.
key_value.45907: Egyptians: Saladin! The Franks have betrayed us! They mean to invade Cairo! We were wrong not to trust our fellow Saracens. Please! These troops are yours to command. Just defeat the treacherous Franks!
key_value.45908: Saracen soldier: My lord, the Franks have been defeated!
key_value.45909: Franks: The Holy Land is ours now. And soon, Egypt will be as well!
key_value.45910: Egyptians: Very well. You leave me no choice. I have allied myself with the Franks. We will conspire to keep you out of Cairo!
key_value.45911:
Saracen soldier: Lord Saladin, the Egyptians are cowardly and weak. If we station troops near their main mosque, they will surely surrender


if we can get our troops to their main mosque!
key_value.45912: Saracen soldier: Lord Saladin, we have found Frankish armor in the ruins of this Blacksmith! Chain Barding researched!
key_value.45913: Egyptians: You will not enter Cairo!
key_value.45914: Saracen soldier: Lord Saladin, we have captured a Frankish war vessel.
key_value.45915: Egyptians: Saladin, where are you going with that great army?
key_value.45916: Egyptians: Saladin, I am afraid that I do not trust your motives. Turn back at once!
key_value.45917: Defeat the Franks west of Cairo.
key_value.45918: Defeat the Franks east of Cairo by destroying their Town Center.
key_value.46006: Defeat Reynald's raiders, bandits, and pirates before they destroy your allies' Town Centers.
key_value.46007:
The Saracen capital can spare little to get you started. You must develop your own base and army.

Keep your allies' trade routes open and they will reward you.

Assign units to guard allied Trade Carts.
key_value.46008: Light Cavalry: We must stop these arrogant Crusader attacks on our peaceful communities.
key_value.46009: Reynald: I am coming for you, Saladin.  Soon …
key_value.46010: Do not allow your allies of Aqaba and Medina to be defeated.
key_value.46011: Saracen soldier: Aqaba's Town Center has been destroyed!
key_value.46012: Saracen soldier: Medina's Town Center has been destroyed!
key_value.46013: Trade Cart: Help us! Crusader bandits are everywhere!
key_value.46014: Aqaba: Help! Crusaders are attacking our trade routes!
key_value.46015: Medina: Reynald is attacking our caravan!
key_value.46016: Aqaba: This is all we can spare …
key_value.46021: Reynald's pirates: I'll be back, Saracen dog!
key_value.46105:
Capture the Piece of the True Cross (a relic) and return it to the Horns of Hattin (marked by flags)

Note: There is precious little stone in the desert. You will have to rely on the strength of troops, not castles, walls or towers.
key_value.46106:
In this case, the best defense is a good offense.

There are not many fish in Lake Tiberias. Support your economy with farms.

As with any relic, your enemy may garrison the Piece of the True Cross in a Monastery.

Beware the Templars and Hospitallers—they are your most dangerous opponents.

Note: There is precious little stone in the desert. You will have to rely on the strength of troops, not castles, walls or towers.
key_value.46107:
Capture the Piece of the True Cross (a relic) and return it to the Horns of Hattin (marked by flags).

Note: There is precious little stone in the desert. You will have to rely on the strength of troops, not walls or towers.
key_value.46108: Monk: We have captured the European's precious relic. My heart weeps for the Crusader infidels.
key_value.46109: Saracen soldier: The European murderers shall die in this desert!
key_value.46110: Reynald: Saladin! I believe we have some unfinished business!
key_value.46111: Monk: The Piece of the True Cross! The Crusaders' faith will be lost! We must return it to our camp immediately!
key_value.46112: Reynald: Avenge me my brothers, for I cannot!
key_value.46113: Jerusalem Scout: Lord Reynald, we have found a Saracen camp!
key_value.46204:
Destroy the 5 towers defending Jerusalem.

Dont destroy any Jerusalem Monastery or the Dome of the Rock.
key_value.46205:
Cut off Jerusalem's food supply by raiding outlying farms.

The two Orders of Knighthood have outlying bases that should be dealt with before assaulting the city.

Trebuchets can make short work of towers from a distance.
key_value.46206: Light Cavalry: The enemy base is formidable. I advise building defenses until we have a large army.
key_value.46208: Jerusalem has 3 towers remaining. Remember, my lord, do not allow any places of worship to be destroyed.
key_value.46211: Destroy the 5 towers defending Jerusalem so that Saladin's army can occupy the city.
key_value.46212: All Jerusalem towers destroyed! The city is ours!
key_value.46213: Saracen soldier: You have destroyed a holy site!
key_value.46214: Do not allow any Jerusalem Monastery or the Dome of the Rock to be destroyed.
key_value.46215: Master of the Templar: Engage the enemy! Let us show these Saracens how knights do battle!
key_value.46216: Master of the Templar: If you strike me down, I will grow more powerful than you can possibly imagine …
key_value.46217: Archer of the Eyes: Shots from our bows rarely miss their mark.
key_value.46218: Jerusalem: The city is ours! Your efforts are futile!
key_value.46219: Jerusalem: Wouldn't your kind prefer to wander in the desert rather than waste our time?
key_value.46306: Defeat 2 of the 3 Crusader cities: Tiberias, Ascalon, and Tyre.
key_value.46307:
Remember: You only need to defeat 2 enemy cities.

You can trade with the village of Hebron, as long as it survives.
key_value.46308: Saracen soldier: My Lord, this mole was made by Alexander the Great when he lay siege to Tyre in 322 BC. Let us hope we are more successful.
key_value.46309: Tiberias: Lord Saladin, we are weary of this senseless bloodshed. Tribute to us 1000 gold as a show of good faith and we will call a truce.
key_value.46310: Hebron: Wicked Crusaders are attacking our village!
key_value.46311: Defeat any 2 of the 3 Crusader cities:
key_value.46315: Tiberias: Did I say 1000 gold? I meant 2000 gold.
key_value.46407: Construct a Wonder and defend it.
key_value.46408:
Managing a large city can be confusing. It might prove helpful to rebuild military buildings where you can easily find them.

When you are ready to build the Wonder, you can delete some of your houses to make room for it.

Attacking one of your enemies early can benefit you later on, but be careful venturing outside Acre's walls.
key_value.46409: Saracen guard: Lord Saladin, the Shah of Persia is sending reinforcements by transport.
key_value.46410: Saracen guard: French soldiers heading for our walls!
key_value.46411: Saracen guard: Jerusalem heading for our walls!
key_value.46412: Saracen guard: It's Richard the Lionhearted! He's attacking!
key_value.46413: Saracen guard: Templars preparing to attack!
key_value.46415: Archer of the Eyes: We shoot to kill.
key_value.46416: Mameluke: Let us show the infidel dogs of the west a sight the likes of which no son of Europe has ever seen!
key_value.46417: Saracen guard: Those two English siege weapon monstrosities will tear our walls to flinders!
key_value.46418: Construct a Wonder and defend it.
key_value.46508: Wait for instructions from Genghis Khan.
key_value.46509:
You can change Diplomacy settings whenever you want, but don't be surprised if the other tribes respond to your actions.

Only Monks are able to pick up, drop or garrison relics in Monasteries.

The Kereyids are known as the most religious of the tribes and may have a few Monks near their camp.

Use the Objectives button to keep track of new objectives or those that have changed.
key_value.46510: Ride forth to each of the Mongol tribes and convince them to join the Khan's army. Make an example of any tribes that openly war against you.
key_value.46511: Mongol soldier: Four Mongol tribes now follow the banner of Genghis Khan. The rest of the world will soon know true fear.
key_value.46512: Kereyids: Winter has been hard and our warriors are hungry. Bring us 20 sheep and we will join you. If you are injured, our Monks can heal you.
key_value.46513: The Kereyids will join if you bring them 20 sheep.
key_value.46514: Kereyids: Thank you, Great Khan. We will honor our word by providing you with these soldiers.
key_value.46515: The Naiman will join if you defeat the Tayichi'uds and return to tell the tale.
key_value.46516: Naimans: Because you have vanquished our enemy, we will gladly join the horde.
key_value.46517: The Tayichi'uds will join if you defeat the Naiman and return to tell the tale.
key_value.46518: Tayichi'uds: You have done well! We will ride with you.
key_value.46519: Tayichi'uds: The Naiman are our enemy. If you drive them from the steppes, then and only then, will we join you.
key_value.46520: Naimans: We are at war with the Tayichi'uds. Destroy their camp and we will join you.
key_value.46521: Uighurs: You must prove that our people will benefit from this alliance. There is a great wolf, Ornlu, whose pack has been attacking our flocks. Slay him and we will join your horde.
key_value.46522: Ungirrads: We will follow you if you can prove to us that you are favored by the gods. Bring to us a holy relic.
key_value.46523: The Uighurs will join if you kill Ornlu the wolf and return to tell the tale.
key_value.46524: Uighurs: Yes, that is the pelt of the great wolf. We will join you, Genghis Khan. And to seal the agreement, we will give you the gift of flaming arrows!
key_value.46525: The Ungirrads will join if you bring a Relic to their Monastery.
key_value.46526: Ungirrads: You have done well in bringing to us this artifact. We will ride with the Great Khan!
key_value.46527: Light Cavalry: Behold! The horde of Genghis Khan approaches.
key_value.46528: Wait for instructions from Genghis Khan.
key_value.46529: Genghis Khan: You men! You will visit each of the outlying tribes. You must convince as many as you can to join our glorious army. But beware the Kara-Khitai. They are without honor.
key_value.46604:
Kill the traitor, Kushluk.

Prevent the tent of Genghis Khan (Wonder) from being destroyed.
key_value.46605:
To 'persuade' the Tayichi'ud villagers to join you, first kill all of their soldiers.

Since the Kara-Khitai are unfamiliar with siege weapons, constructing towers can be a powerful defense.

Note: The Mongols do not yet know how to make Siege Workshops.
key_value.46606: Kushluk: It's Genghis Khan! We must flee!
key_value.46609: Mongol soldier: Such is the vengeance of the Great Khan.
key_value.46610: Prevent the tent of Genghis Khan (Wonder) from being destroyed.
key_value.46611: Mongol soldier: The tent of the Great Khan has been destroyed! He will be most displeased.
key_value.46612: Kara-Khitai: Kushluk is our guest. It would be most rude for us to send him away.
key_value.46613: Light Cavalry: I spotted a Tayichi'ud village to the north. Perhaps the inhabitants can be 'persuaded' to join us.
key_value.46614: Tayichi'uds: Please, don't hurt us! We can aid in your blood feud!
key_value.46615: Kara-Khitai: We will destroy this great tent. Genghis Khan will sleep in the dirt with the camels.
key_value.46706: Conquer the Tanguts, Hsi Hsia, Jin, and Sung.
key_value.46707:
The Great Wall will give you trouble without siege equipment. Fortunately you can capture some siege units northeast of the Wall.

Your initial base can defend you for a short time, but you will soon have to push into China to find resources.

The Chinese nations will put aside their differences to fight a common enemy. You must wage war on all four at once, lest one of them gain the upper hand.
key_value.46708: Mongol soldier: Great Khan, we have captured a Transport Ship.
key_value.46709: Mongol soldier: The Great Wall of China … Our army is not equipped to deal with such walls. Scouts report a Chinese village to the northeast. Perhaps we can 'convince' some Siege Engineers to join us …
key_value.46710: Mongol soldier: Great Khan, with these engineers, we can establish a stronghold in China and construct powerful engines of destruction.
key_value.46711: Jin: What do a people who sleep in tents know of the word 'culture'?
key_value.46712: Chinese engineers: Mongols! Run for your lives!
key_value.46713: Conquer the Tanguts, Hsi Hsia, Jin, and Sung.
key_value.46804:
In the north, deploy Subotai's horde to conquer Russia.

In the south, the Khwarazm shah is expecting a gift, but it is assassins he will find in our Trade Carts. We must deliver the carts to the shah quickly, before he breaks his alliance with us.
key_value.46805:
Your two armies are divided and will not be able to meet until they reach Samarkand.

If your assassination attempt fails, the leadership of the shah will guarantee that the Persians are a much more deadly enemy.

The Persians are expecting their gift. If they do not receive it soon, they may eventually declare war on you.
key_value.46806: Trade Cart: We come bearing gifts for the shah!
key_value.46807: Cavalry Archer: Great Khan, our assassins are concealed in these Trade Carts. Once the carts are near the Persian shah, the assassins will strike! Without their leader, the Persians will fall like grass beneath our hooves!
key_value.46808: Khwarazm shah: And what have the Mongols sent me? No doubt a bribe begging me not to destroy them.
key_value.46810: Persian gatekeeper: I should have expected such treachery from Mongols. They mean to attack! Defend the Shah! Defend Samarkand!
key_value.46811: Mongol soldier: Careful, Great Khan. If the Persians see our army, they will not accept our 'gift.'
key_value.46812: In the south, the Khwarazm shah is expecting a gift. But it is assassins he will find in our Trade Carts. We must deliver the carts to the shah quickly, before he breaks his alliance with us.
key_value.46813: Assassin: Quickly, we must strike at the shah!
key_value.46814: Merkids: It's the horde of Genghis Khan! We are doomed!
key_value.46815: Persian gatekeeper: You may enter. Our city of Samarkand is just over that hill.
key_value.46816: Assassin: Now the Persians will be an easier target. We die for Genghis Khan!
key_value.46817: In the north, deploy Subotai's horde to conquer Russia.
key_value.46904: Capture the flags of Poland, Germany, and Bohemia.
key_value.46905: Don't spend all of your stone at the Market. You're going to need it.
key_value.46906: Scout Cavalry: Lord Ogatai, King Wenceslas is approaching with a huge army. Scouts have located a region in the pass ahead where we can make our stand.
key_value.46907: Construct 3 Castles within the flagged area, and withstand the assault of the Bohemian army.
key_value.46908: Mongol soldier: Lord Ogatai, we have completed the Castles. We are ready to withstand the assault of King Wenceslas and his Bohemian knights!
key_value.46911: Mongol soldier: All three flags captured! We are victorious!
key_value.46916: Mongol soldier: Careful, my lord. The fortress of Wenceslas is just up ahead! We cannot defeat them man to man.
key_value.46917: Hermit Monk: We've been stuck on this mountain for 15 years. Show us the way down, and we will gladly join your army.
key_value.46918: Polish Knight: Mongols! We're doomed for certain.
key_value.46919: Mongol soldier: Lord Ogatai, we are taking too long to constuct our defenses. The Bohemian cavalry could arrive at any moment!
key_value.47003:
Survive until Subotai's reinforcements arrive.

Defeat Hungary.
key_value.47004:
Because of the ice on the Sajo River, it is impossible to build ships.

We must use our Saboteurs wisely. We cannot train any more.

Siege Onagers can flatten forests.
key_value.47005: Mongol soldier: Lord Ogatai, we must hold off the Hungarians until Subotai arrives. He will be here in 40 minutes.
key_value.47006: Mongol soldier: Subotai should be here in 30 minutes.
key_value.47007: Mongol soldier: Subotai should be here in 20 minutes.
key_value.47008: Mongol soldier: Subotai should be here in 10 minutes. He'd better not be late …
key_value.47011: Mongol soldier: The Hungarians are trying to blow up the Sajo River bridge!
key_value.47012: Saboteurs: Just get us close enough to an enemy building and we will give our lives for the cause!
key_value.47014: Mongol soldier: Such is the fate of the Hungarians and all who would oppose the tribes of Mongolia!
key_value.47016: If we build a strong fortification, we will smash their army against our walls and towers.
key_value.47018: Your armies are too close to my city! Stand down or I will be forced to declare war!
key_value.47019: So be it! War it is, then! You will live to regret your invasion.
key_value.47020: You have defeated me in honorable combat! If you will spare my life, I will give you all of my remaining resources!
key_value.47021: (You will have to wait for any units being created to appear before you can research at a building.)
key_value.47022: You can scroll to view more of the map by moving your mouse to the sides of the screen. For example, move your mouse to the very bottom of the screen to scroll down.
key_value.47023: Villagers can gather food, wood, gold, and stone that you will need to build buildings, research technologies, and create soldiers.
key_value.47024: Always explore the map. You will need to locate some extra resources and find out what your enemies are doing.
key_value.47025: Your soldiers will automatically attack any enemy soldiers that get near them. You can also select your soldiers and right-click on a specific enemy unit you want to attack.
key_value.50010: Standard -- Choose this if you have played the William Wallace campaign, but are still learning your way around the game.
key_value.50011: Moderate -- Choose this if you are comfortable with the game but aren’t quite ready for the next level.
key_value.50012: Hard -- Choose this to face the most challenging aspects of the game.
key_value.50013: Remember, you can change the difficulty level at any time during a campaign by selecting it on the previous screen.
key_value.60005:
1. Bleda may be defeated in several ways; you can change your stance with him to Enemy and attack him, see that he dies in an accident, or refuse his challenge altogether and flee the Hun camp.

2. Look for allies in unlikely places. The Scythians (green) are not on good terms with the Romans (blue) so it may be possible to convince the two to fight against each other.

3. The Huns may only reach the Castle Age.
key_value.60008: Attila must make sure Bleda is killed and return to the Huns' camp. Only then can the Huns ride against their enemies.
key_value.60009: OPTIONAL: Rescue Hun captives from the Roman fort to the south.
key_value.60010: OPTIONAL: Free the Scythian Scout from the Roman fort. He promises a reward.
key_value.60011: OPTIONAL: Bring Attila to the Scythian village in the west to discuss an alliance.
key_value.60012: OPTIONAL: Send 10 Horses to the flagged Scythian palisade so the Scythians can supply Attila with soldiers.
key_value.60013: OPTIONAL: Keep 10 Horses in the flagged Scythian palisade so the Scythians can supply Attila with soldiers.
key_value.60014: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: You challenge my every decision. It is as if you seek to lead the Huns yourself.
key_value.60015: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: Very well. The Iron Boar lairs near here. Let the one who kills this mighty beast lead our people.
key_value.60016: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: This way Attila -- follow!
key_value.60017: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: Attila, coward, fight and earn your right to rule!
key_value.60018: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: Get out of my sight, Attila, and take your traitors with you. I have no brother!
key_value.60019: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: Attila, that boar would have killed me had you not intervened.
key_value.60020: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: Pity that none will ever learn of your loyalty. Archers, attack!
key_value.60021: ‹PURPLE›Bleda the Hun: Tracks, brother. Ride ahead and see if you can flush the boar out.
key_value.60022: ‹PURPLE›Hun Commander: Bleda will lead us to ruin. Perhaps he should not return from his boar hunt. Accidents can happen….
key_value.60023: ‹PURPLE›Hun Tarkan: Bleda is no more. When Attila returns to camp he alone will rule the Huns!
key_value.60024: ‹PURPLE›Hun Tarkan: Bleda wastes our time. Let us follow Attila.
key_value.60025: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: We ride with you, Attila.
key_value.60026: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: Let us go. Bleda will soon seek you out. Some of our families are across the western river. We should see to them.
key_value.60027: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: This road leads to a bridge in both directions. Northwest is the way we want. South leads to the Romans.
key_value.60028: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: This is the bridge of which I spoke.
key_value.60029: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: We razed this Roman camp to the ground.
key_value.60030: ‹YELLOW›Hun Villager: Attila! Welcome! We are not many who follow you, but we will follow where you lead -- lead us to glory!
key_value.60031: ‹PURPLE›Hun Tarkan: It was an ambush! Bleda tried to kill Atilla. Bleda is not fit to rule!
key_value.60032: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: Let us slay the rest of the traitors.
key_value.60033: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: Attila is king of the Huns! He will lead us to victory against our blood enemies.
key_value.60034: ‹PURPLE›Hun Tarkan: And what were you doing in the forest, noble archer, if not waiting to ambush Attila at Bleda's command? We are best rid of Bleda -- hail Attila!
key_value.60035: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: Attila has fallen! Woe to the Huns! We will weep blood and bitter tears.
key_value.60036: ‹YELLOW›Hun Tarkan: Some time ago the Romans captured a number of Hun villagers. Bleda arranged for their return, but I do not trust Bleda and I do not trust the Romans. We should free them -- no bargaining!
key_value.60037: ‹GREEN›Scythian Scout: My thanks for rescuing me. We nomads should work together. Perhaps if your leader, Attila, will visit our village in the west our people can make an alliance. For now, a truce?
key_value.60038: ‹GREEN›Scythian Scout: Wait! I am the son of the Leopoxais, a leader amongst my people. If you free me you will be rewarded.
key_value.60039: ‹GREEN›Scythian Scout: Wild horses have stampeded through our town and scattered the herd. They must be found and returned to the palisade.
key_value.60040: ‹GREEN›Scythian Leopoxais: Welcome, Attila. We greet you with lowered bows. My thanks for the safe return of my son. You are an honored guest. Continue west until you begin to see our palisades.
key_value.60041: ‹GREEN›Scythian Leopoxais: We owe the Huns more than our gratitude, but we desperately need Horses. If you could supply us with 10 Horses we will repay our debt of honor.
key_value.60042: ‹GREEN›Scythian Leopoxais: Attila's honor is meaningless! We will bring death to the treacherous Huns.
key_value.60043: ‹GREEN›Scythian Leopoxais: The Huns have killed my son! We will spit on Attila's grave!
key_value.60044: ‹RED›Persian Shah: You would be wise to withdraw from our domain and pursue your petty conquests elsewhere Huns!
key_value.60045: ‹RED›Persian Shah: You have foolishly tempted our wrath!
key_value.60046: ‹RED›Persian Shah: You play a dangerous game with the lives of your people by sending them into our territory!
key_value.60047: ‹BLUE›Western Roman Empire: Our arrangement was with Bleda! I will not turn the captives over to Attila! You must take them by force!
key_value.60048: ‹PURPLE›Bleda's Archers: Attila murdered Bleda! We were too late to stop the bloodshed. We are left with an honorless cur for a leader!
key_value.60050:
Your scouts report: Attila the Hun (yellow) initially commands no troops as all of the Huns are loyal to the Hunnic king, Bleda. Attila must somehow depose Bleda in order to inherit troops and villagers.

There are three other enemies scattered across the landscape. The Western Roman Empire (blue) has a fort to the south where it holds some Huns captive. The Romans rely on their infantry in combat.

The Scythians (green) have a scattered encampment to the west. Because the Scythians are a nomadic people, there are unmined reserves of stone in their area.

The most dangerous enemy is the Persian city across the bay to the east. The Persians hoard lots of gold, but their army consists of Mangonels and War Elephants as well as a considerable navy.
key_value.60052: Defeat 2 of your remaining 3 enemies (the Scythians, Romans and Persians).
key_value.60108:
1. Each of the small villages (not counting the Roman fort) has a resource: food, wood, gold, stone, villagers, and troops. Your Tarkans will suggest what to do in each village to capture a resource.

2. This is a raid -- get what you can and get out! Destroying some buildings will grant you resources, but it is not necessary to raze every enemy building.

3. Notice locations of resources. You might need them at a later date.

4. The Huns are still confined to the Castle Age.
key_value.60109: Raid the Roman villages. Once you have enough resources to build a forward base, then you can field an army against the Romans.
key_value.60110: Train an army and defeat the Romans by leveling their Town Center.
key_value.60111: OPTIONAL: Give 6 villagers to the Scythian Wild Women in return for their assistance.
key_value.60112: ‹BLUE›Eastern Roman Empire: Huns have ransacked our fort! I fear for the future of the Empire!
key_value.60113: ‹ORANGE›Scythian Wild Woman: You are most foolish to trespass here. If you bring us 6 of your villagers, we will make it worth your while.
key_value.60114: ‹ORANGE›Scythian Wild Women: We thank you for this gift. Your reward waits in the clearing to the north.
key_value.60115: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Now that we have a base, we must train many riders to withstand the Roman attack and then go on the offensive!
key_value.60116: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: The Eastern Roman Empire is fielding their army. We must hasten with our raid so that we have enough resources to train our own army.
key_value.60117: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Let us raze the Sofia Town Center with our Tarkans and see what loot we may find!
key_value.60118: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: The Sofians had much food stockpiled in their Town Center.
key_value.60119: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: The locals speak of wild Scythians that dwell somewhere nearby. We should be cautious.
key_value.60120: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: I do not like the looks of this….
key_value.60121: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: I remember this place. They took several of our raiders prisoner before. We must rescue our Hun brothers held at the Castle before they are executed.
key_value.60122: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: We have captured all of Naissus' lumber!
key_value.60123: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Now these peasants will do our bidding! Let us find a suitable location to establish our camp.
key_value.60124: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Roman gold! There is no other metal than shines as sweetly.
key_value.60125: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: The town of Naissus produces the best lumber in the region. Let us take all we can by destroying these Lumber Camps.
key_value.60126: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: The gold mines of Adrianople deserve to be plundered! Let us destroy all of their Mining Camps.
key_value.60127: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Huns do not need houses! Let us burn these to the ground and take these villagers with us.
key_value.60128: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Now that we have defeated Dyrrhachium, we can easily free the prisoners.
key_value.60129: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: If we attack the Roman fort with too few soldiers, we will surely die.
key_value.60130: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Beyond this moat is the Roman fort. We should avoid it until we are ready.
key_value.60131:
Your scouts report: Attila's Huns (yellow) invade the Eastern Roman Empire with several cavalry, but no villagers. They expect only token resistance from all of the villages.

The exception is the Roman army (blue), which has a fortified base to the east. Do not attempt the invade it until you are prepared.

The other villages may have food, wood, gold, stone, villagers, or troops that you can use to challenge the Romans.
key_value.60204:
1. Although your goal is to collect gold, do not worry about spending it to train troops. Huns make money by extorting the Romans, not by conservation!

2. Destroying Roman Town Centers, Docks, Markets and similar buildings will scare the Romans into paying up. But despite their protests, do not cease until you have 10,000 gold.

3. You cannot merely trade resources for the gold you needed. Your objective is to exact a tribute from the Romans.

4. The Huns may not go to the Imperial Age.
key_value.60205: Stockpile 10,000 gold in tribute from the Romans.
key_value.60206: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: The Romans have given us the gold we need. Now we can truly establish a Hunnic empire!
key_value.60207: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Attila, we have found a gold mine. 'Tis not much, but it will help us attain our goal.
key_value.60208: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Perhaps we underestimated the defenses of Constantinople. We are not equipped for a direct siege, though perhaps we can destroy their docks….
key_value.60209: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: You have destroyed our shipyards! We will pay you 500 gold to cease these attacks.
key_value.60210: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: Curse you, Huns! Will 500 more gold stay your hand?
key_value.60211: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: The Huns have torched Marcianopolis! Please, take this 3000 gold and just go away.
key_value.60212: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: The Huns have razed yet another dock? When will it end?
key_value.60213: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: The Huns have claimed two more Docks, in the shadow of our Castle, no less. Perhaps we should buy them off….
key_value.60214: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: The Huns have built a Castle on Roman land! Let us send them 500 gold as a sign of goodwill.
key_value.60215: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: You Huns are disrupting our trade routes. Take this gold and be gone!
key_value.60216: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: You Huns have sunk our merchant fleet! Just take this 500 gold and leave our seas!
key_value.60217: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: Philippopilis has lost its Town Center. Why won't these Huns just leave?
key_value.60218: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: Now the Huns are attacking the docks at Philippopolis. Can nothing be done about them?
key_value.60219: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: Attila, King of the Huns, if we give you 500 more gold will you cease these raids?
key_value.60220: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: No! You must not destroy our Wonder -- the cornerstone of our city. Take this, please, and leave!
key_value.60221: ‹BLUE›Constantinople: Now the Huns destroy our places of worship. Truly, they are barbarians who love nothing but gold.
key_value.60222:
Your scouts report: The Huns (yellow) have a small town that they will need to defend against early attacks from Marcianopolis (green).

Marcianopolis does not have a strong army, but their town is walled, which can prevent an early Hunnic attack. Once you breach the gates, however, the town should crumble.

Phillippopolis (red) is defended only by a few towers initially, but they will train an army of infantry and Light Cavalry.

Constantinople (blue) is by far the greatest threat. The city's famous walls are very hard to siege but it is not necessary to do so. Extort money from the Romans, and you will be victorious.
key_value.60305:
1. Your forces begin scattered. Look for a good place for an initial camp while avoiding wolves. In the dead of winter, forage sites are hard to come by, but there are hungry deer to be found.

2. You cannot match the Frankish technology, but you do have the strengh of numbers. Unleash the horde upon the cities of Gaul!
key_value.60310: OPTIONAL: Burgundy is willing to join you, if you can convince them you are trustworthy. First they want a tribute of 500 gold.
key_value.60311: OPTIONAL: Burgundy will join you if you build a Castle within the flagged area of their town within 10 minutes.
key_value.60312: ‹PURPLE›Burgundy: Please, spare us, oh great Huns! We would join you if you could only tribute to us 500 gold and then build a Castle in our town to help defend us!
key_value.60313: ‹PURPLE›Burgundy: I hope I am not making a mistake…but for now, we ride with the Huns!
key_value.60314: ‹PURPLE›Burgundy: We appreciate your show of good faith. Now if you build a Castle within our town, we will know that you can be trusted. You have 10 minutes.
key_value.60315: ‹PURPLE›Burgundy: It is just like a Hun to break his promise. We asked for a simple Castle, but I suppose no one asks favors of Attila the Hun.
key_value.60316: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: Our forces are weak and scattered from recent attacks. We must regroup before we ravage the Frankish countryside.
key_value.60317: ‹BLUE›Western Roman Empire: You have burned your last town!
key_value.60318:
Your scouts report: After invading Gaul, the Huns begin scattered. They must regroup while avoiding stumbling too close to Burgundy (purple) in the south, Metz (red) to the north or the great city of Orléans (cyan) to the northwest.

Burgundy trains archers, rams, and infantry, but is not well-defended and might fall to an early attack. The Burgundians are easily intimidated and might even be persuaded to join the Hunnic cause.

Metz makes up for Burgundy's weakness with an army of Knights and Throwing Axemen. Their Castle and proximity to Orléans offers them some defense.

Orléans is a walled city protected by Towers and Castles. Its army of Spearmen, Knights, and Monks may prove a challenge for the Huns.

Scouts also report that the Western Roman Empire is sending Aetius' army to reinforce Gaul. The Romans have no town in the area, but their legions and Cataphracts could strike at any time.
key_value.60406: 1. This battle will play like a Death Match. Prepare for attack almost immediately, but don't forget to collect resources to replenish your losses.
key_value.60407: Defeat the Romans, Alans, and Visigoths.
key_value.60408: ‹YELLOW›Hun Soldier: The Romans have lost. Now there is nothing to stop our invasion of Italy!
key_value.60409: ‹RED›Ostrogoths: Attila! You brought us to this accursed battlefield. Now you must keep the Romans from killing us all.
key_value.60410: ‹RED›Ostrogoths: This river will run red with the blood of Goths and Romans!
key_value.60411: ‹RED›Ostrogoths: Attila! Our forces are being slaughtered! You must come to our aid soon or else face the Romans alone.
key_value.60412:
Your scouts report: The Huns (yellow) and their allies, the Ostrogoths (red), occupy the right-hand side of the battlefield.

The Romans (blue) and their allies, the Visigoths (green) and Alans (cyan), are drawn up across the creek on the left-hand side of the battlefield.

The embattled Franks (gray) have been caught in the middle of the battle, and will soon be defeated. Their fate is none of the Huns' concern.

Among your enemies, the Romans are the most dangerous. Their infantry, Cataphracts, and siege weapons will initially try and hit the Ostrogoths on the Huns' flank. The Visigoths train Huskarls and some cavalry, while the Alans are composed mostly of Spearmen and Archers.
key_value.60506:
1. Do not attack the city of Rome. It is not a threat, and you need someone left who can surrender to you.

2. The Hun unique technology, Atheism, is very useful if your opponent attempts a Relic or Wonder victory.

3. Do not send all of your troops on the offensive if you lack sufficient resources to defend your town.

4. When you do go offensive, make sure you have many fully, upgraded units, as your enemies will work together to stop you.
key_value.60507: Attila must meet with Pope Leo I outside the gates of Rome.
key_value.60509: Defeat Milan, Padua, Verona, and Aquileia, so that you may parlay with Rome.
key_value.60510: ‹BLUE›Rome: King Attila, before we pursue this wanton bloodshed any further, we request that you come personally to a meeting with Pope Leo I in Rome.
key_value.60511: ‹BLUE›Pope Leo I: Attila, might I have a word with you in private, please?
key_value.60512:
Your scouts report: The Huns (yellow) begin with ample resources in the foothills of the Alps. Below lie the well-defended city states of Northern Italy.

Milan (green) has an agressive army that may come looking for you if you take too long to go on the offensive. Milan trains Knights and Archers and has a small navy.

Padua (purple) also lies to the north and may attack early. Padua is known for its Archers and siege weapons.

In the northern marshes lies Aquileia (red), which has few soldiers initially, but can eventually field Knights, Spearmen, and Scorpions.

As the Huns advance through Italy, they will eventually come into contact with Verona (orange), whose Knights, Archers, and Throwing Axemen offer the final defense of the Roman Empire.

Rome itself (blue) lost most of its forces fighting the Huns in Gaul. After the Huns defeat the other cities, they can walk into Rome and proclaim themselves the new heirs to the Empire.
key_value.60706:
1. Some of the folk of Castille may pledge themselves or their homes to the charismatic El Cid when they see him or his soldiers.

2. Most of the stone in Castille has already been quarried for its namesake castles. Almost all of the stone that remains in the area is in the territory of King Alfonso.

3. El Cid cannot yet advance to the Imperial Age.
key_value.60707: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Welcome Rodrigo -- the tournament awaits only your arrival to begin!
key_value.60708: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Defeat my Champion in combat, Rodrigo Díaz de Bivar, and I will give you command of my army!  Let the tournament begin!
key_value.60709: ‹YELLOW›Sancho's Swordsman: El Cid will fall to my blade!
key_value.60710: ‹YELLOW›Sancho's Knight: I would face The Cid, my King, with your permission.
key_value.60711: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: You would face him from horseback? He, afoot? I will not allow that. However, if he wishes, I have a horse for Rodrigo in my stable -- Rodrigo?
key_value.60712: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: The horse, Bavieca, comes from the renowned royal stables of Seville.
key_value.60713: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Very well, brave Rodrigo, face the knight afoot.
key_value.60714: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: I will take it as a personal insult if you leave before a Champion has been chosen.
key_value.60715: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Leave and do not return, Rodrigo. You are no longer The Cid.
key_value.60716: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Lament, for The Cid has been slain!
key_value.60717: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Rodrigo Díaz de Bivar, The Cid, you will lead the armies of Castille. I am glad that you have won; you are the only man I would trust with a very important duty.
key_value.60719: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Rodrigo, you know of my brother Alfonso. You also know of his ambition to rule all of Spain. I need you to travel to his Castle at Golpejera, capture Alfonso and bring him to me so that I may…persuade him that ruling Leon is enough.
key_value.60721: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: El Cid, so great a Champion as yourself must have a charger to carry him into battle. Go to my stable and retrieve the steed that is now yours.
key_value.60722: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: A splendid sight! Now, go back to the task at hand.
key_value.60723: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Your army has assembled -- look!
key_value.60724: ‹YELLOW›King Sancho: Wonderful, with this building you have begun your quest in earnest! I send my thanks and the thanks of Castille.
key_value.60725: ‹YELLOW›Spanish Serf: I am not jesting soldier, get out of these fields!
key_value.60726: ‹YELLOW›Spanish Serf: El Cid! My Lord, you lead the rabble -- er, the soldiers we have seen around here? Forgive our harsh words, we are at your service.
key_value.60727: ‹YELLOW›Spanish Serf: El Cid! We heard you were King Sancho's Champion. We are at your disposal.
key_value.60728: ‹YELLOW›Castillian Army: El Cid! Champion! El Cid!
key_value.60729: ‹YELLOW›Spanish Serf: Our homes are yours El Cid!
key_value.60730: ‹YELLOW›Spanish Monk: We have heard of The Cid's piety and would humbly join his service.
key_value.60731: ‹BLUE›King Alfonso: So, my brother would have words with me? Since you leave me no choice, I will ride back with you to see him.
key_value.60732: ‹YELLOW›Spanish Serf: Clumsy soldiers! Not two weeks ago another army traipsed through our fields and destroyed half of our harvest! Mind your lumbering feet!
key_value.60733: ‹YELLOW›Spanish Serf: That is enough! Oafish, thoughtless, clumsy, boulder-footed soldiers….
key_value.60734: Become King Sancho's Champion in a trial by combat.
key_value.60736: Take command of the Castillian army in order to capture King Sancho's conniving, ambitious brother, King Alfonso. Alfonso's Castle lies to the northwest, across the river.
key_value.60737: El Cid himself must bring the captured King Alfonso to King Sancho's tournament grounds.
key_value.60739:
Your scouts report: El Cid (red) starts alone and can only gain troops if they are granted by King Sancho.

Sancho's subjects (yellow) are loyal to Sancho and friendly with The Cid and might prove helpful.

King Alfonso (blue) is your enemy. He has a well-fortified city. Your initial forces can probably damage his city, but it is likely you will need to train some reinforcements, particularly siege weapons, to destroy his Castle. The border between Golpejera to the north and the Castillian border Castles to the south should have ample space and resources.

Alfonso trains Knights and Pikemen, so guard your cavalry with Pikemen of your own.
key_value.60806:
1. Since you are unable to construct Trebuchets, garrisoned Battering Rams are probably your best siege weapon.

2. Search for guidance from a Moorish holy man living on the lake.

3. El Cid may not advance to the Imperial Age.
key_value.60807: ‹YELLOW›Toledo Refugee: My Cid, you must help us! Rebels are tearing our city apart! Search for the Imam -- he will know what to do! He fled to the lake to the east.
key_value.60808: ‹PURPLE›The Imam: Welcome, my Cid. I was forced to flee Toledo due to the open rebellion in the streets. I tried to calm the Spaniards and Moors, but they would not listen.
key_value.60809: ‹PURPLE›The Imam: The rebel leaders have power because of the Relics that they have stolen from churches and mosques. If you could recover all 4 of the Relics and bring them to me, I believe I could quell the rebellion.
key_value.60810: ‹PURPLE›The Imam: Now that you have brought me these Relics, the people of Toledo will listen to me and I should be able to end the rebellion. Thank you for this noble act, my Cid.
key_value.60811: ‹AQUA›Motamid: My Cid, if you wish to build Castles, you will need plenty of stone. My scouts have located a large quarry to the southeast that may be of interest to you.
key_value.60812: ‹GREEN›Moorish Rebels: They are taking the Relics to that mosque on the island! Attack them!
key_value.60813: ‹AQUA›Motamid: My Cid, if you are in need of food, might I suggest fishing from the lake.
key_value.60814: ‹RED›El Cid's Soldier: The Cid has died ignobly in battle.
key_value.60815: ‹AQUA›Motamid: This is our well, my Cid, though you may drink of it if you wish. I am Motamid of the Moors. If it is true that you have come to restore order to Toledo, then you have my gratitude.
key_value.60819: Last rest stop for many miles
key_value.60820: Find a way to stop the rebellion in Toledo.
key_value.60821: El Cid must meet with the Imam, for he will know how to quell the unrest in Toledo.
key_value.60822: Recover the 4 Relics from the rebel leaders and return them to the Imam.
key_value.60824:
Your scouts report: El Cid (red) starts with a small force that you can use to construct your base. You should do so quickly and scout for resources later.

El Cid is fighting against the Spanish Rebels (orange) and the Moorish Rebels (green) over the helpless city of Toledo (yellow). There are other Moors nearby, Motamid (cyan) and the Imam (purple), a holy man. Neither seems agressive against El Cid's forces.

The Spanish Rebel army is composed of infantry, Knights, and Battering Rams. The Moorish Rebels use archers, Camels, and Mangonels. Either army may have Monks. Toledo has strong walls, so make sure to bring along siege weapons.
key_value.60904:
1. El Cid no longer leads a Spanish army, so become familiar with the Saracen technology tree.

2. Know when to fight and when to run away. You may need to destroy walls that block your path, but only if there is no alternative.

3. El Cid does not view Alfonso as an enemy so much as misguided. As such, you should not destroy anything of Alfonso's unless you are forced.
key_value.60907: El Cid must find a new city in which to live and a new lord to serve.
key_value.60908: Join Motamid of the Moors at his Castle in Zaragoza.
key_value.60909: Destroy Alfonso's Castle, so that you may continue on to Zaragoza.
key_value.60910: Defend Zaragoza by destroying Count Berenguer's Siege Workshop nearby.
key_value.60913: ‹GREEN›Motamid: We meet again, El Cid. You could not have arrived at a better time. The army of Count Berenguer is approaching our gates! Defeat him, and you may have the land outside my city gates as your own.
key_value.60914: ‹BLUE›Alfonso's Soldier: My Cid, I know that the king is irate, but I am certain you do not mean to leave without your trusty Bavieca! She waits for you in the stable to the northwest.
key_value.60915: ‹BLUE›Alfonso's Soldier: My Cid, here is your horse. Do not judge King Alfonso too harshly. We will open the gates for you now. Godspeed.
key_value.60916: ‹BLUE›King Alfonso: That's enough of a head start. If The Cid shows his face near our city again, you may open fire.
key_value.60917: ‹GREEN›Moor Camel: Greetings, my Cid. My lord Motamid has heard of your situation and welcomes you to join him at his city of Zaragoza. It is just a short ride to the southeast of here.
key_value.60918: ‹RED›Knight: King Alfonso is a fool to send you into exile. We will follow where you lead, my Cid.
key_value.60919: ‹GREEN›Moor Camel: My Cid, King Alfonso has blockaded the gap leading to Zaragoza. If we are to get through, we must siege his Castle. Perhaps we can find the troops we need to the south.
key_value.60920: ‹BLUE›King Alfonso: El Cid, we stand nothing to gain by fighting against each other. Let us call a truce and each just go our separate ways.
key_value.60921: ‹GREEN›Moor Villager: My Cid! What little we have is yours, if you can just destroy Alfonso's castle to the north.
key_value.60922: ‹GREEN›Motamid: Thank you for saving my city. Here is a small reward for your trouble. Now you may use these villagers to build your own encampment northwest of Zaragoza. But be vigilant, Berenguer may come again!
key_value.60923: ‹RED›Spanish Soldier: The Cid has fallen in battle!
key_value.60924: ‹GREEN›Moor Camel: My Cid, we should not travel in this direction, for it leads to the holds of our enemy, Lord Berenguer. Zaragoza lies to the south of here.
key_value.60925: ‹BLUE›King Alfonso: I cannot stand the sight of you, El Cid. I command that you leave my kingdom at once!
key_value.60926:
Your scouts report: El Cid (red) starts alone in exile. Do not fear, for you will soon find recruits to your cause. You will have little in the way of an economy until you meet up with an old friend.

King Alfonso (blue) is your enemy, but he is more of an annoyance than a threat. The real enemy is Count Berenguer of Barcelona (purple). He will send swordsmen, Knights, Scorpions, and Battering Rams your way.

Motamid the Moor (green) is a potential ally as are any other Moors you may encounter.
key_value.61005:
1. Save King Alfonso as quickly as possible.

2. The sea can be an important battlefield and a good source of food. Including a navy in your strategy may prove useful.
key_value.61006: Follow the Knight in order to rescue King Alfonso.
key_value.61010: Escort King Alfonso to his camp to the west.
key_value.61011: OPTIONAL: Bring El Cid to the Black Guard Mosque.
key_value.61012: OPTIONAL: Convert the Black Guard Mosque in return for aid in defeating Yusuf and the Black Guards.
key_value.61013: OPTIONAL: Destroy the Black Guard Navy's Transports to stop the arrival of reinforcements.
key_value.61014: ‹BLUE›King Alfonso: You have done it, my Cid! Without their Transports, Yusuf will have to call off his invasion.
key_value.61015: ‹RED›Spanish Soldier: King Alfonso has been killed in battle.
key_value.61016: ‹BLUE›King Alfonso: Rodrigo has fallen! Alas, if only I had trusted you….
key_value.61017: ‹BLUE›Alfonso's Knight: Hurry, my Cid. King Alfonso's forces are deep in Moorish territory and are horribly outnumbered.
key_value.61019: ‹RED›King Alfonso: Rodrigo, if you have any loyalty left, you will save me from the Moors. Please cover my retreat to my camp to the west.
key_value.61020: ‹RED›King Alfonso: Thank you, Rodrigo. Now you must lead my army against Yusuf and his Black Guards. If you can destroy all of their Docks, they will be unable to transport soldiers across the Strait of Gibraltar and must postpone their invasion of Spain.
key_value.61021: ‹RED›King Alfonso: A second wave of marauders! We must flee!
key_value.61022: ‹YELLOW›Black Guard Monk: A blessing upon you, serf of The Cid. You are welcome here. Summon The Cid, we would speak with him.
key_value.61023: ‹YELLOW›Black Guard Monk: El Cid's soldiers! Please, do not destroy our place of worship. Instead, summon The Cid to us that we may speak with him.
key_value.61024: ‹YELLOW›Black Guard Monk: You are most tolerant, my Cid. Take our Mosque under your protection by sending a holy man to convert it and, though I should not, I will help you to defeat Yusuf and his Black Guard.
key_value.61025: ‹YELLOW›Black Guard Monk: Our thanks, my Cid. I feel free to help you because I have forseen your victory. I seek only to bring the bloodshed to a swift close.
key_value.61026: ‹YELLOW›Black Guard Monk: The Transports are the key. Destroy the Black Guard Navy's Transports and you will effectively cripple the arrival of reinforcements.
key_value.61027: ‹YELLOW›Black Guard Monk: Also…El Cid, if you should wish to leave a holy man here at the Mosque, we will teach him all that we know.
key_value.61028: ‹RED›Spanish Soldier: That was the last of the Black Guard Navy's transports. That should delay their reinforcements indefinitely!
key_value.61029: ‹RED›Spanish Soldier: We are halfway through the Black Guard Navy's Docks and halfway to stopping the advance of Yusuf's invasion!
key_value.61030: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: I have learned of Sanctity, now I shall learn of Fervor.
key_value.61031: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: I have learned the ways of Fervor and now they teach me of Herbal Medicines.
key_value.61032: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: I have mastered the poultices and remedies of Herbal Medicine and now am studying the ways of Atonement.
key_value.61033: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: The ways of Atonement are now ours. The monks now teach me of Heresy.
key_value.61034: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: I have learned the intricacies of heretics and Heresy and now learn the art of Illumination.
key_value.61035: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: We now know of Illumination. The monks will soon teach me their Block Printing.
key_value.61036: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: The technique of Block Printing is ours. Now I will learn the might of Theocracy.
key_value.61037: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: We have discussed, debated, and learned of Theocracy. Now I will delve into the mysteries of Faith.
key_value.61038: ‹RED›Monk Studying at Mosque: The wonderment of Faith is with us, my Cid. The Black Guard Monks thank you and have taught me all they know.
key_value.61039:
Your scouts report: El Cid's forces (red) are allied with those of King Alfonso (blue).

There are three enemies, the Black Guard Army (cyan), the Black Guard Navy (Yellow) and Yusuf's Elite Guard (Green). The two land armies field mostly Camel and siege units. The navy trains Galleys and Spearmen.

All three of your enemies have walled cities with many towers, so try using Trebuchets and garrisoned Battering Rams against them. Eventually, you may need to build a navy as well. You can construct your Docks within the city of a vanquished enemy or in the no man's land between the cities.
key_value.61040: OPTIONAL: Send a Monk to oversee and learn at the former Black Guard Mosque.
key_value.61105:
1. El Cid no longer serves the Moors. Your technology tree is Spanish once again.

2. Look for soldiers and villagers who will join The Cid. You will need an army to take Valencia.

3. Know when to fight and when to run away.

4. Count Berenguer's army is mighty, but he does not own a navy. Therefore, you can get plenty of food from the Mediterranean, but fielding your own navy is not necessary.

5. Berenguer's mountain fortress is virtually impenetrable. Although you can slow him down by a direct assault, that is not the path to victory.
key_value.61106: El Cid must once again find a new city in which to live.
key_value.61107: El Cid must flee and establish a new base.
key_value.61108: Defend Valencia from Berenguer until the Wonder is completed.
key_value.61110: ‹ORANGE›Camel: The Cid will lead us to victory against Count Berenguer!
key_value.61111: ‹PURPLE›Berenguer's soldier: It is the one they call The Cid! If we bring his head, Count Berenguer will be most pleased.
key_value.61112: ‹PURPLE›Berenguer's soldier: We claim Valencia in the name of King Alfonso! Turn back at once!
key_value.61113: ‹YELLOW›Valencian villager: Welcome, El Cid, to Valencia. We have suffered much in this war. But those days are passed. We know that you will restore the city to its former glory, El Cid Campeador!
key_value.61114: ‹YELLOW›Valencian villager: The Wonder has been destoyed! Valencia will be nothing but a by-water, and The Cid's name will be forgotten.
key_value.61115: ‹YELLOW›Valencian villager: By defending our Wonder, The Cid has helped to put Valencia on the map! Viva el Cid!
key_value.61116: ‹YELLOW›Valencian villager: The Cid has died ignobly in battle.
key_value.61117: ‹YELLOW›Valencian villager: Lumber is hard to come by in these parts. We will try to give you what we can.
key_value.61118: ‹ORANGE›Lérida fishermen: It is El Cid Campeador! We will throw down our nets and follow him to Valencia.
key_value.61119: ‹GREEN›Denia villager: You are welcome here, my Cid. We will follow your commands if you can help defend us from Count Berenguer.
key_value.61120: ‹GREEN›Denia villager: Berenguer is attacking! Ours is but a peaceful village. We cannot defend ourselves. We should flee south across the river.
key_value.61121: ‹ORANGE›Lérida Knight: It is The Cid! Finally have we found a lord worthy of our service.
key_value.61122:
Your scouts report: El Cid (red) is alone again and this time Motamid cannot come to his assistance.

There are several towns in southern Spain that might prove allies, Denia (green), Lérida (orange), and Valencia (yellow). None of these towns can field a large military.

El Cid's enemy is once again Count Berenguer (purple). Berenguer has a well-fortified city in the north that will prove very difficult to siege. As such, other avenues to victory are a better option. Berengeur relies on combined arms of archers, infantry, and Knights along with a plethora of siege weapons. Construct your defenses well!
key_value.61124: ‹RED›Missionary: We have heard of The Cid's piety and would humbly join his service.
key_value.61205:
1. You will need to expand out from the Valencian fortress in order to procure more resources.

2. Concentrate on fighting in Spain at first. Later you can attempt to sail across to Yusuf's base in Africa.

3. Spanish Cannon Galleons are powerful. You should use them when attacking Yusuf in Africa.
key_value.61206:
Defeat the three armies of Yusuf so that Valencia will remain free.

The body of The Cid (near the Castle) must come to no harm, lest the people of Valencia realize they have lost their leader.
key_value.61207: Defeat the three armies of Yusuf so that Valencia will remain free.
key_value.61208: The body of The Cid (near the Castle) must come to no harm, lest the people of Valencia realize they have lost their leader.
key_value.61209: ‹RED›Ximena: My poor Rodrigo. 'Tis only his horse who lives. But the men must not find out, or they will never have the courage to face Yusuf!
key_value.61210: ‹RED›Valencia soldier: The rumors are true! The Cid has fallen in battle! We have no chance for victory without him.
key_value.61211:
Your scouts report: El Cid (red) has all the buildings he needs in Valencia to quickly field an army.

There are three enemies: The Black Guard Army (cyan), Navy (yellow), and Yusuf's elite forces (green).

The Black Guard Army is north of Valencia and the most immediate threat, but it can be dispatched by a series of quick raids. The Black Guard Army is composed mostly of Camels and Cavalry Archers.

The Black Guard Navy is west of Valencia but can be reached by land. The Navy is better defended than the Army but can still be attacked early. In addition to cavalry, the Black Guard Navy has some Monks.

Yusuf is the most dangerous enemy. His ships may attack Valencia early on and his fortress in Africa is dangerous. Yusuf trains Camels, Cavalry Archers, and Monks that he will attempt to transport across in addition to Fire Ships and Cannon Galleons.
key_value.61304:
1. You must defend the shrines that are sacred to the god Quetzalcoatl. Making new Monasteries will not be sufficient to please him.

2. Your enemies will attempt to destroy the shrines in order to embarrass you before the gods. Therefore, do not attempt to claim the shrines until you can defend them.

3. Aztec Monks are very powerful when fully upgraded. Once you capture a shrine (Monastery) and have advanced to the Castle Age you can train Monks.

4. The Aztecs are restricted to the Castle Age.
key_value.61305:
Capture the 4 shrines (Monasteries) sacred to Quetzalcoatl.

Place a sacred Relic in each of the 4 shrines (Monasteries).
key_value.61306: Capture the 4 shrines (Monasteries) sacred to Quetzalcoatl.
key_value.61307: Place a sacred Relic in each of the 4 shrines (Monasteries).
key_value.61308: ‹GREEN›Aztec villager: I hear the growl of the jaguar. Is this a bad omen?
key_value.61309: ‹ORANGE›Tepanaca: You defile our sacred temple, Aztecs! The gods demand a sacrifice!
key_value.61310:
Your scouts report: Montezuma's forces (green) begin in the Feudal Age with only a few soldiers. These few must defend the Aztec town from early attacks.

Your enemies are three; the Tlatiluco (red) are located to the west. Their army of swordsmen and Eagle Warriors can be dealt with relatively early.

The Tepanaca (orange) dwell to the north of your town. Their walls may keep you out of their town until you have siege weapons. They train Archers and Eagle Warriors.

The Xochimilco (purple) are your most dangerous enemy. They live far to the north and train Archers and Scorpions. Do not engage them until you have many Eagle Warriors at your command.
key_value.61311: ‹GREEN›Aztec villager: We have allowed one of the sacred shrines to be destroyed! I fear the wrath of the gods! The corn will bleed and insects will plague the cities of the Aztec for all eternity!
key_value.61404:
1. Use your Eagle Warriors to locate a suitable location for an Aztec town.

2. Be aware of Tlaxcalan war ships on streams and rivers.

3. The Aztecs have two powerful infantry units: the Jaguar Warrior, which can easily defeat other infantry, and the Eagle Warrior, which is a good counter for archers, horses and siege weapons.

4. The Aztecs cannot yet advance to the Imperial Age.
key_value.61405: Deliver the summons of war to the Texcoco and Tlacopan Town Centers.
key_value.61406: Deliver the summons of war to the Texcoco Town Center.
key_value.61407: Deliver the summons of war to the Tlacopan Town Center.
key_value.61408: Defeat the Tlaxcalans by destroying their 4 Town Centers.
key_value.61409: Defeat your former allies, the Tlacopan and Texcoco.
key_value.61410: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: Emperor Montezuma insists that you make war on the Tlaxcala.
key_value.61411: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: Montezuma of the Aztecs demands that as a member of the Triple Alliance, you attack the wicked Tlaxcala.
key_value.61412: ‹YELLOW›Tlacopan Warrior: Montezuma oversteps his authority…but we will comply.
key_value.61413: ‹YELLOW›Tlacopan Warrior: Now that we are rid of the Tlaxcala, let us rid ourselves of these Aztec taskmasters as well.
key_value.61414: ‹PURPLE›Texcoco Warrior: Montezuma asks us to do much for the Aztecs.  But we shall do his bidding…for now.
key_value.61416: ‹WHITE›Mysterious Voice: These warriors shall receive the blessing of the rain god and will fight with the skill of ten normal men!
key_value.61417: ‹BLUE›Hernán Cortéz: I claim these lands and all the gold it bears in the name of Ferdinand of Spain. Until all of the gold is brought to me, I shall not return home. And to prove it, I am sinking my ships.
key_value.61419: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: Now we can attack the Tlaxcalans. Villagers are being sent by Transport from Tenochtitlan to establish our forward base.
key_value.61420: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: None shall challenge the will of Montezuma and the Aztec empire!
key_value.61421: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: We have found a hidden temple to Tlaloc, the rain god. The magicians say that if we bring 10 Jaguar Warriors to this location, we will be rewarded.
key_value.61422: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: But wait…what is this that approaches?
key_value.61423: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: Who is this man who has arrived? Could it be that the god Quetzalcoatl has returned?
key_value.61424: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: We have destroyed one Town Center. Three remain.
key_value.61425: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: We have now leveled two of Tlaxcala's Town Centers. Two remain.
key_value.61426: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: Tlaxcala has one Town Center remaining. Where can it be?
key_value.61427: ‹GREEN›Aztec Eagle Warrior: We have destroyed all of Tlaxcala's Town Centers. Now they will surely surrender.
key_value.61428:
Your scouts report: Montezuma's forces (green) begin with only a few Eagle Warriors. These messengers must visit the other two members of the Triple Alliance, the Tlacopan (yellow) and Texcoco (purple).

The Tlacopan train swordsmen and Eagle Warriors while the Texcoco train archers and Mangonels.

All of these troops will be needed to defeat the wicked Tlaxcala (red) who live to the north across the rivers. The Tlaxcala are known for their archers, infantry, and mad shaman.
key_value.61430: OPTIONAL: Bring 10 Elite Jaguar Warriors to the Temple of Tlaloc and be rewarded.
key_value.61504:
1. The dense rain forest is home to many jaguars. Be cautious.

2. Tabasco, your ally, lives dangerously close to your enemies. It may be possible to save them, but do not despair if Tabasco is destroyed.

3. Do not slay the Spanish beasts if they can be of some use.
key_value.61506: Prevent the Aztec allies in Tabasco from being defeated.
key_value.61507:
Capture 20 Spanish horses and return them to the flagged pen in the Aztec camp

OR Defeat the Spanish.
key_value.61508: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: Now that we have all of the Spanish horses, they will be unable to send their deadly knights and conquistadors into battle.
key_value.61509: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: This is the pen where we will corral the captured Spanish horses.
key_value.61510: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: The Spanish armies are dangerous because of the beasts they ride into battle. If we could capture these animals, then the Spanish would be much less of a threat.
key_value.61511: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: It is to no avail. The Spanish beasts and weapons are more powerful than our warriors. Tabasco is lost.
key_value.61512: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We do not know the intentions of these Spanish arrivals. For now, our enemies are the Tlaxcala.
key_value.61513: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: The Spanish are attacking our allies in Tabasco. We must come to their aid.
key_value.61514: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We have captured 10 Spanish horses. We are halfway to our goal.
key_value.61515: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: Our runners have confirmed that the Spanish and Tlaxcalans have formed an alliance against us. Now we must do battle with them both.
key_value.61516: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We have defeated the Tlaxcalans and slowed the Spanish advance, but I fear the final confrontation is yet to come.
key_value.61517: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: It is here that the Spanish sank their own Transports to prove their determination to conquer our lands. Cortéz must be nearby.
key_value.61518:
Your scouts report: The Aztecs of Montezuma (green) have a small fortress to the south. In the center of the area is a large cliff and north of this is your ally, Tabasco (orange). To the west is the sprawling city of your enemies, the Tlaxcala (red). To the east are the Spanish (blue). Their motives are unknown.

The Tlaxcala army is composed of Archers, Skirmishers, and Eagle Warriors led by Monks. Their production might be slowed by an early attack.

The Spanish are far more powerful. Defeating their cavalry and swordsmen will require siege weapons as their fortress is protected with cannon.
key_value.61604:
1. You will need to sneak around Spanish and Tlaxcalan soldiers until you are ready to fight. Avoid conflict if you can.

2. Use your Eagle Warriors to scout the path ahead. Use Pikemen to fight any Spanish Conquistadors you might encounter.

3. It is acceptable to damage the buildings of Tenochtitlan even though they once belonged to your people. The city can be rebuilt once the Spanish are driven out.
key_value.61605: Destroy the Spanish Wonder to end their influence in Tenochtitlan.
key_value.61606: Rescue the Aztec warriors held prisoner by the Tlaxcala.
key_value.61607: Travel across Lake Texcoco, where you may safely gather resources.
key_value.61608: Use Monks to capture Spanish villagers from Tenochtitlan.
key_value.61609: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: An Tlaxcalan priest! We must be cautious. Hmmm…I wonder what would happen if we opened that jaguar pen?
key_value.61610: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: If you truly mean to free Tenochtitlan, then we will fight alongside you. Many Aztecs are held prisoner to the north. They would join us as well.
key_value.61611: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: Vengeance shall be ours. We can gather our strength across the lake, but to get there we must steal a Transport from Tenochtitlan!
key_value.61612: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: We can train priests at this Monastery, and use them to capture villagers from Tenochtitlan.
key_value.61613: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: The Spanish thought that Tenochtitlan was theirs.  But they did not count on the strength and courage of Aztec warriors!
key_value.61614: ‹GREEN›Jaguar Warrior: I must make my way back to Tenochtitlan and end the Spanish influence there. But how?
key_value.61615: ‹BLUE›Spanish Conquistador: What are you doing so close to the city? Stirring up trouble, no doubt.
key_value.61616: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: We have reached the Tlaxcala outpost. We do not have time to destroy every building. Let us free the prisoners and escape.
key_value.61617: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: I have heard tales of an island in Lake Texcoco that is covered with gold, but is sacred to Tezcatlipoca, the jaguar god.
key_value.61618: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: Montezuma was tricked by the Spanish. Vengeance shall be ours!
key_value.61619: ‹GREEN›Eagle Warrior: There are Transports on the beach ahead, but they are guarded. We will need several Aztec warriors to defeat them.
key_value.61620: ‹GREEN›Jaguar Warrior: Out of my way, pig!
key_value.61621:
Your scouts report: A single Aztec Jaguar Warrior leads the resistance. He must gather forces along the shores of Lake Texcoco before venturing into Tenochtitlan in the center.

The Tlaxcala have gathered in force along the north shore of the lake and along the causeways. They have many Eagle Warriors and a few Monks.

The Spanish occupy Tenochtitlan. Their Conquistadors, Missionaries, and Mangonels could be trouble for the Aztec infantry.
key_value.61703:
1. This far from Tenochtitlan you are cut off from your resources and will have to search for additional gold and stone.

2. Spanish Cannon Galleons are deadly. Do not lose your navy on Lake Texcoco or risk shore bombardment.

3. Tlaxcala Jaguar Warriors are adept at defeating Aztec infantry. A pity the Aztecs have been unable to domesticate horses….
key_value.61705:
OPTIONAL: Bringing captured Spanish units to the plaza (inside the torches) will allow you to create new units.

Bringing horses will create cavalry.

Bringing Trade Carts full of gunpowder will create Bombards.
key_value.61706: ‹GREEN›Jaguar Warrior: The Spanish shall never again set foot in Tenochtitlan! Let none escape our blades!
key_value.61707: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We have trained a horse rider.
key_value.61708: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: My emperor, we have been studying Spanish horses and cannon and have found that there is no reason Aztecs could not use these weapons, provided we had the proper materials.
key_value.61709: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: If we capture Spanish horses, it is possible that we can train cavalry of our own. If we capture their stores of gunpowder, we could even create some cannons to use against the Spanish.
key_value.61710: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: In their haste to flee, the Spanish abandoned these carts filled with gunpowder.
key_value.61711: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: It is an old Spanish ammunition depot. These wagonloads of gunpowder might be useful….
key_value.61712: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We have captured a Spanish horse. If we return it to our citadel, perhaps we can learn to ride it into battle!
key_value.61713: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We have created a Bombard Cannon.
key_value.61714:
Your scouts report: The Aztecs (green) begin on an island in Lake Texcoco in pursuit of fleeing Spanish (blue) and Tlaxcalans (red).

The two enemies have a combined fortress to the north of the lake that will require a considerable army to penetrate.

Additional resouces can be garnered east and west of the lake, but if you do not focus enough on a navy the Spanish will be able to level your entire town with their ships.
key_value.61804:
1. Tenochtitlan is a vast city. However, there are multiple buildings of each type, so it should be easy to train units or research upgrades.

2. Defend the bridges into the great city from Spanish and Tlaxcalan land attacks, but also train ships to defend against Spanish warships and Transports. Spanish Cannon Galleons can be deadly.
key_value.61805: Defeat the Tlaxcala, the Spanish Army and the Spanish Navy.
key_value.61806: ‹GREEN›Aztec warrior: What are these strange weapons? A gift from the gods?
key_value.61808:
Defeat the Tlaxcala, the Spanish Army, and the Spanish Navy.
