OPTIONAL: Prevent Tenochtitlan's Wonder from being destroyed in order to keep the morale of your troops high.
key_value.61809: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: The great pyramid has been destroyed. The gods will surely punish us for our insolence.
key_value.61810: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We have done it! Tenochtitlan still stands and the armies of Cortéz are defeated. The Aztec Empire has triumphed!
key_value.61811: ‹BLUE›Spanish Conquistador: We have returned for the rest of your gold. Surrender now or feel the wrath of our bombards!
key_value.61812: ‹BLUE›Spanish Conquistador: You are postponing the inevitable. The time of the Aztec Empire has passed. Look to us as your new rulers.
key_value.61813:
Your scouts report: The Aztecs (green) are back in control of the great city of Tenochtitlan but enemies are approaching from all sides.

The Tlaxcalans (red) attack from the western causeway. Their city is not well-fortified and might fall to an early attack.

The Spanish Navy is south of Tenochtitlan. The Spanish have many Cannon Galleons patrolling the lake and their shore is defended by Bombard Towers. It still might be possible to locate an undefended landing spot.

The Spanish army is just to the north of Tenochtitlan. The Spanish have constructed gates and Castles to defend their forces. Expect to encounter Knights, Conquistadors, Missionaries, and Bombard Cannons. The Spanish will use Transports if they cannot attack from the land.
key_value.61814: ‹GREEN›Aztec Warrior: We demolished the southern causeway to slow the Spanish advance.
key_value.61903:
1. The Moslems are attacking outlying Frankish farms. This will slow them down while you send for Charles Martel's army and build up your defenses.

2. The Berbers and Moors utilize inexpensive troops in combat. While Frankish Knights can defeat them, the Moslems spend fewer of their resources fielding armies.

3. You can click on signs for directions.
key_value.61904:
Prevent the Moslems from destroying any of your 3 Town Centers.

Capture the 6 Trade Carts in the Moors' baggage train and bring them to the Cathedral in Tours.
key_value.61905: Prevent the Moslems from destroying any of your 3 Town Centers.
key_value.61906: Capture the 6 Trade Carts in the Moors' baggage train and bring them to the Cathedral in Tours.
key_value.61907: ‹RED›Frankish Soldier: The Moslems have retreated from Frankish lands! We are victorious!
key_value.61908: ‹RED›Frankish Soldier: The Moslems are advancing slowly, but we will not have long before they are at the walls of Tours. Poitiers has fallen already.
key_value.61909: ‹RED›Frankish Soldier: The Moslems have destroyed one of our Town Centers. The rest of the city is sure to fall!
key_value.61910: ‹RED›Frankish Soldier: We have reached Poitiers! The Moslem baggage train is protected inside. If we can capture it, they will retreat back from whence they came.
key_value.61911: ‹RED›Frankish Soldier: We lost Charles Martel in battle today. The Franks may keep fighting, but their hearts are no longer in it.
key_value.61920:
Your scouts report: The Franks (red) defend the large city of Tours to the north. Charles Martel's army is to south of the city.

There are two armies of Moslems; the Berbers (yellow) occupy the western edge of the map. They train Light Cavalry, swordsmen, and rams, but their town is not well-defended and could fall to an early attack.

The Moors (green) have occupied the city of Poitiers to the southwest, making their army harder to defeat. They train Camels, Knights, and Scorpions, but will switch to Mamelukes given enough time.
key_value.61921: Since part of the Moslem baggage train has been lost, you will now need to defeat the Moslems.
key_value.62004:
1. Resources in Norway will run out soon. You must colonize other lands to keep the Viking civilization prosperous.

2. Skalds tells of an ocean where worms eat away at the hulls of wooden ships.

3. The Vikings may advance only to the Castle Age.
key_value.62005: Transport Erik the Red west across the ocean to the New World and establish a colony there.
key_value.62006: The Vikings must build a Town Center, a Market, and 12 Houses in the New World.
key_value.62008: ‹RED›Viking: To build enough Longships for this journey, we'll need gold, and lots of it. There's plenty in the fishing villages of Britain for the taking.
key_value.62009: ‹RED›Viking: It has been a hard winter, and the wolves are hungry. We must protect our villages from their packs.
key_value.62010: ‹RED›Viking: Hear that howl? That one's the king of the wolves. He can take down an army of our Norsemen.
key_value.62011: ‹RED›Viking: The British keep their gold in these Markets. Burn all you can and carry the gold back to our ships.
key_value.62012: ‹RED›Viking: Legends have spoken of this place, the Sea of Worms! The waters here be alive and eager to chew through the hulls of our Longships. We should sail clear of this place, even if it means crossing Greenland by foot.
key_value.62013: ‹RED›Viking: So this be the Isle of Greenland. We should be able to find food and wood here to replenish our fleet.
key_value.62014: ‹RED›Viking: The New World! I claim it in the name of Erik the Red!
key_value.62015: ‹RED›Viking: Wild men live in these forests, callin' themselves the Skraelings. They don't have steel like ours, but they're fierce and they have numbers. It will be a long and bloody winter.
key_value.62016: ‹RED›Viking: The name of Erik the Red will never be forgotten as the first Viking in the New World!
key_value.62017: ‹RED›Viking: To establish our settlement here, we will need to construct a Town Center, a Market, and 12 Houses.
key_value.62018: ‹RED›Viking: Without Erik the Red, we will never reach the New World.
key_value.62019: ‹GREEN›Viking: You wish to see the Sea of Worms? Look upon it and despair!
key_value.62020:
Your scouts report: The Vikings under Erik the Red (red) have few buildings and only a handful of Berserks to defend themselves from ravenous wolves. Although you are safe from attack for the moment, Vikings from Greenland may raid your shores.

The British (blue) have little in the way of a standing army so they are ripe for raiding.

Greenland (green) is more of a mystery, though it is known that the Vikings there have many Longships.

A race of wildmen (purple) are rumored to live in the New World.
key_value.62104:
1. While you prepare your army to invade England, be watchful of Saxon attacks into Normandy.

2. The Isle of Wight, along England's southern shore, is a safe staging ground for your invasion.
key_value.62105: Conquer England by destroying the Castle of Harold the Saxon (orange).
key_value.62106: OPTIONAL: Send Transports to the north to pick up Harald Hardraade's Viking Berserks.
key_value.62107: ‹AQUA›Harald Hardraade: William of Normandy, you and I have no quarrel. It's Harold the Saxon who's the enemy of us both. If you declare me an ally, I'll do likewise with thee.
key_value.62108: ‹ORANGE›Harold the Saxon: You Viking scum forget how to fight this far inland!
key_value.62109: ‹AQUA›Harald Hardraade: William! Old Harold the Saxon's smashed my forces at Stamford Bridge. My Vikings will keep fighting, but you'll have to come here and transport them across yourself.
key_value.62110: ‹ORANGE›Harold the Saxon: Go home, young William. This island will remain Saxon!
key_value.62111: ‹ORANGE›Harold the Saxon: Come down off those horses and see how Huskarls fight man to man!
key_value.62112: ‹BLUE›Norman Knight: The Saxons have the British Isles well fortified. We'll need to transport our Knights across the channel and use them to defend our builders. Norman Castles should hold back the Saxon tide both here and on Britain.
key_value.62113: ‹BLUE›Norman Knight: Harold the Saxon has taken to the seas. We can't let his navy control the English Channel or we'll never succeed in our invasion.
key_value.62114: ‹BLUE›Norman Knight: All hail William the Conqueror, King of England and Normandy!
key_value.62115:
Your scouts report: The Normans (blue) have a large town established in France. Their lands should be free of enemy marauders, but Harold's Raiders (yellow) could attack at any moment.

The Saxon Navy (red) will try to repel any Norman Transports or warships that threaten Harold's Army (orange). You can try to defeat the Saxon Navy's shipyards to the north and south before laying siege to Harold the Saxon's Castle near London.

The Vikings under Harald Hardraade (cyan) are a wildcard. They are at war with Harold the Saxon, but can they be trusted?
key_value.62206:
1. Your Turkish army has no villagers. In order to replenish your troops, you will need to rely on tributes from conquered Byzantine Themes (towns).

2. Do not destroy many buildings of the Byzantine Themes or you will have less to use once they are conquered.

3. This battle takes place centuries before the discovery of gunpowder.

4. Garrisoned Battering Rams are useful for taking out enemy gates and towers.
key_value.62207:
Defeat the Byzantine army.

Receive tributes from the Byzantine Themes (towns) by capturing their Town Centers.
key_value.62209: Receive tributes from the Theme of Cappadocia by capturing their Town Center.
key_value.62210: Receive tributes from the Theme of Pisidia by capturing their Town Center.
key_value.62211: Receive tributes from the Theme of Galatia by capturing their Town Center.
key_value.62212: OPTIONAL: Destroy the 4 Saracen towers so that your allies can mine their gold.
key_value.62213: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: Below us lie the many Themes of the Byzantines. We should capture all we can before facing the brunt of the Byzantine army.
key_value.62214: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: We can capture this by destroying the towers protecting it. Then the villagers will produce gold for the Turks!
key_value.62215: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: With this gold, we can train many more horse archers.
key_value.62216: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: We have captured Cappadocia. As long as their villagers are safe, we should have all the resources we need.
key_value.62217: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: This town will produce gold coin for us now, as long as we can keep the Byzantines from taking it back.
key_value.62218: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: Those Cataphracts pack quite a punch. Better to fire and retreat than face them toe-to-toe.
key_value.62219: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: The Byzantine army is fortified atop this plateau. We must be patient until we have the troops we need to conquer it.
key_value.62221: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: The Theme of Galatia shall submit to Turkish rule!
key_value.62222: ‹PURPLE›Seljuk Rider: Manzikert has fallen! The Byzantines will be forced to withdraw to Constantinople, and all of Anatolia shall belong to the Turks.
key_value.62223: ‹RED›Cappadocia Villager: Turks! Pouring out of the Zagros Mountains!  They'll spare no one!
key_value.62224: ‹YELLOW›Galatia Villager: We surrender! Just spare our families!
key_value.62225:
Your scouts report: The Seljuk Turk army (purple) is far from home and does not have the resources to construct a base. You can, however, train additional units.

Additional resources and buildings can be gained by conquering the three Byzantine Themes (towns) of Cappadocia, Pisidia, and Galatia and the Saracen (cyan) gold mines. However, you must defeat -- not conquer -- the Byzantine army.

The Byzantine Themes rely largely on walls and towers for defenses. The Byzantine Army is a different story. You can expect to combat Cataphracts, Monks, and the famous Roman Legions.
key_value.62306:
1. Because you are in enemy lands, cut off from supplies, you will be unable to establish a town or train new units. You must survive with your initial army.

2. Since you lack resources, converting enemy villagers will serve only to let you repair siege weapons.
key_value.62307: King Henry V must return home to England.
key_value.62308: OPTIONAL: Destroy the University in Voyeni (green) to recover and learn from the great texts stored there.
key_value.62309: OPTIONAL: Destroy the Blacksmith in Amiens (cyan) to recover armor and weapons.
key_value.62311: ‹RED›English Soldier: We'll see how these French knights stand up to English Longbows!
key_value.62312: ‹RED›English Soldier: My King, the siege of Harfleur is lost! We should withdraw before our casualties are too grave!
key_value.62313: ‹RED›English Soldier: The French will undoubtedly harry our retreat -- we must make haste to a Transport that our King Henry will once again see beloved England!
key_value.62314: ‹RED›English Soldier: It is as I feared -- this bridge has been destroyed.
key_value.62315: ‹RED›English Soldier: We may just be able to slip between these cliffs and the walls of Voyeni. However, Voyeni is known for its learning -- perhaps we can recover something from the University there.
key_value.62316: ‹RED›English Soldier: We have recovered Greek Fire -- let us apply it to our arrows and rain fire on the French!
key_value.62317: ‹RED›English Soldier: Those are the gates that protect Amiens. The town is known for its smithing -- we could try to recover some of their handiwork from the Blacksmith there.
key_value.62318: ‹RED›English Soldier: We have recovered armor for our swordsmen, knights and archers, as well as fine blades and arrowheads!
key_value.62319: ‹RED›English Soldier: The nearby town of Frevent is quiet and peaceful; we should be able to rest here, but not for too long.
key_value.62320: ‹RED›English Soldier: The Castle of Agincourt lies down this road. We will likely face many French Knights. The fighting will be fierce!
key_value.62321: ‹RED›English Soldier: Quickly now, my King, board and set sail for beloved England.
key_value.62322: ‹RED›English Soldier: England! A sweet sight! King Henry is almost home!
key_value.62323: ‹RED›English Soldier: Voyeni is known for its learning -- perhaps we can recover something from the University here.
key_value.62324: ‹RED›English Soldier: King Henry has fallen! We have failed our King! We shall pay with our blood!
key_value.62325: ‹RED›English Soldier: A Trebuchet! If we could capture it, the Castle of Agincourt will pose little danger!
key_value.62326: ‹RED›English Soldier: Excellent! The French will regret allowing this to fall into our hands!
key_value.62327: ‹RED›English Soldier: North along the road, men! North and then west to the Docks!
key_value.62328: ‹BLUE›French Knight: Come down here in the mud and you will see how the French knights fight!
key_value.62329: ‹RED›Henry V: If we are mark'd to die, we are enow to do our country's loss; and if to live, the fewer men, the greater share of honor.
key_value.62330: ‹RED›Henry V: Today is Saint Crispian's day, and every year from now on you will be able to show your scars and say that you were here with me on Saint Crispian's day. He today who sheds his blood with me shall be my brother.
key_value.62331:
Your scouts report: The English (red) must navigate or conquer several French towns before they can return home. Harfleur (purple) is in the southwest, Amiens (cyan) is atop a cliffed plateau in the south, Voyeni (green) is in the center of the area, Frevent (yellow) is to the southeast, and French Knights (blue) roam the north.

England lies to the northwest, across the English channel. You will need Transports to reach it.

Bridges are out or heavily fortified down most of the length of the River Somme, but there may be an undefended crossing further southeast.
key_value.62332: Acquire a Transport Ship in order to send Henry V home to England.
key_value.62333: Optional: Break through the enclosure around the French Knights' trebuchet and capture it for the English.
key_value.62403:
1. Do not use all of your villagers to construct the Wonder. You will need some to gather resources and to repair walls, towers, and ships.

2. It is very difficult to go offensive against the Turkish fleet. Concentrate on defenses instead.

3. Greek isles hold additional resources, if you can defend them….
key_value.62404: Complete and then defend your Wonder from the Turkish navy for 200 years.
key_value.62405: OPTIONAL: Tribute the Greeks (green) 800 gold so they will ally with you.
key_value.62406: ‹RED›Spanish Navy: There's hundreds of Turkish ships out there. We don't have the numbers to go offensive, so we should just keep their Galleons and Transports at bay.
key_value.62407: ‹RED›Spanish Navy: Turkish Transports! Don't let them land!
key_value.62408: ‹RED›Spanish Navy: The Wonder is in jeopardy! Save it if you can!
key_value.62409: ‹RED›Spanish Navy: It is dangerous to sail too far into the jaws of the Turkish fleet. We're better off patrolling our own shores.
key_value.62410: ‹RED›Spanish Navy: Our Fire Ships will sink the Turkish fleet to the bottom of the Ionian Sea!
key_value.62411: ‹RED›Spanish Navy: The Wonder is complete. Now we just need to defend it.
key_value.62412: ‹RED›Spanish Navy: Why did our brilliant leaders insist on building the Wonder so close to the shoreline?
key_value.62413: ‹GREEN›Greek Villager: I do not think we would fare well under Turkish rule. If you tribute to us 800 gold, we will ally with you instead.
key_value.62414: ‹GREEN›Greek Villager: Ah, it is prudent for us to join forces againt the Turks. You may mine gold from our villagers or islands and we will tribute you what we can spare.
key_value.62415:
Your scouts report: Don Juan's Spanish and Italian fleet (red) has abandoned the sea to build a Wonder on the beach.

They must defend it from the warships and Transports of Ottoman Turks (purple). The Turks use a variety of different ships, including Cannon Galleons, and will attempt to transport Janissaries and Bombard Cannons across the sea. However, quick counterattacks against the Turks may slow their progress.

The Greek villages (green) are caught in the middle of the battle, but might join you if presented with the right opportunity.
key_value.62505:
1. Some of your Samurai are in Kyoto with Lord Nobunaga. They will not be able to escape on their own, but they can attempt to protect Nobunaga.

2. Defeat the garrison at Osaka and establish your own town in its place. Do not wantonly destroy buildings, or you will have to rebuild much once you capture Osaka.

3. Although a direct assault on Kyoto can be succesful, sneak attacks may yield fewer casualties.

4. Rebel Monks in Kyoto are actively searching for Relics. Do not allow them such a victory!
key_value.62506: Your lord, Nobunaga, is trapped in Kyoto. You must rescue him to restore his honor.
key_value.62507: Establish a base from which to attack Kyoto.
key_value.62508: Destroy all 3 of Kyoto's Castles to punish them for the murder of Lord Nobunaga.
key_value.62509: ‹YELLOW›Nobunaga's Sailor: Prepare to disembark on enemy shores.
key_value.62510: ‹AQUA›Hideyoshi's Soldier: Lord Nobunaga is in Kyoto. We must rescue him to restore his honor.
key_value.62511: ‹YELLOW›Nobunaga's Sailor: We will send in saboteurs to open that wall.
key_value.62512: ‹AQUA›Hideyoshi's Soldier: The rebels in Kyoto have executed Lord Nobunaga! They will pay for this offense with their lives. Leave no Castle standing!
key_value.62513: ‹AQUA›Hideyoshi's Soldier: We have captured the enemy Town Center.
key_value.62514: ‹AQUA›Hideyoshi's Soldier: We have captured enemy bombards.
key_value.62515: ‹AQUA›Hideyoshi's Soldier: Lord Hideyoshi has cast down another enemy. Soon, all of Japan will be unified under a single leader and we can be done with these civil wars forever!
key_value.62516: ‹AQUA›Hideyoshi's Soldier: This village will be causing us no more grief.
key_value.62517:
Your scouts report: Hideyoshi's forces (cyan) begin on board Lord Nobunaga's ships. After you invade Osaka, you will need to quickly neutralize resistance and establish a base.

There are three enemies in this region. Osaka (red) has walls and Castles, but has a small standing army. Hyogo (blue) is a relatively small village. An early strike can eliminate this threat, but Hyogo will eventually attack with infantry, archers and Samurai if allowed to build unchecked.

Kyoto (green) is the most dangerous enemy, as the city is well-defended and there are many Spearmen, Samurai and Knights defending the Castles. Kyoto may also build a navy if given the opportunity.
key_value.62605:
1. Defend the Wonder if you can, but you can achieve victory without it.

2. The Japanese navy is superior to the Koreans. You will need to figure out some way to even the odds.

3. The Koreans are unable to construct Castles or train some of their most powerful units, at least initially.
key_value.62606:
Defend Korea from the Japanese.

OPTIONAL: Prevent the Japanese from destroying Korea's Wonder.
key_value.62608: OPTIONAL: Prevent the Japanese from destroying Korea's Wonder.
key_value.62609: Destroy all of the Japanese Docks to end their threat to Korea.
key_value.62610: Find Admiral Yi and learn of his secret weapon.
key_value.62611: Use Turtle Ships to defeat the Japanese navy.
key_value.62612: ‹RED›Korean Sailor: Korea is free once again!
key_value.62613: ‹RED›Korean Soldier: We cannot drive off the repeated attacks of these Japanese warships. We must seek aid from Admiral Yi Sun Shin. Rumor has it that he has been working on a secret weapon.
key_value.62614: ‹RED›Korean Soldier: With these Turtle Ships, we will send every Japanese ship to the bottom of the sea! We should build as many as we can.
key_value.62615: ‹RED›Korean Sailor: Our coast is now rid of Japanese marauders, but they could return in the future. We should sail to Japan and destroy all of the Japanese Docks.
key_value.62616: ‹ORANGE›Chinese Chu Ko Nu: Admiral Yi, we can assist you in driving off the Japanese raiders, but you will have to transport us across the sea.
key_value.62617:
Your scouts report: Korea (red) has an extensive town, but is vulnerable to the Japanese navy, particularly its Cannon Galleons.

Expect Japan (yellow) to attack with everything they have, including ships and Samurai on Transports. You will need to play defensively until you have the means to bring the battle back to the Japanese homeland.

Two potential allies may be found. Admiral Yi (green) is a brilliant Korean tactician who will certainly assist, provided you can locate him.

The Chinese (orange) are no friends of Korea, but they may fear the Japanese even more. Might they be of assistance?
key_value.63000: ‹BLUE›PANOS: I go to join my forefathers...
key_value.63021: ‹BLUE›PANOS: Come, my friends. Our ship lies anchored at this dock. Let us board it and join our brethren at sea.
key_value.63022: ‹YELLOW›SAILOR: All aboard! Let us set sail!
key_value.63023: ‹BLUE›PANOS: Steady, fellows. We are close to the fleet now!
key_value.63024: ‹YELLOW›CAPTAIN: Our orders have changed. Adjust course men, we sail to the camp of Emperor Louis II!
key_value.63025: ‹YELLOW›CAPTAIN: Scouting ships report a large Arab fleet directly west of us. We should engage them at once!
key_value.63026: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS II: Soldiers of Christendom! We are here to take back the land that is ours in the name of God! It begins with the city of Matera. Messenger, go to the gates of Matera and demand their surrender!
key_value.63028: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS II: Those bastards have killed my messenger! Smash that gate and burn the city down!
key_value.63030: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: Well done, soldier. These fools have paid the price for resistance.
key_value.63032: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: Travel to the city of Oria and liberate it from Arab control.
key_value.63034: ‹BLUE›PANOS: All enemy troops have been dealt with. Let's go talk to the Lord of Oria.
key_value.63035: ‹BLUE›PANOS: The enemy watches this road. We should turn around.
key_value.63036: ‹BLUE›PANOS: Enemy troops guard the road northeast, which leads to Bari. Prepare for battle!
key_value.63037: ‹BLUE›PANOS: Well done men. We should take the left turn and then head north. Stay on the road!
key_value.63039: ‹AQUA›CIVILIAN: Christian troops are here. Let us rebel!
key_value.63040: ‹AQUA›LORD OF ORIA: Thank you for freeing my city from the infidel. I am in your debt.
key_value.63041: ‹BLUE›PANOS: Will you help us siege Bari?
key_value.63042: ‹AQUA›LORD: I would, but infidel brigands in the countryside to the southwest still threaten my land and city. Slay them all and I can be of assistance. Here are some men to help you carry out this task.
key_value.63043: ‹BLUE›PANOS: We have cleansed the land of infidels.
key_value.63044: ‹BLUE›PANOS: That's all of them. We should return to Oria.
key_value.63045: ‹AQUA›LORD: Good! Tell Emperor Louis II that I will support him.
key_value.63046: ‹BLUE›PANOS: My lord, I am back, but where has the fleet gone?
key_value.63047: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: They left. Emperor Basil wanted to marry my daughter. I refused and so he withdrew his support. I will give you a ship to return home if you wish, but I would rather you stayed and helped conquer Bari. You have proven yourself a good soldier.
key_value.63048: ‹BLUE›PANOS: I will stay. What orders have you for me, my lord?
key_value.63049: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: Take my ships and sail to Bari's harbor. Destroy all towers and docks there so we can land troops. Then return to me.
key_value.63050: ‹BLUE›PANOS: It will be done. To the boats, men!
key_value.63051: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: I have learned the civilians in Bari want the Arabs defeated. This means the city will not be hostile to us. However, the gates are still locked, and we need a way in.
key_value.63052: ‹BLUE›PANOS: I know of a sapper that lives in Oria. He could undermine the walls of Bari.
key_value.63053: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: Go then, and enlist his services!
key_value.63054: ‹BLUE›PANOS: Sapper! Can you bring down the walls of Bari?
key_value.63055: ‹AQUA›SAPPER: There is a weak spot in the wall across a fordable area of the moat. Bring me there.
key_value.63060: ‹BLUE›PANOS: The city is ours! Well done men!
key_value.63061: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: Bring me to the main castle of Bari!
key_value.63062: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: My crusade against the infidel Arabs has succeeded! Bari shall be the newest addition to the Carolingian Empire!
key_value.63063: A few months later, at the castle of Benevento...
key_value.63064: ‹GREY›ADELCHIS OF BENEVENTO: Louis, you promised to invade only to drive out the infidels, not to take the land for your own!
key_value.63065: ‹ORANGE›LOUIS: Nonsense. This land will be a fine addition to the Carolingian Empire!
key_value.63066: ‹GREY›ADELCHIS: Then you leave me no choice. Guards! Arrest him!
key_value.63067: Louis was released only on the condition that he would never return to southern Italy again, and Panos took up residence in Oria. Five years passed and the Byzantines sought to reconquer Bari, this time from the Lombards. They sent a letter to Panos.
key_value.63068: Panos knew the lay of the land and had been inside Bari, so the Byzantine commander wanted his help in taking the city.
key_value.63069: ‹YELLOW›COMMANDER: Ah, Panos Nautikos. Tell me, what do you know of the city of Bari?
key_value.63070: ‹BLUE›PANOS: Five castles fortify the city of Bari. Destroy them, and the city will surrender.
key_value.63071: ‹YELLOW›COMMANDER: Very well. You know the lay of the land--take my army and conquer the city!
key_value.63072: ‹YELLOW›SOLDIER: We have broken their resistance! Long live the Byzantine Empire!
key_value.63073: ‹YELLOW›SOLDIER: A large fleet has arrived to aid our siege.
key_value.63074: ‹YELLOW›SOLDIER: One castle down, four to go!
key_value.63075: ‹YELLOW›SOLDIER: Two castles down, three to go!
key_value.63077: ‹YELLOW›SOLDIER: Four castles down! Only one left!
key_value.63078: ‹BLUE›PANOS: I figured there would be Lombard robbers here...have at you, knaves!
key_value.63087:
NOTE: Sometimes, to begin a dialogue, you will have to select another unit. The objectives will prompt you when this is the case.

1. You will have a fixed amount of troops for the majority of the scenario and will not receive many reinforcements. Carefully manage the troops that you have, and guard your precious siege weapons.

2. As with any battle, tactics are important. Use uphill advantage and proper counter-units when possible. Pikemen are more effective against cavalry than archers or swordsmen, and Cataphracts are good all-around troops that are especially deadly to infantry. Luring tactics are also effective against superior forces.

3. When besieging Lombard-controlled Bari, time is of the essence. Your besieging army has the upper hand, but the Lombards will overpower you if you wait too long.

4. Bari has multiple entrances, and besieged cities do not have the supplies to rebuild their buildings.

5. Panos Nautikos and his forces may reach the Imperial Age.
key_value.63088:
Your scouts report:

Panos begins the scenario in an unnamed port, somewhere in Byzantium (Yellow). Soon he will join a large Byzantine fleet sent towards Bari.

In the center of the map is Bari (Red) , a major city and the object of your conquest. It is surrounded by a moat, extensive fortifications, a strong harbor, and defended by many Arab (Green) swordsmen and cavalry.

The road southwest of Bari leads to Louis' camp (Orange) on the beach, near the hostile town of Matera (Purple). Matera is defended by walls, a castle, towers, a small garrison, and a contingent of Arab cavalry.

West of Bari and north of Matera is an open countryside where bandits and brigands run wild.

North of Bari and northeast of the countryside is the city of Oria (Cyan), which is occupied by the Emirate (Green). They yearn to join the Christian cause.

-Northeast of Bari and southeast of Oria is a Byzantine encampment (Yellow) containing a sizable army.

The Lombards (Grey) are the most dangerous opponent. When defending Bari, they will train droves of infantry and archers, supported by Monks and knights, and they will even sally forth with trebuchets.
key_value.63090:
1. Unload all Byzantine troops at the camp of Louis II and array them in formation there, for Louis wants to address the troops. Once all men have disembarked and assembled, select Louis II (orange cavalier).

You must destroy any Arab ships in the area. Scout around.
key_value.63091: 2. Bring the messenger (and only the messenger) to the gates of Matera to offer terms of surrender. If the Materans see other troops, they will think it is an attack.
key_value.63092: 3. Sack Matera by destroying all buildings there except houses.
key_value.63093: 4. Bring Panos to Louis, who is waiting just outside the destroyed gate of Matera, and select the Emperor to speak to him.
key_value.63094: 5. Take the east road from Matera and travel to Oria. Liberate Oria by killing all enemy troops inside the city.
key_value.63095: 6. Descend upon the countryside to the southwest and slay every Arab rider you find! Search the area thoroughly and clear all of the roads as well! Once you have slain them all, return to Oria's lord.
key_value.63096: 7. Bring Panos back to Louis' camp to report the victory at Oria and receive further orders from Louis.
key_value.63097: 8. Sail to Bari harbor and destroy all docks, ships, and towers there, in order to cut the enemy's supplies. Try not to lose any transport ships; you will need them later. Once done, return to Louis.
key_value.63098: 9. Go to the castle of Oria, where the sapper is waiting for you.
key_value.63099: 10. Bring the sapper to the weak spot in the wall.
key_value.63100:
11. Panos' men have breached the walls of Bari. The Barians are Christian and not hostile towards you but you must cleanse the city of the occupying Arab troops to conquer it.

In other words: Defeat the Emirate of Bari.
key_value.63101:
12. Bring Louis to Bari Castle.

Note: Now that the city has fallen, the gates in the harbor are now open.
key_value.63102: 13. Bring Panos to the commander of the Byzantine camp to the east.
key_value.63103: 14. Destroy the five castles defending Bari so the Byzantines can conquer the city.
key_value.63507:
1. Use good tactics, counter units, and uphill advantage when fighting. Often, you will need all the advantages you can get!

2. Always follow the objectives on the Objectives screen as well as prompts ingame- they contain useful advice!

3. There are lots of secrets, rewards, and quests for those who explore the map. Even revisiting places that you have already been to can prove helpful, but make sure that you always bring Michael along. He is your leader and whoever you see will want to talk to him.

4. You will need the support of the locals to fight the Rebels. A castle and a good port in particular are crucial. The town of Potenza has both of these.

5. The rebels will control an advanced and prosperous city compared to your small towns. This means they will have superior technology and produce more advanced units than you. However, they cannot rebuild military buildings as they are under siege.

6. Michael Nautikos can only reach the Castle Age and cannot build most fortifications.
key_value.63508:
Your scouts report:

The city of Bari (Purple), Michael's home, is located in Apulia, south Italy, on the shore of the Adriatic Sea. It is heavily fortified on all sides with a strong wall and many towers and castles.

On the northeast side, Melus' castle overlooks a large harbor.

Bari is garrisoned by Byzantine Tagmata units (Yellow) and Melus' soldiers (Red) - Lombards, Goths, and Normans.

The road east from Bari leads to the friendly port city of Brindisi (Cyan), a major trading partner of Bari and part of the Byzantine Empire.
key_value.63526: ‹RED›MELUS: Michael, you must travel along the beach to the Lombard village in the north to recruit more men to fight the rebels.
key_value.63528: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: But my lord, why recruit Lombards? Are we not defended well enough by the Byzantine Tagmata garrison?
key_value.63530: ‹RED›MELUS: No, and that is none of your concern. Now go!
key_value.63533: 1. Bring Michael to the Chieftain (cloaked man) of the Lombard village in the north.
key_value.63534: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Melus of Bari demands more men to garrison the city.
key_value.63535: Select the Lombard chieftain to continue.
key_value.63538: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: What are all of these brigands doing here?
key_value.63540: ‹GREEN›GUARD: Are you mad? Rebels patrol the forest, going there is suicide!
key_value.63541: ‹GREEN›CHIEFTAIN: The rebels threaten us too, friend. Melus of Bari will have no men until the rebels attack us no more.
key_value.63543: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Very well, I shall bring your reply to Melus.
key_value.63545: ‹RED›MELUS: Michael, why have you not brought more men?
key_value.63547: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: The Lombards refused to give us any. Their village is under constant attacks by the rebels.
key_value.63549: ‹RED›MELUS: Useless fools! I will deal with them later. For now, I want you to force the leader of Brindisi to pay us tribute. The money will help us defend Bari from the rebels.
key_value.63551: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: My lord, I need more men.
key_value.63553: ‹RED›MELUS: Yes, take these Tagmata and Varangians. Bring me back some gold!
key_value.63554: 3. Bring Michael to the church in Brindisi and meet with the city's leader, a monk.
key_value.63555: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: I am here on behalf of Melus of Bari, who demands you pay tribute to him.
key_value.63557: ‹AQUA›MONK: Why should we pay Melus? He will just use the money to rebel against the Empire!
key_value.63559: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Nonsense! Lord Melus is defending Bari from the rebels.
key_value.63561: ‹AQUA›MONK: Why then does Melus fill his city with Lombard and Norman soldiers, men who answer only to him and not the Empire?
key_value.63563: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: *to himself* I was wondering the same thing... *aloud* I will speak no more of this. You must deliver the tribute to Melus.
key_value.63565: ‹AQUA›MONK: Very well, I see your mind cannot be changed. Take the gold and go back to Bari.
key_value.63567: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Thank you. Melus will be pleased.
key_value.63568: 4. Bring Michael and his men back to Melus in Bari.
key_value.63569: ‹RED›MELUS: Kill all of the Byzantine scum!
key_value.63570: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: My God! A rebellion has broken out! We must get to Melus!
key_value.63571: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Look! Melus is the one leading the rebellion! We must escape out the gate to the west!
key_value.63572: 5. Michael and his men must escape to the west and seek refuge somewhere.
key_value.63573: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Look, a Lombard camp! Let me go talk to them, perhaps they can help us.
key_value.63574: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Friend, my men and I have fled the city of Bari. It has rebelled under the leadership of Melus. Can you help us?
key_value.63575: Select the cloaked Theign to continue.
key_value.63576: ‹GREEN›THEIGN: We have heard of this rebel and I assure you we have no sympathy for him so we will help you. My brethren have a village to the north of here.
key_value.63580: ‹GREEN›THEIGN: Then you will know that they are under constant threat from the rebels. Brave as you and your men are, you are not numerous enough to defeat all of them. You need more support.
key_value.63584: ‹GREEN›THEIGN: There are two places where you might find support for your cause.
key_value.63585: ‹GREEN›The town of Capua, which is held by the Normans who are not loyal to Melus and will help you,
key_value.63586: ‹GREEN›and the city of Potenza, a commercial trading center on the river with a large harbor.
key_value.63587: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: But if there are so many rebels, how will we make it there alive?
key_value.63589: ‹GREEN›THEIGN: You will have to be cautious. I will sneak through the mountains to the other village, but my men will help you fight. Good luck!
key_value.63592: 6. Bring Michael to the Norman town of Capua and meet with its lord to ask for help.
key_value.63593: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Friend, we flee the rebellion of Melus in Bari. Will you help us defeat him?
key_value.63594: ‹GREY›NORMAN: We will help you, but we need something in return. A pilgrim convoy carrying a sacred relic was ambushed by rebels in the swamp. If you bring this relic to our church, we will join you. Our town priest and some men will accompany you.
key_value.63596: 7. Bring the relic in the swamp to Capua's church.
key_value.63597: ‹GREY›NORMAN: Well done indeed. We will join you!
key_value.63598: -Bring Michael to Potenza and ask for help from their leader.
key_value.63599: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Will you aid us in our fight with Melus?
key_value.63600: ‹AQUA›POTENZA'S LEADER: I would, but a rebel fortress looms over our town.
key_value.63601: ‹AQUA›POTENZA'S LEADER: Destroy it, and we will join you.
key_value.63602: -Destroy the rebel encampment (all towers, barracks, and archery range) and kill Dattus of Bari (red knight). Then bring Michael back to Potenza's lord.
key_value.63603: ‹AQUA›POTENZA'S LEADER: Smoke rises from the rebel encampment, and our town is freed. We will join you!
key_value.63604: ‹GREEN›MINER: So you are the great man who fights the rebels. We will mine gold for you!
key_value.63605: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: Let's build up an army quickly! Once he finds our town, Melus will attack!
key_value.63606: ‹GREEN›CHIEFTAIN: Ah, Michael, you are back, and fighting Melus this time. If you build a tower near the beach to defend us from Melus, we will help you fight him.
key_value.63607: -Build a tower on the spot marked by the flag to protect the Lombard village from the rebels.
key_value.63609:
8. Defeat the rebels by destroying all military and economic buildings, soldiers, and ships. Do not worry about destroying Bari, it can be rebuilt after the rebellion is quashed.

Once Bari is recaptured and the rebels defeated, bring Michael to the courtyard of Melus' castle.
key_value.63610: ‹BLUE›MICHAEL: We have won the battle, but where is Melus?
key_value.64003:
1. Always look to defend chokepoints, use counter-units and elevation, and possibly encircle your opposition. The Normans will invariably outnumber you so you need to find ways to even the odds.

2. Beware of the numerous Norman patrols roaming the countryside and the Norman camps.

3. Enemy units will not dodge projectiles if you use the attack ground feature.

4. Sandbars will sink any ship that inadvertantly sails into them.

5. Andreas Nautikos will have access to all of the finest soldiers that Bari has to offer- Tagmata (Two-handed swordsmen), Varangians (Halberdiers), Crossbowmen, Elite skirmishers, Light Cavalry, Knights, certain siege units, and some ships.
key_value.64004:
Your scouts report:

Andreas Nautikos is being briefed by the catepan of Bari, Stephanos Pateranos.

The city of Bari (Purple) is a bustling harbor city on the Adriatic coast, but is currently besieged by vast armies of Normans.

The Normans (Grey) are your most dangerous opponent. They have encircled the city of Bari with several camps, and will attack with droves of swordsmen, crossbowmen, skirmishers, spearmen, siege, and their fearsome knights.

The Adriatic sea is a good potential escape route from Bari, but the waters outside Bari are patrolled by several Norman vessels.
key_value.64047: In memorial of the great dog Jayko
key_value.64048: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: Sir Andreas Nautikos. You, being part of one of the most prominent families in Bari, will be honored with an important task. You will reinforce our camp in the south.
key_value.64049: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: The camp guards the few farms we still have. It is essential that we stave off the famine. This supply of food must keep going!
key_value.64050: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: I will not fail you, my lord.
key_value.64051: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: Take this patrol with you. These are the few I can afford to spare- use them wisely.
key_value.64052: ‹PURPLE›TAGMATA GUARD: Good luck, Andreas! I would suggest you don't dawdle. You don't want to wander around too much with these Normans on the prowl.
key_value.64054: 1. Bring Andreas and his men to the camp marked by the flag.
key_value.64055: ‹PURPLE›CAPTAIN: Sir Nautikos! I'm glad to see you here. We could really use your help- the Normans attack this camp regularly.
key_value.64056: ‹PURPLE›CAPTAIN: The farms must be protected at all costs. We need them to supply the city with all the food we can get.
key_value.64057: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Not to worry. With my reinforcements and your expertise, we'll see them off!
key_value.64058: ‹BLUE›BYZANTINE SOLDIER: The Normans are on their way to our position!
key_value.64059: ‹BLUE›BYZANTINE SOLDIER: We've lost many, and the Norman onslaught isn't letting up... I fear we've met our match.
key_value.64060: 2. Defend the camp against Norman attacks. You will lose if the barracks are destroyed.
key_value.64061: ‹PURPLE›BYZANTINE SOLDIER: Our Captain has been killed!
key_value.64062: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: I see... This is the most we can do. Let us hope the food we have now is plenty.
key_value.64064: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: We had better rush back to the gates. Make sure these carts arrive at the granary in one piece!
key_value.64065: 3. Escort the two food carts to the granary marked by the flag. You will lose if either cart is destroyed.
key_value.64066: ‹BLUE›BYZANTINE SOLDIER: With this food, the city will last a few more days- let us hope that will suffice.
key_value.64067: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: We've made it. Let's go see the Catepan for further instructions.
key_value.64068: ‹PURPLE›TAGMATA CAPTAIN: Hurry up, you lot! The Normans aren't going to wait for you to arrive!
key_value.64069: 4. Bring Andreas to Stephanos Pateranos, at Bari's keep.
key_value.64070: 5. Bring Andreas to the Tagmata Captain.
key_value.64071: ‹PURPLE›TAGMATA CAPTAIN: Why are you here? The Normans are about to assault our walls! Move!
key_value.64073: ‹PURPLE›TAGMATA CAPTAIN: Where do you think he is? He's already at the breach! Now move along!
key_value.64074: 6. Meet with Catepan Stephanos Pateranos near the breach in the wall.
key_value.64075: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: Ah, sir Nautikos. I'm glad you've made it in time. I've been informed of your actions at the camp. You did well.
key_value.64077: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: I need to attend to a counterattack on a Norman position elsewhere, so I require that you organise the defences here. Understood?
key_value.64079: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: Best of luck, sir Nautikos.
key_value.64080: ‹PURPLE›DOCTOR: Andreas Nautikos? Your men look exhausted... I cannot allow them to fight anymore. They need help.
key_value.64081: ‹PURPLE›DOCTOR: I will take them to my monastery... They need some rest!
key_value.64083: ‹PURPLE›SOLDIER: This collapsed building is blocking the street!
key_value.64084: 7. Head to the walls of Bari and take over the command.
key_value.64085: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: I suppose there's only one thing to do. For Bari, men!
key_value.64086: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: We must act swiftly. We'll soon run out of resources for our troops, and the Normans aren't letting up. We have intelligence telling us they have several caches of supplies not far from here- We should plunder them!
key_value.64087: ‹BLUE›BYZANTINE SOLDIER: We've lost a Food Cart!
key_value.64088: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: They've brought down the gate! To arms!
key_value.64093: 8. Destroy three of the four marked buildings (lumberyard, barracks, mill and archery range), while preventing the destruction of any of your own military structures. You will obtain resources to train more troops when you raze any of these buildings.
key_value.64094: -Destroy the monastery deep in the Norman lines.
key_value.64095: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: The monastery has been taken down! Look at that gold...
key_value.64096: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: That will hold them off for a while!
key_value.64097: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: Charge, my fellow warriors! Break their line!
key_value.64098: ‹PURPLE›MESSENGER: The Catepan requires your aid! A tower controlled by the Normans has our fleet pinned down and our cavalry can't break them!
key_value.64099: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: Can you believe it? I bought a trebuchet from a Norman soldier! This one is going to the docks, where I can display it to my colleagues.
key_value.64100: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Hm, I might have an idea...
key_value.64101: 9. Head to the trebuchet in the docks.
key_value.64102: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: What's the matter? Need anything?
key_value.64103: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Well, uhm... I was wondering if you could let me have your trebuchet, if you don't mind.
key_value.64104: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: Have my trebuchet? What for?
key_value.64105: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: I don't know if you happened to notice, but the Normans have the city surrounded. Your trebuchet would be a valuable asset in taking down an important enemy position.
key_value.64106: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: I'm not going to hand it over to the first person who asks. Unless...
key_value.64107: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: One of my trade vessels has crashed into a nearby sandbank a couple of weeks ago. If you bring it back for me, the trebuchet is yours.
key_value.64108: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: All I can spare to aid you in this task is this ship. My assistant Cranos will guide you through the process.
key_value.64111: ‹BLUE›CRANOS: The ship has been repaired. Time to get out of here!
key_value.64112: 10. Repair the ship of Loukas Procopius and bring it back to the docks of Bari.
key_value.64113: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: I am very grateful Thank you for returning my ship!
key_value.64114: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: You can have my trebuchet, as promised.
key_value.64115: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: The Normans are attacking the docks. Run!
key_value.64116: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Good to know this trebuchet functions properly.
key_value.64117: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: I had work to do here, I was not being slothful. Don't look at me like that...
key_value.64119: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Let's bring this trebuchet to the Catepan.
key_value.64120: 12. Bring Andreas and the trebuchet to Stephanos Pateranos.
key_value.64121: ‹PURPLE›TAGMATA CAPTAIN: You again? ...Where did you get that siege weapon from?
key_value.64122: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: A trader gave it to me for running an errand for him. I heard we need to neutralize a Norman tower and I thought it would be just the tool for the job.
key_value.64123: ‹PURPLE›TAGMATA CAPTAIN: Didn't know it was the season for trebuchets... But anyway, I fear it's too risky to use this device. It's seen some years and I don't feel like facing the Catepan's wrath in case we fail.
key_value.64124: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: So you prefer to sit here and twiddle your thumbs? I doubt that'll make the Catepan any happier...
key_value.64125: ‹PURPLE›TAGMATA CAPTAIN: If you so insist... I would advise setting it up near our walls. This will force the Normans to come in the range of our towers to try and dismantle it.
key_value.64126: You will lose if the trebuchet gets destroyed.
key_value.64129: ‹PURPLE›STEPHANOS PATERANOS: What? An attack? I have not commenced any attack!
key_value.64131: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: The streets sure are empty... Several have somehow escaped the city walls, many more have fought to their deaths and the rest dares not leave their homes. At times like this I reminisce of the days of prosperity...
key_value.64133: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: Our Catepan is in danger! We must come to his aid!
key_value.64134: 14. Normans are attacking Stephanos Pateranos from behind. Prevent him from getting killed.
key_value.64136: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: The sea is ours again! Full assault!
key_value.64137: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: The Normans are sending more ships to reinforce their docks!
key_value.64140: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Now that the Norman ships are preoccupied with our fleet, it would probably be best to leave the city by sea.
key_value.64141: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: I fear Michael was right. Bari will soon fall because of the sheer amount of Normans. We do not have enough men to keep the Normans at bay for long anymore.
key_value.64142: 16. Head to the docks of Bari.
key_value.64143: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: Ah, I see you still draw breath. How fares my trebuchet?
key_value.64144: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: It pulled us through. I was wondering what you were doing here, sir Procopius.
key_value.64145: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS:  I was thinking of, uh... paying my family back in Greece a visit. It seemed like the right time, now that the Norman fleet is, well, preoccupied.
key_value.64147: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: Of course I don't mind! Without Cranos around, I could really use an extra pair of arms.
key_value.64148: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: I thought I was missing someone. Where is he now?
key_value.64149: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: He's off waging war with the Normans. He is a sailor, after all.
key_value.64150: ‹PURPLE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: But enough chatter. All aboard!
key_value.64151: ‹BLUE›LOUKAS PROCOPIUS: Let us go! Mind the sandbanks though...
key_value.64154: Loukas Procopius must survive and the transport ship must not be destroyed.
key_value.64155: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: We must lose those tailing galleys first!
key_value.64157: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Argh... I die for my city!
key_value.64163: ‹BLUE›ANDREAS: Our transport ship has been destroyed!
key_value.64166: ‹PURPLE›MAN: These ruins have actually been around for centuries... But with the Normans destroying everything in sight, you couldn't even tell, could you?
key_value.64507:
1. You can click on the local people (Red) to ask them about the countryside. Some will give you valuable information, while others are blatant liars.

2. During some missions, you will need to protect specific units. You need a cart to pick up hay, and a monk to heal the injured man in the fortress. If either of these units die, you will lose.

3. You will control a limited number of units for the entire scenario and will only receive reinforcements upon completing missions. Therefore, properly managing your troops is crucial.

4. Some quests will have to be completed before others. For example, you can only use the water from Luigeusi's aqueduct after proving your mettle to him.

5. Carmagnola's fortress in the west is well-guarded and should be avoided before you have united all of the captains under one banner.
key_value.64508:
Your scouts report:

A Company of condottieri under the Sforzas are marching west to attack Carmagnola, but first need a way to ford the river.

Villagers in the small town (Red) know the lay of the land, and are sure to be of some help.

The condottiero bands have camped out in the countryside:

-Captain Johannes (Yellow) has taken up camp slightly west of the local village.

-Captain Bontolmo (Cyan) has taken residence in an abandoned fortress to the north of a swamp.

-Captain Luiguesi (Purple) has camped with his siege near the eastern cliffs.

-Captain Marcelo (Grey) has taken residence around an old watchtower to the east of the village.

-Captain Guitano (Orange) and his cavalry have taken up camp in an old barn to the south of the swamp.

Raiders (Green) in the pay of Carmagnola have poured out of their fortress in the west of the map and now pillage the countryside. Their infantry, archers, and light cavalry should be no match for a strong condottiero force, but the fortress will require siege weapons to breach.
key_value.64519: ‹RED›MUZIO SFORZA: Men! Do you want Carmagnola to sit, invincible in his fortress? Do you want this campaign to last as long as this rain has? Then stop complaining! We march!
key_value.64520: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Father, one of the captains is being too soft on the men... giving them one and a half rations, giving them breaks on the march...it is only murmurs but what should we do about this?
key_value.64521: ‹RED›MUZIO SFORZA: We will speak of this later, we must focus on marching. However, I do want to know which bastard is letting my men go soft. Keep your eyes open and be wary.
key_value.64523: ‹RED›MUZIO SFORZA: Hmph. The scouts said this river would be flooded. No matter. If we are cautious enough, we can cross here!
key_value.64524: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Should we even attempt the river at all? There is a ford to the southwest.
key_value.64525: ‹RED›MUZIO SFORZA: Francesco! You have two options: Grow up, or be a craven coward and cross down there. I will cross here!
key_value.64526: ‹RED›MUZIO SFORZA: Arghhh! I am no match for the pull of the river!
key_value.64528: ‹YELLOW›JOHANNES: Monsieur, I am sorry for your loss. However -
key_value.64529: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: No! no. He's not dead. He's holding onto a log just around the bend!
key_value.64530: ‹YELLOW›JOHANNES: I'm sorry, but he was wearing plate armor... and you saw how fast the current was moving... I'm sorry sir. He was a great commander, if a bit hard. However...
key_value.64531: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: However what? We still have our contract! We have to keep going. I will take charge of the Brigata!
key_value.64532: ‹YELLOW›JOHANNES: None of the captains are bound to service after the commander dies. Unless you can prove your worth, we're gone. If you fail we don't get paid. Again, sorry for your loss...
key_value.64533: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Well, I guess I'll have to prove myself to them.
key_value.64535: 1. Convince all the captains to rejoin.
key_value.64536: ‹YELLOW›JOHANNES: So you wish to prove yourself, huh? Well, I never thought you a great fighter. Kill the bandit leader on the road directly west, and I'll rejoin you.
key_value.64537: -Kill the bandit leader west of Johannes' camp and return with evidence of his death.
key_value.64538: ‹YELLOW›JOHANNES: Good job Sforza! You did it! Fighting is not your only weakness; the other captains will tell you. But I felt it was your greatest and you overcame it. Here are the men I promised.
key_value.64539: ‹AQUA›BONTOLMO: Ah! Francesco! ....hmmm...you might be able to help me. My second in command is dying in the fortress and he needs a healer! If you can find one, I will rejoin you.
key_value.64540: -Find a monk and bring him to Bontolmo's fortress.
key_value.64541: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Healer! I am in need of your assistance! A man is dying!
key_value.64542: ‹AQUA›BONTOLMO: Thank you Sforza! Here are some men. I always thought you were too slow to make decisions unlike your father. Muzio was far too tough, though. Learn from his good traits and bad!
key_value.64543: ‹PURPLE›LUIGEUSI: So you want my siege back, eh Sforza? Prove you can help me. You never learned to salvage food and weapons from scraps because Muzio coddled you (but nobody else). We need five wheels.
key_value.64544: -Find 5 downed carts and bring the wheels back to Luigeusi.
key_value.64547: ‹PURPLE›LUIGEUSI: Hah! I was wrong, you've learned hard work! Or you purchased these wheels. Smart either way! Here's the siege I promised. You can also use this aqueduct if you like.
key_value.64548: ‹ORANGE›GUITANO: Muzio sometimes tested our patience with him. If only he could see us now, drinking swamp water. If you can find us fresh water, that is all I need to rejoin the Brigata.
key_value.64550: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: This is the purest water I've ever tasted!
key_value.64551: ‹ORANGE›GUITANO: Ahhh, Sforza. You considered my request and swiftly granted it. You are more even-tempered than your father. I will rejoin the Brigata. Take some of my men with you.
key_value.64552: ‹GREY›MARCELO: The Brigata is broken, Sforza. I will be blunt: I do not like you. I think you are arrogant. If you can do a humble man's work and put hay into this cart for our horses, I will rejoin.
key_value.64553: -Find 6 stacks of hay for Marcelo's horses.
key_value.64554: ‹GREY›CART DRIVER: Sir! We're full. Where to now?
key_value.64555: ‹GREY›MARCELO: Ah, you are not the arrogant little boy I thought you to be. I am humble enough to recognize that you are a grown man, worthy of following. Take some of my men!
key_value.64556: ‹YELLOW›JOHANNES: Sforza, you've done a great job in reassuring all of the Captains. If you can do one more thing the Brigata will be yours: destroy the bandit fortress guarding the ford far to the west.
key_value.64557: ‹AQUA›BONTOLMO: Sforza, you are quick-witted and I respect that. You know we still have a mission. My scout say that far to the west is a bandit fortress guarding the ford. Destroy it!
key_value.64558: ‹PURPLE›LUIGEUSI: Heh heh heh, Sforza! You are my leader! There is a bandit fortress far to the west! Use my beautiful machines to destroy it so we can cross the ford and get our money!
key_value.64559: ‹GREY›MARCELO: The entire Brigata is under your command, but there's always money. We must finish our mission. To do so, destroy the bandit fortress blocking the ford. It is located in the west.
key_value.64560: ‹ORANGE›GUITANO: I am sure you will take my counsel, young Sforza. The ford to the northwest of here is guarded by a bandit fortress. Destroy it so the Brigata...your Brigata may cross.
key_value.64561: 2. Destroy Carmagnola's castle to the west.
key_value.64562: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERI: We are victorious! Thanks be to the Lord!
key_value.64563: ‹YELLOW›JOHANNES: I pledge myself to you and your banner.
key_value.64564: ‹AQUA›BONTOLMO: I will follow you, Francesco Sforza. You are a worthy leader!
key_value.64565: ‹PURPLE›LUIGEUSI: Francseco, you are imponente! We follow Francesco Sforza!
key_value.64566: ‹GREY›MARCELO: Your father was a great man, and you will follow in his footsteps, as I will follow in yours.
key_value.64567: ‹ORANGE›GUITANO: As long as you allow us to be your counsel, you will be successful!
key_value.64568: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Father, I will make you proud.
key_value.64571:
‹GREY›CART DRIVER: Okay, we can fit 5 more of these in.

1/6 HAY COLLECTED.
key_value.64572:
‹GREY›CART DRIVER: One third of the way there...

2/6 HAY COLLECTED.
key_value.64574:
‹GREY›CART DRIVER: Damn it! I stubbed my toe on that root.

4/6 HAY COLLECTED.
key_value.64581: ‹RED›MERCHANT: Yeah, my cart broke down next to the river ford. Both it's wheels are cracked though.
key_value.64582: ‹RED›VILLAGER: My cart broken down on the south side of the river, just north of the cliffs. Only one wheel was broken though.
key_value.64583: ‹RED›VILLAGER: There's a broken cart just east of the farms.
key_value.64584: ‹RED›VILLAGER: Man, all this hay everywhere. I even went down next to that old barn where the Condottieri cavalry are, and there was some to the east of them!
key_value.64585: ‹RED›VILLAGER: All the water round here is bad, save for the aqueduct water. The river water has debris from upstream cause of the flooding, and the stream water from the swamp is all brackish.
key_value.64588: ‹RED›LUMBERJACK: I work hard to earn my salumi.
key_value.64589: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: The bandit leader is dead! Let's take his head back to Johannes.
key_value.64590: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Our cart is a wreck! How will we deliver the hay now?
key_value.65006:
1. Sforza's men are Elite Condottiero, and stronger than average Condottiero. You would do best to protect them.

2. You depend on Milan for resources, so use them wisely!

3. You can also upgrade units in the blacksmith, rather than massing troops.

4. Sforza will reach the imperial age automatically.
key_value.65007:
Your Scouts report:

Sforza (blue) has arrived at the gates of Milan (yellow) in search of a contract. The recent wars between Milan and Florence are a good opportunity for an upcoming condottiero to prove himself.

The duke seeks mercenaries to raid the Florentine countryside (red) in the south. Although it's not fortified, they can rely on some well equipped units.

Milan has already hired the Malatesta Compagnie (cyan). They stand by to respond to any counterattack. If such an assault would happen, it is likely to come from the east. Both Pizzighettone and Cremona have taken precautions.

The Venetians (purple) have hired the mercenary Carmagnola (orange), but haven't picked any side in the conflict yet.
key_value.65016: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Let's go men. This should be our most lucrative job yet. A quick romp through the beautiful Tuscan countryside, AND we're getting paid for it.
key_value.65017: ‹YELLOW›VISCONTI: ...Sforza...where have you been? Seeing if the Florentines can make you a better offer?
key_value.65018: ‹YELLOW›VISCONTI: Hmph, nevermind. Take this payment, and use our market to feed your troops if needed.
key_value.65019: ‹YELLOW›VISCONTI: Now go and raid Tuscany for me! There is a company of heavy cavalry waiting for your command at the eastern gate.
key_value.65020: ‹AQUA›MALATESTA: Good luck on pillaging Tuscany. If the Florentines try a counterattack, I'll crush them with the main force of Milan.
key_value.65021: 1. Take command of Milan's Heavy Cavalry. They await Sforza at the eastern gate.
key_value.65022: ‹BLUE›CAVALRY CAPTAIN: Commandante, Piacenza is the perfect operating base to raid Tuscany. I've ordered some transportship to get us there.
key_value.65024: ‹YELLOW›WATCH COMMANDER: Welcome, Sforza! The duke ordered me to aid your company. Feel free to use our houses and stables. We're at your command!
key_value.65025: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Perfect! Let's plunder this beautiful Florentine countryside.
key_value.65026: 3. Raid Tuscany: destroy the 4 outlying Town Centers and 25 other buildings.
key_value.65027: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: We've dirsupted the Florentine economy enough. Let us head back to Piacenza.
key_value.65028: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: We've destroyed about 10 buildings. 15 more and the Florentines will be thoroughly terrorized.
key_value.65029: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: That's about 20. Just a few more to go and we will have ravaged Tuscany enough.
key_value.65031: ‹YELLOW›MESSENGER: The duke has sent for you. The Venetians allied themselves with the Florentines. They're marching on Cremona!
key_value.65032: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Wait! Do not cross yet! Venetian ships!
key_value.65033: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: We've no time to lose! We must reinforce the city before the Venetians arrive.
key_value.65034: The duke has sent you an additional payment.
key_value.65035: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: I can see smoke off in the distance. More ships attacking Cremona!
key_value.65037: 1. Try and reach the captain of Cremona by avoiding the Venetian fleet.
key_value.65038: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Captain, most of the Venetians sailed right past us towards Pavia. We must warn the duke. They're going for a direct assault on Milan!!!
key_value.65039: ‹YELLOW›CAPTAIN: Unfortunately my hands are tied. The Venetian leader Carmagnola is besieging Pizzighettone to the north. We've strict orders to intercept any of his reinforcements.
key_value.65040: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Give me the command over your barracks. I'll make quick work of those reinforcements!
key_value.65041: 2 Minutes until the reinforcements march. Prepare your troops!
key_value.65042: 1 Minute before the Venetian reinforcements arrive. Prepare for battle!
key_value.65043: 2. Eliminate Carmagnola's reinforcement troops. Do not allow them to get past the walls of Cremona.
key_value.65044: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: That's settled. Let's hope Pizzighettone can withstand the siege while we warn the duke.
key_value.65046: 3. Bring Sforza back to Milan to report to Duke Visconti.
key_value.65047: ‹YELLOW›VISCONTI: What?! I've sent Malatesta with all our forces northwards, to protect the crossing at Pizzighettone. We're defenseless against an attack from the river!
key_value.65048: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Then the Venetian deception has worked. But not all is lost, my duke. Give me command of Milan's defenses! I will not fail you.
key_value.65049: The Venetian fleet will arrive in 6 minutes.
key_value.65050: The Venetian fleet will arrive in 3 minutes.
key_value.65051: The Venetian fleet will arrive in 1 minute.
key_value.65055: ‹YELLOW›VISCONTI: Sforza! The enemy is getting closer.
key_value.65056: 5. Defend Milan from the Venetian assault by:
key_value.65057: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Good job men, that's one front cleared! Let's hope Malatesta manages to break the siege of Pizzighettone.
key_value.65058: a) Destroy the Venetian fleet (Cannon Galleons).
key_value.65060: ‹AQUA›MALATESTA: Bring down that last siege tower before it breaches our gates!
key_value.65061: ‹ORANGE›CARMAGNOLA: Cursed! We've lost all our siege. But I've got an idea to lure them from behind those walls. Let's go, men.
key_value.65062: ‹AQUA›MALATESTA: It worked! Those Venetian dogs retreat with their tails between their legs. Let's chase them down!
key_value.65063: ‹AQUA›MALATESTA: Haha, they entered the swamp. Fools! We have them now. Show no mercy, men.
key_value.65066: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: There's something off. Those bandits looked...Venetian... We'd better get straight to Piacenza.
key_value.65070: ‹BLUE›MERCENARY: Our leader is dead! What will become of the Brigata?
key_value.65071: ‹AQUA›SERGEANT: Halt! Pizzighettone is under siege. The bridge has to stay clear for when we need a swift retreat.
key_value.65072: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: We're not equipped for a full Siege, so stay away from their town.
key_value.65073: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Visconti, I just came from Cremona. The Venetians never meant to take it. They're heading straight for Milan!
key_value.65506:
1. Your two spies (Geremio and Simone) start at the outlet of a sewer ditch. You must travel up the ditch to the camp.

2. Your units travel in fog of war. if they are in the light, you are likely seen by a guard.

3. Your units are difficult to select with one click. Drag a box around them - this always works.

4. When you are approached by a guard, you have just under 5 seconds to kill the guard before the alarm is sounded. Once the alarm is sounded, the guards will rush to where you are.

5. Do not walk into the blackness.

6. Onagers can cut down trees, especially in opportune areas to set up defenses.

7. The area is very low on Stone, you have no access to warships. You must rely on flesh and blood troops to counter the enemy ships. Instead of building 5 towers, build 1 tower and garrison it with 5 Arbalests.

8. Genoese Crossbowmen have an attack bonus vs Galleons as well as higher HPs and pierce armor, and it may be worth it to sacrifice some extra defenses to build a Castle.

9. Fishing can be very profitable, but you will have to defend your ships from Venetian patrols with land units.
key_value.65507:
Your scouts report:

You start with two spies (blue) and have to infiltrate Carmagnola's camp (orange). Avoid his patroling guards.

The Venetian fleet (purple) is in the area and the battle is unavoidable.
key_value.65511: ‹ORANGE›GUARD: So this is where we dump the body... slit his throat, then.
key_value.65513: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Ugh. Why the hell did Sforza drop us off at the refuse ditch? Carmagnola's men are so inattentive, I think we could have waltzed through the front and have the same result.
key_value.65514: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Oh hush. We're here now. Sforza's smart, he knows what he's doing. Come on, we don't have much time.
key_value.65516: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: I'm sure it was just a rat. Grow some balls.
key_value.65517: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: You talk as if a rat's not serious. My grandmother remembers stories her grandfather told her about the black plague. How rats caused it.
key_value.65518: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Whatever. I'll show you my black plague if you don't quiet up.
key_value.65519: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Heh heh. Do you smell that?
key_value.65520: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: I told you we should have taken the main gate.
key_value.65521: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Geremio, look at him. It was the previous spy sent... We should be careful.
key_value.65528: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Oh no! We've been caught! We can't fight off this many men!
key_value.65529: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Geremio, while we're here we should probably cause some chaos.
key_value.65530: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Yeah, sounds like a plan... is that gunpowder?
key_value.65531: SELECT THE OUTPOST WHEN YOU ARE READY TO BLOW UP THE GUNPOWDER DEPOT
key_value.65532: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Okay, we have 15 seconds to get away, otherwise the blast will kill us.
key_value.65533: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Well, that was pretty. Let's leave before guards show up.
key_value.65534: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Heh. Carmagnola spends so much time with Bombards, he doesn't know how to safely keep Trebuchets. They're loaded and pointed at the Castle!! Ha!
key_value.65535: Select the Outpost to fire the Trebs
key_value.65538: ‹BLUE›CYSION: Thanks so much! For a little while, I thought I was....Forgotten! Now, we've got work to do.
key_value.65539: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: What kind of name is Cysion, anyway?
key_value.65540: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Look, it's Carmagnola's personal tent! It doesn't look like he's in! Let us sneak inside...
key_value.65541: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: But wait! There's a guard there! Let us sneak behind and cut our way in.
key_value.65542: CLICK ON THE TENT TO GO IN
key_value.65543: ‹BLUE›Ow! Watch where you're sticking that knife! Cut the tent, not me!
key_value.65544: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Look at all this loot! He must have two campaign's worth of plunder in here.
key_value.65545: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Okay, great. But we need to find the plans. Look, that seems to be his personal belongings...
key_value.65546: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Yes! I've found them... He intends to face us directly up here on the northern shore outside of his camp... I'll leave a report here saying that we're planning to land upstream and then march down along the northern shore...
key_value.65547: SELECT YOUR SPY AND LEAVE THE TENT!
key_value.65549: To poison their ale, click on the Outpost.
key_value.65550: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Okay, that's done. We won't know if it's helped at all till morning...heh, I bet you that refuse dump is going to smell even worse.
key_value.65551: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Look, here are the Village's Mills. Sforza is a good man, he'll compensate the villagers once we defeat Carmagnola. For now, let us deprive him of food!
key_value.65552: Select the Outpost to destroy the Mills.
key_value.65553: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Sforza is a good man. He will rebuild this Village's Farms.
key_value.65554: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Hey, do you want to cut the saddle straps for those cavalry?
key_value.65555: Click on the Outpost to cut the saddle straps.
key_value.65556: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Okay, done. But let's make sure we stack them exactly how we found them. Imagine them rushing to mount their soldiers, putting the saddles on, mounting, and then sliding off! Hah!
key_value.65557: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: I don't feel too good about it because this aqueduct is for the village here but we can rebuild it. If we destroy it now, Carmagnola's men will go into battle thirsty!
key_value.65558: Select the Outpost to destroy the Aqueduct.
key_value.65560: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: There's nothing this way. We should go back.
key_value.65561: ‹YELLOW›MONK: PSST! Hey, I know who you are... I'll heal your wounds for you if you come by this way.
key_value.65562: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: Hey, here's their baggage train. Maybe if we were to ruin it...?
key_value.65563: Select the Outpost to ruin the baggage train.
key_value.65564: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Ruined. That made a cool sound, eh?
key_value.65566: 1. Put fake scouting reports in Carmagnola's tent.
key_value.65567: 2. Bring the Spies back to their starting area near the waterfall so they can sail back to Sforza's Army.
key_value.65568: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: That was fun. That entire place stunk of gunpowder though.
key_value.65570: 1. You have 20 minutes to build up your soldiers to defend against the Venetian attack.
key_value.65571: 2. Destroy the 7 Heavy Galleons of the Venetians.
key_value.65572: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Good job men! We've smashed the Venetian fleet!
key_value.65573: 3. Do not allow the Milanese Fleet to be destroyed.
key_value.65574: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Damn! There is nothing stopping the Venetians from attacking Milan! Visconti will have my head for this...
key_value.65575: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: It's good to see you two. We have to get ready for the Venetian assault. How long will it take?
key_value.65577: ‹BLUE›GEREMIO: About 20 minutes from now. But thanks to our dastardly deeds, Carmagnola will sit across the river in his gigantic camp so we can create a defense force unhurried.
key_value.65578: ‹BLUE›SIMONE: Heh, he thinks we're going to be marching on his camp by land. He's going to watch helplessly as we smash the Venetians on the rocks!
key_value.65579: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: We have to scout the river and set up defenses on the islands.
key_value.65581: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: And here comes the Milanese fleet! We cannot allow them to be defeated, or else the Venetians can invade the heart of Milan again.
key_value.65582: ‹ORANGE›CARMAGNOLA: You're a sly one, Sforza. You've managed to survive so far, but my army is ready for you. Come at me with the best you got and you'll see how a real Carmagnola fights!
key_value.65585: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Carmagnola and the Venetians are defeated. This invasion should mean peace in Milan, and with peace comes prosperity for myself and my Brigata.
key_value.65586: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: We will run out of gold here soon. We should probably build a Market and trade with the small Milanese town here.
key_value.65587: Do not allow Geremio or Simone to be killed.
key_value.65588: ‹BLUE› No! I can't do the rest of this mission alone!
key_value.65590: ‹ORANGE›HAND CANNONEERS: Hey, those guys are spies! Get them!
key_value.65591: ‹ORANGE›MEN-AT-ARMS: Hey! Those guys are spies! Get them!
key_value.65592: ‹ORANGE›CHAMPIONS: Hey! Those guys are Spies! Get them!
key_value.66007:
1. Protect your condottieri, you can't buy or recruit any more of them. However, if you prove to be a worthy commander, other condottieri may join you.

2. Use your bombard cannons wisely, you'll need them even after Piacenza falls.

3. The only way to defeat the Venetian fleet is to bombard them with your cannons or block the shallows with cannoneers. Use the hills around the shore to gain an advantage.

4. All bonuses that your army will aquire will affect only the starting condottieri.

5. You are restricted to the Castle age.
key_value.66008:
Your scouts report:

Francesco Sforza's army of condottieri is camped to the northwest and has orders to conquer the treacherous towns who joined Venice. Pavia (Red) is the first on the road- they are still neutral to you and can be persuaded peacefully to join you. Cremona (Yellow) is in the south and is your only unwavering ally. You can buy mercenaries from there but also have to protect them from Venice. The locals (Orange) are friendly but also there are hostile rebels (Gray).

Piacenza (Green) lies southeast of Pavia and is hostile to you, but it has a small garrison and can be easilly overrun if it's defences are breached. Caravaggio (Cyan) is located to the north, with a strong garrison and could rely on direct support from the Venetian army as well. The Venetian (Purple) castles to the east contain medium-sized garrisons and the rumors say that there are many stored weapons and armor.
key_value.66012: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Sforza has died, we have lost!
key_value.66013: 1. Bring Sforza to the castle in Pavia.
key_value.66014: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Now we have to march on Piacenza, to the southeast. We can also loot the rebel villages to the east!
key_value.66015: ‹RED›ARTILLERY COMMANDER: Senior Sforza, we will help you to fight against Venice!
key_value.66016: 2. Besiege Piacenza and destroy 4 of its towers.
key_value.66017: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: With the old vassals reconquered, now we have to attack the castles directly controlled by Venice.
key_value.66018: 3. Destroy the 3 Venetian castles: Mozzanica, Vailate and Treviglio.
key_value.66019: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we have destroyed the Venetian fortresses on the river Adda! However, Venice has sent its navy this way! They will arrive in two minutes.
key_value.66020: - Ravage the rebel countryside and destroy their 2 markets, 4 mills 1 blacksmith and 1 town center.
key_value.66021: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: The rebelious peasants are punished for their insubordinance.
key_value.66022: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: The Venetian admiral Andrea Quirini is attacking Cremona with a large fleet, we must stop him!
key_value.66024: ‹YELLOW›CITIZENS OF CREMONA: We are saved. Thank you, signore Sforza!
key_value.66026: ‹AQUA›CITIZENS OF CARAVAGGIO: Signore Sforza, we surrender!
key_value.66027: 6. Bring Sforza near the torch on the road for Brescia (northeast of Caravaggio).
key_value.66028: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: The Republic orders us to stop, we have done our duty!
key_value.66029: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Venice has sent its general Micheletto Attendolo with a relief force! We must defeat them!
key_value.66030: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we heard for your victories and we want to plunder with you...I mean to fight for your glory!
key_value.66031: ‹RED›CITIZENS OF PAVIA: Signore Sforza, we send you the taxes from our city.
key_value.66032: - Buy Bombard Cannon for 200 gold by clicking the siege workshop in Pavia.
key_value.66033: - Buy Hand Cannonier for 50 gold by clicking the archery range in Cremona.
key_value.66034: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, now we can hire more mercenaries with that gold.
key_value.66035: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we are more experienced after the recent victory.
key_value.66036: - New plate cuirasses are cast and stored in the blacksmith of Treviglio.
key_value.66037: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we found new armor in that Venetian blacksmith.
key_value.66038: - New schiavona swords were brought from Dalmatia to the blacksmith in Vailate.
key_value.66039: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we found new weapons in that Venetian blacksmith.
key_value.66040: ‹GREEN›CITIZENS OF PIACENZA: Signore Sforza, we collected your tribute, that's everything we have.
key_value.66041: ‹YELLOW›CITIZENS OF CREMONA: We kept the entire trade income, and now we give it to you!
key_value.66042: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we looted the treacherous villages. The plunder is enormous and they will stay loyal for now.
key_value.66043: MONK: Noble lord, I made a vow to stay in that monastery and never leave that cliff, but I can heal your army.
key_value.66044: - Keep 5 units garrisoned in the castle of Pavia, to prevent the city from revolting.
key_value.66045: ‹RED›CITIZENS OF PAVIA: Signore Sforza, we regret to inform you that we no longer need your assistance.
