key_value.66047: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Pavia should not be trusted, they easily switch allegiance. We have to keep 5 of our man in front the castle as precaution.
key_value.66048: - There are new steel bucklers in the blacksmith of Mozzanica.
key_value.66049: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we found new shields in that Venetian blacksmith.
key_value.66050: ‹YELLOW›CONDOTTIERO: Signore Sforza, we are eager to join you and fight for fame and glory!
key_value.66051: CONDOTTIERO: You are Sforza? That means there will be loot somewhere near here, for everybody knows you don't travel for nothing! Could we join you?
key_value.66052: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Most of the vassal cities have sided with Venice, but Cremona is still loyal. The Republic ordered us to punish the rebels.
key_value.66053: - Buy Knight for 100 gold by clicking the stable in Piacenza.
key_value.66054: - Buy Crossbowman for 30 gold by clicking the Archery range of the Locals.
key_value.66055: - Buy Long Swordsman for 40 gold by clicking the Barracks of the Locals.
key_value.66056: ‹BLUE›FRANCESCO SFORZA: Thanks to the diplomacy of my mother-in-law Agnese del Maino, Pavia will join us- I only have to visit their castle.
key_value.66505:
1. The Dock and Siege Workshop are disabled so trying to attack the city of Milan is suicide.

2. The Venetians are our allies for now. But can they be trusted?

3. It's not a bad idea to save on a regular basis.

4. Protect your hero! It is better to keep him somewhere in a building in your base than to let him wander off and get killed.

5. Your main competitor for resources on the map is Abbiategrasso. You should attack them as early as possible.
key_value.66506:
Your scouts report:

The city of Milan (Green) is right in front of your encampment. It's heavily fortified and its walls impregnable.

The republican army of Milan (Yellow) will do anything at its power to defend the city.

Abbiategrasso is a small town along the canal West of Milan.

There are several small encampments outside of Milan as well.
key_value.66507: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: The city of Milan is too well fortified, and I do not have access to siege equipment. We can't capture it by force so we'll have to starve them out.
key_value.66508: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: I have heard news that Milan is divided between a party that is for us and a party against us. They should capitulate soon. Meanwhile the Venetians are holding the rivers for us.
key_value.66511: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: That trading outpost is Milan's gateway to Pavia. We should destroy it and destroy all of the Trade Carts.
key_value.66512: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: The Venetians are blockading Pizzighettone, so now Milan should have no land lines. If we build a Market here, we can intercept shipments of wood from the southern mountains.
key_value.66513: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Abbiategrasso protects the channel that feeds Milan from the River Ticinum. We must torch this town to the ground!
key_value.66514: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Now Milan is cut off from all points through the river.
key_value.66515: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: So this is where Milan's granaries are. They are quite close to the city. Destroy their defenses so we can keep it. If we starve the people, we must also provide for them later.
key_value.66516: - Conquer the granaries of Milan by destroying the Towers guarding them.
key_value.66517: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: As long as we can protect the granaries it will provide us with food for our army.
key_value.66518: + Search for important points to attack and cut Milan's supplies off.
key_value.66519: - Destroy the trade outpost and the trading carts.
key_value.66521: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Well done men. It won't take long now before Milan will run out of food. Keep the siege going.
key_value.66523: ‹BLUE›SCOUT: Sir! A couple of scouts said they have urgent news for you! They'll meet you in the forest as they don't want spies to hear of it.
key_value.66525: ‹BLUE›SCOUT: We've captured this Venetian ambassador on his way to Ambrosia. He admitted that Venice is going to form an alliance against you.
key_value.66526: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Damn those Venetians! Prepare our troops!
key_value.66527: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: The Milanese republican army will defend the city at all cost. We should prepare ourselves for their attacks.
key_value.66528: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: They know the location of our camp. Now WE must prepare for a siege.
key_value.66529: ‹PURPLE›VENICE: This ends today Sforza! Let's see how you condottieri scum die!
key_value.66532: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: The Venetian main army has reached Milan!
key_value.66534: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Venice is launching a final attack!!
key_value.66535: ‹YELLOW›MILANESE PEOPLE: We are tired of these Republicans who backstabbed you, and the Venetians have treated us poorly as well.
key_value.66536: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Send the food from the granaries to the city, we must show the people that I intend to lead them as a just ruler.
key_value.66537: + Lay siege to Milan until they run out of food.
key_value.66538: ‹PURPLE›VENETIANS: Sforza, we have decided to spread the ideals of Republic across Italy. That means Milan will be free of your tyranny. Surrender now or face our wrath.
key_value.66540: ‹BLUE›CONDOTTIERO: Sforza has died. All is lost...
key_value.66541: + Bring Sforza to the castle of Milan.
key_value.66542: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Victory! Milan belongs to the Sforza!
key_value.66544: + Survive the Venetian attacks until the Milanese surrender.
key_value.66545: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: The Milanese have torched their own granaries? But why? Something is not right. They can't be THAT desperate to defeat me, unless they have some sort of trump card.
key_value.66546: - Build 2 mills at the old granary site and collect 3000 food.
key_value.66547: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Good, that will secure the food supply.
key_value.66548: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Men! Do not destroy the granaries! We need them!
key_value.66549: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: Men, what good is a starving city? We must keep the granaries.
key_value.66550: ‹BLUE›SFORZA: ..........I will have to discipline you soldiers more. Once we secure this area, we must rebuild the granaries AND stockpile 3000 Food.
key_value.66553: - Build a market on the old trade post to receive wood shipments.
key_value.67007:
1. Use your army wisely and keep your soldiers alive, you will need as many as possible in the final part.

2. The friendly monks can heal your army.

3. Orellana is fast and has ranged attack, do not keep him standing still when he fights.

4. Explore the area southwest and northwest of Quito, you can find adventures and profit.

5. Recruit the most useful warriors in La Culata, their mobility is crucial for later battles.

6. Use hit-and-run tactics in the ruined town. Do not engage at the southern part, but rather, lure the enemies to the north.

7. Francisco de Orellana may not reach Imperial Age.
key_value.67008:
Your scout's report:

Francisco de Orellana(blue) starts in castle age with a small army in La Culata but without any villagers or base. He has to find and speak with Gonzalo Pizarro.

La Culata(teal) is a friendly town located on the western shores of the map. Here you can recruit soldiers after you have spoken with Pizarro.

Quito(orange) is an allied city; it is found east of La Culata and in the center of the map.

Gonzalo Pizarro(red) is your ally; he can supply you with an army and will give you objectives.

Gonzalo Diaz de Pineda(yellow) is your rival conquistador; he is neutral to you and is residing in Quito.

Locals(purple) are friendly natives; their soldiers can join your army, and their villagers can provide you with food.

Rebels(green) are your enemy; they use guerilla tactics and have small groups placed all over the map. In addition, they have a large force hidden somewhere in the mountains around Quito.

Incan ruins(gray) are neutral to you and their structures can be used for defense or resupply.
key_value.67021: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Men, there is no time to lose. Pack your gear and we will be on our way.
key_value.67022: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Where are we heading towards, don Francisco?
key_value.67023: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: To the east, to the city Quito. Governor Gonzalo has sent a letter. He is expecting us there.
key_value.67024: 1. Travel to Quito and find Gonzalo Pizarro.
key_value.67025: ‹ORANGE›Gonzalo Pizarro: Francisco, what took you so long? Did you receive my letter?
key_value.67026: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Yes, governor. I was pleased to read your offer to help and locate the riches of El Dorado and La Canela. I have heard the stories myself, and if half of them are true, I would be mad not to join.
key_value.67027: ‹ORANGE›Gonzalo Pizarro: I knew I could count on you, kinsman! But there is one problem. Diaz de Pineda is already preparing an expedition to El Dorado. Perhaps you can 'persuade' him to join us? *Winks*
key_value.67028: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: What did you have in mind?
key_value.67029: ‹ORANGE›Gonzalo Pizarro: First, kill his sergeants. Then bribe his merchants. Sabotage his preparations until he becomes desperate. However, avoid an open conflict with Pineda and his guards.
key_value.67031: ‹YELLOW›Carlos the Merchant: Maria, your hair is so soft and your lips are so sweet. But, unfortunately, I must return to my uncomely wife.
key_value.67032: ‹YELLOW›Mistress: Oh, Carlos. Give me one last kiss. I am burning with desire.
key_value.67033: ‹YELLOW›Carlos the Merchant: But Maria, we are in public.. And if anyone should see us...
key_value.67036: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Well, well, Carlos! Having a good time?
key_value.67037: ‹YELLOW›Carlos the Merchant: What do you want? What did you see?
key_value.67038: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: I have seen enough to know that a certain shipment to Diaz de Pineda will be cancelled. Otherwise, your wife will be pleased to hear about the sweet lips of Maria!
key_value.67039: ‹YELLOW›Carlos the Merchant: You scumbag! I will cut your tongue before you can tell her. Guards, grab him!
key_value.67041: ‹YELLOW›Carlos the Merchant: Okay, okay! Enough. If you keep your tongue, I will delay the shipment.
key_value.67042: 2. Kill Pineda's 4 sergeants (marked with flags). Do not alarm the rest of Pineda's men.
key_value.67044: ‹ORANGE›Gonzalo Pizarro: Ah, Francisco. I knew you would not let me down! In fact, I am promoting you to second in command. I will make way to the Sumaco valley. Assemble your army and join me there.
key_value.67045: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: We have enough men and we are ready to join the expedition.
key_value.67046: 8. Gather all your men and go to the Sumaco Valley, located east of Quito, to find Pizzaro's camp.
key_value.67047: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Hmm, it seems this town is abandoned, we are safe here. Reports tell us that there is a large army of rebels hidden nearby. Scouts, go to Gonzalo's camp and ask for a relief party.
key_value.67048: ‹BLUE›Scout: Don't worry, amigo. This cliff is crossable and it is perfectly safe.
key_value.67049: 9. Bring at least one of your scouts to Gonzalo.
key_value.67050: ‹BLUE› Francisco de Orellana: The rebel army is attacking us! Quickly fortify this abandoned town and prepare to fend off their attacks!
key_value.67051: 10. Hold off the incan rebels and accumulate 100 kills.
key_value.67052: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: We've defeated them, they're running away! Let's regroup and wait for Gonzalo to arrive.
key_value.67053: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizarro: Francisco! Your scouts told me that you got attacked by an army of rebels! Are you hurt?
key_value.67054: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: No, I'm fine. I never thought natives could assemble such a large army in such a short time.
key_value.67055: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizzaro: I've enslaved many of them, now we have men to carry our supplies through the rain forest and we're ready for our journey. On to El Dorado!
key_value.67056: ‹BLUE›Scout: We're sorry for our cowardice, don Francisco.
key_value.67057: 7. Click on the Pavillions next to the units you'd like to buy: Conquistador: 100g; Champion: 60g; Arbalest: 45g; Hand Cannoneer: 50g; Long Swordsman: 40g).
key_value.67058: 6. Return to La Culata to recruit more soldiers.
key_value.67065: - Plunder the temple of Pacha Kamaq.
key_value.67066: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: I wonder what we can buy with that?
key_value.67068: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Can you promise us enough loot? Then we will follow you!
key_value.67069: - To recruit the slingers, collect 100 food and select their hut.
key_value.67071: - To recruit the kamayuks, collect 100 food and select their hut.
key_value.67073: ‹PURPLE›Villager: We are simple fishermen and llama herdsmen. Please spare us, and we will give you all of our food!
key_value.67074: - Destroy the gray dock to gather its food.
key_value.67075: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Now we have enough food supply!
key_value.67076: ‹ORANGE›First Merchant: I saw a squad of conquistadors leaving westwards. They were on a mission to find the temple ruins. But they never returned.
key_value.67077: ‹ORANGE›Second Merchant: I spoke with the locals, and they are willing to join whoever gives them food.
key_value.67078: ‹ORANGE›Third Merchant: I heard that there is an abandoned algae plantation on the beach. Algae are very nutritious.
key_value.67079: ‹PURPLE›Slinger: We always wanted to travel to new countries. Give us 100 food and we will join you! Click our hut when you are ready.
key_value.67080: ‹PURPLE›Kamayuk: We are tired of wandering the jungles in search of hunt. If you can provide us 100 food, we'll follow you anywhere. Click our hut when you are ready.
key_value.67081: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: This looks like an algae plantation. We could plunder the harbor to gain some of those nutritious plants.
key_value.67084: ‹AQUA›Monk: Don Francisco, wait! Take that totem of the condor, the bird of seeing. It will help you on your journey.
key_value.67085: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: This must be the condor, the monk was right, it shows us the treasures!
key_value.67086: At least one scout must survive.
key_value.67087: When done, select the outpost to continue.
key_value.67506:
1. Conquistadors can be used very effectively in a hit and run manner.

2. Far away from Spain, the explorers can no longer get their hands on gunpowder and other European technology. So instead you have to relly on your Inca allies and their tech tree.

3. When you get wood to build a Dock, do not waste your time and/or wood to build other buildings.

4.In Feudal Age, the strongest combination is fully upgraded massed archers. There is not much gold to be found for archers though so use your resources wisely.

5. Man-at-Arms are good at fighting against Eagle Warriors and destroying buildings.

6.Do not kill Llamas if you find any. They will be needed to complete a quest.

7.Do not forget to save often.
key_value.67507:
Your scouts report:

The Spanish (Blue) are driving an expediton deep in the jungle, thus the more advanced technologies are not available. You are restricted to the Feudal Age.

You start your journey in the northern corner of the map. A river cuts the map into two parts. El Barco (Yellow) is situated on the eastern part.

Imara (Purple) and three peaceful villages (Green) are on the western part. You will not be able to cross the river without a boat.

Hostile warriors (Cyan) can come up anywhere.
key_value.67516: ‹BLUE›Spanish soldier: Without our leaders we are lost!
key_value.67517: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: What an endless rainforest! It will not be easy to find El Dorado here.
key_value.67518: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizarro: We will make it. It is well worth the trouble, we will be richer than king Carlos himself! Let us go!
key_value.67520: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizarro: Look! Boats of local people. There must be a village near here. Keep your eyes open, men, we will take the village at once!
key_value.67521: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizarro: The village is here! If we destroy their watch towers, I am sure they will surrender. Attack!
key_value.67522: Destroy all watch towers in El Barco.
key_value.67523: ‹YELLOW›Chief Vicaquirao: We surrender! Please spare our lives!
key_value.67524: Bring Pizarro and Orellana to the chief to ask him about El Dorado.
key_value.67525: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizarro: Wise choice to surrender, chief. We are searching for El Dorado, the kingdom made of gold. Tell us where it is, and we will spare the lives of you and your people.
key_value.67527: ‹YELLOW›Vicaquirao: I have never heard of El Dorado. I only lead this little village. There is no other settlement within many, many miles. But you can rest here before continuing your search.
key_value.67529: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: If I may be so bold, don Pizarro. We should proceed by the river. By boat we could cover longer distances much faster.
key_value.67530: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizarro: Good idea, nephew. Let us scout the woods for resources for a ship. And take a villager along to carry anything we would find.
key_value.67531: Click Francisco de Orellana to continue.
key_value.67532: ‹BLUE›Monk: Please! Take me home! I'll help you recover from your diseases and heal your wounds in return.
key_value.67533: Take the villager to the storehouse, so he can bring the wood back to the village.
key_value.67534: ‹BLUE›Villager: I have found some wood and a cart in the storehouse. Unfortunately there was no sail. It must have been stolen by the enemy tribe who lives deeper in the jungle.
key_value.67535: Take back the stolen sail. Once you have found it, pick it up with the Trade Cart.
key_value.67536: ‹BLUE›Villager: Alright, now we have everything to build a ship for you. We can return to the village.
key_value.67537: ‹BLUE›Villager: There, I can see our sail! (the flag)
key_value.67538: Take the Trade Cart back to the Trade Workshop in the village.
key_value.67539: ‹BLUE›Villager: All resources are in place. We can start building a Dock.
key_value.67541: ‹BLUE›Gonzalo Pizarro: The ship is ready. Therefore I name this place El Barco (ship)... Our fittest men are already on board. Bring food for the rest. Good luck, my nephew!
key_value.67542: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Thank you, uncle. We will return in twelve days. You can count on us!
key_value.67543: Sail down the river and look for food for the squad.
key_value.67544: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Nothing changes... I have seen the same rainforest since we left. Are we sailing in circles?
key_value.67545: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: This cursed jungle! We hardly find food for ourselves. My men are starving. How will we bring food for the main force?
key_value.67546: ‹BLUE›Spanish soldier: The current is too strong to sail upstream.
key_value.67547: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Wait, I hear war drums. We are approaching a settlement. Prepare men, we will rush them... it has worked so far.
key_value.67548: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Here is the village. Let us capture it by defeating their army. Attack!
key_value.67550: ‹PURPLE›Chief of Imara: Alright, you have won the battle, strangers. I am ready to negotiate a treaty.
key_value.67551: Bring Francisco de Orellana to the Chief of Imara to negotiate with him.
key_value.67552: Click the Chief of Imara to continue.
key_value.67553: ‹PURPLE›Chief of Imara: You have defeated us. What do you wish from my people?
key_value.67554: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: We will gather information about this area before we return to El Barco. We will need food and shelter while we stay at your village. If you help us, no one will be hurt.
key_value.67555: ‹PURPLE›Chief of Imara: I accept your conditions. My villagers will help you gather the resources you need. There are three other villages in our neighborhood. They are our friends. Visit them for more information.
key_value.67556: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: A friendly approach to these native people could be a good idea. It would be better for everyone. Let us visit the other villages.
key_value.67557: Visit the leaders of the neighboring villages to gather information about your position.
key_value.67558: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: Greetings chief! We come from across the Great Water with peace and seek to navigate the river. Can you share your knowledge of the landscape?
key_value.67560: ‹GREEN›Chief: Welcome, strangers! I can see that your armors are much better than ours. There is a Javelina in the forest to the West from our village. Lure it to my Town Center for my villagers, and I will help you.
key_value.67561: - First Chief (Jaguar Warrior): Lure the Javelina to the chief's Town Center(use a villager to shoot it twice and then task your villager to the Town Center).
key_value.67562: ‹GREEN›Chief: Thank you for your help. I know the village you call El Barco. It would take several weeks to return there this time of the year. The current of the river is too strong now. This river runs into the mighty Amazon river.
key_value.67563: ‹GREEN›Chief: I am sorry, but we do not have time to chat. The enemy tribe will attack us any time. Mmm, you have much better equipment. You could defeat them. Their camp is to the north. Destroy it, and I will help you.
key_value.67564: - Second Chief (Elite Eagle Warrior): Destroy the camp of the enemy tribe.
key_value.67565: ‹GREEN›Chief: Thank you. In gratitude I will answer your question. I have heard about wealthy kingdoms further down the river. One of them is even ruled by women. Do not underestimate them- they fight more fiercely than most men!
key_value.67566: ‹GREEN›Chief: Greetings, outlanders. First you must help us. You ride four-legged beasts, thus you are able to move much faster. Someone has broken our llama pen. Bring back our twelve llamas to the pen and repair the fence. Then I will help you gladly.
key_value.67567: - Third Chief (Kamayuk): Bring back 12 llamas to their pen and rebuild the missing palisade.
key_value.67568: ‹GREEN›Chief: Thank you very much for returning our llamas. Regarding your question: if you plan to navigate the river down-stream, you better brace up your ship to withstand the attack of hostile tribes.
key_value.67569: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: We have drifted too far away from my uncle. We cannot navigate the river up-stream. Prepare yourself, men, the only thing we can do is to sail towards the great Amazon river and the Atlantic Ocean...
key_value.67570: ‹BLUE› Spanish soldier: The current is too strong! We're being dragged to the shores!
key_value.67571: ‹BLUE› Francisco de Orellana: Just our luck. Our ship has run aground. We'll have to continue on foot.
key_value.67575: ‹BLUE›Francisco de Orellana: We're unable to finish the task the chief gave to us. Now we're never getting out of this jungle.
key_value.67576: ‹BLUE›We've killed too many llamas. Now the chieftains will never help us get out of this forsaken place.
key_value.67577: ‹BLUE› We musn't kill the llamas. The friendly tribes here might still need them.
key_value.68007:
1. The jungle is thick, so it wont always be easy to explore it.

2. Though you may find food, it's not much, eventually you need to escape this jungle.

3. You can sacrifice your troops, that way you will consume less food.

4. Keep track of your good/bad deeds by the number of flags in the western corner. (6 of one kind is required.)

5. It's advisable to avoid hostile forces.

6. You can interact with most food suppliers by left-clicking on the unit.
key_value.68008:
Your scouts' report:

Francisco de Orellana (blue) starts with a small army embarked on ships to the northwest and seeks a way to travel further down the river. However, his food supply is very low and the soldiers are starving.

The area is believed to be inhabited by the fearsome Amazones,a tribe of women warriors (red). They are hostile, but can be persuaded to cooperate. Their warrior vassals (grey) on the other hand, will attack any intruder on sight.

There are no other big settlements in the area. Instead you'll find small villages (green), a native trading post (cyan), a temple (purple) and fisheries (yellow) scattered across the map. You can obtain food from most of these places one way or another.

Technology is absent and you are restricted to the dark age.
key_value.68021: ‹BLUE›Orellana: The river seems do be getting bigger. We might be close to the ocean soon...
key_value.68022: ‹RED›Soldier: Did you hear that? It sounded like a big explosion. Like a barrel of gunpowder...
key_value.68023: ‹BLUE›Orellana: Yes, I got a strange feeling about it. We should find food and get out of this place.
key_value.68024: ‹BLUE›Orellana: We need food. There is a village up ahead. Kill all villagers and take their food.
key_value.68025: 1. Kill the villagers in the village up ahead.
key_value.68027: ‹BLUE›Orellana: We need more food. Spread out!
key_value.68028: 2. Find food to keep your army alive.
key_value.68029: 3. Reach the island on the east side of the river. Convince the Amazones to let you pass by:
key_value.68030: ‹BLUE›Orellana: We made it, let's rest here for a bit. The king will be pleased with the prospect of silver in this area.
key_value.68032: You got 25 Food and a map.
key_value.68033: You took 30 food and a map
key_value.68034: You got 15 food and a map.
key_value.68036: You have found a hunting lodge.
key_value.68037: ‹GREEN›Hunter: You want food? Kill that Jaguar for me then.
key_value.68039: - Kill the jaguar in the north.
key_value.68044: ‹GREEN›Fisherman: I will give you 100 food for one transport ship.
key_value.68045: - Bring one transport to the Trade Workshop and select it. (Reward 100 food)
key_value.68046: You got 100 food from selling the ship.
key_value.68047: You have found a Native trading post.
key_value.68048: ‹AQUA›Merchant: Getting past the Amazones? It's possible. You can convince them of your goodwill by helping their subjects.
key_value.68050: ‹PURPLE›Blind Priest: You want to get past the Amazones? Those women took my eyes when I was but a boy. I want revenge! Disrupt their food supply and they will give in.
key_value.68054: ‹GREEN›Chief Cotama: The great mountain have destroyed most of our crops. Silence it and we will give you food.
key_value.68055: You have found a heathen shrine.
key_value.68057: You took 30 food from the shrine.
key_value.68058: b) Destroying 6 food sources (green and yellow).
key_value.68059: a) Being kind to 6 food suppliers (green and yellow).
key_value.68060: You have found a Llama herd.
key_value.68061: ‹GREEN›SHEPHERD: I've lost one of my llamas when herding up north. Would you bring it safely back, please?
key_value.68062: - Find the lost llama and return it to the shepherd.
key_value.68064: The Amazones have been persuaded to open up the gate. You can now pass through.
key_value.68065: ‹BLUE›Orellana: What is this! Must be the Amazones. They've blocked off the river! Turn around at once.
key_value.68067: Francisco de Orellana has fallen. The quest is a failure. You have lost...
key_value.68068: ‹BLUE›Orellana: Is that SILVER?! Wait until the king hears about this!
key_value.68070: ‹PURPLE›CHIEFTAIN: Our miners need food so they can work hard. Unfortunately, Thonapa is too scared to walk alone in the swamp. Will you escort him?
key_value.68071: ‹BLUE›CONQUISTADOR: I guess the miners will have to face hunger... just like us.
key_value.68072: - Deliver the goods to the miners in the south.
key_value.68073: - Travel to the Volcano and find a way to ease its wrath.
key_value.68074: ‹BLUE›CONQUISTADOR: Hmm, these boulders are blocking the river.
key_value.68078:
--- SECONDARY OBJECTIVES ---

You can obtain food from:

- Fishermen: click on the villager to negotiate or destroy the villager to pillage.

- Shrines: click on the forage bush to leave it alone or on the relic to plunder it.

- Amazone Suppliers: click on the villager/chief to negotiate or destroy the villagers to pillage.


Some suppliers will give you specific quests:
key_value.68506:
1. The island on which you disembarked is the perfect spot to build your base. There is no need to look for another island.

2. Do not wait too long to free the Spanish captives since you don't need a lot of troops to rescue them. In addition, the leader of the captives will provide you essential information. Wandering the map before you hear this intel is not advisable.

3. After freeing the captives, start with the quests for the Macapaba and Januacu tribe. Scout the map well and you'll find plenty of rewarding sidequests! These will give you the necessary resources to capture the mines of Los Negros.

4. Francisco de Orellana may reach Imperial Age.
key_value.68507:
Your scouts report:

Francisco de Orellana is travelling towards the ocean. However, he has to retrofit his vessels before he can sail it. Thus he'll need to construct a base.

The mouth of the Amazon river contains many small islands. The friendly Januacu tribe (cyan) has claimed those in the north, but Los Negros (red and green) have taken over some islands up-river (south). They are your most dangerous enemy on the map.

The other friendly tribe, Macapaba (yellow), live on the western bank. They have a large village up-river.

On the eastern bank Los Negros have multiple settlements. They are heavily guarded and should only be opposed with a great force.
key_value.68509: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Don Francisco has fallen! Without the guidance of our leader we have no hope of escaping this madness.
key_value.68510: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Don Francisco! Can you feel it? The current is getting stronger. We must be close to the ocean!
key_value.68511: ‹BLUE›Orellana: Excellent! The sooner we escape this madness, the better. Let's find a suitable place to set up camp and retrofit our vessels to be seaworthy.
key_value.68512: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: This island seems to be inhabited by Los Negros. Better avoid these cannibals and sail north.
key_value.68531: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: The final one. Say my name and I disappear. What am I?
key_value.68532: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Yes! You have a quick mind, but will you solve the last riddle as well? Take another bite and find out.
key_value.68535: ‹BLUE›Orellana: This seems like a fine place to start the retrofitting. Disembark and get to work!
key_value.68536: 1. Build a town center on the island to secure a base camp.
key_value.68537: ‹BLUE›Orellana: While we are gathering the necessary resources, we should scout the area. If rumors are true, Los Negros are holding some Spaniards captive.
key_value.68538: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Is that wise don Francisco? The Los Negros tribes eat men for dinner! For all we know, our shipwrecked countrymen may have already been eaten.
key_value.68539: ‹BLUE›Orellana: It's our duty as good Christians! We'll send an expedition to the island east of us. Look for captives. Los Negros are not the only ones who know how to cut some limbs. Use force if you have to.
key_value.68540: 2. Rescue the Spanish captives from the cannibals (Los Negros).
key_value.68541: ‹GREY›Juan Cortejo: God has heard our prayers! I'm Lieutenant-General Juan Cortejo and our galleys ran aground some months ago. I was giving up all hope, but now you saved us!
key_value.68542: ‹BLUE›Orellana: Well met Lieutenant-General! Join our party and we'll get you out of this hell. But first, do they keep more of your crew prisoners?
key_value.68543: ‹GREY›Juan Cortejo: No, they... they ate all the others. We want revenge Orellana! But we can't fight them barehanded. They've locked our weapons in the warehouse on this island.
key_value.68544: 3. Pillage (destroy) the warehouse on the eastern side of the island to recover the armors and weapons. Then return to Juan Cortejo to gain his support.
key_value.68545: ‹BLUE›Orellana: We've got their armors. We should return to Juan.
key_value.68547: ‹BLUE›Orellana: I like your spirit Don Juan. But to be honest, my crew and I are looking to escape this river as soon as possible.
key_value.68548: ‹BLUE›Juan Cortejo: I understand Francisco, but these small islands will not provide you the necessary resources to retrofit your vessels.
key_value.68549: ‹BLUE›Juan Cortejo: You have two options. (1) you can seek help from the more friendly tribes in the north and west. (2) you can try and take over the rich mines of Los Negros.
key_value.68550: 4. Prepare your fleet for a voyage over sea. Construct 15 Galleons.
key_value.68551: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Don Francisco, the ships are ready to sail the ocean.
key_value.68552:
--- SECONDARY OBJECTIVES ---

If you're short on gold you can:

A. Take over the rich mines of Los Negros.

B. Help the friendly tribes in the north and west to gain some gold. Questgivers are indicated by a purple colour. Simply click on them:
key_value.68553: Hint: Possible questgivers are indicated by a purple colour. Simply click on them to ask for help.
key_value.68554: ‹PURPLE›Fisherman: I'm sorry adventurer, but I'm out of fish. Los Negros have taken my fishing spot! Perhaps you are strong enough to teach them a lesson?
key_value.68555: - Fisherman: Destroy the fishtraps to scare Los Negros away from the fishing spot.
key_value.68556: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: I hope they won't balance this food loss with eating more people. Anyway, let's get back to the fisherman and claim our reward.
key_value.68557: ‹PURPLE›Fisherman: Thanks to you I'm back in business! Take this as a token of my gratitude.
key_value.68558: ‹PURPLE›Fisherman: I'm off fishing. I just hope the stench of Los Negros didn't scare all the fish away.
key_value.68559: ‹PURPLE›Master Blacksmith: If you're looking for weapons, you've come at the wrong time. Normally I get my supplies from our mines at the west, but lately I didn't receive any shipment.
key_value.68560: ‹PURPLE›Master Blacksmith: If you'd check it out I would be most grateful.
key_value.68561: - Blacksmith: Check out the mines to the west of Macapaba.
key_value.68562: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Seems like Los Negros have slaughtered these poor miners. We should look inside the cave for survivors.
key_value.68563: ‹GREEN›Cannibal: Fresh meat has just arrived, boys. Let's get them!
key_value.68565: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Just more dead miners inside. We should report this back to the master blacksmith in Macapaba.
key_value.68566: - Return to Master Blacksmith in Macapaba and report your findings.
key_value.68567: ‹PURPLE›Master Blacksmith: I feared that Los Negros were behind this. But thanks to your actions the mines are safe again and I can restart my business. Please accept this small gift.
key_value.68568: ‹PURPLE›Master Blacksmith: Apprentice, prepare the workplace! We'll be getting shipments again.
key_value.68569: ‹PURPLE›High priest: You're just in time to witness the duel between the champion of Macapaba and the champion of Januacu! They'll fight to the death to please the god Huitzilopochtli!
key_value.68570: ‹YELLOW›Macapaba priest: If we win this sacred duel, our tribe gains the favor of the gods. Stranger, if you'd guide our champion to victory, we would be forever in your debt.
key_value.68571: - High priest: Guide the champion of Macapaba to victory. Select him to start the duel.
key_value.68572: ‹YELLOW›Macapaba champion: May the gods give me the strength to beat my opponent!
key_value.68573: The gods have provided an attack boost!
key_value.68574: The gods are pleased with the duel and provide an HP buff!
key_value.68575: The gods sent an attack buff!
key_value.68576: The gods have provided another HP boost.
key_value.68577: - High priest: Kill the other champion. The gods will provide some buffs so keep your eyes out and get them before your opponent.
key_value.68578: ‹PURPLE›High priest: The champion of Macapaba is victorious!
key_value.68579: ‹YELLOW›Priest: We're most grateful for your guidance stranger. Please accept this as a reward.
key_value.68580: ‹PURPLE›High priest: The champion of Januacu is victorious!
key_value.68581: ‹YELLOW›Priest: You... you've brought eternal shame to our tribe! Curse you, stranger. May Huitzilopochtli take your soul.
key_value.68582: ‹PURPLE›Researcher: We're currently excavating this ancient temple of Pachacamac, the two-faced god. But at the moment we only found one head.
key_value.68583: ‹PURPLE›Researcher: We believe the second head to be located on the island nearby, but every expedition we've sent so far hasn't returned. Perhaps you can clear it from any dangers?
key_value.68584: - Researcher: Clear the island of any danger, so they can start researching the second head of Pachacamac.
key_value.68585: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: The island is safe. We should return to the researcher.
key_value.68586: ‹PURPLE›Researcher: Thank you so much for your help! Now we can finally study both sides of Pachacamac.
key_value.68587: ‹PURPLE›Guard: You'll find nothing of interest behind this gate, stranger. The forest is cursed. Every animal beyond this gate is pure evil.
key_value.68588: ‹PURPLE›Guard: Last year a strange woman appeared in our town. Soon the animals came... and destroyed our home. I don't know how much longer we can keep them off. Can you help us?
key_value.68589: - Guard: Find and kill the witch who turned the animals against the villagers.
key_value.68590: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: The animals seem less vicious. Whatever effect the woman had on them, it's gone. We should report to the guard.
key_value.68591: ‹GREY›Witch: Haha! Foolish adventurer. Do you wish to oppose the strength of the forest?
key_value.68592: ‹PURPLE›Guard: You've killed the wicked witch? Now we can start rebuilding our community! Thank you, mighty stranger.
key_value.68593: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: So stranger, you've come to test your knowledge? Answer my three riddles correctly and I'll reward you. Answer them incorrectly... and you'll know the meaning of pain.
key_value.68594: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: If you're up to the challenge, simply eat one of my magic berries.
key_value.68595: - Shaman: Select the forage bush to start the riddles. Select one of the yurts to give your answer.
key_value.68596: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Ha, brave lad! Here goes the first one: What always runs but never walks, often murmurs, never talks, has a bed but never sleeps, has a mouth but never eats?
key_value.68600: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Haha, not so bright this time! But hold your tears. Eat another berry and try again.
key_value.68601: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Oops, wrong guess! If you're still up for it, you can eat another berry and try again.
key_value.68602: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Ah the will is strong in this one. Again: What always runs but never walks, often murmurs, never talks, has a bed but never sleeps, has a mouth but never eats?
key_value.68603: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Correct! I knew you were a bright one. If you're up for the second riddle, eat another one of those berries.
key_value.68604: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Riddle two it is! I am always hungry, I must always be fed, the finger I touch, will soon turn red. What am I?
key_value.68611: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: I'm sorry, but that's not correct. Eat another berry and try not to disappoint me again.
key_value.68612: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: Well done! You're one of the few souls who solved all my riddles. I'm impressed.
key_value.68613: ‹PURPLE›Shaman: My time is done here. The knowledge is passed on. Farewell stranger!
key_value.68614: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: You visit us at our darkest hour, stranger. Someone murdered my brother Supay and displayed his body in the middle of our town square!
key_value.68615: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: We've arrested four suspects, but we have no further clues. Perhaps you can shed some new light on this gruesome crime?
key_value.68616: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: Seek out some villagers and gather what intel you can find. If you've come to a conclusion, return to me and point out the murderer. I would be most grateful!
key_value.68617: - Inspector: Solve the murder on Supay. Question the villagers on the island (click on purple units).
key_value.68618: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: I think I've gathered enough clues. I should return to the town square and bring the murderer to justice.
key_value.68619: ‹PURPLE›Wife of Supay: I was already at bed when my husband Supay let someone in. It must be a local otherwise he wouldn't have opened the door. Some moments later I heard a terrible scream and ... (indistinct sobbing)
key_value.68620: ‹PURPLE›Veteran: I've seen many wounds during my life as a warrior. I tell you this stranger: the one that killed Supay clearly had a military training.
key_value.68621: ‹PURPLE›Blacksmith: The inspector asked me to take a look at the crime scene as I know a great deal about weapons. I've found nothing but a feather. Perhaps he was tickled to death?
key_value.68622: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: Before you voice your conclusions, take a moment to hear the last plea of the suspects. After all, their lives lay in your hands.
key_value.68623: ‹AQUA›Pacari: I'm Pacari, born and raised on this island. Those who know the jaguar warriors will know they value honor above all else. So I swear on my honor: I did not kill Supay!
key_value.68624: ‹YELLOW›Thonapa: I'm Thonapa, warrior from the Macapaba village to the south. I only arrived here after the murder, but the inspector won't believe me.
key_value.68625: ‹AQUA›Ikhuno: Ikhuno is the name. I live and train at the archery just behind us. Supay was a good neighbor. Why would I want him dead?
key_value.68626: ‹AQUA›Apaci the kind: They call me Apaci the kind. I spent my life on this island  reading the signs of the gods. Little do I know about killing.
key_value.68627: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: You've heard them all. Now, who do you accuse of murdering my brother?
key_value.68628: ‹AQUA›Pacari: Wait... What? I've done nothing wrong... Curse you stranger! You sentenced me to death!
key_value.68629: ‹YELLOW›Thonapa: Wait... What? I've done nothing wrong... Curse you stranger! You sentenced me to death!
key_value.68630: ‹AQUA›Apaci the kind: Wait... What? I've done nothing wrong... Curse you stranger! You sentenced me to death!
key_value.68631: ‹AQUA›Ikhuno: How did you...? It doesn't matter, I've no regret. Supay was an annoying man. He stole my arrows. He deserved to die! And so will you!
key_value.68632: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: Thank you for finding the murderer of my brother. Please accept this for your trouble.
key_value.68633: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: I'm not sure we've got the right one, stranger. At least somebody paid for the death of my brother. Please accept this for your troubles.
key_value.68634: ‹PURPLE›Inspector: With the murder over we can finally bury my brother. And guard, release the other suspects.
key_value.68635: ‹PURPLE›Trader: You want to make some extra coin? I heard the Macapabas are holding a festival and need lots of food. I can sell it high at their market.
key_value.68636: ‹PURPLE›Trader: Problem is, the fruit rots. If you can take me there fast enough, I'll split the profit. Just grab some food from our market when you're ready.
key_value.68637: - Trader: You've been asked to escort a trader to Macapaba in time. If you're ready, click on the market next to the trader.
key_value.68638: ‹PURPLE›Trader: Let's start our journey! Only 4 minutes until the fruit is unsellable.
key_value.68639: ‹PURPLE›Trader: Just our luck! This gate is locked. We need to get to another one... and fast!
key_value.68640: ‹PURPLE›Trader: Only 2 minutes left before the fruit turns bad.
key_value.68642: ‹PURPLE›Trader: Only 30 seconds. We need to get these fruits on the market. Now!
key_value.68643: - Trader: Bring him to the Macapaba market before his fruit has rotten.
key_value.68644: ‹PURPLE›Trader: Haha! They paid a great price for the fresh fruit. Just as I expected. Here is your share of the profit.
key_value.68645: ‹PURPLE›Trader: No! The fruit has rotten. We can only sell these as food for livestock. I wouldn't count on a great profit now.
key_value.68646: ‹PURPLE›Trader: As I expected. They would only accept the fruit for a low price. Here is your part of the profit. Too bad we weren't here before the fruit turned bad.
key_value.68647: ‹PURPLE›Priest: Los Negros are a brutal people. But now they have gone too far! They started building a temple on the island just south of here.
key_value.68648: ‹PURPLE›Priest: That island is ours! They have no right! Perhaps if their construction was disrupted by some white outlander, they'll see how foolish their plans are.
key_value.68649: ‹GREEN›Soldier: Invaders! Kill them. We only need another 40 seconds to complete the temple.
key_value.68650: - Januacu priests: Prevent the construction of the Los Negros temple.
key_value.68651: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: We've turned the construction site in chaos. This should please the Januacu priests. Let's return and claim our reward.
key_value.68652: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: We've failed to prevent the construction. We'd better not show our faces to the Januacu priests.
key_value.68653: ‹PURPLE›Priest: Haha, that will teach them! Good work.
key_value.68654: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: This place gives me the chills. Perhaps we can find someone in the town of Macapaba who knows more about this place.
key_value.68655: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Those cannibals were protecting the ruins of an ancient temple. Perhaps the nearby Macapaba tribe would find this interesting as well.
key_value.68656: ‹PURPLE›Researcher: We're currently excavating this ancient temple of Pachacamac, the two-faced god. I heard you found the location of a second temple. Thank you so much for the help!
key_value.68657: ‹BLUE›Conquistador: Looks like we disrupted the construction of a temple. Some Januacu priests might be interested in this information.
key_value.68658: ‹PURPLE›Priest: Los Negros tried to build a temple on our island?! And you stopped them? Ha, that will teach them.
key_value.68659: ‹BLUE›Orellana: Very well. All on board! Let's leave this mad river at once.
key_value.69005:
1. Do not try to enter Rome itself. Only death awaits you there.

2. Many barbarian refugees are still wandering the woods around Rome. Scout well and you might find a friend or two.

3. The trained legionaries possess great fighting abilities. Take them out first and don't let them near your troops.

4. The troops of Rome are powerful thanks to their organization and discipline. However, if you'd cut down the centurions, they'll lose their fighting spirit.

5. Alaric cannot advance to the next age.
key_value.69006:
Your scouts report:

Alaric (blue) marches from the east to cut off the supply lines of Rome. He does not have a base camp.

Barbarian refugees (gray) are scattered over the map. They are your allies and are willingly to join. Some refugees (purple) made up a provisionary camp in the south.

Your enemy, Rome (red), is located in the west. However, it's walls are too thick to breach. Worry more about the legions (yellow) they've sent out to counter Alaric's actions.
key_value.69013: ‹BLUE›GUARD: Scout! Why are you rushing upon our leader in this manner? Speak now before I cut you down where you stand.
key_value.69014: ‹PURPLE›SCOUT: I'm sorry great Alaric but I have news! Roman transport ships carry large amounts of food into the city by the river. If we are to challenge the Romans, we must stop this now!
key_value.69015: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: You're right, we must secure those supply lines! Rome's walls are strong, but they won't help against starvation. We'll take over that river!
key_value.69016: 1. Destroy the three watch towers to take control of the river.
key_value.69017: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: Great! We've taken control over the river... We should regroup with the other Goths before advancing.
key_value.69018: 2. Bring Alaric to the Goth camp in the south.
key_value.69019: ‹PURPLE›REFUGEE LEADER: Welcome king Alaric. With our combined strength, we can cut Rome's trade routes. Their trading post is just north of here.
key_value.69020: 3. Take over and hold the market to the north. This will cut off the final trade route to Rome.
key_value.69021: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: It is done. Every trader who comes here will be arrested. Now.. We wait for Rome to empty its legionaries upon us.
key_value.69022: ‹BLUE›We've lost control over the trade route. Our blockade has failed!
key_value.69024: 4. Repel the attack of the Roman legions. Do not let them destroy the market.
key_value.69025: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: The legion's attack has been repelled! All hail Alaric! All hail Alaric!
key_value.69026: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: With their supply lines cut off, the senate will be forced to meet our demands!
key_value.69027: ‹PURPLE›SOLDIER: I heard many refugees are still wandering these woods. Last night we saw campfires to the east.
key_value.69028: ‹BLUE›SCOUT: Alaric, we have found a Goth refugee camp. These fierce soldiers look eager to join our cause.
key_value.69029: ‹PURPLE›SOLDIER: The gates appear to be locked, but there is another passage to the north, my king.
key_value.69030: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: That monastery probably contains valuable treasures! Maybe we can 'convince' these priests to hand them over.
key_value.69031: - Sack the monastery by destroying it.
key_value.69032: - Search the eastern bank of the river for lost refugees. They'll be happy to join your forces.
key_value.69033: ‹GREY›REFUGEE: You! You're Alaric? I really need your help. I am part of a small group of refugees who has escaped a Roman camp to the north. There are several more of us there. You must help them! Please!
key_value.69034: - Help the refugee save his fellow soldiers from the Roman's stockade.
key_value.69035: ‹GREY›PRISONERS: Alaric! Our savior! Our weapons are yours!
key_value.69036: ‹GREEN›PRIEST: Stop! Leave our treasures and I'll offer you my services.
key_value.69505:
1. Your scout has very little HP. Try and avoid all conflicts to keep him alive.

2. The northern bridge forms a bottleneck. Here, a small force could hold back an entire army.

3. Athaulf has brought many capable soldiers. Make use of them.

4. Alaric may not reach the Imperial Age.
key_value.69506:
Your scouts report:

Alaric has set up his camp in the center of the map. He's waiting for the emperor's permission for his people to move to their new gained land.

Two friendly villages (Grey) are located west of Alaric's camp. They lack military strength, but can provide valuable intelligence.

The right hand of Alaric, Athaulf (green), has set up his camp in the east. He can provide additional troops when needed.

Your enemy, Roman legions (red and yellow), are scattered across the map.
key_value.69513: ‹PURPLE›PIKEMAN: My king, my king Alaric! One of our patrols was just slaughtered by Roman legionaries.
key_value.69514: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: What? Captain, what do you make of this? You said Rome's troops didn't follow us out here.
key_value.69515: ‹PURPLE›CAPTAIN: My king, the scouts' reports are comprehensive. Those legionaries must have come from somewhere else.
key_value.69516: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: Strange... Scout! I need you to investigate this. Ride to the nearby villages and find out where these legionaries came from.
key_value.69517: 1. Investigate the village to the north-west
key_value.69518: 2. Investigate the village to the south-west
key_value.69519: INFORMANT: Last days I've seen multiple Roman legions entering a camp to the south. They stop there to rest and then proceed to Rome. They carry the Imperial Standard.
key_value.69520: GUARD: HALT! This bridge is reserved for Roman legionaries! They shall not be hindered on their march to Rome.
key_value.69522: ‹BLUE›SCOUT: My king, it looks like Honorius is sending reinforcements to Rome behind our backs. They have a rally camp just west of us. We've been double-crossed!
key_value.69523: ‹PURPLE›ALARIC: What!? The Emperor will pay for his treachery! First, we'll take out that rally camp. Leave none alive.
key_value.69524: ‹BLUE›SCOUT: Looks like I need to find another way around this.
key_value.69526: 1. Destroy the rally camp by razing the main camp tent.
key_value.69527: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: Kill the rest of the treacherous Romans! Then we go back to the camp.
key_value.69528: ‹GREEN›SCOUT: My king, I've spotted a large legion moving towards the bridge in the north. We must intercept them before they reach Rome! They'll be here in 10 minutes.
key_value.69529: 2. Prepare your army for the incoming legion.
key_value.69530: ‹BLUE›5 minutes until the Roman army arrives
key_value.69531: ‹BLUE›2 minutes until the Roman army arrives.
key_value.69532: ‹BLUE›The Roman army is nearly upon us!
key_value.69533: ‹GREEN›SCOUT: Alaric, Athaulf! We've discovered a second and last rally camp to the north.We couldn't get any closer, because it is heavily fortified.
key_value.69534: 3. Kill the Roman General to break the morale of the incoming legion.
key_value.69535: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: Their General is dead! Give no quarter, kill any remaining soldier.
key_value.69536: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: Athaulf, send word to the rest of your men. We will need all the men we can muster for this.
key_value.69538: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: That will teach the Emperor not to betray the Goths again!
key_value.69539: Optional: Bring Athaulf to his camp in the east
key_value.69540: ‹BLUE›Men, it's time for battle! Follow me!
key_value.70004:
1. Use good tactics and pay heed to the suggestions of your soldiers. Staying on the main road, for example, would be wise.

2. Alaric's captain Athaulf has sent scouts and forces in the way ahead of Alaric. Some wait close by, while others wait in a port town, ready with more ships.

3. Bands of Saurus' men are known to be stationed outside Ravenna. Finding a sea route to the port would help you avoid impossible battles.

4. Saurus owns many ships around the waters of Ravenna. Staying clear of Ravenna while traveling overseas is a good idea, as you will be less prone to attacks.

5. The Goths are limited to the Castle Age.
key_value.70005:
Your scouts report:

Alaric (Cyan) begins with a small force in the west of the map, and plans to meet with the Emperor in Ravenna.

The city of Ravenna (Purple) lies in the east of the map on the Adriatic coast.

Several towns and villages (Red) litter the countryside, and some may be willing to aid you in your mission.

The forces of Saurus (Green) are your main adversary. Scores of infantry, cavalry, and archers roam the countryside, killing all they find. Saurus himself is known to control a fortress southwest of Ravenna.
key_value.70009: ‹BLUE›BODYGUARD: Alaric, our ally Athaulf has sent men ahead that are surely waiting for us. They will have scouted the area and will have some essential information for you.
key_value.70010: ‹BLUE›Knight: Ah, Alaric, at last! We've been waiting here for days now. Our mission was from Athaulf- we have scouted ahead for your arrival. In the plains to the east, we encountered a slain merchant and his cart.
key_value.70011: ‹BLUE›Surely it was but a bandit attack, but if I were you, I would be cautious about entering the woods. Also, men of the Goth, Saurus, have been seen lurking to the south. I wouldn't risk taking that way.
key_value.70012: ‹BLUE›There is a village up north that some of our men travelled to, but I have heard naught from them since. We should go check if they have any information for us.
key_value.70013: 1. Meet up with some of Athaulf's men to the east.
key_value.70014: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: What in the... bandits? We must not be delayed. Kill them!
key_value.70016: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: What the...?! We are being attacked! It is my old rival, Saurus!
key_value.70017: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: Alaric! And so we finally meet. We've acquired some ships to make the journey easier for you. We should pass Ravenna and go on to Ravenna's harbor. From there, it's almost a straight walk to the Gates.
key_value.70018: 2. Alaric must safely reach the northern village.
key_value.70019: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: I heard rumours about some restless mercenaries in the port to the east. Perhaps they are willing to join us?
key_value.70020: ‹BLUE›MERCENARY: Finally, a worthy commander to join! Let us leave this boring port.
key_value.70022: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: That wasn't the Emperor's harbor. Saurus has taken it over... I will have his head, after I've talked to the Emperor. To Ravenna!
key_value.70023: 4. Bring Alaric to the Emperor's palace in Ravenna.
key_value.70024: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: Saurus' men have locked the gates to Ravenna! The Emperor has betrayed us. Retreat! Retreat!
key_value.70025: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: My King. We have word of a troubled village to the south. We may shelter our troops there.
key_value.70026: 5. Bring Alaric to the Italian village to the south.
key_value.70027: ‹RED›KNIGHT: You! You are the Goth king who challenged Rome! You, can tame this beast! Saurus and his men are harrasing our village, claiming new people everyday to work at their fortress. Please, kill him for us!
key_value.70029: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: The fortress of Saurus is destroyed, but the man himself isn't here.. The traitor is a coward!
key_value.70505:
1. Assure that the eastern gate is destroyed, but protect your ram from counterattacks.

2. There are two routes to Athaulf's camp. The southern one through the countryside is far safer, but if you are really daring you can try to race through the camps of the Emperor's legions.

3. Beware counterattacks by the Emperor's legions in the rear of your camp.

4. Rome is well-defended by the city guard. It will take a great army to fight to the Arch of Constantine.

5. The Goths may reach the Imperial Age.
key_value.70506:
Your scouts report:

The Goths are attacking Rome from several sides. Alaric (Green) leads the main attack on the eastern walls, while Athaulf (Cyan) attacks the western wall.

The Emperor's legions (Purple) have been seen in the area, and may try to reinforce Rome.

The citizens of Rome (Red) care little for the conflict and are only interested in their own survival, so they will not offer resistance.

The City Guard (Yellow) is a different matter- their armies of infantry, archers, and cavalry will defend Rome with their lives.
key_value.70512: ‹GREEN›ALARIC: Bring down those towers! Bring them down!
key_value.70513: ‹GREEN›KNIGHT: Alaric, the ram is ready at the gate. Do you want me to give the order sir?
key_value.70515: ‹GREEN›SOLDIER: Watch out! The Emperor's legions have arrived! They must not reach the ram!
key_value.70517: ‹GREEN›ALARIC: Commander, send forth all legions. Do not stop the attack until the city is taken. Honorius will pay for his betrayal.
key_value.70518: ‹GREEN›ALARIC: Blasted! More of the Emperor's legionaries are attacking!
key_value.70519: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: We've repelled the attack! Now, it is Athaulf who must continue the attack. Courier! Deliver the orders to Athaulf!
key_value.70521: ‹BLUE›ATHAULF: Argh, we've lost too many men in that attack! We must rebuild before we can enter the city! You, villagers! We must gather plenty of food! We do not have enough food to feed more fighting men!
key_value.70522: 2. Deliver the attack orders to Athaulf.
key_value.70523: ATHAULF: Soldiers! This is it! Make ready the trebuchets!
key_value.70525: ‹BLUE›ATHAULF: We've now got enough resources to rebuild the army. We now follow Alaric's orders, we take ROME!
key_value.70526: >Select Athaulf when you're ready to attack Rome. <
key_value.70527: Ref: Caelir complaining about wood around Rome on the forum.
key_value.70530: 4. Launch the attack on Rome.(select Athaulf)
key_value.70531: Launch the attack on Rome.(select Athaulf)
key_value.70532:
‹RED›CIVILIAN: Please! End our misery! Stop the hunger! Go into the city, take what you need! We are starving inside here!

-Gate Unlocked-
key_value.70533: ‹RED›CENTURION: Get the Emperor's sister to safety. We fight to the death for Rome!
key_value.70534: ‹BLUE›ATHAULF: Our target is the legions defending the Arch of Constantine. Slay all opposition.
key_value.70535: 5. Bring Athaulf to the Arch of Constantine
key_value.70536: ‹BLUE›ATHAULF: We must hold this until reinforcements arrive!
key_value.70537: ‹BLUE›ATHAULF: The Emperor's sister has locked herself inside the Mausoleum of Hadrian! I think she wouldn't mind some Goths invading her privacy.
key_value.70538: 6. Bring Athaulf to the Mausoleum of Hadrian
key_value.70539: ‹BLUE›ATHAULF: Well, well, the emperor's sister! Don't worry my lady, I won't harm you. You are far too valuable for our negotiations. Rome on the other hand...
key_value.70541: ‹BLUE›ALARIC: Let the men sack Rome... It will be a lesson for the treacherous Emperor!
key_value.71007:
1. Always keep your troops together. Spreading out is of no advantage.

2. Protect your healer.

3. There is no need to limit yourself to one quest. But eventually, as you go along a quest line all other quests will be locked.

4. All quest lines have different endings, resulting in three different ways to win this scenario.

5. If you are going to hunt, keep a lot of archers alive. If you are going to attack Bhimdev Solanki, keep a lot of melee units alive.

6. During the hunt you can heal Prithvi by eating berries from forage bushes.
key_value.71008:
Your scouts report:

You are a young prince (Orange) eager to prove yourself by hunting.

Your father, the king (Green) thinks you should visit the guru Ram Purohit (Yellow) in the mountains.

Talks of a new foe (Red) have reach Delhi. This new foe has an encampment south of the river.

There are bridges across the river- one at Delhi Harbor and one at the Mining Town to the east.

In this scenario you are limited to the Feudal Age and can't advance further.
key_value.71009: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: Father, I'm going out for a hunt. I'm taking the poet with me.
key_value.71010: ‹GREEN›Raja Someshwar: You cannot always hunt, son. One day you must find a lovely wife and have many children. I urge you to visit the guru instead.
key_value.71018: ‹GREEN›Soldier: We heard you were going out for a hunt. We will come with you.
key_value.71020: ‹RED›Rider: Down with the Raja! Long live Bhimdev Solanki!
key_value.71021: ‹ORANGE›Chand Bhai: I think that was the last of them my prince. But who is Bhimdev Solanki? And why didn't the tower signal to the troops?
key_value.71035: ‹YELLOW›Confused Farmer: Where is that blasted hoe!
key_value.71037: ‹YELLOW›Mahout: Greetings my prince! I bring bad news. A man called Bhimdev Solanki has built a military camp south of the river and is wreaking havoc over there.
key_value.71038: ‹GREEN›Soldier: My prince! Bhimdev Solanki just crossed this river. We managed to capture his ships and were thinking of bringing them to the drydock upstream.
key_value.71039: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: The bridge is out of service, my prince. We will need to cross the river by boat.
key_value.71040: ‹RED›Archer: This town belongs to the lord Bhimdev Solanki, and we will crush any attempt to take it from him.
key_value.71041: ‹YELLOW›Villager: Thank you for helping our town. But we fear Bhimdev Solanki's men will return.
key_value.71042: ‹ORANGE›Chand Bhai: It seems we've captured enemy documents. Bhimdev Solanki's camp is just south of here.
key_value.71044: - Liberate the town (yellow) across the river.
key_value.71045: ‹ORANGE›Chand Bhai: Seems like they will keep attacking. We must barricade this town. Use the villagers to build a watch tower.
key_value.71046: - Finish the watch tower to protect the town.
key_value.71047: ‹YELLOW›Villager: Thank you my prince! Please accept this as a token of our gratitude.
key_value.71048: ‹ORANGE›Chand Bhai: My prince, we cannot destroy the castle without siege weapons. Turn around at once!
key_value.71049: ‹ORANGE›Chand Bhai: Great! With this town liberated the bridges can be repaired.
key_value.71052: ‹AQUA›Spearman: Welcome to our peaceful village my lord! Here we live in harmony and wealth. Tread into the jungle beyond here and see for yourself.
key_value.71053: - Witness the village source of wealth.
key_value.71054: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: Watch out! It's an ambush, my prince!
key_value.71055: ‹ORANGE›Chand Bhai: We've managed to capture a horse and a donkey. Have we not walked enough?
key_value.71056: - Bring Chand Bhai to the donkey to mount him.
key_value.71058: - Bring Prithvi to the horse to mount him.
key_value.71059: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: With these rams we could easily take down a castle.
key_value.71060: - Find out why the troops didn't move to counter the attack.
key_value.71061: ‹GREEN›Thirsty Soldier: Thank you for coming my prince! The lake had dried up after Solanki's men surrounded us. If it weren't for you, we would have died from thirst!
key_value.71062: ‹GREEN›Watchman: I alerted the troops when I saw the enemy, long before your arrival my prince. There was nothing else I could do.
key_value.71063: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: Stay behind, men. This is a journey I must make alone.
key_value.71065: ‹YELLOW›Ram Purohit: I'm glad you came my prince. Your father has asked me to arrange a meeting. Tread in to the jungle north of here if you please.
key_value.71066: - Tread into the jungle and meet someone.
key_value.71067: ‹YELLOW›Sanyogita: Hello! I'm Sanyogita. Pleased to finally meet you, Prithviraj. I am here to offer my hand to you. If you can beat my champion, that is.
key_value.71068: - Beat Sanyogita's champion to gain her love.
key_value.71069: ‹YELLOW›Sanyogita: Ohh my prince! I now know whom I love. But I fear our love to be opposed by my father. He intends to marry me with a foreigner to gain power. But when we meet again, I shall run away with you.
key_value.71070: ‹YELLOW›Villager: Help, help! The tiger took my family. Help me shoot it please!
key_value.71071: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: Stay back men. I will slay the beast myself.
key_value.71073: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: That wasn't a tiger. That was a lion and I slew it barehanded. Right?
key_value.71074: ‹YELLOW›Villager: Yes my prince. A lion it was, not a tiger.
key_value.71075: ‹YELLOW›Ram Purohit: Hunting for women is like hunting blindfolded. You can hunt for eternity without ever striking the target. Therefore, I can teach you the art of shooting blindly. If you follow me.
key_value.71076: ‹YELLOW›Ram Purohit: My dear prince, please try to shoot at those sandfilled dolls across the river. But with this blindfold on. You have 9 seconds.
key_value.71078: ‹YELLOW›Ram Purohit: I'm sorry, but you were too slow.
key_value.71079: ‹YELLOW›Ram Purohit: Let's try again, my prince.
key_value.71080: ‹YELLOW›Refugee: Please save our town across the river from Bhimdev Solanki!
key_value.71081: ‹YELLOW›Camel Rider: My prince! We've come to aid you.
key_value.71082: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: We are here! Everyone with a bow follow me.
key_value.71083: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: That looks like a really fat boar! If we lure it into the river it would surely drown.
key_value.71084: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: I am now ready to stand on my own two feet.
key_value.71085: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: We are victorious! This will be of benefit for Delhi.
key_value.71086: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: Hunting like this, I no longer fear the face of death.
key_value.71087: - Bring the ships to the drydock to the west.
key_value.71088: ‹GREEN›Shipbuilder: These ships has seen better days. While I shape them up, maybe you can do a little hunting, my prince. I would need a new pelt for the bed anyway.
key_value.71089: ‹YELLOW›Pikeman: Help us, my lord. Bhimdev Solanki's troops have occupied our mining town. Without this town the bridges cannot be repaired.
key_value.71090: ‹AQUA›Rider: My prince. While you are out, why don't you visit our prosperous village and learn about our ways? *Chuckles*
key_value.71091: - Liberate the mining town, so that the bridges can be repaired.
key_value.71092: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: Due to their bad condition the ships have sunk, my prince.
key_value.71093: ‹YELLOW›Ram Purohit: Well done my prince. You have mastered the arts of shooting blindly.
key_value.71094: - Master the art of shooting blindly.
key_value.71096: ‹ORANGE›Prithvi: These berries have healed me completely!
key_value.71098: ‹YELLOW›Sanyogita: Thank you my prince, I was on my way to the guru Ram Purohit when Bhimdev Solanki's men found me and brought me here.
key_value.71099: ‹YELLOW›Sanyogita: Thank you my prince, I've been hiding behind that tree for hours.
key_value.71507:
1. There isn't much gold so you'll mostly have to rely on trade for an income. You can sell food and wood if needed.

2. Most of the resources can be found in the wilderness outside of your bases. However, watch out for enemy raids. Your walled towns will be able to protect your villagers from your enemies if they're under attack.

3. The rival states can be taken by force but they also might be persuaded to join you. Maybe our scout knows things that can be used to this purpose.
key_value.71508:
Your scouts report:

The ruler of the Solankis wants to build a monument but his empire's resources don't match his ambitions.

The Paramaras are having problems defending their land against their neighbors, even with their knowledge on how to build trebuchets.

Kashmir has access to many riches in the North but it needs to trade them with the rest of India. The other kingdoms on the other hand aren't very fond of another rival accessing their markets.

The Solankis have a mighty fortress but have been in a fierce rivalry with the Gaharwars and their leader. They'd welcome anyone who could help them get rid of the Gaharwars.

The Gaharwars are lead by a strong raja, Jaichand of Kannauj, who would never consider submitting to another ruler. But with him gone, his people might think otherwise perhaps.

The Ghaznavids are a constant threat to Northern-India. They will not stop before they have achieved their goal of the conquest of the whole of India.
key_value.71511: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: The other rivals have but two choices. They will ally with me or they will perish. Whatever their choice is, Rajputana will be mine in the end.
key_value.71512: ‹BLUE›Kashmir: The Gaharwars, our lords, have blocked the southern markets to cut of your trade, but instead they're hurting our trade income. If you can liberate it we'll stop listening to our overlords and ally with you instead.
key_value.71513: ‹BLUE›Kashmir: You opened the southern markets for us. I, the ruler of Kashmir, will be at your service for the remainder of my years.
key_value.71514: ‹PURPLE›Gaharwars: With our army and leader gone we're left defenseless. If you can bring us twenty-five elephant archers to defend ourselves, we'll submit to you.
key_value.71515: ‹PURPLE›Gaharwars: That will do. Thank you, for the mighty elephants.
key_value.71516: ‹YELLOW›Chandelas: We are tired of the Gaharwars. Get rid of their leader and we'll ally with you.
key_value.71517: ‹YELLOW›Chandelas: You managed to capture Jaichand- the gods must favor you! We are now allies.
key_value.71518: ‹AQUA›Paramaras: We like the idea of an alliance, but we need to be able to protect ourselves. Can you build a castle for us on this hilltop?
key_value.71519: ‹AQUA›Paramaras: With that castle at our gates our enemies will think twice before invading us.
key_value.71520: ‹GREY›Solankis: You want us to help you? We need you to help us first. We want to build a monument but we lack the resources. Send us the building materials for it and we'll join your cause.
key_value.71521: ‹GREY›Solankis: Our new monument will be the pearl of our city. We thank you, Prithviraj.
key_value.71522: ‹AQUA›Paramaras: Some of these fortresses are very strong. If you can bring us the relic, that is said to be in the North, we'll help you by building trebuchets for you.
key_value.71523: ‹AQUA›Paramaras: Excellent. We will provide you with the trebuchets you need.
key_value.71524: ‹PURPLE›Jaichand: I think it's time to make it clear that I rule over these parts. I will get rid of you myself.
key_value.71525: ‹BLUE›Kashmir: Spies report that Ghaznavid warriors are planning to invade the land!
key_value.71528: 1. Conquer, vassalize, or subjugate 4 out of 5 enemy states, excluding the Ghaznavids (green).
key_value.71529: -Destroy the Gaharwar (purple) towers defending the southern market to help Kashmir (blue).
key_value.71530: -Bring twenty-five Elephant Archers to the Gaharwars (purple).
key_value.71531: -Kill the Raja of the Gaharwars (purple) so that Chandelas (yellow) can ally with you.
key_value.71532: -Build a castle on the flagged hill near the Paramaras (teal).
key_value.71533: -Send the Solankis (grey) 1000 stone, 1000 gold and 1000 wood for their monument.
key_value.71534: -Give the relic to the Paramaras in order to acquire trebuchets.
key_value.71535: ‹ORANGE›Villagers: We're looking for a new home. Can you help us?
key_value.71536: ‹ORANGE›Merchant: We're unhappy with the new taxes in Chandela lands. Can we trade for you instead?
key_value.71537: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: We've found gold in this abandoned temple!
key_value.71538: ‹RED›Sadhu: I've lived here in peace for many years. I guess it's time for me to disappear again. But let me help you with your life's quest before I go.
key_value.71539: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: Where did he go to? And why are some of these rocks gleaming all of a sudden?
key_value.71540: ‹RED›Villager: Ghaznavid raiders are crossing the river! Please, someone help us!
key_value.71541: At least one of the two castles you begin with must stand.
key_value.71542: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: Without the two cities I have nothing left.
key_value.71544: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: Prithviraj has died. His empire is doomed!
key_value.71545: ‹GREY›Solankis: Thank you, for helping us finish our Monument. In return, we'll make sure the Ghaznavids are busy for a while.
key_value.71546: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: Against all odds Prithviraj succeeded. We are victorious!
key_value.72006:
1. Reveal the red guardposts and use walkarounds (Follow the bright road).

2. You can attack guards from behind, resulting in a backstab that kills them instantly.

3. Stay away from the Royal Guards in the garden. Backstabbing won't work on them.

4. Keep a lookout for berry bushes. If you are hurt they can heal you.

5. When escaping the city, leave some units to shield your escape.

6. There are rumors of a passage that the bandits use to travel between Delhi and Kannauj.

7. Scout the areas around Delhi and visit the indian villages, they could help you.

8. The market in Delhi is closed, you have to find its trading partner to reopen it.
key_value.72007:
Your scouts report:

Prithviraj (Orange) starts alone and unmounted in the south. His capital Delhi (Yellow) lies in the north and there are friendly Indian villages (Green) in the countryside.

Kannauj (Purple) lies to the south, Raja Jaichand's army (Red) is in the central area. There are bandits (Grey) scattered between the settlements.
key_value.72022: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: I'll infiltrate Kannauj to steal away Sanyogita from the Swayamvara. Stay here and await my return. Be ready to cover our retreat!
key_value.72024: 1. Prithviraj must reach Sanyogita and take her with him. Sneak behind the red guards to avoid detection.
key_value.72025: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: My love, I've come to take you away! Follow me to the market. I'll sneak you out of the city by trade cart.
key_value.72027: 2. Take both Prithviraj and Sanyogita to the Marketplace and steal a cart.
key_value.72028: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: My men are waiting outside the city gates. Just keep your head down and we’ll be out of here before they know it!
key_value.72030: 3. Leave the town and reach Prithviraj's men.
key_value.72031: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: Sanyogita, my love, please get in the carriage. We have to reach Delhi before your father finds out you're gone.
key_value.72033: ‹PURPLE›Raja Jaichand: Scout, my daughter is kidnapped! Send out all of our troops and find her!!!
key_value.72034: ‹PURPLE›City Guard: The gates are locked for the Swayamvara...
key_value.72035: *Prithviraj passes a golden coin through the gate.
key_value.72036: ‹PURPLE›City Guard: ...but a stranger with a fat purse is always welcome. One word of advice though: avoid the red city guard. They’re married to duty and don't care for gold.
key_value.72037: ‹PURPLE›Gate Guard: These elite guards are a real menace when they work together, you know.
key_value.72038: ‹RED›From inside the tower: I've heard that the Royal Guard inside the garden are really tough soldiers, one even took a knife in the back and survived.
key_value.72039: ‹RED›Market Guard: No one is allowed to come near the cargo area. Defend yourself!
key_value.72040: The Carriage with Sanyogita must not be destroyed.
key_value.72041: 4. Get Prithviraj and the carriage to the castle in Delhi.
key_value.72042: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: We made it, my love! But we're not safe yet. I expect your father will try everything to get you back. Hide in the castle while I fight him off.
key_value.72043: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: This road is blocked. We need to find another way.
key_value.72044: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: A smuggler's tunnel! This could be our salvation...
key_value.72045: ‹YELLOW›Captain: Thanks for saving us, my king! Those bandits surprised us on our patrol.
key_value.72046: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: These bandits were very thoughtful to leave so much gold for us.
key_value.72047: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: I can see light at the end of this tunnel!
key_value.72048: 5. Break the Siege of Delhi by destroying Raja Jaichand's two Castles.
key_value.72049: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: The siege has been lifted, my marriage and my city is safe!
key_value.72050: ‹RED›Red Guard: Guards! It's Prithviraj! Kill him!
key_value.72051: - Regain control of the gold mine outside of Delhi by destroying all of Jaichand's fire towers.
key_value.72052: - Capture 5 relics from the holy temple of Kannauj and place them inside the yellow monastery in Delhi.
key_value.72053: ‹PURPLE›They've taken all of our holy relics to Delhi, it is a sign that their cause is just. Therefore, we shall be merciful.
key_value.72054: - Finish the new aqueduct to bring fresh water to Delhi.
key_value.72055: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: With this new aqueduct, we can properly cook our food.
key_value.72057: ‹GREEN›Villager: Hello! Can you please help us? The Raja keeps travelling up the river, taking our food as he moves by. Can you help us reconstruct our tower on the cliff so that we may keep them out?
key_value.72058: - Help the village build a tower to stop the incoming ships.
key_value.72059: ‹GREEN›Villager: Thank you, my Raj! In return these monks will serve you as long as you may have them.
key_value.72060: ‹GREEN›Soldier: This village suffers from the forces of Jaichand. Will you help us find a new home?
key_value.72061: - Transport the refugees to their new home.
key_value.72062: ‹GREEN›Villager: We are forever in your dept. Here, take this as reward.
key_value.72063: ‹GREEN›Camel Trainer: For only 300 gold I will teach you my secrets of camel training. (Research Imperial Camel)
key_value.72064: - Accumulate 300 gold and select the green stable to research Imperial Camel.
key_value.72065: ‹GREEN›Lumberjack: Pulling these logs is hard. But if you bring me two camels I'll be happy to supply wood to your cause. Bring them to the pile of logs behind me.
key_value.72067: - Give the Lumberjack two camels, so that he may supply you with wood.
key_value.72068: ‹GREEN›Young Man: Help! Please save my mother from the wolves outside her cabin.
key_value.72069: - Slay the wolves outside the cabin.
key_value.72071: ‹GREEN›Mother: Bless you, Raj! As a reward I shall teach you about herbal medicine.
key_value.72072: ‹GREEN›Trader: Could I ask for your help? This trade cart needs an escort to the yellow market in Delhi.
key_value.72073: - Escort the trade cart to the yellow market in Delhi.
key_value.72074: ‹YELLOW›Trader: Thank you! We will engage in trade with you.
key_value.72075: ‹YELLOW›My king? The city is the other way...
key_value.72077: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: These berries have healed me completely!
key_value.72505:
1. The battle is winnable with any of the troop choices, but your strategy must vary. Archers should leave the fighting on the front lines to elephants and fire from a distance instead, while horsemen are good for flanking maneuvers.

2. Make sure to get the experience bonus for your regiment sooner or later, for it will help you to win the first battle.

3. Cutting enemy supply lines will reduce the strength of the defenders of Bathinda.
