4. Ghori's headquarters to the far north can prove to be challenging to destroy, but taking it out earlier would be beneficial.

5. Do not rely only on one type of soldiers, because their loyalty could decide the conflict for either side.
key_value.72506:
Your scouts report:

The army of Prithviraj Chauhan (Red) is lined up along the southeast side of the battlefield, consisting of medium and light infantry, foot archers, camels and small regiments of monks, knights and elephants.

The army of Muhammad Ghori (Green) takes the northwest side of the field. His army consists of cavalry archers, light cavalry, camels, mamelukes, knights and mounted monks. Ghori's forces also have an encampment to the far north.

Bathinda (Yellow) is a well-fortified city to the northwest. Its garrison consists of horse archers, pikemen and skirmishers.

Tarain (Cyan) is a small village to the southeast. It won't take sides but can be used for trade by the Chauhans.
key_value.72508: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: Raja, please choose the troops that you shall command during the battle!
key_value.72509: Select the Chu Ko Nu to choose the arbalest regiment.
key_value.72511: Select the Paladin to choose the Cavalier regiment.
key_value.72512: ‹ORANGE›Cavalier: We are the finest Rajput cavalry!
key_value.72513: Select the Imperial Camel to choose the elephant regiment.
key_value.72515: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: The battle has started. Full advance! Charge!!!
key_value.72516: -Bring at least 10 of your units to the enemy hill, marked with a flag.
key_value.72517: ‹ORANGE›Marksman: The hill is secured. We are more experienced and have become sharpshooters now.
key_value.72518: -Raid the enemy's baggage train and destroy the main yurt.
key_value.72519: ‹ORANGE›Cavalier: The commander's yurt is in ashes. Our horses are better trained and swifter from now on.
key_value.72521: ‹ORANGE›Mahout: We inflicted heavy casualties. The elephants can endure more fatigue in future battles.
key_value.72523: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: Ghori is fleeing, we have won the battle!
key_value.72524: -Destroy the castle in Ghori's camp. It acts as the headquarters and manages the training of the elite troops.
key_value.72525: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: The enemy castle is no more!
key_value.72526: -Destroy the mosque in the city, to boost your religious power.
key_value.72527: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: We have acquired great knowledge from sacred texts in the ruins of the mosque!
key_value.72528: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: This wood pile can be used to build siege engines, but first we have to bring our villagers here.
key_value.72529: -Bring 5 villagers to the wood pile east of the fortress.
key_value.72531: -Destroy the market in the supply camp northeast of Bathinda.
key_value.72532: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: We have cut Bathinda's food supply! This will surely weaken its garrison!
key_value.72533: -Destroy the connecting reservoir of the aqueduct to the west.
key_value.72534: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: We have cut Bathinda's water supply! Without water, the defenders will be helpless!
key_value.72535: 2. Defeat Muhammad Ghori and capture Bathinda.
key_value.72536: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: The victory is ours! Let us rejoice!
key_value.72537: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: We are now ready to assault the city. Charge!
key_value.72541: ‹GREEN›Muhammad Ghori: I used the time you spent on attacking that pitiful town to gather many allies under my banners! Run Prithvi, run while you still can!
key_value.72542: ‹GREEN›Muhammad Ghori: I learned for your custom to fight only from dawn and until dusk, noble indeed... Launch the night attack!
key_value.72543: ‹GREEN›Muhammad Ghori: Today you win, but our day of reckoning will come, Chauhan!
key_value.72544: ‹ORANGE›Deserter: We are doomed... Great Sultan, please spare us and we will join you instead!
key_value.72545: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: This is the water supply of the city.
key_value.72546: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: Boulders blocked the river, we can't use our trade carts or receive reinforcements anymore. However, we can use trade cogs.
key_value.72547: ‹AQUA›Villager: We will give you workers to aid you in your fight!
key_value.72548: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: This is the food supply of the city.
key_value.72550: ‹ORANGE›Prithviraj: Now we have to build a strong encampment and take Bathinda!
key_value.72551: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: The dishonorable Ghori attacked before sunrise, which is against the code of war, and inflicted heavy casualties on us.
key_value.72552: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: This must be the seat from which Ghori gives his orders.
key_value.72553: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: I wonder what treasures this Mosque can provide to us?
key_value.72554: ‹ORANGE›Chand Bhai: Ah... my Raj, I'm terribly wounded and I have to retreat to my quarters. You must carry on, without me!
key_value.72555: ‹GREEN›Muhammad Ghori: Ah... I die for the glory of the mighty Ghorid Empire!
key_value.73007:
1. The roads in the region around Kurikara are crawling with Taira troops. Taking the most direct route to the city would be advisable.

2. The Taira do not yet know that supplies have been delivered to the city, but they will soon attack ferociously.

3. The sea is of great strategic importance, but the route out of the bay is blocked by dangerous rocks…

4. Having conscripted all locals into the army, the Taira are unable to rebuild any buildings.

5. This battle occurs long before the advent of gunpowder weapons.
key_value.73008:
Your scouts report:

-Minamoto no Yoritomo has sent a relief force (Blue) to aid the defenders of the strategic city of Kurikara (Purple), a walled city loyal to Minamoto and under the command of his cousin Yoshinaka.

-The Hojo Clan (Yellow) has a city in the east under the sovereignty of their lord Tokimasa, who has no love for the Taira but will only consider joining the Minamoto if they can break the siege of Kurikara.

-The Taira Army (Orange) will be your primary opponent early on. Their forward siege camp must be destroyed if the siege of Kurikara is to be broken, and three military encampments guard the crossings of the river.

-The Taira Guards (Green) patrol the countryside and their villagers are feeding and supplying the Taira forces.

-Surrounded with a moat and fortified with strong walls, towers, and castles, the Taira capital of Kyoto (Cyan) has yet to be captured by an invading army. Should the walls be breached, legions of soldiers will rush to the defense.

-The Taira armies are commanded by fierce warlords and princes (Red), not the least of them the Emperor Taira no Kiyomori himself. Killing the princes commanding the Taira armies in the field is vital to the success of your armies.
key_value.73022: ‹BLUE›SCOUT: The road to Kurikara is well guarded. We must be swift and elusive if we are to reach the city alive!
key_value.73023: 1. Bring the supply cart and at least one soldier to Yoshinaka's palace (marked by the blue flag).
key_value.73024: ‹PURPLE›YOSHINAKA: Many thanks for the supplies- we are barely holding out. What news from Minamoto?
key_value.73025: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: The cart has been destroyed! How will we supply Yoshinaka now?
key_value.73026: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: Minamoto promises to send help over the mountains, but is currently occupied with a rebellion. We are sent to aid in the defense of the city.
key_value.73027: ‹PURPLE›YOSHINAKA: Very well- we will do the best we can. Take over defense of the city!
key_value.73028: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: Hurry men, to the defenses! Defend Kurikara with honor!
key_value.73030: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: Yoshinaka's palace has fallen! We are surely doomed...
key_value.73031: 2. Defeat the Taira Army (Orange) and slay the 5 Taira princes (Red) commanding it.
key_value.73032: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: The Taira armies are defeated and their princes slain!
key_value.73033: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: We have slain Taira no Kiyofusa!
key_value.73034: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: We have slain Taira no Tadanori!
key_value.73035: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: We have slain Taira no Michimori!
key_value.73036: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: We have slain Taira no Tomonori!
key_value.73037: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: We have slain Taira no Tsunemasa!
key_value.73038: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: My lord, we wish to sail around the northern peninsula but are unable to do so due to the treacherous rocks. If we were to capture the lighthouse, then our ships would be able to sail through!
key_value.73039: -Kill Taira no Kiyofusa and his personal guard and capture the lighthouse (monument) so your ships can sail through the rocks unscathed.
key_value.73040: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: The lighthouse is ours! Now we can sail through!
key_value.73041: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: A cart has arrived over the mountains from Kamakura. Ensure that it reaches the palace in Kurikara!
key_value.73042: -Bring carts arriving from Kamakura to your palace in Kurikara to receive 1000 gold per cart.
key_value.73043: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: My lord, the Hojo clan requests that we send an envoy to their palace to discuss an alliance.
key_value.73044: -Bring one military unit to the Hojo palace to negotiate an alliance.
key_value.73045: ‹YELLOW›HOJO TOKIMASA: I wish to make war on the Taira, but I do not have the proper weaponry. If you bring me 2 trebuchets, then I will commit to this war.
key_value.73046: -Bring 2 trebuchets to Hojo Tokimasa's palace to earn his alliance.
key_value.73047: ‹YELLOW›HOJO TOKIMASA: We fight with the Minamoto clan!
key_value.73048: ‹BLUE›MINAMOTO: May the world quake and the Taira fools tremble before the might of my army!
key_value.73049: ‹BLUE›MINAMOTO: It is time to take the battle to the Taira heartland. We march on Kyoto!
key_value.73051: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: Minamoto-sama has fallen! We are doomed to dishonor!
key_value.73052: 3. Conquer Kyoto from the Taira by destroying all military buildings, slaying all defenders, and killing Emperor Taira no Kiyomori.
key_value.73053: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: Minamoto-sama, Taira no Kiyomori is dead and Kyoto is ours!
key_value.73054: ‹BLUE›SAMURAI: We are nearing the Imperial city of Kyoto. It is far too well defended to attack before we have defeated the Taira armies in the field!
key_value.73105:
1. Protect the local villages to ensure a steady flow of tribute.

2. Paying the tributes the White Huns ask of you isn't obligatory, but the White Huns are a dangerous adversary and placating them early on would be wise.

3. Forming an alliance with the Gokturks will help you in defeating the White Huns.

4. If you are low on gold, you can earn a great profit through trade with the trading post at the other end of the Silk Road.

5. Cavalry Archers dominate these plains- countering them with Halberdiers and Elite Skirmishers will be the most cost effective solution. The Persians have excellent cavalry so be sure to use them as well. War Elephants, on the other hand, aren't very useful in this situation.

6. Savarans are Persian heavy cavalry that can regenerate. They come at a price but they are worth their weight in gold.
key_value.73106:
Your scouts report:

-In the West, several Persian villages lie spread out over the land. They have little to no fortifications.

-In the North live the tribes of the Gokturks.

-In the East the White Huns have several fortifications in strong positions.

-There is a Fire Temple dedicated to Zoroaster on the edge of the Persian sphere of influence.

-The Silk Road, a trade route stretching from China to the Byzantine Empire, winds through this land and trade is very lucrative here.
key_value.73107: ‹YELLOW› KHOSRAU: Those treacherous Huns have been squeezing our empire dry for far too long. Our army is on its way but we must keep on paying the Huns until it arrives.
key_value.73108: ‹ORANGE›GUIDE: Welcome to Khorasan, my lord. Follow me, I'll lead you to a good place to set up camp.
key_value.73109: ‹ORANGE› GUIDE: This is the spot. Here you can build a small base and collect the resources to pay off the White Huns until you are strong enough.
key_value.73110: ‹ORANGE› GUIDE: The Persian villages will give you their resources as long as they're protected. Raiders are often sighted in these regions so your help is much needed.
key_value.73112: ‹YELLOW›KHOSRAU: The White Huns have a battle-hardened army matching our own. Maybe we should contact the Gokturks, a natural enemy of theirs, and attack them from two fronts.
key_value.73113: ‹AQUA› GOKTURKS: So you want an alliance with us against the White Huns? Very well. Just don't get in our way.
key_value.73114: ‹YELLOW› COMMANDER: The Persian army has arrived sir...
key_value.73115: ‹YELLOW› KHOSRAU: Wait, this is it? Where is the rest of the army?
key_value.73116: ‹YELLOW› COMMANDER: Our Western general is still negotiating with the Byzantines about the peace treaty and needs our army in case negotiations fail. However, we do bring you our best cavalry technologies and war elephants.
key_value.73117: ‹YELLOW› KHOSRAU: It seems that we'll have to do it ourselves then. I will need control over all of our resources to do so.
key_value.73118: ‹ORANGE› PERSIAN VILLAGES: We're at your command.
key_value.73119: ‹YELLOW› KHOSRAU: We're ready to bring the fight to the White Huns. Let them know we're done paying tribute.
key_value.73120: ‹GREEN› How dare you! My army will crush you Persian!
key_value.73121: ‹YELLOW› KHOSRAU: The Silk Road going through this region could make us a lot of money. However, the White Huns control the road between India and Persia.
key_value.73122: ‹YELLOW› KHOSRAU: Great. Now with the Silk Road in our hands we'll earn extra income.
key_value.73123: ‹AQUA› GOKTURKS: With the White Huns gone, we think we should control the income of the trade in this region. You'd just waste it on your war against the Byzantines anyway.
key_value.73124: ‹YELLOW› KHOSRAU: The true backbone of the Persian army is its heavy armored cavalry like the Cataphracts and the Savarans. It seems we can recruit some here. (Click on the big pavilion- 1500 gold for 10)
key_value.73125: ‹BLUE› TRAINER: Your Savarans are ready, my lord.
key_value.73126: ‹AQUA›GOKTURKS: These mines on the plateau are ours. Stop mining there or I'll get rid of your miners myself.
key_value.73127: ‹AQUA› GOKTURKS: That's it. If you want to mine there, you'll have to fight for it.
key_value.73128: ‹BLUE› MONK: Welcome, my lord. We monks follow the ways of Zoroaster but we're short on men. If you bring us 10 villagers we will give you some of our relics. After all this is the homeland of Zoroaster and there are plenty of relics here.
key_value.73129: ‹BLUE› MONK: Thank you, my lord. Let us help you bring the relics to your camp.
key_value.73130: ‹BLUE› FISHERMAN: To prevent overfishing we breed our own fish. If you send us 1000 wood we would be able to build more traps and release the fish occasionally.
key_value.73131: ‹BLUE›FISHERMAN: Thank you. You'll now be able to keep a large fishing fleet at all times.
key_value.73132: ‹AQUA› GOKTURKS: You've defeated us?! Fine, we'll keep our promise and retreat behind the Oxus river.
key_value.73133: ‹GREEN› WHITE HUNS: How is this possible? You've utterly defeated us...
key_value.73134: ‹YELLOW›KHOSRAU: We've defeated our enemies and avenged my grandfather. Long live the Persian Empire!
key_value.73135: ‹YELLOW› COMMANDER: Khosrau is dead! We've failed to protect the empire.
key_value.73136: ‹AQUA›GOKTURKS: So you think you can dishonor our treaty? We'll see about that.
key_value.73139: 1. Follow the guide to the place where you can set up your base.
key_value.73140: 2. Reach the Imperial Age and wait for your army to arrive.
key_value.73145: - Pay 400 gold in tribute to the White Huns within 5 minutes.
key_value.73146: - Pay 600 gold in tribute to the White Huns within 5 minutes.
key_value.73147: - Pay 1000 gold in tribute to the White Huns within 5 minutes.
key_value.73148: - Send a messenger to the Gokturks to form an alliance.
key_value.73149: -Destroy and replace the towers guarding the Silk Road.
key_value.73151: -Tribute 1000 wood to Khorasan to earn access to their fish supply.
key_value.73152: -You can train ten Savarans by clicking on the main pavilion (costs 1500 gold).
key_value.73153: ‹GREEN›WHITE HUNS: We expect you to pay us 400 gold. If you don't you'll face our wrath.
key_value.73154: ‹GREEN›WHITE HUNS: That will do for now...
key_value.73155: ‹GREEN› WHITE HUNS: My spies tell me the great Khosrau himself has arrived to manage his Eastern provinces. I suspect we can expect a bit more this time then. 600 gold.
key_value.73156: ‹GREEN›WHITE HUNS: I knew you were a man of your word. You'll hear from me again soon.
key_value.73157: ‹GREEN›WHITE HUNS: I think there's much more gold hidden in your empire somewhere. We now want 1000 gold.
key_value.73158: ‹GREEN› WHITE HUNS: Our coffers are filled with Persian gold. It's been a pleasure working with you.
key_value.73159: ‹GREEN› WHITE HUNS: You refuse to pay the tribute? You'll pay dearly for your insolence.
key_value.73204: ‹AQUA›EAGLE WARRIOR: We are losing the ford! Quickly, head to Dos Pilas and warn its citizens!
key_value.73205: ‹AQUA›EAGLE WARRIOR: Warriors from Calakmul have defeated our army. They will soon be on their way to our town. To arms!
key_value.73207: ‹AQUA›EAGLE WARRIOR: There are five small raider camps in the area. Destroy them! We need to show them who rules this land.
key_value.73208: 2. Advance to the castle age and hold your ground against the attacking Calakmulians in the meantime. You will lose if your town center gets destroyed.
key_value.73211: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Three camps have been destroyed. Well done!
key_value.73212: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: We took down a fourth camp!
key_value.73213: -There are five small raider camps around Dos Pilas. Destroying them would help get rid of this nuisance, and there might be a little gold to gain as well.
key_value.73214: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: All camps have been destroyed! Ah Chuy Kak will be satisfied.
key_value.73215: ‹AQUA›SCOUT: We're not strong enough to attack the warriors of Calakmul. Our orders from the masters of Tikal is to stay on the defensive.
key_value.73216: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: There is a village situated to the west of us. It is currently occupied by raiders. If we liberate this village, it will certainly give us support in the future.
key_value.73217: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: The village has been liberated. Now we'll be able to use its market for trade!
key_value.73218: -Liberate the village in the west of the map by killing all raiders in that area.
key_value.73219: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Calakmul's attacks aren't letting up. We'll be done for soon!
key_value.73220: The forces of Calakmul appear to be too strong for us. Will we accept their request and join their side? Or will we remain loyal to Tikal?
key_value.73221: ‹PURPLE›CALAKMUL WARRIOR: We hereby claim the city of Dos Pilas for the almighty rulers of our city. You either fight for us, or die!
key_value.73222:
3. You may now choose to remain loyal to Tikal, or surrender to Calakmul and join their side.

Select the wonder of the city you wish to side with.
key_value.73224: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Dos Pilas has fallen into the hands of Calakmul! We must flee to Uaxactun and prepare a counterattack.
key_value.73225: 4. Flee to Uaxactun in the east.
key_value.73226: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Very well. Let's now prepare a counterattack to recapture Dos Pilas!
key_value.73227: ‹BLUE›SPEARMAN: You are welcome to enter Uaxactun, friend of Tikal.
key_value.73228: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Our town hall has been destroyed!
key_value.73229: -Recapture Dos Pilas by destroying its Town Center.
key_value.73230: ‹AQUA›SOLDIER: Dos Pilas' Town Center has been destroyed. The city is back in our hands!
key_value.73231: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Our allies at Naranjo are being attacked by the forces of Calakmul. We must help them!
key_value.73232: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Naranjo has been captured by Calakmul!
key_value.73233: -Defend Naranjo for 15 minutes. If the city gets overwhelmed, Naranjo will be captured by Calakmul.
key_value.73234: -Naranjo has defected to the side of Calakmul. Defeat them, we need to show what happens to the ones who join our enemies.
key_value.73235: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Naranjo has been defeated. Well done!
key_value.73236: ‹AQUA›SCOUT: We're not strong enough to attack the warriors of Calakmul. Our order from the masters of Tikal is to stay on the defensive.
key_value.73237: 5. Defeat Calakmul by destroying its wonder.
key_value.73238: ‹ORANGE›TIKAL: Calakmul lays in ruins. We are victorious!
key_value.73239: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: Bandits have seized control of a former Tikalian fort on a cliff to the south.
key_value.73240: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: The bandit fort has been destroyed!
key_value.73242: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: We fight for Calakmul from now on!
key_value.73243: 4. Defeat Tikal by destroying its wonder.
key_value.73244: ‹PURPLE›CALAKMUL: Tikal is burning. Victory is ours!
key_value.73245: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: There is a Tikalian fort situated on a cliff to the south of Uaxactun. We should destroy it immediately.
key_value.73246: -Destroy the fort of Tikal on the plateau to the south of Uaxactun.
key_value.73248: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: To the northeast lays the city of Naranjo. Being allies of Tikal, they protect Tikal very well from one side. When we take them down, we could flank Tikal.
key_value.73249: ‹GREY›SCIENTIST: I've been studying the history of this landscape for over a decade. Because of the ongoing war, it is difficult for me to travel around to look around for artifacts. If you could help me study the area, I'll reward you greatly.
key_value.73253: -Scout the map to find 3 stone heads to examine for the scientist. To examine a head, bring a unit near one. Once you've examined all three heads, return to the scientist.
key_value.73254: ‹GREY›SCIENTIST: Thank you very much for your research. Here is your reward!
key_value.73255: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: We've spotted a bandit camp to the south. I wonder what they're doing here...
key_value.73256: -Destroy the bandit camp to the south and find out why they're here.
key_value.73257: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: The bandits were protecting a large gold mine. Look at all of this!
key_value.73258: ‹GREY›MONK: Our fellowship of monks have been searching for a holy relic for decades. We will reward you greatly if you find this relic.
key_value.73259: -Find the relic the monks have spoken about and bring it into their monastery.
key_value.73260: ‹GREY›MONK: I can hardly believe my eyes. You found the relic! You will be greatly rewarded.
key_value.73261: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: We had better bring this relic to the monastery of those monks. We could get cursed if we keep it for ourselves!
key_value.73262: ‹AQUA›WARRIOR: I believe this is the relic those monks spoke of- let's bring it to their monastery.
key_value.73263: ‹GREY›MAN: I trade in turkeys. Bring every turkey you find to my workshop. I will reward you greatly.
key_value.73264: -Are you in need of gold and have spare turkeys? Bring them to the workshop of the turkey trading man. He will pay you 100 gold for each turkey you give to him.
key_value.73275:
1. Be on your guard while scouting. The area around Dos Pilas is crawling with bandits. They will pick off any unwanted traveller they see.

2. Don't spend too much time constructing a base when you might have to flee from there at some point.

3. There is not many gold available. If there only was a market in the area we could use for trade.

4. You are limited to but one town center.

5. Scouting around and clicking on grey units will enable various side quests, completing these will grant you significant bonuses.

6. There are several artifacts scattered around the countryside. A relic is rumored to lie in an overgrown jungle in a ravine southwest of Tikal. Stone carvings lie on the road northwest of Dos Pilas, on a bank across the stream from an abandoned tower southeast of Dos Pilas, and in the mountains east of Uaxactun, respectively.

7. You are able to advance to the imperial age, but bear in mind that the Mayans did not have access to advanced siege engines like trebuchets, or gunpowder units like petards.
key_value.73276:
Your scouts report:

You have a handful of units under your control at the start. Together with troops of Dos Pilas, you’re defending a ford against the forces of Calakmul.

Dos Pilas (yellow) is a small city currently under control of Tikal. They’ll be training a mixed army.

Tikal (orange) is a huge city located in the east of the map. They will train a host of different units to fight their enemies. Their unique unit, the slinger, will tear apart any infantry which comes near it.

Calakmul (purple) is another colossal city, located in the north of the map. Just as Tikal, their military will be diverse. Their unique unit, the jaguar warrior, will be a pain to fight against in hand to hand combat. Taking them out from a distance, before they reach your troops, would be a sound plan.

Uaxactun (blue) is another small city siding with Tikal. They will be training a small, but varied army to fight their opponents.

Naranjo (red) is probably the smallest city in the area. Their military consists of eagle warriors, plumed archers, scorpions and swordsmen. Naranjo is not an aggressive city; their behaviour will be focused on the defences.

Raiders (green) are a pain for everyone. They roam the countryside around Dos Pilas and harass unsuspecting victims.

Countryside (grey) simulate the neutral people who do not side with any of the mentioned cities. They generally have to do with the numerous side quests to be found when scouting the map.
key_value.73307:
IMPORTANT! You cannot advance through ages normally-clicking the icon will not have any effect. You will advance instead by achieving certain objectives.

1. Avoid the Pechenegs as much as you can.

2. The Pechenegs may defeat you several times. Keep moving on and do not give up- in the end you will find a safe home for your people.

3. If you have to cross a river to attack an enemy, it is a good idea to build a military base on their land, so you can reinforce your army more easily.

4.This is a long scenario- save often.
key_value.73308:
Your scouts report:

The Magyars (Red) start in the eastern part of the map with a yurt village, a few troops, hunting wolves and livestock. You are surrounded by Pecheneg warriors. Do not fight them, for you are hopelessly outnumbered. Try to minimize your losses and save as many units and animals as you can.

Pechenegs (Yellow) reside in the northern part of the map and are the mortal enemy of the Magyars. Their army is very strong, avoid them as much as you can.

The powerful empire of the Khazars (Orange) lies to the south. They are allied to the Magyars, and enemies of the Pechenegs. It might be a good idea to contact them.

The Kabars (Cyan) are people living under the authority of the Khazar empire. They are friendly towards the Magyars.

The Byzantines (Blue) are a strong empire far to the southwest. They are friendly towards the Magyars.

The Bulgars (Purple) live far to the west. Not much is known about them, except that they often have border conflicts with the Byzantines. They seem to be skilled warriors.

The Moravians (Green) live far to the west, north of the Bulgars.
key_value.73324: 1. Gather the Magyar tribes and migrate southwest towards the Khazar Empire.
key_value.73325: 2. Send a messenger to the Khazar Khagan (Leave your livestock outside the walls, otherwise they may get converted).
key_value.73326: 3. Build up your new home and defend it from the Pechenegs.
key_value.73327: 4. Evacuate your town. Bring at least 30 units to the flag.
key_value.73328: OPTIONAL: Sell your horses to the Khazars by bringing them to the pen next to the castle.
key_value.73329: You cannot advance to the next age quite yet. Be patient- you will get there!
key_value.73330: ‹RED›MAGYAR WARRIOR: The Pechenegs are attacking us again!
key_value.73331: ‹RED›MAGYAR CHIEFTAIN: The winters are colder and dryer every year. Our people and animals are hungry. The Pechenegs constantly keep attacking us. We cannot stay here any longer.
key_value.73332: ‹RED›MAGYAR WARRIOR: Your majesty, the Pechenegs have chased us away from our lands and we seek a new home. Is there room for us in your empire?
key_value.73333: ‹ORANGE›KHAGAN: Welcome, Magyars! The Pechenegs are our enemies as well. You can live on the periphery of my empire as long as you pay taxes regularly. In turn we will share our technology and cultivation methods with you. You can also trade with us.
key_value.73334: ‹ORANGE›KHAGAN: Our close proximity will discourage the Pechenegs a bit, but you will not be in complete safety. Be careful...one more thing: do not try to build anything in my city. That would make me really angry.
key_value.73337: ‹ORANGE›KHAGAN: You have violated our agreement. There is no room in my empire for parasitic people like you!
key_value.73338: ‹ORANGE›KHAGAN: I can see that your horses are strong and beautiful. If you have any for sale, I would be quite interested.
key_value.73339: ‹RED›VOIVOD LEVEDI: We cannot hold against this attack! We must retreat!
key_value.73341: 5. Build up the first principality of Hungary, and defend it from the Pechenegs.
key_value.73342: 6. Help the Byzantines by defeating the Bulgars.
key_value.73343: 7. Evacuate the principality. Bring at least 60 units to the flag.
key_value.73345: 8. Bring Kusid and the horse to Svatopluk.
key_value.73347: 10. Conquer the Carpathian Basin by defeating the Moravians.
key_value.73349: ‹RED›SEVEN MAGYAR CHIEFTAINS: Hereby we confirm the union among our tribes with this blood oath. Furthermore, we choose Álmos to be the Grand Prince of the Seven Magyars.
key_value.73350: ‹RED›SEVEN MAGYAR CHIEFTAINS: From now on, we are blood brothers.
key_value.73351: ‹BLUE›LEO THE WISE: Magyars, I have heard that you are fierce warriors. We have a little problem with our Bulgar neighbors. If you could help us fight them, I would reward you well. You can use our ships to cross the Danube.
key_value.73352: ‹AQUA›KABARS: Let us join the alliance of the Seven Magyars. We do not want to live under the supremacy of the Khazars any longer. With our three tribes we are ten now!
key_value.73353: ‹PURPLE›BULGARS: All right, Magyars, you have won. We offer peace.
key_value.73354: ‹BLUE›LEO THE WISE: Thank you, Magyars. You have helped us a lot. As a reward we will share some of our knowledge with you!
key_value.73355: ‹PURPLE›BULGARS: Pechenegs, now that the Magyar warriors are on our land, you can attack them freely. Take revenge for us!
key_value.73356: ‹RED›ÁLMOS: It is impossible to resist the Pecheneg forces. Let us save what we can. We must run!
key_value.73358: ‹RED›ÁRPÁD: Look at this lush grass, fertile soil, and sweet water in the rivers! I have never seen anything similar. Kusid, find out who lives on this land, and offer our price for it. Here is the most beautiful horse that I own. This land is perfect for the Magyars. I am going to take it.
key_value.73359: ‹RED›KUSID: I am Kusid, messenger of the Magyars. Árpád, our commander, sends you this gift.
key_value.73360: ‹GREEN›SVATOPLUK: What a glorious steed! Thank you very much! You are very kind, Magyars. Welcome.
key_value.73361: ‹RED›KUSID: In return we would like a small tract of grassland, a sod of soil, and a flask of water from the river.
key_value.73362: ‹GREEN›SVATOPLUK: Take as much as you want.
key_value.73363: ‹RED›KUSID: I will! You will hear from us later. Goodbye!
key_value.73364: ‹RED›KUSID: Here! I bring everything we asked: the grass, the soil and the water.
key_value.73365: ‹RED›ÁRPÁD: Good. Now the land is ours. Let us take it!
key_value.73366: ‹RED›ÁRPÁD: We have conquered a new homeland for ourselves, and for the many generations of Magyars to come!
key_value.73369: ‹RED›ÁRPÁD: Leave our land Svatopluk, until it is not too late!
key_value.73370: ‹GREEN›SVATOPLUK: How come it is your land?
key_value.73371: ‹RED›ÁRPÁD: We paid for it with the horse! You gave us grass, soil and water. Now we own everything.
key_value.73372: ‹RED›ÁRPÁD: If we destroy that castle, we can capture the docks. We will need them to cross the river.
key_value.73407:
1. Scout your starting position, as there are warriors willing to join you.

2. You can either destroy all enemy towers and ships blocking the river passage or use your own ships to cover the shipment by taking the fire while it crosses.

3. The shipments are being sent from all across the land and they will spawn in different places. Make sure to clear the enemy navy from the sea, as if any shipment is lost you will be defeated.

4. The River Pirates may be open to negotiate an alliance, but they will not be cheap.

5. Rumors say that a monk in the region is developing a secret weapon with which you can easily defeat the enemy navy.
key_value.73408:
Your scouts report:

The Wu navy (Red) controls the shores and has blockades on all river crossings. The Wu army (Purple) has a strong base on the land and will train a large army. The River Pirates (Green) have a naval base to the northeast and small squads dispersed across the land guarding important resources.

The Temple Complex (Yellow) is to the southeast and will assist you but has no army and needs protection. The Chinese Peasants (Cyan) have a few small villages in the area and can help you as long as you keep them safe.
key_value.73411: 1. You have 25 minutes to clear the blockade before the first shipment arrives.
key_value.73412: 2. Escort the first shipment to the temple complex.
key_value.73413: 3. Escort the remaining four shipments safely. Each will arrive 25 minutes after the previous reaches the temple.
key_value.73414: 4. Build the monument and protect it from enemy attacks.
key_value.73416: - Find a fuse to ignite the oil.
key_value.73417: - Find a smith to cast the fire siphons.
key_value.73418: - Find master builders for the ships.
key_value.73419: - Pay 2000 gold to the River Pirates and they will assist you.
key_value.73420: - As long as the Trade Workshop (Cyan) stands, you'll receive dragon ships.
key_value.73421: - The rice farmers wil provide you with food as long as their market stands.
key_value.73430: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: The enemy is four times stronger than us and if we want to win this war, we will have to get the people on our side.
key_value.73431: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: The construction of a great monument is already commissioned, our task is to make sure the materials get there safely.
key_value.73432: ‹AQUA›SCOUT: Watch out, oh Lord of Ten Thousand Years, the enemy navy is blocking the passage ahead!
key_value.73433: ‹BLUE›DEMOLITION SAILOR: No worries, we'll blast their ships into a million pieces!
key_value.73434: ‹BLUE›CHU-KO-NU: We've constructed this mighty trebuchet especially for you, my lord.
key_value.73435: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: This village has joined our cause.
key_value.73436: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: It takes more than a couple of ships and some towers to stop our great navy!
key_value.73437: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: A transport ship with the finest lumber in the region, used by our most talented woodworkers, has arrived in the bay. We must protect it at all costs.
key_value.73438: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: We have acquired control of the town, now we have to ensure that the rest of the materials reach the construction site.
key_value.73439: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: The most elaborately carved stones in the land, sent by our stonemasons, are on their way to the temple.
key_value.73440: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: Marble blocks that will be turned into statues of lions and kings are close by and need protection.
key_value.73441: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: Ships with golden nuggets for the final decorations of the temple sail to our location. All efforts should be made to keep that treasure safe!
key_value.73442: ‹BLUE›SAILOR: This is the final shipment, it brings foliage of the most beautiful trees, bushes and flowers, for the gardens of our monument.
key_value.73443: ‹GREEN›PIRATE: The Wu navy is too strong and can become a threat for us if they win this war. We would rather help you, for the right price of course.
key_value.73444: ‹GREEN›PIRATE: Thank you for the gold. Let us help clear the blockade for you!
key_value.73445: ‹AQUA›SHIPBUILDER: Mighty lord, we support your cause and we offer to build ships for you.
key_value.73446: ‹AQUA›FARMER: We heard of your ambition to win the war and we will be glad to provide food for your army, but you must keep our market safe.
key_value.73447: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: Our great structure is completed- we will reach the heavens and our names will be remembered forever!
key_value.73448: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: The shipment was destroyed! We can't proceed any further with the construction of the temple.
key_value.73449: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: The temple has fallen! We are humiliated.
key_value.73450: ‹ORANGE›PENG YANZHANG: You tried to trick us, but you will fail. Men, assault and destroy that foundation at all costs!
key_value.73451: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: The first shipment of goods has made it to the temple. We must make haste and clear a way for the next shipment!
key_value.73452: ‹BLUE›WATCHMAN: Enemy transport ships are heading for the temple complex!
key_value.73453: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: We have everything we need. Let's start building our temple.
key_value.73454: ‹BLUE›WATCHMAN: Demolition ships heading for our docks!
key_value.73455: ‹BLUE›WATCHMAN: Enemy War galleys approaching the temple complex!
key_value.73456: ‹BLUE›WATCHMAN: A shipment has arrived at the site.
key_value.73458: ‹AQUA›TAOIST SCHOLAR: Time to test the potion.
key_value.73459: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: The rocks in this area are covered with oil. We can use it to burn the enemy ships!
key_value.73460: ‹BLUE›QIAN YUANGUAN: We can use this black powder to ignite the oil.
key_value.73461: ‹AQUA›BRONZE SMITH: I can make the finest dragon headed siphons for your ships!
key_value.73464: ‹BLUE›SOLDIER: My lord, this is the location from which the next shipment will arrive. We have to clear the way for it- we can't afford any mistakes!
key_value.73507:
1. If you are about to occupy a city, do not forget that the more that you destroy, the less you will own later on.

2. Use monks to heal your army if you have the opportunity.

3. The most effective way of searching an area is spreading your units all over it.

4. When preparing the army in Messina, you can use a Market to trade the available resources according to your needs.

5. When you have occupied Limassol, you can find resources outside of the city walls. Build Town Centers to secure them and protect your Villagers.

6.Everybody is allied to you at the start, but the peace is fragile. Be careful, for there is tension in the air.
key_value.73508:
Your scouts report:

-The army of Richard the Lionheart (Red) is embarking upon the Third Crusade. First, Richard has to meet his fellow kings in Sicily to prepare the operation. You start your journey north of Sicily on board of your ships.

-Tancred (Green), king of Sicily, resides in his city (Palermo) in the western corner of the map. He is your ally and will host the meeting of kings.

-Philip Augustus (Blue), king of France is an old rival of Richard, but this time they will join their forces for a common goal. His camp is already in Sicily next to Messina. Philip is not known for his prowess on the battlefield, but for plotting and conniving instead.

-Messina (Yellow) is a city on the eastern coast of Sicily. It is protected by walls and has a well-equipped port. They are your allies, but do not abuse their patience.

-Limassol (Cyan) is a port city on Cyprus. Cyprus is in the north eastern part of the map.

-Isaac Komnenos (Cyan) is the ruler of Cyprus. Usually he resides in Nicosia, a well fortified city in the middle of Cyprus. He is your ally, but he is not very fond of the Western European royal dynasties.

-Cyprus (Cyan) represents the inhabitants of Cyprus, both civilian and military. They obey the commands of Isaac Komnenos.
key_value.73510: ‹RED›ENGLISH SOLDIER: Our great military leader is dead! We cannot continue the campaign without him.
key_value.73517: ‹RED›RICHARD: I can already see the land of Sicily. Let us land and put up our camp there.
key_value.73518: Land on Sicily and bring the army to the camp location.
key_value.73519: ‹RED›RICHARD: Men, construct the camp while I meet the other kings to plan the Crusade.
key_value.73520: Bring Richard to the meeting of kings.
key_value.73521: ‹BLUE›PHILIP AUGUSTUS: Welcome, Richard. You are late as usual.
key_value.73522: ‹RED›RICHARD: Tancred, are you the king of Sicily? What has happened to king William? Where is my sister Joan?
key_value.73523: ‹GREEN›TANCRED: Unfortunately, William died. I had to take his place. Your sister became quite greedy after the death of her husband, so I put her into prison to give her time to think over her demands.
key_value.73524: ‹RED›RICHARD: How dare you? Bring my sister here with her inheritance! Now!
key_value.73525: ‹GREEN›TANCRED: Here is your beloved sister. Take her wherever you want. You will not get a single penny from me.
key_value.73526: ‹RED›RICHARD: I have always known that you are a rat. I do not wish to continue the negotiations with you. Goodbye, Tancrat.
key_value.73528: 3. Bring Richard and Joan back to the camp.
key_value.73529: ‹YELLOW›MESSINA: We do not want to feed foreign troops anymore. Leave our island at once!
key_value.73530: ‹RED›ENGLISH SOLDIER: Your majesty, local forces are attacking our camp!
key_value.73532: ‹RED›RICHARD: All right, now it is our turn. Let us take that blasted city.
key_value.73533: 4. Take the city of Messina by destroying all its warehouses (Trade Workshop). 5 left.
key_value.73534: 4. Take the city of Messina by destroying all its warehouses. 4 left.
key_value.73535: 4. Take the city of Messina by destroying all its warehouses. 3 left.
key_value.73536: 4. Take the city of Messina by destroying all its warehouses. 2 left.
key_value.73537: 4. Take the city of Messina by destroying all its warehouses. 1 left.
key_value.73538: ‹RED›ENGLISH SOLDIER: Your majesty, we can use the captured buildings to train our own troops.
key_value.73539: ‹RED›ENGLISH SOLDIER: Your majesty, we have found valuable resources in a warehouse.
key_value.73540: ‹YELLOW›MESSINA: Please do not destroy our city, Richard. We surrender.
key_value.73541: ‹BLUE›PHILIP AUGUSTUS: Tancred, Richard has occupied Messina. He is quite dangerous, but I know how to deal with him. Let him go to the Holy Land alone. We can take his property while he is away. If we are lucky, he will not even return alive.
key_value.73542: ‹GREEN›TANCRED: All right, Richard. I do not want more bloodshed. Here is the inheritance of your sister. Let us sheathe the sword. I also give you ships to support you on the Crusade.
key_value.73543: ‹RED›RICHARD: Thank you, Tancred. I knew that I would be able to convince you. Now it is time to prepare for the crusade! Men, we are done here. All aboard!
key_value.73544: 5. Bring Richard, Joan, and her wealth to the Transport Ships at the red flag.
key_value.73545: ‹RED›RICHARD: This is going to be your ship, my sister. I hope, you will find it comfortable.
key_value.73546: 6. Board the units you want to take on the Crusade onto the 5 Transport Ships. You can bring up to 50 units (heroes included). Keep in mind that you are going to besiege fortified cities. Click the castle of Tancred (Green, in the West of the map) if you are ready to launch the fleet.
key_value.73547: ‹RED›RICHARD: Let us go! The Holy Land is waiting for us! Goodbye, Sicily!
key_value.73548: ‹BLUE›PHILIP AUGUSTUS: Good luck Richard! I will join you in the Holy Land.
key_value.73549: ‹RED›RICHARD: Dark clouds are gathering... We are heading into a storm.
key_value.73550: ‹RED›RICHARD: It is already here! Furl the sails!
key_value.73551: ‹RED›RICHARD: This is insane! I can't see anything!
key_value.73552: ‹RED›RICHARD: That was a terrible storm! We have lost the rest of the fleet. Where are we?
key_value.73553: ‹RED›NAVIGATOR: Somewhere south of Cyprus. I think I can spot land.
key_value.73554: ‹RED›NAVIGATOR: According to my calculations we won't find other ships here. We should search to the east.
key_value.73555: 7. Find the lost ships of the fleet.
key_value.73557: ‹RED›RICHARD: That is my sister's ship! But where is the crew?
key_value.73558: ‹AQUA›LIMASSOL GUARD: Richard, your sister has been captured by the ruler of Cyprus, Isaac Komnenos. You can free her by means of ransom.
key_value.73559: ‹RED›RICHARD: Was her wealth not enough for Isaac? Let us take Limassol, attacking has worked very well for us once before.
key_value.73560: 8. Land in Limassol and conquer it by occupying its two Castles. You can capture a Castle by bringing Richard next to it.
key_value.73561: ‹RED›RICHARD: I have occupied Limassol, Isaac! Will you set my sister free now?
key_value.73562: ‹AQUA›ISAAC KOMNENOS: Leave the city, Richard! It's not too late to flee.
key_value.73563: ‹RED›RICHARD: Then your days as king of Cyprus are numbered.
key_value.73566: ‹RED›RICHARD: I hereby name myself the king of Cyprus.
key_value.73600: ‹RED›SULTAN: Osman, your father was a great man. For that I'll give you a chance to prove yourself. We need more men to help us fight off the Mongol invaders. You must visit five Beys and convince them to join us.
key_value.73601: ‹GREEN›HORSEMAN: Not all Beys will be willing to join in the campaign to the East. Killing them might be the only way to convince their tribe.
key_value.73612: BEY BATUR: We will never obey the demands of the Sultanate of Rum!
key_value.73613: BEY BARIS: We'll listen to the call of our fellow brethren. If you need healing, I can help you.
key_value.73614: BEY ALTAN: We will ride East to face the Mongol menace!
key_value.73615: BEY ALTAN: We're not to be disturbed by anyone! Even you, Osman!
key_value.73616: BEY ILKIN: If our lord needs our help, we'll be happy to come to his aid.
key_value.73617: BEY ILKIN: You come here telling me what to do. I'll teach you a lesson, you arrogant dog.
key_value.73618: BEY METIN: We are our own masters. Prepare to die!
key_value.73619: TRIBESMAN: You've killed our Bey... We submit to you.
key_value.73621: CAMEL RIDER: We were wrong to listen to our Bey. We will ride with the other Turks.
key_value.73622: TRIBESMAN: Please spare us. We will go join your army as you asked.
key_value.73623: ‹GREEN›OSMAN: The Sultan of Rum demands that his subjects take up arms and ride East!
key_value.73624: ‹RED›SULTAN: You've gathered enough support for our Eastern campaign. If you return, I'll give you resources, villagers, and land on which you can settle.
key_value.73625: ‹RED›SULTAN: You can have the land West of here. The former Byzantine town of Thebasion, renamed Sogut by your father, would make a good place to start. Good luck, Osman.
key_value.73626: ‹GREEN› OSMAN: We've found specially crafted arrows in this blacksmith.
key_value.73627: ‹GREEN› OSMAN: We've liberated the town of Sogut. From here we'll start our conquests. Unload the trade carts and get to work!
key_value.73628: ‹GREEN› OSMAN: The other Turkish factions want to marry off their daughters. A marriage consolidates the bond between two states. I should think carefully about which state to choose as an ally and from whom to receive a dowry.
key_value.73629: ‹BLUE›KARESI: A wise choice. Now take your bride home for the wedding celebrations.
key_value.73630: ‹BLUE›KARESI: You'll be a good son-in-law, Osman. Together, we can conquer the rich Byzantine lands.
key_value.73631: ‹YELLOW› GERMIYAN: You won't regret your choice. Take your new bride to your town and we'll talk about our new bond.
key_value.73632: ‹YELLOW› GERMIYAN: We're family now, and as such we will ride out against our enemies together.
key_value.73633: ‹AQUA›CANDAR: I welcome a new son to the family! I'm sure you'll take my daughter safely to her new home.
key_value.73634: ‹AQUA› CANDAR: Nobody will be able to resist the combined Ottoman and Candar forces!
key_value.73635: ‹GREEN› OSMAN: The time to chose a bride has passed. No alliance has thus been concluded.
key_value.73636: ‹GREEN› OSMAN: We should deal with the other Turkish rivals. There can only be one to rule the Ghazi warriors.
key_value.73637: ‹GREEN› OSMAN: The Byzantine cities are well fortified, but even so they're not as strong as they used to be. We should take three Byzantine cities in order to expand my empire.
key_value.73638: ‹ORANGE›SIR ROGER DE FLOR: My name Is Roger de Flor. I'm a Condottiero and a former Knight Templar. The Byzantine emperor has asked me and my Catalan Company to help him get rid of you greedy Turks, and so I will.
key_value.73639: ‹GREEN› OSMAN: We've let one of the Turkish princesses die. We can't succeed now, as our reputation is tarnished.
key_value.73640: ‹GREEN›OSMAN: We destroyed all of our enemies! Anatolia now belongs to the Ottoman Turks!
key_value.73641: ‹ORANGE› ROGER DE FLOR: I'm wounded! Men, take me back to Constantinople!
key_value.73642: ‹RED›GUARD: Good luck, Osman! But be on your guard, as there are hostile tribes wandering the plains of Anatolia.
key_value.73643: ‹GREEN› GHAZI WARRIOR: Oh great Osman, we are Ghazi warriors who heard of your fame and are offering you our services in battle.
key_value.73644: ‹GREEN› SOLDIER: Lord Osman, more Ghazi warriors have arrived to join us!
key_value.73645: ‹GREEN› SOLDIER: Refugees have arrived from the East.
key_value.73648: 1. Seek out 5 Turkish tribes and convince them to join the Sultanate of Rum.
key_value.73656: -Bring the carts with resources to the town center in Sogut.
key_value.73657: -Chose a bride for Osman by bringing Osman to one of the brides. Each Turkish faction will give you different benefits, so choose wisely. After 15 minutes the Turks will retract their offer and Osman will be unable to marry anyone.
key_value.73665: ‹GREEN›TURKISH SOLDIER: Osman is dead! Our enemies have prevailed...
key_value.73666:
Your scouts report:

Osman (Green) and his army start on the eastern edge of the map in the allied Rum Sultanate (Red).

The Byzantine Empire (Purple) has settlements in the center of the map and to the northwest.

There are three smaller turkish states: Karesi (Blue) to the west, Germiyan (Yellow) to the south and Candar (Teal) to the east.

Enemy Turkish nomads (Gray) are dispersed all over the area and rumors say that a strong mercenary army called the Catalan Company (Orange) will come from the west.
key_value.73667:
1. Be wary that not all of the Beys will decide to join the Rum Sultanate, they may support the nomads instead, thus you'll have to kill them to ensure the loyalty of their troops.

2. Choose your bride from the strongest turkish state, because you'll have to conquer the rest after that.

3. You can't recruit any gunpowder units, except janissaries.
key_value.73669: ‹GREEN›CAMEL RIDER: It would be an honor to fight at your side Osman!
key_value.73670: ‹GREEN›CAVALRY ARCHER: Your father was a great man Osman. You have our loyalty.
key_value.73671: 2. Return with Osman to the Sultan
key_value.73707:
1. Avoid the local coastal settlements (marked on the minimap) when searching for a campsite- their defenses are too strong.

2. There are 5 possible campsites (marked by flags on your minimap) - 3 in Scotland, 1 on the Isle of Man, and 1 in Southern Ireland, each with different strengths and weaknesses.

3. Build up your defenses- your foes will notice the arrival of the main army and subsequently attempt to wipe out your camp.

4. Each Christian village, town, and city with at least one monastery is house to a holy relic, for a total of 23.

5. Destroying churches, markets, town centers, cathedrals, and wonders will grant you medium to large sums of gold in loot.
key_value.73708:
Your scouts report:

-The vanguard of the Viking army has finally reached the British Isles, with the task of scouting the region and establishing a suitable camp.

The British Isles are ruled by 7 separate kingdoms:

-The Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Northumbria (Yellow) is the principal target of the Viking army, and their capital, York, is by far the most fortified city in the region.

-The Anglo-Saxon kingdom of East Anglia (Orange) has been plagued by internal weakness and is quite susceptible to falling at the hands of a strong amphibious assault.

-The Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Mercia (Blue) is one of your more dangerous foes, but its power is spread out over a large swath of land.

-The Anglo-Saxon kingdom of Wessex is by far your most dangerous adversary. Controlling the rich land of southern England, the kings of Wessex have inherited all that the Romans once left behind.

-The Scottish lords controlling the Strath of the River Clyde are rulers of fearless warriors who are the core of a burgeoning kingdom.

-The Irish dynasty of Ui Neill controls most of Northern Ireland, but has been greatly weakened by dynastic struggle and wars with its more powerful southern neighbor.

-The Irish kingdom of Munster, with its seat at the famed Rock of Cashel, has been waging war quite effectively against its neighbors.

-Viking longboats, the most powerful warship of the age, will make quick work of any opposition.
key_value.73722: ‹RED› JARL: There lies our target, the fortified city of York. We are too few to attack it- we must find a suitable location to make camp and await the arrival of the main army.
key_value.73723: ‹RED›CAPTAIN: My lord, we have scouted the British Isles and found several suitable sites for a camp! We should be sure to avoid the local settlements though- their defenders are far too powerful for us to fight at the moment.
key_value.73724: ‹RED›JARL: Let us make haste and set up a camp!
key_value.73725: 1. Construct a camp- build a Town Center, a Barracks, a Market, and 5 houses at any one of the 5 campsites (marked on the map by flags).
key_value.73726: ‹RED›JARL: Excellent! Our camp is complete. We should build up a force and await the arrival of the main army from overseas.
key_value.73727: Instead of founding a camp at one of the unoccupied locations, you could attack the monastery at the Isle of Man (marked by a flag) and set up your camp there.
key_value.73728: ‹RED›JARL: It is a shame that this monastery is house to neither treasure nor relics, but this promontory would be a brilliant location for a castle!
key_value.73729: 2. Continue building up your base and await the arrival of the main army. They will be here in 15 minutes.
key_value.73730: ‹RED›VIKING: Hark! Look to the sea! The army has arrived!
key_value.73731: The main army has arrived! There are four ways you can win the scenario (see hints for more detail) :
key_value.73732: 1. To take vengeance on King Aella and prove the superiority of the Norse Gods, destroy the palace in the Northumbrian city of York and replace it with a temple to Odin (wonder) of your own.
key_value.73733: 2. Capture 15 relics and place them in your monasteries.
key_value.73734: 3. Accumulate a sum of 50,000 gold- weregild for Ragnar's death.
key_value.73735: 4. Defeat 5 of your 7 enemies (Northumbria, East Anglia, Mercia, Wessex, Strathclyde, Ui Neill, and Munster).
key_value.73736: ‹RED›VIKING: Praise be to the Aesir- our victory is complete!
key_value.73737: -Destroy enemy Markets, Monasteries, Town Centers, Cathedrals, and Wonders to loot large sums of gold.
key_value.73738: -Capture enemy relics to supplement your gold income.
key_value.76044:
NOTE: Sometimes, to begin a dialogue, you will have to select another unit. The objectives will prompt you when this is the case.

1. Wallachia is a very diverse region. To represent this, many different types of soldiers with their names changed can be found in this scenario.

2. You control a small amount of troops for most of the scenario and will only periodically receive reinforcements, so be frugal and use good tactics.

3. The powder cart will sometimes be allowed past the bridge without incident, but if it is stopped by the gun-toting guards, then it will have to be manually tasked onwards.

4. The order in which you choose to help the rebel Voivods can make a great difference in your success, though reaching Istvan is impossible until you have helped Jakub and Danislav.

5. When the Hungarian army arrives, concentrate on clearing out the troops blocking the small pass to the harbor, and RUN! Your army is expendable, but Dracula and the 3 other Voivods must reach the transport ship.
key_value.76045:
Your scouts report:

Dracula begins the game just outside the allied Turkish capital of Edirne (Adrianople). He must cross the Danube River to enter his homeland of Wallachia.

The usurper Vladislav II of the Danesti clan, Voivod (prince) of Wallachia, holds a firm grip over most of Wallachia, with a strong army spread throughout the diverse region. He is by far the most dangerous enemy.

There are currently three self-proclaimed Voivods (princes) in rebellion against Vladislav II that could be useful allies:

-Jakub (Blue) is the strongest, and his castle stands in the center of the map, guarding the main crossing of one of the Danube tributaries.

-Danislav (Orange) just lost his capital to Vladislav II, and as a result is hiding in the woods in the west of the map with a few loyal men.

-Istvan (Yellow) is pinned down in his castle in the north of the map by a massive Danesti siege army.

Several Wallachian (Grey) villages litter the map, though many are in the hands of Vladislav II. n
The army of Hungary (Green) has not been seen in Wallachia for a month, but they support Vladislav II, and their fearsome cavalry are renowned throughout Europe.
key_value.76046: 1. Bring Dracula to Sultan Murad II at his castle in Edirne and select the sultan to speak with him.
key_value.76047: ‹PURPLE›MURAD II: Ah, young Vlad. You must have heard the unfortunate news. I offer you the opportunity for vengeance.
key_value.76049: ‹RED›DRACULA: What is it you have in mind?
key_value.76051: ‹PURPLE›MURAD II: Board a ship and cross the Danube. I have given you an army with which to retake your homeland. You will rule there as my vassal.
key_value.76053: 2. Board the ship at the Edirne docks.
key_value.76054: ‹RED›DRACULA: NO!  NOT TO THE ROCKS! Curse this current...
key_value.76056: ‹PURPLE›SCOUT: My lord, a Wallachian village lies up the road. We should seek their help.
key_value.76059: ‹RED›DRACULA: I die today... but there is so much left to do!
key_value.76060: 3. Bring Dracula to the chieftain of the Wallachian village (marked on the map to the northwest) and select the chieftain to speak to him.
key_value.76061: ‹GREY›CHIEFTAIN: Welcome Vlad, son of the Dragon. How may I help you?
key_value.76062: ‹RED›DRACULA: I wish to retake my father's kingdom.
key_value.76064: ‹GREY›CHIEFTAIN: Three local Voivods rule this region. You should seek them out.
key_value.76066: ‹ORANGE›DANISLAV: My army was smashed by the Danesti scum and my city has been overrun! If you retake it, I will join you.
key_value.76067: 5.1. Travel to Danislav's city (marked on the map to the northeast) and liberate it by destroying the military buildings there (barracks, archery range, stable, and blacksmith) and killing all enemy troops. Then return to Danislav.
key_value.76068: ‹ORANGE›DANISLAV: Well done! My men are yours.
key_value.76070: ‹GREY›SOLDIER: We are tired of your oppressive rule! Die, Danesti scum!
key_value.76072: ‹RED›DRACULA: Impaled Danesti corpses... I may like this Voivod...
key_value.76073: ‹BLUE›JAKUB: Well met, Dracula! That treacherous cur Vladislav II has been pillaging my land for weeks! Liberate the town south of here and we will join you.
key_value.76074: 4. Travel to Voivod Jakub's castle and speak to him.
key_value.76075: 4.1. Liberate the town to the south by destroying the military tower there and killing the Danesti general. Then return to Jakub.
key_value.76076: ‹BLUE›JAKUB: Fine work, no less than what I expected. My army is yours!
key_value.76077: ‹RED›DRACULA: This is not good... we need a way to distract them.
key_value.76078: ‹RED›DRACULA: Let's head back to the market of the first village.
key_value.76079: -Go back to the market of the first Wallachian village you visited and select it to examine it.
key_value.76080: ‹RED›DRACULA: This cart of gunpowder will serve our purposes. Now back to the task at hand.
key_value.76081: ‹GREY›CART DRIVER: I will go on ahead and distract the patrol.
key_value.76082: ‹GREY›CART DRIVER: There! That mine on the right!
key_value.76086: 6. Seek out Voivod Istvan in his city to the far north.
key_value.76087: ‹YELLOW›ISTVAN: My city is under siege by that rascal Vladislav II! Before I join you, you must help me defeat the invading troops!
key_value.76089: 6.1 In 3 minutes, Vladislav II will attack Istvan's city. Defeat the attacking forces and then raze his military camp to the southeast to the ground! Then return to Istvan.
key_value.76090: ‹YELLOW›ISTVAN: Thank you Dracula! You are truly a great warrior.
key_value.76093: ‹RED›DRACULA: We have the support of the local lords. Now on to the battle!
key_value.76095: ‹RED›DRACULA: Their attack is breaking. Press forward and raze their camp!
key_value.76096: ‹RED›DRACULA: There are Istvan, Danislav, and Jakub. I should meet with them to discuss battle plans.
key_value.76097: ‹RED›DRACULA: This is a fine muster, Lords. What is the situation?
key_value.76099: ‹BLUE›JAKUB: Thanks to a scout in the mountains, we know the terrain. Observe the field.
key_value.76100: Observe the battlefield. When you are done, select Dracula.
key_value.76101: ‹RED›DRACULA: They have cannons, Hungarian Huszars, and Hungarian Swordsmen. How?
key_value.76103: ‹YELLOW›ISTVAN: I do not know, but that is unimportant at the present. Their cavalry are aligned in front, which means we will likely see a charge. Dracula, lead us to victory!
key_value.76104: ‹RED›DRACULA: Vladislav II will drown in his own blood.
key_value.76111: 7. The battle will begin in 3 minutes. Use this time to organize your army and prepare your strategy. Don't stray past the ruins on your side of the road, however, or the battle may start before you have planned!
key_value.76114: ‹RED›DRACULA: Their army is breaking rank! We have almost won!
key_value.76115: ‹GREEN›JOHN HUNYADI of HUNGARY: Not so fast, Dracula! Wallachia is ours!
key_value.76116: ‹RED›DRACULA: Istvan, Jakub, Danislav! We must flee! The harbor may have a boat!
key_value.76117: 9. Dracula, Istvan, Danislav, and Jakub must flee the battle and travel to the harbor to the southeast to board a ship.
key_value.76118: ‹RED›DRACULA: Head east to Moldavia, I say! And watch out for enemy vessels!
key_value.76119: 10. Sail east to Moldavia and disembark at their harbor. Garrison all four of your heroes in the castle to speak to its lord.
key_value.76508: ‹ORANGE›BOGDAN II: Welcome, Vlad. What do you desire from humble Moldavia?
key_value.76509: ‹RED›DRACULA: Advice on how to reclaim the Voivodship of Wallachia, my birthright.
key_value.76510: ‹ORANGE›BOGDAN II: To the northwest in the Transylvanian forest lies the Bran Castle, a stronghold of the Order of the Dragon. You will find supporters there.
key_value.76511: ‹RED›DRACULA: We will ride there with all haste!
key_value.76512: ‹ORANGE›BOGDAN II: Go, but beware of Danesti troops on the road!
key_value.76513: 1. Dracula must travel to the door of the Bran Castle in Transylvania.
key_value.76514: ‹RED›DRACULA: Arise, brothers of the Dragon! Let us send the usurper to his grave!
key_value.76523: ‹RED›DRACULA: This mine may prove useful later...
key_value.76524: ‹RED›DRACULA: We can use these mining camps to help clear away the rubble from that bridge!
key_value.76525: ‹GREY›HERMIT: Halt, friends! A large Danesti force blocks the mountain pass!
key_value.76526: ‹GREY›HERMIT: If you were to slay the Danesti general in command of their forward camp, it may draw the attention of the army and lure them away!
key_value.76527: -Kill the Danesti general (cavalier) in command of the forward camp. It is rumored he likes walking the well-trod road northeast of the camp...
key_value.76528: ‹RED›DRACULA: Die, scum! Now quickly, to the pass!
key_value.76529: 2. Build up your forces and seek the aid of the towns scattered around Transylvania and Wallachia. To win, destroy the castles in Targoviste (far west of the map) and kill Vladislav II (King unit).
key_value.76530: ‹RED›SOLDIER: The usurper Vladislav II is dead! Long live Vlad Dracula!
key_value.76531: The Order of the Dragon has recruited three Paladins at the Bran Castle.
key_value.76532: A mercenary has been hired at the tavern (trade workshop).
key_value.76533: ‹GREEN›HUNGARY: Dracula, I see no point in us fighting when we share a common enemy in the Turks. If you would supply our army, we would gladly aid your cause.
key_value.76534: -Tribute the Hungarians 1000 food to acquire their support.
key_value.76536: ‹RED›SOLDIER: The craven cowers in the tower to the west!
key_value.76546:
1. The road between the cliffs directly northwest of Moldavia is the best way to reach the Bran castle, and it is also the route that the Danesti general likes to take on his leisurely walk.

2. Hungary will offer its alliance if you can prove your mettle by reaching the Imperial Age, so assure that they are not destroyed.

3. Once you reach the Bran Castle, the scenario will begin to play like a game of 'Risk'. Most local (Grey) towns, cities, and villages on the map can be captured by each major power, and each has certain useful buildings from which to train troops. Control of a town is determined by ownership of the converting torches in each one. Guard them carefully, or they will quickly fall! The main city of each player, however, cannot be captured and must be destroyed the old-fashioned way.

4. Some buildings have special mechanics to make up for being unable to train units from them. The Bran Castle (wonder) will periodically produce Paladins for Dracula, and the port inn (trade workshop) in the center of the map will recruit mercenaries.

5. Vlad Dracula may reach the Imperial Age.
key_value.76547:
Your scouts report:

Dracula and his loyal lords begin in exile in the Kingdom of Moldavia (Orange), which will field an army of Boyars, archers, infantry, and siege with some cavalry thrown in. Moldavia supports Dracula's claim to the Wallachian throne.

Several local towns and cities (Grey), many of them on the Danube River, are scattered across the map. In the far North lies the Bran Castle, the headquarters of the crusading Order of the Dragon, who are loyal to the Draculesti clan (Dracula's family).

In the northwest of the map lies a Hungarian (Green) military base. Hungary trains droves of cavalry supported by some light infantry, archers, and siege. Their allegiance is unknown- they previously backed Vladislav II, but they have been angered by his pro-Turkish policies and so might support Dracula instead.

In the south lies the territory of the Ottoman Empire (Purple), which is now hostile towards Dracula due to their newfound support of Vladislav II, but are far more focused on fighting the Hungarians. Their army is comprised of light infantry, cavalry, archers, siege, and the legendary Janissaries.

Vladislav II (Cyan) is by far the greatest threat, controlling the Wallachian capital of Targoviste in the far west of the map. He will train heavy cavalry, infantry, archers, siege, monks, and the fearsome Boyars. In addition, he may try to control the Danube River with a flood of ships.
key_value.77007:
1. Tactics in the first battle are important. Pay heed to the suggestions of your troops and try to take the enemy by surprise. If any of your men are standing on the road when the Ottoman army arrives from the northwest, then the element of surprise will be lost.

2. Certain guards in Giurgiu will be on the lookout for suspicious activities. Follow the prompts of your men, and if anybody appears to recognize you, then get away from them!

3. Janissaries guard the castle well. You could try to distract them, but be warned, it won't take long before they will discover what's going on so you have to garrison your troops in the castle once they're gone.

4. Four of the villages are feeding the Turkish fortress of Darstor. Destroying these villages will cripple Darstor's capacity to fight.

5. Three of your enemies are located across the Danube, so controlling the river is a must.

6. Vlad Dracula may reach the Imperial Age.
key_value.77008:
Your scouts report:

Dracula's army begins the scenario on the road northwest of Giurgiu, preparing to ambush a Turkish army (Purple) that is arriving from the northwest to reinforce Giurgiu.

Giurgiu is in the hands of the Ottoman Army (Purple) and is quite well-defended, but may be taken by stealth.

Across the river is the Turkish fortress of Darstor, which is the greatest military threat. Their fortifications and strong army will provide strong resistance, though they rely on the neighboring villages for supplies...

Four villages are supplying the fortress of Darstor but are only themselves defended by a token force:

-Obluciza (Green) is located in the northeast of the map on your side of the river, and supplies Darstor with stone.

-Orsova (Yellow) is located in the southwest of the map on your side of the river, and supplies Darstor with wood.

-Novoselo (Orange) is located in the east of the map, across the river, and supplies Darstor with food.

-Rahova (Cyan) is located in the south of the map, across the river, and supplies Darstor with gold.
key_value.77010: ‹RED›DRACULA: Soon, a huge Turkish army will come flooding through this mountain pass! We must create an ambush to surprise them!
key_value.77016: ‹RED›HAND CANNONEER: We can hide in those bushes. The enemy won't know what hit them.
key_value.77018: ‹RED›DRACULA: Today we took an arm of the Ottoman empire. Now let us move on to the rest of its body!
key_value.77019: ‹RED›SCOUT: Sir, I've scouted the Giurgiu fortress but it's too fortified. How are we ever going to be able to take it?
key_value.77020: ‹RED›DRACULA: Maybe we can capture the fortress without a fight once we get there. How is your Turkish?
key_value.77021: 2. Take Giurgiu by capturing the castle.
key_value.77022: ‹RED›DRACULA: A Turkish trader! Get him! He'll help us with our plan!
key_value.77025: ‹RED›DRACULA: Let's see how well I remember my Turkish. My army will hide in the forest, waiting for my signal in the meanwhile.
key_value.77026: ‹AQUA›GUARD: Welcome to the safest city of Wallachia, stranger. Our town is always open to traders.
key_value.77028: Garrison soldiers into towers to gain control over them.
key_value.77029: ‹AQUA›CAVALIER: That trader looks familiar to me somehow...
key_value.77032: ‹AQUA›JANISSARY: Where do you think you're going to, merchant? I'll give you 5 seconds to get out of here or you're in trouble.
key_value.77033: ‹AQUA›JANISSARY: You don't listen much, do you? You're under arrest!
key_value.77035: -Take down the Banner of the Janissary regiment to lure them away from the castle.
key_value.77036: ‹AQUA›JANISSARY: Who took down the banner of the Janissaries?! Let's go beat them up guys!
key_value.77037: ‹RED›DRACULA: Head for the castle and light a signal to call for reinforcements!
key_value.77038: ‹RED›SOLDIER: See that smoke? Come on men, Dracula needs our help!
key_value.77039: ‹AQUA›SOLDIER: We're under attack! Men to arms!
key_value.77041: ‹AQUA›SOLDIER: Only janissaries are allowed in the castle. You had better turn back or you'll pay for it...
key_value.77043: ‹AQUA›GUARD: Have you seen those soldiers before? I don't recognize them. Soldiers! What are your names?
key_value.77044: ‹AQUA›GUARD: Those soldiers do not belong here! To arms!
key_value.77045: ‹AQUA›JANISSARY: Wait, who is guarding the castle? You idiots! It's a trap! To arms!
key_value.77046: ‹RED›DRACULA: I wonder how the janissaries will react when they see their banner taken down...
key_value.77047: ‹RED›DRACULA: Let's rebuild our forces and patch up our wounded.
key_value.77049: ‹RED›HUSSAR: And from here we can attack the enemy from the rear.
key_value.77051: ‹RED›DRACULA: Now we're ready to take on the enemy.
key_value.77052: 4. Subdue all the enemy villages and forts by destroying their town centers, castles and wonders.
key_value.77053: ‹RED›SOLDIER: Dracula is dead! We have failed!
key_value.77054: ‹RED›DRACULA: I cannot die now! There is still vengeance to take!
key_value.77055: ‹YELLOW›ORSOVA: Spare us, great Dracula! We will give you everything we have!
key_value.77056: ‹GREEN›OBLUCIZA: Enough! Please, enough! I'm sure for a certain price you can find it in your heart to spare us!
key_value.77057: ‹PURPLE›RAHOVA: We are but a small village! If you spare us we can be of some use to you...
key_value.77058: ‹GREY›DARSTOR: Our great fortress has fallen! We surrender!
key_value.77059: ‹ORANGE›NOVOSELO: We had no choice than to help the Turks! Our village lies in the shadow of their fortress...
key_value.77062: The castle in Giurgiu must stand.
key_value.77064: 120 seconds before the Turkish army arrives.
key_value.77065: 60 seconds before the Turkish army arrives.
key_value.77066: 10 seconds before the Turkish army arrives.
key_value.77067: ‹AQUA›GUARD: Hey you're seeing ghosts, they're probably just some new recruits.
key_value.77068: -Destroy all of Orsova's lumbercamps to stall the enemy's naval production.
key_value.77069: ‹RED›DRACULA: We've raided Orsova's wood supply. This will damage the ship building capacity in the region.
key_value.77070: -Destroy all of Obluciza's mining camps to deprive the enemy of their stone supply.
key_value.77071: ‹RED›DRACULA: Without the stone supply of Obluciza, nobody will but ourselves be able to build new towers or castles.
key_value.77072: -Destroy all the mining camps of Rahova to stop the enemy from training Janissaries.
key_value.77073: ‹RED›DRACULA: Let's see how our enemies will pay their special units without the gold supply of Rahova.
key_value.77074: -Destroy all mills that belong to Novoselo to weaken your enemies.
key_value.77075: ‹RED›DRACULA: Novoselo has lost all their mills!. This will seriously limit their population capacity.
key_value.77076: ‹RED›DRACULA: Bringing down those towns and fortresses one by one may take too long. Instead we could raid and pillage to wear them out. Our scouts can find out their weaknesses.
key_value.77077: ‹RED›DRACULA: Orsova is known for their wood production. The whole region depends on their lumber for their ships.
key_value.77078: ‹RED›DRACULA: This is Obluciza's stone quarry. Without it our enemies won't be able to build more fortifications.
key_value.77079: ‹RED›DRACULA: The mines of Rahova pay for the elite soldiers of the Ottoman army. If we destroy them, they'll no longer be able to hire new ones.
key_value.77080: ‹RED›DRACULA: Much of the food supply in the region comes from Novoselo. Without it they'll surely suffer.
key_value.77507:
NOTE: Some parts of the map are inaccessible at certain points of the scenario, or for its entirety. Objectives will only pertain to the areas that are accessible at the time.

1. The first part of the scenario is a cutscene depicting Dracula's response to the first wave of Ottoman invaders. All you need to do is sit back, watch, and enjoy.

2. Each fortress has several strengths and weaknesses and can train different troops, so use fitting strategies for their defense, and beware of enemy siege weapons!

3. Dracula's 'scorched earth' campaign requires that the countryside is completely obliterated (destroy all buildings except houses unless otherwise prompted) and the Ottoman Forward Troops defeated.

4. The Night Attack on the Ottoman camp is a valiant but doomed effort. Once most of your army is lost you will receive further objectives.

5. Vlad Dracula and his kingdom of Wallachia may reach the Imperial Age.
key_value.77508:
Your scouts report:

Dracula begins the scenario in his capital of Targoviste, but plans to lead his vast army of 22,000 (Grey) to the Danube River to ambush a contingent of the Ottoman army.

The Ottomans (Purple) are the most dangerous adversary. Their advance into Wallachia is spearheaded by an army of Janissaries, archers, heavy cavalry, siege, and polearms, and they will set up forward camps as they advance.

Dracula's kingdom of Wallachia (Grey) controls most of the small towns and fortresses on the map, which must be held at all costs.

The Ottoman Forward Troops (Purple) are a nominal threat, and have some units scattered around the map which will have to be dealt with sooner or later.

The countryside (Yellow) is next to no threat, as only a token force guards their buildings. If captured by the Turks, however, they could supply the vast Ottoman army.

In the far north of the map is Poenari, Dracula's personal castle. This is the best place to make a last stand, and its convenient location allows for an escape to Hungary in desperate circumstances.
key_value.77525: Wallachia, Spring of 1462                                                                                                                                                                                                     Central town square of Targoviste
key_value.77526: ‹GREY›MESSENGER: My lord, the Turkish army has been spotted just north of the Danube! They pillaged and burned some villages but are now retreating south!
key_value.77527: ‹RED›DRACULA: It must be the vanguard for a greater force. Quickly, messenger! Send word to my vassals to mobilize at great haste!
key_value.77528: ‹GREY›MESSENGER: Yes, my lord! I shall depart at once!
key_value.77530: ‹GREY›ISTVAN: Soldiers, come forth and start on the road to battle!
key_value.77531: ‹GREY›JAKUB: So the Turks are here? Men, let's slaughter the invading scum!
key_value.77533: ‹PURPLE›GENERAL: Hurry, men! We must cross the river before Dracula's army arrives!
key_value.77534: ‹RED›DRACULA: Onwards men, we're gaining on them! Soon we will slay them all!
key_value.77535: ‹PURPLE›GENERAL: Halt, troops! Halt, I said! *to Danislav* What on earth are you doing here?
key_value.77536: ‹GREY›DANISLAV: I am here to take your head, scum! Charge!!!
key_value.77538: ‹RED›DRACULA: Finish them off! We will impale them all back at Targoviste!
key_value.77539: A great victory was won that day, and true to his word, Dracula impaled all of the Turks outside Targoviste.
key_value.77540: However, Ottoman troops crossed the Danube again and threatened two of Dracula's border castles.
key_value.77541: Defense of these castles was vital, for they were gateways into Vlad's kingdom.
key_value.77542: ‹GREY›ISTVAN: We must defend these castles against the invading army of the Turks!
key_value.77543: 1. Drive back the attacking Turks by killing 500 of their troops.
key_value.77544: ‹GREY›SOLDIER: The Turks are fleeing! We have won!
key_value.77547: The Fagaras castle must not be destroyed.
key_value.77553: ‹RED›DRACULA: Men, we have defended our borders thus far but we cannot do so for long! We must give them no chance to supply their army. We destroy everything!
key_value.77554: 2. Raid the countryside and pillage and burn everything! In addition, clear out all Ottoman troops you find.
key_value.77555: ‹RED›DRACULA: That's enough for now, men. Let us return to Targoviste!
key_value.77556: ‹RED›DRACULA: The gold from these mines will pay for plenty of mercenaries!
key_value.77557: ‹RED›DRACULA: The mines here are overflowing with wealth! Let us loot what we can!
key_value.77558: ‹RED›DRACULA: Mills like these hold much food! Let us destroy it and all others like it!
key_value.77559: ‹RED›DRACULA: Throw their corpses down the well. Let's see the Turks drink fouled water!
key_value.77560: ‹RED›DRACULA: We have found many provisions in this market!
key_value.77562: ‹RED›DRACULA: This path leads to the settlement of Brasov. We 'punished' them a few years ago for disloyalty, but we shall complete the job now!
key_value.77563: ‹RED›DRACULA: We have found much armor in this blacksmith!
key_value.77564: ‹RED›DRACULA: We have razed their town center! Impale them all!
