key_value.77565: ‹RED›DRACULA: This dock will send no more supplies to the Turk camps.
key_value.77566: ‹RED›DRACULA: Look out men, Turks are out and about. Draw your swords!
key_value.77567: ‹RED›DRACULA: Turks guard the bridge! Kill them all!
key_value.77569: ‹RED›DRACULA: I cannot die here! There is still so much to do!
key_value.77570: ‹RED›DRACULA: A treacherous Boyar in the Turkish army? Impale him!
key_value.77571: Once the Turkish army approached Targoviste, the Sultan was horrified at the sight of his impaled men, and fled back to his capital.
key_value.77572: Commanding the Turkish army in the Sultan's place was a familiar face: Radu, Dracula's own brother, now a puppet of the Sultan.
key_value.77573: The Turkish army was far better-equipped and Dracula had lost many of his men in the prior battles. Dracula was forced to flee north, to Poenari Castle.
key_value.77574: ‹RED›DRACULA: It would appear that we have visitors...
key_value.77575: ‹GREY›MONK: My lord, we come to provide you with holy consort.
key_value.77576: ‹RED›DRACULA: Ah, monks! Tell me, what does God think of these impaled men?
key_value.77577: ‹GREY›FIRST MONK: You are the ruler of this land and God respects your judgment.
key_value.77578: ‹GREY›SECOND MONK: Dracula, God finds you a despicable being, but your defense of this land is admirable in His eyes.
key_value.77579: ‹RED›DRACULA: I appreciate honesty, but I detest patronizing liars. Impale the one who spoke first!
key_value.77581: ‹RED›DRACULA: The Turks are attacking! Defend Poenari at all costs!
key_value.77583: ‹RED›DRACULA: We have survived thus far, but we are nearly broken! However, I have one more trick up my sleeve...
key_value.77584: The Poenari Castle must not fall.
key_value.77586: 4. Take the mountain path to the southeast to rendezvous with the Wallachian army.
key_value.77587: ‹RED›DRACULA: Well met, friends! Now to destroy the Turk camp!
key_value.77588: ‹RED›DRACULA: The Sultan is not here and we have no hope to hold back the Turks! I must flee to Hungary!
key_value.77589: 6. Dracula must flee to Hungary! The sewers of the Poenari Castle empty out in a mountain stream, where Dracula has a small boat just for this purpose. Garrison Dracula in the castle to take this route.
key_value.77590: ‹RED›DRACULA: Off to Hungary! I will be back!!!
key_value.77593: 5. Take your army and raze the Turk camp to the ground!
key_value.80007:
1. The military strength of the Turkish Raiders is in their many camps. Their production will decrease with each one you raze.

2. Dracula's capture of the fortress of Sabac will give Hungary a much larger and stronger base to aid you from.

3. Controlling the Danube River will prove beneficial not only for its large population of fish but also for the ability to launch naval attacks on the enemy. At the very least, guard the many bridges, fords, and other crossings.

4. To destroy the cities of both Basarab and the Turks, you will need heavy siege equipment and well-equipped troops. Initially you will have neither, but with the help of some of the locals you might overcome this disadvantage...

5. Vlad Dracula is limited to the Castle Age.
key_value.80008:
Your scouts report:

Dracula begins the scenario in a Hungarian camp on the Danube River, which he must defend from early Ottoman attacks.

The Ottoman Raiders (Purple) pose a threat early on, mounting attacks from several camps on the southern side of the Danube. They will train archers, knights, spearmen, and siege in their attempts to destroy your camp.

Hungary (Green) is your strongest ally, and will support you with armies with a core of heavy cavalry and siege if you can hold off the Turks and establish a foothold in Wallachia.

Guarded by a token force, the Turkish fortress of Sabac (Purple) lies on the Danube and is coveted by Hungary.

Wallachia (Grey) is tired of a decade of oppression under the Turkish yoke and is eager to help Dracula reclaim the throne.

The usurper and Turkish puppet Basarab Laiota (Cyan) controls the main Wallachian cities and fortresses northwest of Targoviste, but has little support from the populace and therefore can only field a weak army. The core of his army is the many Boyars who supported his rise to power.

The greatest threat by far is from the Ottoman Army (Purple), firmly entrenched in Targoviste. Their army is mobilized in its full might and prepared for all-out war, boosting droves of Janissaries, Sipahis, siege, and Muslim priests in addition to the standard levy of infantry and archers.

Italian mercenaries (Yellow) are rumored to have set up a camp in Wallachia. Perhaps they will help you...
key_value.80014: ‹RED›DRACULA: I cannot die now! There is so much left to do!
key_value.80015: ‹RED›DRACULA: That's enough of these Turk invaders. Let us destroy them!
key_value.80017: ‹RED›DRACULA: The Hungarian border is safe from the Turks. To Wallachia!
key_value.80018: 2. Bring Dracula to the Town Center of the Wallachian town of Campulung (marked on the map).
key_value.80019: ‹RED›DRACULA: Arise, brothers, and help me overthrow the usurper Basarab Laiota!
key_value.80021: ‹RED›DRACULA: The traitor Basarab Laiota is dead!
key_value.80023: ‹RED›DRACULA: The invader scum have been pushed back once and for all!
key_value.80024: -Capture the fortress of Sabac by defeating its garrison so that the Hungarians can have a proper base to launch their attacks.
key_value.80025: ‹GREEN›MATTHIAS CORVINUS: Sabac is ours! Now we can properly support you on the battlefield!
key_value.80026: ‹YELLOW›CONDOTTIERO: Hail, brother! Some of the finest warriors in all of Europe are for hire here! Tuscan Condottieri or Balestrieri from Genoa!
key_value.80027:
-From now on, you may hire Condottieri or Genoese Crossbowmen from the mercenary camp (yellow). To hire a Condottiero, click on the barracks. To hire a Genoese Crossbowman, click on the archery range.

Cost:
-Condottiero: 60 Gold
-Genoese Crossbowman: 50 Gold
key_value.80028: ‹ORANGE›CRAFTSMAN: Welcome, fellows... you are Vlad Dracula's men? It was under his benevolent rule that I was able to start my business! Take these trebuchets as a gift of thanks!
key_value.80029: ‹ORANGE›CRAFTSMAN: There is something I would wish to discuss with the great Vlad Dracula. Perhaps, he would honor me by visiting me here at my shop?
key_value.80030: ‹RED›DRACULA: Well met, friend. You requested to see me?
key_value.80031: ‹ORANGE›CRAFTSMAN: So the rumors are true--my lord has returned!
key_value.80032: ‹RED›DRACULA: Yes, I have braved high peaks and terrible peril to return. So tell me, what is it you wish to discuss?
key_value.80033: ‹ORANGE›CRAFTSMAN: My lord, under your gracious rule, we prospered as a people. My apprentices and I were able to forge the finest weapons and build the finest machinery.
key_value.80034: ‹ORANGE›But now, I can barely feed myself, not to mention my apprentices. If you could supply us with enough food for the winter and enough gold to buy the supplies we need, then we would be able to reopen our business and teach you all we know!
key_value.80035: -To accept the craftsman's offer and give him 2000 food and 2000 gold, select the trade workshop.
key_value.80036: ‹RED›DRACULA: I gladly accept your fair offer.
key_value.80037: The master craftsman has built a trebuchet!
key_value.80038: ‹RED›DRACULA: So this is what is left of my once great castle. A curse on the invaders!
key_value.80041: -Bring Dracula to the craftsman at his shop.
key_value.81005:
1. The Berbers have access to a wide array of cavalry units that are light, inexpensive, and excel at outmaneuvering and countering most enemy armies. Needless to say, they should form the core of your fighting force.

2. The city of Cordoba and the Visigoth fortresses are well-fortified. You will require well-supported siege equipment to breach them.

3. Fish are abundant in the Atlantic Ocean and the Alboran Sea as well as several rivers, but beware of marauding Visigoth ships.

4. If you run low on gold, you can trade across the sea with the Berber city of Ceuta to the south. Pirate hoards are also rumored to be located on various islands and might provide a decent boost to your economy.

5. The Berber army is restricted to the Castle Age and its population limit is 120. Reinforcements of heavy troops, however, will periodically arrive from North Africa.
key_value.81006:
Your scouts report:

- Tariq Ibn Ziyad's army (Yellow) has landed at Gibraltar and must defeat the army of the Visigoth king Roderic (Green) in order to establish a foothold in the region before the Berbers deem it safe to send him villagers to establish a camp.

- The army of the Visigoth king Roderic (Green) has assembled on the far side of the ford in the northwest and is comprised mainly of infantry units with a few supporting archery and cavalry units. It is loosely unified, however, and will be demoralized beyond help should their leader fall in battle.

- A pair of Visigoth fortresses (Cyan) in the northeast watch over much of the region, and their troops will aggressively resist any invader. The core of their armies is infantry, but they will employ small contingents of archers, cavalry, and siege as well, and send warships to attack from the water.

- The city of Cordoba (Purple, located in the far north of the map) is well-fortified and its strategic location means that it will have to be taken if the Berber army is to control southern Iberia. Legions of archers, cavalry, infantry, siege, and clerics will provide staunch resistance on the land, while their warships will defend the city from amphibious incursions.

- There are a couple local villages (Grey) spread across the region that may be willing to aid your war effort once Roderic's army is defeated.
key_value.81013: ‹YELLOW›Berber Soldier: All is lost, for our glorious commander has fallen!
key_value.81014: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: Gaze upon this fruitful land, my brothers. Our conquest of Iberia begins today!
key_value.81015: + March to the northwest and defeat Roderic's Army (Green). Killing Roderic will cause his army to lose morale (-20 HP).
key_value.81016: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: We have won a great victory here today, my brothers! Let us construct a camp and seize Cordoba, the jewel of Southern Iberia!
key_value.81017: ‹GREEN›Visigoth Soldier: Our king has fallen--we are doomed!
key_value.81018: ‹GREY›Visigoth Soldier: We have deserted the usurper Roderic to fight for an honorable man like yourself! His army is camped just across the ford to the northwest.
key_value.81020: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: A ship of villagers has arrived from Ceuta to help us establish a camp. To work, quickly--there is no time to lose!
key_value.81021: + Conquer Cordoba by destroying its Castle.
key_value.81022: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: Cordoba is ours! You have fought well today, comrades, and by the will of Allah we have succeeded!
key_value.81023: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: It seems that the Visigoths have scouted our position. Bolster the defenses and be prepared for enemy attacks!
key_value.81024: - Destroy Visigoth castles to loot gold.
key_value.81025: ‹YELLOW›Berber Soldier: The Visigoths had much gold hoarded in this castle.
key_value.81026: - Bring Tariq to local villages (Grey) to gain their support.
key_value.81027: ‹GREY›Villager: We are tired of Visigoth rule, and will follow you instead!
key_value.81028: ‹GREY›Visigoth: Your cause is just. Our stable will train your horsemen and our dock will build your ships!
key_value.81029: - Reinforcements will periodically arrive by transport from Ceuta.
key_value.81030: ‹YELLOW›Berber Soldier: Reinforcements have arrived from Ceuta!
key_value.81207:
1. Strike quickly at Toledo - the Visigoth garrison is weak, but messengers have been sent out to the surrounding towns and will return with reinforcements if you wait too long.

2. Mountainous regions are rich in mineral resources. Additionally, if you run low on gold, you can trade with the city of Cordoba or a local trade post east of Toledo.

3. Talk to (click on) the locals in the countryside - they may have interesting information to share.

4. The enemy towns are preparing to build Wonders as a mark of their dominance - do not allow them to do so!

5. The army of Tariq ibn Ziyad cannot yet reach the Imperial Age. Additionally, Tariq's shipbuilders did not travel with him on this expedition, so building docks or ships is impossible.
key_value.81208:
Your scouts report:

- The army of Tariq ibn Ziyad (Yellow) has gathered on a promontory just southeast of the city of Toledo (Grey), the Visigoth capital, which lies in the center of the map. Toledo must be captured quickly in order to establish a foothold in the region and resupply the troops.

- The Visigoth garrison of Toledo (Green) represents only a token defense of the city, and is comprised of infantry, archers, and a few scorpions. They have also erected several makeshift towers guarding the main gates and the bridge across the river Tagus.

- The city of Cordoba and several local settlements (Orange) are situated in the east of the map. They will serve as valuable trade partners should your gold supply run low.


Four of the surrounding fortified towns pose significant threats:

- Seville (Blue) lies far to the south, and will field armies of Crossbowmen, Light Cavalry, Pikemen, and a few siege units.

- Merida (Red) is situated in the southwest, and its formidable fortress complex is guarded primarily by Huskarls, Pikemen, Long Swordsmen, and Cavalry Archers.

- Talavera (Purple) controls the far west of the map, and trains Knights, Light Cavalry, Skirmishers, siege units, and will also build ships to harass you from the river.

- Guadalajara (Cyan) lies far to the north. Their army is composed of Huskarls, Long Swordsmen, Skirmishers, and siege units. A small military camp also guards the mines in the mountains east of Toledo.
key_value.81215: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Allah save us, for our great leader has fallen!
key_value.81216: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: Across this river lies Toledo, the Visigothic capital. We should seize it quickly before word of our arrival reaches the nearby towns.
key_value.81217: ‹YELLOW›Scout: Honorable Tariq, our sappers have undermined all gates leading into the city, and only a token force remains to guard it.
key_value.81218: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: Let us strike swiftly and bring glory to the Caliphate!
key_value.81219: + Capture Toledo by defeating the Visigoth Garrison (Green) and destroying all of its towers.
key_value.81220: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: The city is ours! Let us strike out from here and conquer the surrounding towns!
key_value.81223: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Seville has fallen to our glorious armies!
key_value.81225: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The people of Merida will bend the knee.
key_value.81227: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The fortress of Talavera lies in ruin, Tariq.
key_value.81229: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The Guadalajarans were fools to resist us!
key_value.81230: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: The heartland of Visigothic Iberia is under our control. Now we can truly establish our rule here.
key_value.81231: ‹YELLOW›Messenger: Tariq-agha, your ally Musa is gathering his forces at Cordoba. They should arrive to reinforce us in 30 minutes.
key_value.81232: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: Messengers have informed the surrounding towns of our presence. We should prepare to meet their armies in battle!
key_value.81233: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: An enemy town is attempting to build a wonder. We must stop them!
key_value.81234: - The army of Musa ibn Nusayr will arrive in 30 minutes to aid in your conquest of the Visigoth heartland.
key_value.81235: ‹ORANGE›Musa: My army is ready to march, Tariq. Onwards to glory!
key_value.81236: ‹ORANGE›Trader: Some time ago, Byzantine merchants sold me the secrets of chemistry. I offer them to you for 500 gold.
key_value.81237: - To buy the Chemistry technology for 500 gold, select the trader's market.
key_value.81238: ‹ORANGE›Trader: Thank you, good sir. With the knowledge of chemistry, your ranged units will be far more effective!
key_value.81239: ‹ORANGE›Guard: Travellers tell tales of a gold-laden island in a lake to the far west...perhaps you can find a ship to take you there?
key_value.81240: ‹ORANGE›Guard: I hear that a caravan carrying a holy relic was attacked by wolves just southeast of here. It may be worth investigating.
key_value.81241: ‹ORANGE›Musa: My engineers in Cordoba are building us trebuchets. They should have one ready for us every 10 minutes.
key_value.81242: ‹ORANGE›Engineer: We have constructed another trebuchet to aid in your conquests!
key_value.81243: - Every 10 minutes, Musa's engineers will build you a trebuchet in Cordoba.
key_value.81245: ‹YELLOW›Tariq: My comrade Musa has fallen! How will we continue our campaign without him?
key_value.81405:
1. Your bases are divided and cannot be connected until the two southernmost Asturian fortresses are destroyed. Difficult as it might be, preserving both bases is vital due to their economic and strategic value.

2. You can ignore the Kingdom of Asturias if you like, but its control of strategic locations and constant raids on your flank might make them a necessary target. Each Asturian fortress is also home to a precious holy relic - capturing them can greatly boost your gold income.

3. As well as being a potential trade partner, Theodemir of Murcia has pledged to occasionally provide your armies with tribute and military support.

4. The Mediterranean Sea is an abundant source of fish. Additionally, a trade route to the Balearic Islands will be quite lucrative, provided you can defend it from enemy vessels.

5. This battle takes place centuries before the introduction of gunpowder into Europe.
key_value.81406:
Your scouts report:

- The Umayyad-Berber army (Yellow) advances in a two-pronged assault on northeastern Iberia. One camp, situated in the south of the map, is poised to strike at the Visigothic cities of Zaragoza (Green) and Narbonne (Cyan), while the second camp, located in the far west of the map, lies on the border of the Kingdom of Asturias (Red).

- To the far south lies the Visigothic realm of Murcia (Orange), an ally and dependency of the Umayyad Caliphate.

- The city of Zaragoza (Green) guards the easternmost crossing of the Ebro river. Zaragoza will field an army of cavalry, Pikemen, and Skirmishers, and a small navy safeguards the city from seaborne incursions up the Ebro river.

- The city of Narbonne (Cyan) lies in the far northeast of the map on the Mediterranean coastline. Their army consists of Skirmishers and auxiliary Light Cavalry built around a core of infantry. Their navy prowls the Mediterranean, eager to harass any attempts at fishing and trade.

- The Kingdom of Asturias (Red) is by far the greatest threat. Multiple fortresses in defensible, strategic locations sprawl over the western half of the map, and their army of heavy infantry, cavalry, and powerful siege engines will present a serious challenge to your forces.

- The locals (Grey) on the Balearic Islands in the east of the map are willing trade partners and may be willing to allow you to use their mines.
key_value.81407: ‹YELLOW›Commander: Our armies are poised to launch an offensive across the Ebro valley and into Septimania.
key_value.81408: ‹YELLOW›Commander: The cities of Zaragoza and Narbonne stand in our way. Let them feel the wrath of our armies!
key_value.81413: + Destroy the castles of the following cities:
key_value.81415: ‹YELLOW›Commander: We have destroyed the castle in Zaragoza!
key_value.81417: ‹YELLOW›Commander: Narbonne has fallen to our glorious armies. Thanks be to Allah!
key_value.81418: ‹YELLOW›Envoy: My lord, Theodemir of Murcia has pledged us his allegiance, and promises to periodically provide us with tribute and soldiers.
key_value.81419: - Theodemir of Murcia will provide you with tribute and supplementary troops every 10 minutes.
key_value.81420: ‹ORANGE›Theodemir: We offer what we can to aid you in your battles.
key_value.81421: ‹GREY›Guard: You may use our mines if you wish.
key_value.81422: ‹RED›Pelayo: We will drive you Moorish scum from our beloved homeland. Prepare for battle!
key_value.81605:
1. Navigating the terrain of the Pyrenees is difficult. Get accustomed to tight mountain passes and adapt your strategy accordingly.

2. The enemy fortresses nestled in the mountains are nigh impregnable. If you encounter one, turning around and finding another route is the best course of action.

3. You have no way of researching upgrades, but local villages may be impressed by your army and supply you with the upgrades you need.

4. Protect your ranged units - their tactical value increases exponentially in this land of cliff paths and narrow passes.

5. Throughout most of the map, the high walls of the mountains will protect your troops from the worst of the elements. Cliffed passes, however, are treacherous and exposed to the harsh winds. Units lingering in them for too long will begin to suffer damage due to exposure to the cold.
key_value.81606:
Your scouts report:

- The army of Abd ar-Rahman al-Ghafiqi (Yellow) has assembled near a local village just south of the Pyrenees mountains. Their objective is to cross the treacherous region and rendezvous with the Umayyad soldiers (Orange) who have made camp north of the mountain range.

- A few local villages (Grey) dot the map, overlooking important junctions and mountain passes. Their location makes them apt resting places but seemingly little more.


Three enemies pose a significant threat to the Umayyad army as it crosses the Pyrenees:

- The Asturians (Red) are only a faint presence in this region, but their fortified bastion in the center of the map and well trained, heavily armored troops nevertheless pose a threat worth considering.

- The Visigoths (Purple) prowl the eastern Pyrenees and are based in a fortress overlooking one of the major eastern passes. Their balanced army of infantry, ranged units, and light cavalry will provide stout opposition to any who would pass their way.

- The Basques (Green) are native to the western Pyrenees. Their army of light infantry, javelineers, and light cavalry would normally only pose a token threat, but their adept strategic use of the terrain makes them deadly to even a better-equipped force.
key_value.81607: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: An Asturian fortress lies just ahead. We do not have the means to capture it - we should turn around!
key_value.81608: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: This road leads to two enemy fortresses! Turn around at once!
key_value.81613: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: Just beyond this outpost lies a Visigoth fortress! We must find another route.
key_value.81614: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Sire, this road leads south into the maw of an enemy fortress! North is the way we want.
key_value.81615: ‹YELLOW›Scout: A dreaded enemy fortress lies just down the road. Our destination is north, not south!
key_value.81616: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: The main road to the southeast is guarded by two enemy fortresses. We must take the mountain pass to the northeast!
key_value.81617: ‹GREY›Local: The passes through the Pyrenees are treacherous and crawling with enemy troops. You have a long and trying journey ahead of you.
key_value.81618: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: Brace yourselves for frigid winds and be wary of enemy ambushes. We must reach the allied camp on the other side of the mountains before the cold of winter claims us all!
key_value.81619: + Abd ar-Rahman al-Ghafiqi, 15 of your men, and at least one supply cart must reach the Umayyad camp north of the Pyrenees.
key_value.81620: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: We have braved the cruel wintry weather of the Pyrenees. Let us make camp, eat, rest, and then continue our conquests. Good work, men!
key_value.81621: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Our glorious leader--Allah save him--is dead! How can we continue our campaign now?
key_value.81622: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: All of our supply carts have been destroyed! We cannot possibly hope to continue our journey without provisions.
key_value.81623: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: Our army has all but perished! Alas that I should lead my men to such destruction.
key_value.81624: ‹GREY›Horseman: Welcome to our humble village, my lord. Allow our blacksmith to upgrade your weapons.
key_value.81625: ‹GREY›Guard: Welcome, and feel free to rest! Our blacksmith will upgrade your armor.
key_value.81627: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: We are nearing the open face of the mountain. Let us traverse this pass quickly lest the cold winds sap us of our strength!
key_value.81628: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: We have braved that horrid mountain pass. Onwards!
key_value.81629: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: Another infernal cliffside pass. Pray to Allah that it's the last!
key_value.81630: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: An Asturian camp! Let us fall upon it as wolves closing in for the kill.
key_value.81631: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: A final Basque ambush stands between us and our goal. Press forward and fight bravely!
key_value.81803:
1. Upon the destruction of an enemy monastery, an enemy army will rush from the nearest enemy city or fortress to the village you are attacking. These armies are too strong to fight and should be avoided at all costs - use the line of sight of your light cavalry to warn you of their arrival.

2. There are three suitable locations for you to establish your camp - one in the far south of the map, one in the east of the map, or you can choose to expand the camp you begin the scenario with. Each choice has different benefits and drawbacks.

3. Fishing is plentiful in the Bay of Biscay, though your enemies will do their best to harass your fleet.

4. The city of Bordeaux and the fortresses of the Frankish army are well fortified - you will require advanced siege equipment to breach them.

5. Several relics lie scattered around the map - some within the walls of Frankish fortresses, and some nestled in the countryside.
key_value.81804:
Your scouts report:

- The army of Abd ar-Rahman al-Ghafiqi (Yellow) has made camp in the south of Aquitania and has been conducting raids while awaiting reinforcements. Its sights are set in particular on the Frankish city of Bordeaux.

- Three Aquitanian villages (Purple) lie in close proximity to the Berber camp. They are providing the Franks with supplies but are only defended by a token force and should crumble easily to a swift raid.

- The city of Bordeaux (Blue) lies near the mouth of the Garonne river, boasting excellent fortifications and a strong land army of mixed composition. Their navy prowls the Bay of Biscay, picking off enemy ships at will.

- The Frankish army (Red) is by far your most dangerous opponent. Numerous fortresses sprawl across the countryside, and hordes of battle-hardened Paladins, Throwing Axemen, swordsmen, and auxiliary troops will be a true test for the proud Berber cavalry.
key_value.81805: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: Three nearby villages supply the Frankish army with resources. We should pillage them before we set up our camp.
key_value.81806: ‹YELLOW›Commander: We have the resources to outfit a handful of extra troops, but we are otherwise on our own until reinforcements arrive.
key_value.81807: + Scare the Aquitanian villages into submission by destroying their monasteries.
key_value.81808: ‹YELLOW›Horseman: Frankish Paladins approach from the northwest. Make haste to our camp!
key_value.81809: ‹YELLOW›Horseman: Frankish Paladins are crossing the river. Flee while there is time!
key_value.81810: ‹YELLOW›Horseman: Let us leave, quickly! I spot Frankish Paladins approaching from the north!
key_value.81811: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: The Aquitanian villages have been subdued! Reinforcements are now on their way to help us establish a camp.
key_value.81812: ‹PURPLE›Villager: To arms! Berber horsemen approach our village!
key_value.81813: ‹PURPLE›Knight: We are under attack by Berber raiders. Call for reinforcements at once!
key_value.81814: ‹PURPLE›Villager: The Umayyad army approaches our village. We are doomed!
key_value.81816: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: Rejoice, for Bordeaux, the heart of Aquitaine, is ours!
key_value.81818: ‹YELLOW›Al-Ghafiqi: The descendants of Merovech are no match for our proud Berber cavalry. Long live the Umayyad Caliphate!
key_value.82012:
1. You are restricted to the Castle Age and a population limit of 100.

2. The Aragonese can train new units while you initially cannot so speed and aggressiveness is critical.

3. Killing the Duke of Alba and Cardinal Mendoza before the camps are destroyed will allow you to begin the build and destroy portion of the scenario with more resources.

4. The bridge into Isabelista-held Zamora is well-defended but finding a beachhead further east will give you access to less defended parts of the city and farmlands.
key_value.82013:
Your scouts report:
Francisco de Almeida commands the reserve in Toro (Green, Spanish), a city on the Duero River.

King Afonso’s Army (Red, Portuguese) has routed after being defeated by Aragon. The remnants hide on the outskirts of the battlefield. Only the presence of Prince Juan himself will restore their fighting courage. The Army consists of light cavalry, pikemen, crossbowmen, and hand cannoneers.

Aragon (Yellow, Spanish) controls the field with three military camps. Its traditional army consists of cavaliers, swordsmen, and archers. Aragon has captured a new Portuguese organ gun. The Duke of Alba and Cardinal Mendoza command the army.

The City of Zamora straddles the Duero west of Toro. The city is divided between the friendly Juanistas (Purple, Spanish), who control the northern bank and the old Romanesque cathedral, and enemy Isabelistas (Gray, Spanish), who command the Peñas de Santa Marta, a rocky outcrop overlooking the bridge over the river. Both sides consist of urban militias of pikemen, condottieri, crossbowmen, siege weapons, and limited light cavalry.
key_value.82015: + Destroy the three Aragonese military camps
key_value.82017: Choose one of the following objectives:
key_value.82019: ‹BLUE›Prince Juan: Francisco! My father's army is broken and the Aragonese approach Toro! We must defend the city! Sao Jorge!
key_value.82020: ‹BLUE›Prince Juan: Though the armies limp away from this battle, many more peasants will die from hunger in the coming weeks.
key_value.82021: ‹BLUE›Francisco: We cannot hide in Toro like rats! Our enemies have three camps between here and Zamora that we must destroy!
key_value.82022: ‹BLUE›Francisco: We have few men but many soldiers are hiding in the wilderness. If Prince Juan goes to them, they will find their courage!
key_value.82023: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The soldiers report the Duke of Alba and Cardinal Mendoza are patrolling nearby. Capturing them would fetch a large ransom.
key_value.82024: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The Prince has been gravely wounded!
key_value.82025: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Only two camps remain! Fight for Portugal and Castile!
key_value.82026: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Aragon is almost defeated! Only one camp remains!
key_value.82027: ‹BLUE›Francisco: We have achieved a great victory over Aragon! But do not rest, men! The treacherous followers of Isabela still divide Zamora!
key_value.82028: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Zamora is freed from the Isabelistas! We have stolen victory from certain defeat!
key_value.82029: The Duke of Alba has been captured!
key_value.82031: The City of Toro has been lost!
key_value.82038: - Bring Prince Juan to the remnants of King Afonso's Army
key_value.82039: - Find and unhorse (kill) the Duke of Alba and Cardinal Mendoza
key_value.82208:
1. You have a population limit of 75.

2. The Barbary Pirates rely on piracy for income. The fewer ships they have, the less resources they gain to train their units.

3. The Banu Arous will spawn raiders until their tents in the desert are destroyed.

4. The Emir can be a powerful ally but weigh his assistance with the threat of giving him cannons.
key_value.82209:
Your scouts report:
Francisco de Almeida commands Fort Graciosa on an island in the Loukkos River. The island has limited resources, however, and must rely on Berber villages on either side of the river.

The local Emir (Red, Saracens) rules the city of El Araich guarding the river's estuary west of Fort Graciosa. He fields swordsmen, skirmishers, and knights, as well as a strong navy. The threat of Portuguese cannons has kept him friendly to Portugal's interests. Until we gain the upperhand over the Barbary Pirates, he may be a worthwhile ally... for a heathen.

The Barbary Pirates (Green, Berber) occupy a former caravanserai and harbor on the north bank of the river. As long as their fleets remain strong and able to seize Christian and Muslim cargoes alike, they will be a difficult adversary. As well as being sailors, the corsairs are skilled archers and spearmen.

The Banu Arous (Yellow, Berber) are light cavalry and camel raiders from the deserts to the south and east. They are an ancient people who still prize tattooed women as their Numidian ancestors did in the time of Hannibal, despite the rigid influence of seven centuries of Islamic law. Venturing into the desert and destroying their tents is the only way to end their raids.

Off the Mauretanian coast are the Canary Islands, territory of the Kingdom of Castile. European treaties matter little in this dangerous frontier, however, and the islands would be a rich source of resources, provided the native Guanches (Purple, Malians) can be pacified. Pagan cousins to the Berbers, they mummify their dead as they have done for centuries. Covered in goatskins with necklaces of bone and shells, they are skilled skirmishers and boatmen.

The flagship of the Ottoman privateer Kemal Reis (Gray, Turks) has been sighted off the coast, attacking Christian ships in support of the beleaguered Emir of Granada. Defeating him in battle would be a boon to the war against the Moors and Ottomans.

And somewhere off the African coast, an expedition led by Duarte Pacheco Pereira has been rumored lost.
key_value.82211: + Destroy the three docks of the Barbary Pirates
key_value.82212: + Destroy the Kasbah (castle) of the Barbary Pirates
key_value.82213: + Destroy the Kasbah (castle) of the Emir at El Araich
key_value.82214: - Sink the flagship of the Ottoman privateer Kemal Reis
key_value.82215: - Bring at least 5 soldiers inside the gate of El Araich to 'request' the assistance of the Emir against the Pirates
key_value.82216: - Bring an organ gun to the Emir's Kasbah (castle) in El Araich to gain his assistance against the Pirates
key_value.82217: - Find the missing Portuguese expedition of Duarte Pacheco Pereira
key_value.82218: - Bring the relic to the castle at Fort Graciosa
key_value.82220: ‹BLUE›Francisco: We cannot remain holed up on this island like galley rats! The Emir controls the estuary. He must be made to understand our position.
key_value.82221: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The Ottoman pirate Kemal Reis! I will make that ship his casket and the Atlantic his grave!
key_value.82222: ‹BLUE›Francisco: With Kemal Reis' terror on the seas ended, new caravels arrive from Portugal.
key_value.82223: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Pereira has found the relics of ancient Carthage!
key_value.82224: ‹BLUE›Francisco: I will take a few of the relics to enrich the garrison.
key_value.82225: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The pirates will threaten Portugal no more!
key_value.82226: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The treacherous Emir is dead and his castle sacked! The Moors will not soon forget the might of Portugal!
key_value.82227: ‹RED›Emir: Intimidation is not friendship, Francisco. Bring an organ gun to my Kasbah for my engineers to study and I will fight with you against the pirates.
key_value.82228: ‹RED›Emir: Excellent. My engineers will study this cannon and use it in our own designs. You are a worthy friend against the pirates.
key_value.82229: ‹RED›Emir: Diplomacy is a game of cunning, Francisco. No treaty will survive when the stakes are guns, gold, and God. Once I crush you, no European will threaten my land or my faith.
key_value.82235: Emir declared war on Barbary Pirates
key_value.82405:
1. You have a population limit of 125.

2. Portuguese castaways and lost ships can be found throughout the sea. Recovering them will provide units and cannons.

3. The choice of siding with or betraying Muhammad ibn Rukn ad Din will have significant effects on the course of the scenario. Siding with him will allow you to gather a large rebel army and have a presence on the mainland. Opposing him will make defeating Kilwa easier but draw the ire of Zanzibar and Muhammad's rebel army.

4. Destroying the Bantu tents in the savanna will stop their raids.

5. Gold is rare but can be obtained through trade, finding the Mutapa gold mines, conquering Zanzibar, and sinking Zanzibar's trade cogs. You can attack Zanzibar at will by changing diplomacy.

6. The Mutapa gold mines are somewhere in the west past the thickest Baobab trees. Bring lumberjacks to get to them.
key_value.82406:
Your scouts report:
Storms have separated Francisco de Almeida and his son Lourenço from the rest of their armada. The damaged ships have reached Songo Songo, one of many islands off the Swahili coast.

Kilwa (Red, Ethiopians) is the Swahili sultanate nearest Songo Songo. It is ruled by Emir Ibrahim, a former minister who recently murdered the sultan and usurped the throne. As a result, Kilwa is on the verge of civil war and has lost control of the city of Mombasa. Kilwa's army consists of swordsmen, archers, skirmishers, and shotel warriors.

An exiled Kilwan prince named Muhammad ibn Rukn ad Din seeks the Kilwan throne. He can be surrendered to Kilwa as a bribe or brought to the Swahili Villages (Green, Malians) marked with flags to raise an army loyal to Portugal.

The Swahili villages are garrisoned by hostile Bantu warriors (Orange, Ethiopians) led by mighty chieftains. The Bantu lord over the inland trading posts and use the savannas to launch attacks on the coastal region. Destroying their savanna camps will end their raids.

Mombasa (Yellow, Malians) is a well-fortified island city north of Kilwa. Mombasa has a strong navy and an army of swordsmen, gbeto, cavalry, and monks.

Zanzibar (Cyan, Saracens) lies on two gold-rich islands off the Swahili coast and is ruled by an Arab sultan. While Zanzibar's fleet is strong, its small army makes it vulnerable to invasion. If the island sultanate becomes hostile, destroying the war ships and defenses will pacify it but a complete conquest will allow Portugal to mine the island resources.

Finally, the Africans tell tales of the gold-filled frontier of a kingdom called Mutapa just beyond where the Baobab trees grow thickest.
key_value.82407: + Bring Muhammad ibn Rukn ad Din to the Swahili villages
key_value.82409: + Bring him to Kilwa for his execution (red flag)
key_value.82412: + Bring an army into Kilwa under diplomatic pretenses
key_value.82413: - Sink Zanzibar's war ships and destroy the fire towers
key_value.82414: - Clear the Bantu from the Swahili trading posts
key_value.82415: - Locate the gold mines of Mutapa
key_value.82416: - Attack Zanzibar's trade cogs and pirate their cargo
key_value.82418: + Muhammad ibn Rukn ad Din must survive
key_value.82419: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The rebel prince promises us an army to conquer Kilwa but he could also make an effective bribe to gain the city's trust.
key_value.82420: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The prince has been executed and the Emir grants us an island. We must take advantage of this friendship to bring an army into the city. I will not forgive the Emir's inhospitality.
key_value.82421: ‹BLUE›Francisco: We have thrown the dice behind the rebel prince! Kilwa will burn!
key_value.82422: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The cowardly Emir flees half-naked into the forest! His silk caftans alone will finance our war with Mombasa!
key_value.82423: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Zanzibar profits from the peace we have brought to Africa. It would please our King to collect his just due from Zanzibar's merchants.
key_value.82424: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The Emir is on to us! Rapidamente! Burn the castle!
key_value.82425: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The Swahili coast is ours! We have seized the riches of Africa and flung open the gates to the Indies with fire and steel!
key_value.82426: ‹AQUA›Zanzibari Diplomat: Kilwa has a new mercenary, I see. My sultan will be displeased.
key_value.82427: ‹AQUA›Zanzibari Diplomat: Make peace with your God. You will see him soon.
key_value.82428: ‹AQUA›Zanzibari Diplomat: The sultan provides gifts and says enough blood has been shed. He decrees the sons of Europe and Africa will live in peace.
key_value.82429: ‹AQUA›Zanzibari Diplomat: Have you not lost enough men to our ships? The Sultan provides peace but he will destroy those who threaten it!
key_value.82430: Muhammad ibn Rukn ad Din has died!
key_value.82604:
1. You have a population limit of 125 but do not need to build houses.

2. Aggressiveness is critical. Loot enemy buildings for resources. Some buildings provide bonus resources.

3. A feitoria can provide steady resources in exchange for population room.

4. The enemy relies on an economy outside Cannanore so do not limit your attacks to inside the city.

5. The fast-moving units of the Hindu Pirates make great raiders, provided you choose to ally with them. Otherwise, defeating the Pirates will bring a surplus of resources.
key_value.82605:
Your scouts report:
Francisco de Almeida and his son Lourenço are besieged at Fort Sant’Angelo in Cannanore after being betrayed by the Kolathiri Raja, ruler of the city.

The Kolathiri Raja (Red, Indians) commands an army of elephants, camels, light cavalry, swordsmen, and archers. His city was a Portuguese ally during the reign of the previous Kolathiri, whose recent death sparked a succession dispute. The new Kolathiri seized the throne with the backing of the Zamorin and in return, has vowed to push the Portuguese into the sea.

The Zamorin (Green, Indians), the cunning ruler of Calicut, has brought an army of elephants, camels, cavalry archers, swordsmen, hand cannoneers, and siege to assist the Kolathiri. His encampments outside of Cannanore will be difficult to challenge directly but his supply lines to the south may be prone to infiltration.

Hindu Pirates (Yellow, Indians), led by the slippery pirate lord Timoji, occupy Anjediva, an island off the coast. Making contact with the Pirates either through war or peace may be in Portugal's best interest.
key_value.82606: Choose one of the following objectives:
key_value.82608: + Defeat the Zamorin and the Kolathiri Raja
key_value.82609: - Sink the Zamorin's cannon galleon before it is ready to sail
key_value.82610: Choose one of the following objectives:
key_value.82612: - Kill the pirate scum and recover the stolen goods
key_value.82615: ‹BLUE›Francisco: They have broken through! Fight for Portugal and Sao Jorge!
key_value.82616: ‹BLUE›Francisco: It is good the gate is broken. No one will accuse us of hiding behind walls! Better to die burning their city than cower like a cornered dog!
key_value.82617: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Spies report the Zamorin employs Italian engineers to arm his ships with cannons. We must destroy the ships before they set to sea!
key_value.82619: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The Zamorin flees in a flurry of robes on a mangy camel! But I do not think this victory has ended our war...
key_value.82620: ‹YELLOW›Timoji: Ah... The illustrious Dom Francisco, it is a pleasure to meet you. Recover my ship stolen from me by the Zamorin and I will pledge myself to your cause.
key_value.82621: ‹YELLOW›Timoji: Dashing and daring! The pirate's blood is in you, Dom Francisco! May our war be profitable!
key_value.82622: ‹YELLOW›Timoji: I welcomed you with kind words and you spit on me! I will drive you back to Europe!
key_value.82623: You will receive more gold from razings as long as Timoji is alive
key_value.82625: OBJECTIVE FAILED: The Zamorin can now build Cannon Galleons
key_value.82810:
1. You have a population limit of 150.

2. While converting Portuguese, do not neglect training new units. You will need to be ready for the battle for Diu as soon as the Portuguese are all converted.

3. Destroying the Mamluk feitorias should be a priority. They are the primary source of resources for the Mamluks.

4. The arid Kathiawar peninsula to the west has rich gold deposits.
key_value.82811:
Your scouts report:
Francisco de Almeida has reached an inland village in northwest India. The death of his son Lourenco must be personally avenged so he cannot surrender the Viceroyship until those responsible for Lourenço's death are destroyed.

Afonso de Albuquerque (Red, Portuguese) has landed with a letter from King Manuel appointing him as Viceroy. His reputation as an overbearing taskmaster makes his men easily swayed by promises of gold and divine intercession. Albuquerque’s expedition consists of conquistadors, halberdiers, arbalests, and hand cannoners. Care should be taken to not inflict heavy losses on fellow Portuguese. At the very least, they will be needed for the battle against Diu.

Diu (Purple, Persians), an island city off the southern coast of the Kathiawar peninsula to the west, will be the focus of the coming battle. Governed by Malik Ayyaz, a Russian converted to Islam, Diu has a primarily mounted army of war elephants, heavy camels, and paladins inspired to battle by Muslim imams. Malik Ayyaz is aided by Venetian engineers who have constructed bombard towers in his city.

Diu is also supported by an army sent by the Ottoman sultan (Green, Turks). This vanguard of janissaries, bombard cannons, and sipahis (cataphracts) has camped in and around the city of Surat across the Konkan River from the Portuguese position.

Amir Husain al-Kurdi commands the Egyptian Mamluks (Cyan, Saracens). His fleet is based on the northern side of the Gulf of Khambhat, north of Diu. The Mamluk army consists of mamelukes, cavalry archers, and siege supported by a detachment of Venetian condottieri. The Venetians also provide the funding for the Mamluk expedition through the resources gathered by their trade embassies (feitorias). Destroying these buildings will cripple the Mamluks.

Finally, Gujarati traders (Yellow, Persians) have market posts in the arid and gold-rich Kathiawar peninsula to the west. Picking sides is unprofitable for these savvy merchants who are eager to trade with the Portuguese.
key_value.82813: + Kill fewer than 15 of Albuquerque's men
key_value.82814: + Kill fewer than 10 of Albuquerque's men
key_value.82815: + Kill fewer than 6 of Albuquerque's men
key_value.82818: Choose one of the following objectives:
key_value.82820: + Defeat the Mamluks, Ottomans, and Diu
key_value.82822: - Find and kill Malik Ayyaz, Amir Husain al-Kurdi, and the Turkish Pasha
key_value.82823: ‹RED›Afonso: By order of His Majesty, you are to be relieved as Viceroy of India and to return to Portugal for inquiry into your activities in the Indies.
key_value.82824: ‹RED›Afonso: This is madness, Francisco! We stand at the heathen's gate and you kill your fellow Christians! For what? For your own vanity?
key_value.82825: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The King does not know the pain of a son’s death! Send the priests to Albuquerque's men to promise them God and gold if they follow me. Not even the King will deny me my vengeance!
key_value.82826: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Send a priest to Albuquerque to seal my command with God’s grace!
key_value.82827: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Send Albuquerque away! Malik Ayyaz plans to execute our brothers in Diu! We have little time to defeat him!
key_value.82828: ‹BLUE›Francisco: Build our defenses! We will make our stand against the Turks and Egyptians over the ruins of India!
key_value.82829: ‹BLUE›Francisco: My dear son, the heathen who took you from me is dead.
key_value.82830: ‹BLUE›Francisco: If the Turkish sultan wishes for more of his pashas to die, he will send them to me!
key_value.82831: ‹BLUE›Francisco: The treacherous Russian renegado has earned his fate for consorting with the enemies of God.
key_value.82832: ‹BLUE›Francisco: I have shed enough blood for my son. Release Albuquerque and give him my banner. It is time for me to return home.
key_value.82833: OBJECTIVE FAILED: Too many Portuguese have been killed!
key_value.83003:
1. Niani will no longer be your ally once it is conquered by the Sosso. Attacking them, however, is not necessary to achieve victory.

2. You may not advance to the Imperial Age.

3. Wildlife is an excellent source of food.
key_value.83004:
Your scouts report:

- Sundjata is fleeing Niani (Orange), the capital of the Mali kingdom, and must find friends in the desert. The town of Kangaba (Yellow) lies west of Niani across the Niger River.

-Pursuing Sundjata are the archers, skirmishers, and scout cavalry of the Sosso Scouts (Red).
key_value.83005: ‹ORANGE›Niani: Sundjata, you must flee the city! We will hold Sumanguru's men off as long as we can!
key_value.83006: ‹ORANGE›Niani: Good luck, Sundjata! May your fate be better than ours.
key_value.83007: ‹PURPLE›Soldier: We will follow you wherever you go, my prince!
key_value.83008: ‹PURPLE›Soldier: We should not go this way. There's a castle protecting the crossing!
key_value.83009: ‹PURPLE›Cavalry Archer: Do not worry, you are not alone on your journey. Our village is on the other side of the river. When we reach it, it is yours.
key_value.83010: ‹PURPLE›Crossbowman: Sumanguru is a cruel ruler. We will help you get out of here.
key_value.83011: ‹YELLOW›Kangaba Villager: We have heard of your sad story. Please let us help you as best we can. Sumanguru's scouts have an encampment south of here. We will help you destroy it!
key_value.83012: ‹PURPLE›Kangaba Villager: The enemy knows you are here, Sundjata! We must prepare for their attacks!
key_value.83013: ‹PURPLE›Soldier: The prince is dead! Sumanguru will remain unchallenged!
key_value.83014: ‹PURPLE›Soldier: This will surely slow them down, but we should still get out of here quickly. Soon Sumanguru's men will swarm this region looking for you.
key_value.83016: + Flee the city and find a new ally.
key_value.83205:
1. Protecting your allies is not absolutely necessary, but it is nevertheless a good idea to do so as they are valuable assets.

2. You may not advance to the Imperial Age.
key_value.83206:
Your scouts report:

- Sundjata commands a forest camp in the south.

- The Sangaran (Red), the strongest of his enemies, have a castle to the northwest. They have a lethal army of archers, skirmishers, scorpions, and monks.

- To the far north and protected by a river and towers are the Labe (Green). Once they reach the Castle Age, they are a challenging opponent, training long swordsmen, knights, and battering rams.

- Niger (Cyan) is secluded in the mountains to the northeast. Their cavalry archers and mangonels are a deadly combination.

- Two towns, Wagadou (Blue) and Tabon (Yellow), support Sundjata. They are surrounded by enemies and will try to defend their lands but will need help from Sundjata.
key_value.83207: ‹PURPLE›Scout: We face many enemies here, but if we can bring our holy relic to their towns, they will surely submit to our rule!
key_value.83208: ‹YELLOW›Tabon: We have always been an ally of your family, and we shall honor that now as well.
key_value.83209: ‹BLUE›Wagadou: We stand by you, Sundjata, but you must protect us from our enemies.
key_value.83210: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: Our relic cart has reached Sangaran. They have decided that they will oppose us no longer.
key_value.83211: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: The relic cart has reached the town of Labe and they have laid down their arms.
key_value.83212: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: Our relic cart has reached Niger. Now they too will submit to Mali rule!
key_value.83213: ‹BLUE›Wagadou: Our town is under attack! Please save us, Sundjata!
key_value.83214: ‹BLUE›Wagadou: Labe knights! They are here to destroy us!
key_value.83215: ‹YELLOW›Tabon: The enemy is in our town! We need your help!
key_value.83216: ‹BLUE›Wagadou: We cannot stand against the onslaught of our enemies and so we must surrender...
key_value.83217: ‹YELLOW›Tabon: Alas! You were unable to protect us.
key_value.83218: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: Sangaran, Labe and Niger send word that they shall submit to Sundjata, ruler of Mali. It seems the tide is turning in our favor!
key_value.83219: ‹PURPLE›Scout: This is the cart carrying the baobab stick of our great commander. We should have units near it at all times so it doesn't fall into the wrong hands.
key_value.83220: + Bring the cart to the flagged plazas in Sangaran (Red), Labe (Green) and Niger (Cyan).
key_value.83405:
1. Avoid attacking Djenne (Green) until you're strong enough.

2. Try to obtain as many resources as you can before building a base. Once you have freed any of the imprisoned villagers, Djenne (Green) will be inclined to go on the offensive.

3. Your units can refresh and heal at local ponds.

4. Destroying the Sosso camp up north will let you gain access to the resources there.

5. Gunpowder units are disabled in this scenario.
key_value.83406:
Your scouts report:

- Sundjata's men arrive from the east. They must be brought to a camp in the south to start their raids.

- The great city of Djenne (Green) dominates the region along the banks of the Niger River. It is well-fortified to withstand any siege.

- Several villages (Cyan) dot the landscape. Some hold resources while others have imprisoned Mandinka villagers loyal to Sundjata.

- Two mining camps (Red) lie to the west and east, producing precious gold and salt. Gold is rare elsewhere in the region so these mines and trade will be the main source of income.
key_value.83407: ‹ORANGE›Imam: Welcome, Malian riders. Some of your comrades already set up camp nearby. You can find them to the south.
key_value.83408: ‹PURPLE›Malian Horseman: This region has many villages loyal to Djenne. Let us raid them and disturb Djenne's precious trade routes before we start our attack on the city itself!
key_value.83409: ‹PURPLE›Malian Horseman: Djenne captured many of our villagers. If we free them, they can help us build a better equipped base.
key_value.83410: ‹YELLOW›Merchant: I have heard of your intentions, Malian warriors. Visit me after you have arrived at your camp.
key_value.83411: ‹YELLOW›Merchant: The Sosso and their allies want to push me out of their trade. Not if I have anything to say about it! If you bring me four camels, I will tell you where they keep their goods and prisoners.
key_value.83412: ‹YELLOW›Merchant: Very good! Here are the locations I think you will find very interesting.
key_value.83413: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: If we destroy the Sosso towers defending these mines, the miners will produce gold for Mali!
key_value.83414: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: This salt mine will provide us with much-needed gold!
key_value.83415: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: Look at that shiny gold these miners are mining! Nowhere else can you find so much of it as here!
key_value.83416: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: We have sacked one of their villages!
key_value.83417: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: These peasants offer to help us. Let us bring them back to our camp.
key_value.83418: ‹GREEN›Djenne: You think your raiders can destroy our villages and get away with it! You shall feel the wrath of the mighty city of Djenne!
key_value.83419: ‹YELLOW›Merchant: I like how you do business, so I would like to make another proposition. Send me 2000 wood and I will build a small trade outpost where your traders can sell their goods.
key_value.83420: ‹YELLOW›Merchant: Splendid! The trade post is ready. You can send your trade carts to it.
key_value.83421: ‹AQUA›Villager: Mali raiders! Run for your lives!
key_value.83422: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: The Sosso encampment up ahead has a lot of resources that our villagers could gather from. It might be worthwhile to conquer it and use it ourselves.
key_value.83423: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: An old workshop. Surely we can put it to good use.
key_value.83424: ‹PURPLE›Mali Horseman: Djenne has been crushed! The Sosso will no longer be able to trade here. We will see how strong Sumanguru is without his precious gold.
key_value.83426: + Locate the camp of your fellow raiders.
key_value.83427: + Destroy the markets inside the walls of great city of Djenne.
key_value.83429: - Raid as many enemy towns as you can by destroying their storage buildings. The resources contained therein will help support your raider army.
key_value.83431: - Use the freed villagers to build a town center.
key_value.83432: Optional: Find four camels and bring them inside the enclosure by the merchant.
key_value.83433: Optional: Capture the western salt mine by destroying the towers defending it.
key_value.83434: Optional: Capture the eastern gold mine by destroying the towers defending it.
key_value.83435: Optional: Send 2000 wood to the Arab traders (Yellow) so you can trade with them.
key_value.83436: Optional: Destroy the Sosso camp in the north to gain access to more resources.
key_value.83437: Optional: Destroy the Sosso camp in the north to gain access to more resources and to stop their raids.
key_value.83604:
1. Mema and Fakoli might be willing to change sides, but they will ask you to do a couple of things for them in return. Be sure to be ready when agreeing to avoid disappointing them.

2. Be prepared for early attacks.

3. Protect the trade outpost - if your enemies destroy it, your task will be much harder.
key_value.83605:
Your scouts report:

- Mali has a small camp set up in the east, on the edge of the desert.

- The Mema (Green) to the north are vassals of Sumanguru, but might betray him if the opportunity arises. They train knights, swordsmen, and battering rams.

- Like the Mema, the Fakoli (Yellow) to the south are also unhappy with their Sosso overlords and will rebel if given the chance. They field an army of crossbowmen, light cavalry, and mangonels.

- Across the river to the west are the Sosso (Red). The Sosso rely on their mighty fortifications and field powerful armies of camels, pikemen, shotel warriors, and siege.
key_value.83606: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: Samanguru has brought his Sosso warriors to do battle against us! Let us teach this dog how we Mali soldiers fight!
key_value.83607: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: There is very little wood in this region. The only way we can get more is by transporting it over the river, but the river is guarded by Sosso towers. We should destroy all five of them.
key_value.83608: ‹YELLOW›Fakoli: We have grown tired of Sumanguru and will join your side, oh mighty Sundjata, for the mere sum of 1000 gold.
key_value.83609: ‹YELLOW›Fakoli: Thank you for the gold. Now if you build a castle in our town, we will honor our agreement. You have 10 minutes.
key_value.83610: ‹YELLOW›Fakoli: We knew we could trust you, Sundjata. Our spears and swords are yours!
key_value.83611: ‹YELLOW›Fakoli: It seems our trust in our Mali brethren was misplaced, as you failed to uphold your end of the agreement. There will be no treaty!
key_value.83612: ‹GREEN›Mema: Great Sundjata, we want to throw off the Sosso yoke, but cannot do so while Sumanguru keeps my daughter hostage. Save her and we will fight for you.
key_value.83613: ‹GREEN›Mema: My precious daughter is back! You have made me a very happy man! We are with you, Sundjata.
key_value.83614: ‹GREEN›Mema: You have let my daughter get hurt! I shall fight you with everything I have, so-called king of Mali.
key_value.83615: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: The Sosso have been utterly beaten and Sumanguru is on the run. We are victorious!
key_value.83616: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: We have allowed our trade post be burned to the ground! Obtaining the wood we need will be far more difficult now.
key_value.83617: ‹PURPLE›Mema Princess: I am very grateful that you saved me, Sundjata. In return I want to offer you the help of my warrior sisters.
key_value.83618: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: Excellent! All towers have been destroyed. Now all we have to do is protect the trade ships when they arrive.
key_value.83619: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: Trade ships spotted to the south!
key_value.83620: ‹GREY›Overseer: Great leader, we believe we can double the load capacity of our transport ships for a small cost. Send us 2500 food and we will make it happen.
key_value.83621: ‹GREY›Overseer: Thank you. All preparations are done and we will now get double the lumber.
key_value.83625: - Fakoli is willing to join you if you can convince them that you are trustworthy.  First they want a tribute of 1000 gold.
key_value.83626: - Fakoli will join you if you build a castle within the flagged area of their town within 10 minutes.
key_value.83627: - Mema is prepared to join the war, but their king needs his daughter to be saved first. Free her and bring her to Mema's castle.
key_value.83628: Optional: Destroy the 5 Sosso towers along the river in order to be able to import wood.
key_value.83629: - Protect the trade ships and the trade outpost to continue receiving shipments of wood.
key_value.83630: Optional: Pay 2500 food to the Malian trade outpost (Grey) to double the load capacity of the wood transports.
key_value.83802:
1. Be aggressive. You start with minimal resources, so the best strategy is to expand quickly and take resources from your enemy.

2. This battle will be fought on both land and sea. Try to find the right balance.

3. Time is of the essence in this scenario.
key_value.83803:
Your scouts report:

Koumbi Saleh (Red), the former capital of the Ghanese Empire, is situated across the lake from our base. There is only one way to it by land, but transporting troops over the lake is certainly a good alternative. Koumbi Saleh is well fortified and fields a powerful infantry army that will be difficult to defeat.

Most resources can be found to the west of our base, on the mainland and on the small islands.

Sumanguru (Orange) is holding up inside the mighty city of Koumbi, he's surrounded by his elite guard and will put a tough final battle before going down for good.
key_value.83804: ‹PURPLE›Scout: Sumanguru has taken refuge in the old Ghanese capital of Koumbi Saleh. Let us finish this and be done with Sumanguru once and for all!
key_value.83805: ‹PURPLE›Warrior: Koumbi Saleh is ours and Sumanguru's reign is over. Long live Sundjata, king of the newly founded Mali Empire!
key_value.83806: ‹ORANGE›Sumanguru: No, I cannot die! Not like this!
key_value.84005:
1. Samuel is a very capable warrior, do not lose him prematurely.

2. You cannot advance past the Feudal Age.

3. Gidajan has a couple of military camps in the area and will regularly send men to attack you. It is not your objective to destroy these camps and it is ill-advised to attempt this.

4. There is a substantial amount of Baoab forest to the south of your camp.

5. There is no gold or stone available in the village. You will have to venture into the wilderness in order to acquire these resources.

6. Shotel Warriors still loyal to Princess Yodit are to be found all across the map. Bring Yodit or Samuel near them for them to join your side.

7. There are but few men in the region available to help us, which means you are restricted to a population limit of 100.
key_value.84006:
Your scouts report:

-Yodit and Samuel (green) just escaped from the city of Aksum. They will have to find a way out of the Aksumite Empire.

-Aksum (yellow) is your only ally. They have some villages and soldiers still loyal to Yodit.

-Gidajan (red) is your most dangerous enemy. They will use a full array of feudal age units to prevent Yodit from escaping.

-Fort in the Mountains (cyan) is the fort which blocks the passage through the mountains in the north. They will train a combination of men-at-arms, spearmen, and skirmishers.

-Fort by the River (purple) is an encampment to the northeast which attempts to block the passageway to the river. They will train a combination of archers, scout cavalry, and eastern swordsmen.

-Camp in the Forest (orange) is the camp in the east. It is the only enemy encampment without any walls, but beware their multitude of towers. They will mainly train scout cavalry, archers, and some spearmen.
key_value.84011: ‹GREEN›Samuel: It won’t be long before Gidajan finds out about your escape. We ought to depart these lands immediately!
key_value.84012: ‹GREEN›Samuel: Don't worry, there are only a few enemy guards. I will deal with them swiftly!
key_value.84013: ‹GREEN›Samuel: I know of a small village whose inhabitants are still loyal to you. From there we can arrange our plans.
key_value.84014: ‹GREEN›Yodit: I know of three possible escape routes. Each of them is being guarded by an encampement loyal to Gidajan. We must choose our opponents wisely.
key_value.84015: ‹GREEN›Soldier: Yodit has been killed. All hope is lost for our beautiful country.
key_value.84016: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Possibly in need of our powerful rams? Pay us 500 gold and they are yours!
key_value.84017: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The rams are at your disposal now. Use them well.
key_value.84018: ‹YELLOW›sailor: If you'd pay me 500 gold, you may use my transport ship.
key_value.84020: ‹YELLOW›Shotel Warrior: We will fight for you!
key_value.84021: ‹GREEN›Soldier: Our princess has escaped. There is still hope for Aksum!
key_value.84023: + Bring Yodit to the loyal village.
key_value.84025: + Bring Yodit to one of the three marked spots on the map in order for her to escape.
key_value.84026: Optional: Tribute 500 gold to Aksum (yellow) in order to obtain their rams.
key_value.84027: Optional: Click on the dock next to the sailor in order to purchase a transport ship for 500 gold.
key_value.84206:
1. The plains near your main camp are rich in food and wood but contain few mineral resources. You will need to push out into the desert to obtain gold and stone.

2. The Red Sea is an excellent source of food, provided you can defend your fishing fleet from pirates.

3. At certain points in the scenario you may be asked to declare war on another player. To do this, simply change your diplomatic stance to neutral or enemy with them.

4. The Nobatians and Ikshids are very protective of their territory and will not tolerate foreign buildings in their land.

5. Princess Yodit cannot advance past the Castle Age, and your population limit is 150.
key_value.84207:
Your scouts report:

- Princess Yodit (green) begins the scenario in the Feudal Age with two camps - one in the plains in the south, and one on the shores of the Red Sea. Both are fairly exposed and will need protection from early raids.

- Beja nomads (red) populate the desert in the eastern half of the map. They are famed merchants and their camps guard an old caravan route along the shores of the Red Sea. They also control the city of Aydhab, an important port in the east.

- The Nubian kingdom of Nobatia (purple) controls the city of Qasr Ibrim in the west of the map. Their motives are unknown, though an army of auxiliary units surrounding a core of Shotel Warriors guards their lands against Ikshid incursions.

- The Egyptian Ikshid dynasty (yellow) controls the city of Aswan, straddling the Nile river in the northwest of the map. Hordes of camelry, horsemen, and swordsmen have unsuccessfully attempted to invade Nubia numerous times.

- Arabian pirates (cyan) control a pair of citadels on the eastern bank of the Red Sea, regularly plundering merchant vessels with a fearsome fleet of war galleys.

- Not all Beja tribesmen are friendly. Many hostile bands (orange) guard treasures and haunt caravan routes in the middle of the desert, while groups of raiders (grey) often descend upon nearby villages in search of loot.
key_value.84209: ‹GREEN›Scout: Princess, the Syrian prince Zanobis is passing through this region. It would be wise if you were to build yourself a reputation so you might impress him.
key_value.84210: ‹GREEN›Yodit: Word of my exploits has spread far and wide. Zanobis will surely choose me as his bride!
key_value.84211: ‹PURPLE›Nobatians: The Ikshids are our sworn rivals. If you wish to earn our respect, you will have to destroy them.
key_value.84212: ‹PURPLE›Nobatians: You truly are a great warrior to have defeated such a fearsome enemy!
key_value.84213: ‹YELLOW›Ikshids: The Nobatians are our worst enemies. Sack their city of Qasr Ibrim and you will have our respect.
key_value.84214: ‹YELLOW›Ikshids: You have done us a great service. May the blessings of Allah be with you!
key_value.84215: ‹RED›Beja Chief: My daughter Makeda has been kidnapped by raiders and taken north. Please, rescue her and bring her back here!
key_value.84216: ‹RED›Beja Chief: My daughter is alive! I do not know how I can possibly repay you.
key_value.84217: ‹RED›Beja Chief: Our village is open and exposed to enemy raids. If you could construct some fortifications to protect us, we would be most grateful.
key_value.84218: ‹RED›Beja Chief: Our village is now safe from enemy raids!
key_value.84219: ‹RED›Beja Chief: Our ports are terrorized by endless swarms of pirates. Destroy their docks and you will have our eternal gratitude.
key_value.84220: ‹RED›Beja Chief: With the pirates destroyed, our trading vessels will be safe to cross the Red Sea. Many thanks, my friend!
key_value.84221: ‹RED›Merchant: The Beja rulers of Aydhab demand tribute that we cannot pay. If you could find two relics and bring them to their monastery, we would be in your debt.
key_value.84222: ‹RED›Merchant: The tribute is paid. Many thanks, you have saved us!
key_value.84223: ‹PURPLE›Nobatians: It is war you wish? Very well, so be it.
key_value.84224: ‹PURPLE›Nobatians: It is war you wish? Very well, so be it.
key_value.84225: ‹YELLOW›Ikshids: You are fools to oppose us! You will pay for your insolence.
key_value.84226: ‹YELLOW›Ikshids: You are fools to oppose us! You will pay for your insolence.
key_value.84228: + Visit the surrounding cities and settlements and listen to their terms. Complete the quests that they give you to build Yodit's reputation.
key_value.84229: - Prove yourself to the Nobatians by defeating the Ikshids.
key_value.84230: - Prove yourself to the Ikshids by defeating the Nobatians.
key_value.84231: - Rescue Makeda and return her to the northernmost Beja village.
key_value.84232: - Build 5 towers in the Beja village, directly southwest of your harbor, to protect them from enemy raids.
key_value.84233: - Destroy the four pirate docks to put an end to their raids on Aydhab.
key_value.84234: - Find two relics and garrison them in the monastery in Aydhab (the easternmost Beja town with a castle).
key_value.84406:
1. There are several posts of enemy soldiers at the river. Attacking them might be costly but it will weaken Dagnajan's army later on.

2. The rebellion in the neighbouring Nubian kingdom of Alodia is spilling into this region. Whatever side we choose, their help can come in handy.

3. Try not to waste any time. Dagnajan's army will be here soon and the more you do early on the easier it will be to stop his mighty army.
key_value.84407:
Your scouts report:

Our men and villagers will arrive in the north, in a more arid area of the region. It won't be easy to get sufficient supplies here so we'll have to use every resource available to us in order to succeed.

The Begemder kingdom (Cyan) is to the east in one of the green valleys and is allied to our enemy. They'll try to delay us while Dagnajan builds up his army. It would be wise to raid them. Their army consists of swordsmen, crossbowmen, and camels.

Just south of us, we have found that Darginda (Orange) has fortified the pass leading to their kingdom. Helping them to secure the pass when the enemy army is on the move should be a priority.

The kingdom of Alodian is having trouble with rebellions. The kingdom has no relations with us but it would be wise for us to either support the kingdom or their rebels to further our interests in the region. Alodian traders (Yellow) have set up a trade post to the west, and a bit further north, the Alodian rebels (Purple) have set up their camp.

Dagnajan (Red) is the king of the mighty Aksum empire. He has several outposts along the river where he is gathering his army for an attack on the kingdom of Darginda. It will take him long to prepare his army but once he is ready he might become unstoppable. Elephants and monks are amongst his troops so we are right to fear it.
key_value.84408: ‹GREEN›Refugee: You aren't soldiers of the Aksumite Empire? Thank God. We have no place to go, could you be so kind to help us?
key_value.84409: ‹GREEN›Scout: I've spotted a large army of the Aksumite heading west! They must not reach the western pass!
key_value.84410: ‹GREEN›Soldier: The Aksumite army has passed! We have failed...
key_value.84411: ‹GREEN›Soldier: Here's where the Aksumites train their elephants. If we destroy the castle and free the elephants, they won't be able to train new ones.
key_value.84412: ‹AQUA›Begemder Soldier: The elephants are on the loose!
key_value.84413: ‹GREEN›Soldier: This village supplies Dagnajan's army with fish. Let's destroy it!
key_value.84414: ‹GREEN›Soldier: That will surely hurt Dagnajan's food supplies.
key_value.84415: ‹YELLOW›Alodian Traders: What are you doing here? Unless you're here to destroy the rebel's camp up north, we suggest you leave.
key_value.84416: ‹YELLOW›Alodian Traders: Thank you for getting rid of those pesky rebels for us. Our markets are open for your merchants from now on.
key_value.84417: ‹GREEN›Soldier: Because of our aligned interests, the Alodians rebels promise to conduct raids on our enemies for the mere price of 300 gold.
key_value.84418: ‹GREEN›Soldier: The monastery up ahead is very important for the Aksumites. We should destroy it.
key_value.84419: ‹GREEN›Soldier: These monks will no longer be able to go on Dagnajan's march west and boost the moral of his army.
key_value.84420: ‹GREEN›Soldier: This is the pass that Dagnajan's army will come through. We warned the Darginda but they're poorly equipped. We'd better not let Dagnajan's army come this far.
key_value.84421: ‹GREEN›Scout: Our spies report that in 1 hour and 15 minutes Dagnajan's army will be on the move. It's much faster than we expected so we must hurry!
key_value.84422: ‹GREEN›Scout: Our spies report that in 1 hour Dagnajan's army will be on the move. It's much faster than we expected so we must hurry!
key_value.84423: ‹GREEN›Scout: Our spies report that in 45 minutes Dagnajan's army will be on the move. It's much faster than we expected so we must hurry!
key_value.84424: ‹GREEN›Soldier: We're getting close to Dagnajan's main base of operation. It would be unwise to attack it.
key_value.84425: + Weaken Dagnajan's army as much as you can before it gets on the move. You have 1 hour and 15 minutes.
key_value.84426: + Weaken Dagnajan's army as much as you can before it gets on the move. You have 1 hour.
key_value.84427: + Weaken Dagnajan's army as much as you can before it gets on the move. You have 45 minutes.
key_value.84428: + Prevent Dagnajan from going through the Western pass.
key_value.84430: - Destroy the docks in the fishing village near Dagnajan (red).
key_value.84431: - Destroy the elephant farm in Begemder's kingdom (teal).
key_value.84432: - Destroy the Alodians' trading post (yellow) or destroy the raiding camp north of it.
key_value.84434: - Pay 300 gold to Alodian Rebels (purple) so they will raid the enemy.
key_value.84435: ‹GREEN›Soldier: The king of Aksum is dead! Without its leader the empire will soon crumble before the power of Yodit, the rightful heir.
key_value.84604:
1. These lands are poor and resources are scarce.

2. Controlling some stelae is a good way to secure a steady income early on - keep at least one unit near each stele to maintain control of it.

3. You begin the scenario in the Feudal Age and can advance to the Imperial Age.

4. Destroying monasteries will allow you to loot some much-needed gold.

5. Going straight for Massawa is bound to end in disaster - it is better to gain the trust of the locals first.
key_value.84605:
Your scouts report:

- Our task is to force Gidajan from this land and thus open the way to Aksum.

- You have no allies in this fight, but the locals can be persuaded to join your cause.

The enemies in this area are:

Gidajan (Red) has his troops stationed in Massawa, from where he controls this land. Success in this mission will only come if we raze Massawa.

Loyalist of Gidajan (Purple) are roaming the countryside, they are set to guard important sites.
key_value.84607: ‹GREY›Villager: We will fight for Yodit once you've visited all the other tribes.
key_value.84608: ‹GREEN›Captain: We are approaching Massawa. Let's seize this land for Yodit!
key_value.84609: ‹GREEN›Scout: Our queen Yodit has made a bargain with the local tribes, use these men as you please.
key_value.84610: ‹GREEN›Scout: We've razed Massawa, the road to Aksum now lies open.
key_value.84611: ‹GREY›Rider: Our holy temple was destroyed by Gidajan. We will join you so that we can have our revenge.
key_value.84612: ‹GREEN›Scout: This land is now ours, let us raze Massawa and drive Gidajan from this land for good.
key_value.84613: ‹GREEN›Scout: Our Arabian allies have sent us some ships.
key_value.84616: +Visit all the local villages to befriend them.
key_value.84617: +Detroy the market, castle, and town center in Massawa.
key_value.84618: Optional: Build a dock in the waters to the north.
key_value.84805:
1. Navigating the city of Aksum is hard. Get accustomed to fights in narrow alleys.

2. The enemy is everywhere, no place is safe in the city, be sure to wall every breach.

3. You start out in the Castle age and can advance to the Imperial age. All units are available except the trebuchet and the monk.

4. Swift progress through the city is advisable. Use your Elite Petards wisely.

5. There are several ways into the city and sometimes avoiding an area and going around is ideal.
key_value.84806:
Your scouts report:

- Our (Green) task is to take the city for queen Yodit. We must be swift if we are to succeed. The longer we wait the stronger the enemy gets.

- You have no allies in this fight, but if we take the market we might be able to start a trade with the rebels (Blue) in the south.

The enemies in this area are:

Gidajan (Red) has been driven into a corner and it may very well be his last stand. Troops are scattered all over the city and ambushes are a likely threat. Narrow streets and alleys could be death traps.

Loyalist of Gidajan (Purple) are roaming the countryside, they wont pose much of a threat though.
key_value.84813: ‹GREEN›General: We have lost our town center, luckily these villagers can help us.
key_value.84814: ‹GREEN›Builder: The town center could not be placed properly, let us build it somewhere else.
key_value.84815: ‹GREEN›General: Let us take back this city for queen Yodit!
key_value.84816: ‹GREEN›General: We have gathered a sizeable army. Now use these elite petards to break through their barricades.
key_value.84818: ‹GREEN›A trebuchet has been delivered to help your cause.
key_value.84819: ‹GREEN›A monk has arrived to heal the wounded.
key_value.84820: ‹GREEN›General: Gidajan is no more, all hail Yodit!
key_value.84821: +Establish your base in the city suburbs by bringing the mobile town center to the blue flag.
key_value.84822: +Build a sizeable army consisting of at least 35 military units.
key_value.85004:
Your scouts report:

- King Takayutpi of Hanthawaddy (Red) is fleeing the Toungoo invasion. He will seek the safety of his castles to the south, but if they are destroyed, he will flee to Prome.

- Prome (Blue) is well-defended by elephant archers and hand cannoneers. The city's great monument must be captured for victory.

- The cavalry and archers of the Shan (Yellow) pose a threat to Toungoo's base.

- The Portuguese (Cyan) will demand tribute when encountered. They can be a powerful friend or enemy.
key_value.85005:
1. You are restricted to a population of 100.

2. Losing your heroes in battle will not bring defeat.
