3. Battle elephants can be effective alternatives to battering rams, especially after researching the Burmese unique technology, Howdah.

4. The Portuguese will not demand tribute until you encounter them. If you do not wish to war with them, have tribute ready before venturing too far west.
key_value.85008: - Kill King Takayutpi in less than 5 minutes
key_value.85012: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: We stand alone against the Shan. Do not fight for glory - fight for Burma, our history, and our future!
key_value.85014: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: A lightning victory! The scholars will think we were Garuda, flying to destroy our enemies!
key_value.85015: ‹GREEN›King Tabinshwehti: Our prey flees like a coward! Bring me the Mon King's head!
key_value.85016: ‹GREEN›King Tabinshwehti: What a great hunt! Stay by my side, my brother, and we will hunt in these lands like hungry tigers!
key_value.85017: ‹GREEN›Burmese Soldier: The King has been wounded! He will rest to fight another day!
key_value.85018: ‹GREEN›Burmese Soldier: The general has been wounded! He will rest to fight another day!
key_value.85019: ‹AQUA›João Caeiro: Your enemies pay me much gold to fight you. I will spare your life for now if you pay me 500 gold.
key_value.85020: ‹AQUA›João Caeiro: Show that you know the value of my friendship better than your enemies do. Give me 500 gold and I will join you in battle.
key_value.85021: ‹AQUA›João Caeiro: You are as wise as you are rich.
key_value.85022: ‹AQUA›João Caeiro: A wise decision. My mercenaries are at your service. Trust in us Portuguese. We help those who appraise the true value of our friendship.
key_value.85023: ‹AQUA›João Caeiro: Foolish! You do not know the power we bring from across the ocean! We could have made a deal but now you will only know death!
key_value.85103:
Your scouts report:

- Pagan is an important religious center, housing many relics of the Buddha. The relics are fragile and will be lost if they are moved or if their monastery is destroyed. As a pilgrims' city, Pagan does not have walls and must be protected by a mobile army.

- The Shan (Yellow) field heavy cavalry and archers. They feed their men from lakeside farms which are vulnerable to waterborne raids.

- The Ava (Red) and the Rakhine (Cyan) have joined the Shan in battle. The infantry, arambai, and monks of Ava are comparable to Toungoo's while the Rakhine infantry are fast and numerous. The Rakhine also possess a strong navy owing to their coastal origins.

- King Tabinshwehti is nearby, commanding the Toungoo army (gaia). If his camp is found, he will join in the battle for Pagan.
key_value.85104:
1. You are restricted to a 100 population limit.

2. Because Pagan is a pilgrims' city open to all, you cannot construct walls.

3. If relics are removed from their monasteries, whether purposefully or through destruction of the monastery, they are irretrievably lost.

4. Arambai are best used in hit-and-run attacks and as a mobile defense, buying time for slower elephants and infantry.

5. If King Tabinshwehti's army is reached early enough, they can provide a significant advantage.
key_value.85106: + Kill King Hkonmaing of Ava (king) and take the Pagan crown
key_value.85112: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: We will need gold for the King's coronation. The monks of Pagan will assist us if we defend their monasteries and the relics they contain.
key_value.85113: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Our enemies approach. They are powerful so we must be like the cobra: when they raise their hand against us, we strike where they are undefended!
key_value.85114: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: My brother will wear this ancient crown.
key_value.85115: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: The monks of Pagan recognize our King. He will rule Burma with the wisdom and justice of the Cakkavatti!
key_value.85116: ‹GREEN›King Tabinshwehti: It is good to see you, my brother! You will join me on my coronation march to Pagan. But first, we must dispose of these unwanted guests…
key_value.85204:
Your scouts report:

- Loyalists in Pegu are attempting to reach Bayinnaung, located SW of the Burmese capital. Only he will restore order to Burma.

- Smim Sawhtut (Red), the King's assassin, controls Pegu and the battle elephants of the royal guard.

- Thado Dhamma Yaza (Blue), an esteemed advisor to Tabinshwehti, believes he should be King and fields ballista elephants.

- Smim Htaw (Orange), a Mon prince turned rebel monk, commands a devoted following of monks and devout Buddhist warriors.

- Sokkate (Yellow) of the Toungoo hills commands a popular uprising. His supporters are poor soldiers but are numerous. Only by dispersing their camps will they be defeated.
key_value.85205:
1. You are restricted to a population of 125.

2. Some of Sawhtut's men feel guilty for their crime. They will either run away from a monk's chastisement or be converted to Bayinnaung's cause.

3. There is more than one way to get word out of Pegu. There is also more than one way to kill Smim Sawhtut.

4. Allying with an enemy provides an immediate respite but peace strengthens them. It is a gamble that you will become more powerful than them in time.

5. You must destroy Sokkate's camps to stop his uprising.
key_value.85206: + Bring word of King Tabinshwehti's death to Bayinnaung
key_value.85207:
Choose one of the following objectives:
+ Build and defend a Wonder
+ Defeat all four pretenders
key_value.85208: - Kill or convert Smim Sawhtut before reaching Bayinnaung
key_value.85209: - Form a temporary alliance with one of the pretenders
key_value.85212: ‹GREEN›Loyalist: The King has been murdered. We must tell Bayinnaung of his brother's death. Only he will rule Burma justly.
key_value.85213: ‹GREEN›Loyalist: Our King has been avenged! The treacherous minister is dead!
key_value.85214: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: My country will be in chaos if I do not stop these pretenders. My grief must wait for another day.
key_value.85215: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: To be a king, one must show his feathers like the dancing peacock. After all, what would the people think if the King does not do King things?
key_value.85216: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: To be master of his roost, the fighting peacock must be vicious against his enemies!
key_value.85217: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Tonight, I will shed tears for my dead brother, the King. In the morning, I will take the throne and build the empire he dreamed of ruling.
key_value.85218: ‹BLUE›Thado Dhamma Yaza: I have spent 40 years in service to Toungoo. I have as much right to the crown as you. Join me, Bayinnaung, and you will be my heir.
key_value.85219: Change Diplomatic Stance with Thado Dhamma Yaza to Ally
key_value.85220: ‹ORANGE›Smim Htaw: You walk the Eightfold Path. My war is not with you. Ally with me and you will be my chief minister.
key_value.85221: Change Diplomatic Stance with Smim Htaw to Ally
key_value.85222: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: I play a dangerous game. Allying with my enemies gives me a respite but it also strengthens them.
key_value.85223: ‹BLUE›Thado Dhamma Yaza: Your actions threaten me! I will crush you before you jeopardize my rule!
key_value.85224: ‹ORANGE›Smim Htaw: You are a fool and a disgrace! I will strike you down!
key_value.85225: ‹GREEN›Loyalist: Hatred is never appeased by hatred. The King's assassin repents.
key_value.85306:
Your scouts report:

- The Burmese have crossed the Three Pagoda Pass into Thailand.

- Prince Ramesuan leads the army of Ayutthaya (Blue) in the city of Sukhothai to the SE. Converting the prince will drive his men to surrender. Ramesuan's sister, Princess Thepkasattri, is travelling to wed the King of Lan Xang. She carries with her a large dowry.

- The rebellious King Mekuti of Lan Na (Yellow) rules the river city of Chiang Mai and the northern mountain city of Chiang Rai. Lan Na has few warriors but many monks.

- King Setthathirath of Lan Xang (Cyan) rules Vientiane across the Mekong River. The city's bridge is well-defended but smugglers have been known to enter the city by another means.
key_value.85307:
1. The mountains are treacherous for large armies. You are therefore restricted to a 40 population limit and can only construct palisades.

2. Do not destroy buildings you will need. Placing a relic in each city's monastery will give you control of that city's buildings.

3. When supported by monks, battle elephants are effective against even tough fortifications.

4. Take care to not lose men to the Nat Enchantresses. They become more powerful with every life they take.

5. Bandits and tribesmen hide caches of looted treasures. Finding them will provide gold.
key_value.85308: + Place a relic in each flagged monastery before the season ends
key_value.85309: - Convert Prince Ramesuan and King Mekuti
key_value.85319: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Bring the relics of the Buddha to each city to demonstrate my devotion!
key_value.85320: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: The Thai prince has been reminded of the Eightfold Path. His men lay down their spears!
key_value.85321: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: With this city, we can train reinforcements.
key_value.85322: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: My enemies bow before me! I am the White Elephant carrying peace and good fortune over the earth! I am Cakkavatti!
key_value.85323: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Kill the nat enchantress quickly before she bewitches the men!
key_value.85324: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: A just king is magnanimous in victory. I permit conquered princes to serve me.
key_value.85325: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: The nats have been driven from the land! Over their remains, I will build statues of the Buddha!
key_value.85326: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: We have recovered the spoils of bandits. We will make good use of this treasure.
key_value.85327: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Take the princess away and confiscate the dowry.
key_value.85328: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: The monks are all dead. You have failed me!
key_value.85402:
Your scouts report:

- Bayinnaung's sons, Nanda and Thinga, attack the Rakhine capital of Mrauk U from both land and sea. Because the Burmese army is so far from the homelands, their supplies are limited.

- The Rakhine (Yellow) have stockpiled resources and have time on their side. The longer the siege lasts, the greater the Rakhine's relative strength becomes.

- The Portuguese (Purple) command the northern end of Mrauk U and fight as mercenaries of the Rakhine. Their ports are well-defended by bombard towers. Beware their Wonder which has strong defensive capabilities.
key_value.85403:
1. At start, you will not be able to train units.

2. You must be aggressive as your resources are limited. A slow approach will only result in a slow defeat.

3. The faster you complete Bayinnaung's meditations, the less time your enemies have to train units for the final battle.

4. A group of monks with Theocracy can turn any odds in your favor.
key_value.85404: + Bring Bayinnaung to the four Buddhist Temples
key_value.85405: + Bayinnaung and Nanda must not fall in battle
key_value.85413: ‹GREEN›Nanda: Father, please sit and allow your sons to fight. You are tired from the long journey…
key_value.85414: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Long is a mile to him who is tired, but short is life to him who is idle. I will go to meditate. You may watch over me.
key_value.85415: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Drop by drop is the water pot filled. Likewise, the wise man, gathering it little by little, fills himself with good.
key_value.85416: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Everything is changeable, everything appears and disappears; there is no blissful peace until one passes beyond the agony of life and death.
key_value.85417: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Thousands of candles can be lit from a single candle, and the life of the single candle will not be shortened. Such is the bliss of the Way.
key_value.85418: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: Even death is not to be feared by he who has lived wisely. Though the flame be put out, the wick remains.
key_value.85419: ‹GREEN›Bayinnaung: My journey is not yet finished. I will go to another Temple to meditate on the Noble Truths.
key_value.85420: ‹GREEN›Nanda: Stand fast, men! Guard the Cakkavatti while he meditates!
key_value.85421: ‹GREEN›Nanda: Stand by your King, men of Burma! Protect the Cakkavatti!
key_value.85422: ‹GREEN›Nanda: The men will protect you on your journey, Father.
key_value.85423: ‹GREEN›Nanda: My father has crossed the stream. I will mourn tonight but today, we have a city to conquer.
key_value.85425: ‹GREEN›Nanda: I have failed my father! He dies without peace!
key_value.85427: ‹GREEN›Nanda: The Rakhine stand alone against us! Do not fight for glory - fight for Burma, our history, and our future!
key_value.85428: ‹GREEN›Nanda: Rejoice, men of Burma! We have conquered a mighty enemy but the greatest victory this day belongs to my father!
key_value.86004:
1. Suryavarman I is a powerful warrior who leads from the front lines. If his elephant is slain from beneath him, he will return to the camp to recover and will be unable to take the field again.

2. Destroying Udayadityavarman I's field camps will deprive him of his offensive potential, but you will still have to take the battle to Angkor.

3. The city of Angkor is well fortified. Bringing some siege weapons along to help breach the citadel would be wise.

4. Khmer ballista elephants are hardy and quite effective against massed enemy units.

5. Suryavarman I's army is restricted to the Castle Age and its population limit is 100.
key_value.86005:
Your scouts report:

- Suryavarman I (Cyan) has established a camp in the west of the map. From this foothold it will be possible to launch attacks towards Angkor, Udayadityavarman I's capital.

- Udayadityavarman I has concentrated his forward armies (Red) in three military camps. Two block the western and southern routes to Angkor, while a third guards the trade route southeast of Suryavarman I's camp. They train armies composed primarily of levied spearmen, skirmishers, and light cavalry, but may later add siege weapons to their offensive pushes.

- The city of Angkor (Orange) lies in the northeast of the map. Their defensive forces consist primarily of crossbowmen, infantry, and light cavalry, but may also train monks and elephants.

- Within the central citadel of Angkor resides Udayadityavarman I, surrounded by his personal bodyguard (Yellow). They will provide a last line of resistance, should Angkor's defenses fail.

- A neutral village (Grey) lies in the south of the map, and is a potential trading partner should the trade route be cleared of enemy troops.
key_value.86006: + Storm the city of Angkor and kill Udayadityavarman I.
key_value.86007: ‹AQUA›Soldier: Udayadityavarman I is dead - victory is ours!
key_value.86008: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: From this camp we will build up and strike at Angkor. Udayadityavarman I's reign ends this day!
key_value.86009: ‹AQUA›Soldier: Our leader has been gravely wounded! Take him back to the camp and see that he recovers.
key_value.86010: ‹YELLOW›Udayadityavarman I: You may have defeated my armies in the field, Suryavarman. But you shall never take Angkor!
key_value.86105:
1. Do not neglect your navy. Controlling the Mekong River and its crossings will be vital to quelling the rebellion.

2. Attacks will arrive from all sides - be prepared to defend on multiple fronts.

3. Do not destroy what you can conquer. Enemy towns will surrender when their main fortification falls.

4. The armies of the various rebel groups have varying strengths and weaknesses. Monks are strong against elephant units but weak against scouts, for example.

5. Suryavarman I's army is restricted to the Castle Age.
key_value.86106:
Your scouts report:

- The army of Suryavarman I (Cyan) controls the Khmer capital of Angkor and a few minor towns in the western region of the empire. It is faced with rebellion from multiple directions:

- The Northern Rebels (Red) hold several towns in the north of the map, and threaten Angkor with an army primarily composed of crossbowmen, light cavalry, and mangonels.

- The Eastern Rebels (Orange) control the rugged eastern portion of the map, employing a force of elephants, scorpions, and monks.

- Jayaviravarman's Army (Yellow) holds a cluster of towns straddling the southern reaches of the Mekong River. Droves of infantry units pour north towards Suryavarman's lands.

- Jayaviravarman (Purple) resides in his citadel in the south of the map, surrounded by his elite guard of heavy infantry.
key_value.86107: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: The rebel scum threaten us from three directions. Strike them down quickly before they can pool their forces!
key_value.86109: ‹RED›Northern Rebels: Please, forgive us for our rash rebellion! We will serve you now.
key_value.86111: ‹ORANGE›Eastern Rebels: We have paid dearly for our folly, Suryavarman. We will fight you no more.
key_value.86112: + Kill Jayaviravarman and defeat his army.
key_value.86113: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: The scum Jayaviravarman lies in the dirt, his forces broken. The south will oppose us no more!
key_value.86114: - Conquer enemy towns by destroying the main fortification of each. Depending on the size of the town, this will either be a tower or the town castle(s).
key_value.86204:
1. You may select any two of the four companies of soldiers to join you on your journey. Each comes with a unique set of strengths and weaknesses.

2. Use the line of sight of your envoy to spot enemy troops before they know of your presence.

3. Explore the map! There are many paths to victory and various secrets to discover. The most obvious route is not necessarily the most prudent.

4. Demolition ships are deadly to groups of units crossing shallows.

5. On Standard difficulty, you are given a monk to accompany your forces. On Moderate and Hard, you will have to make do without him.
key_value.86205:
Your scouts report:

- Suryavarman's diplomatic convoy (Cyan) begins its journey on the western fringe of the Khmer Empire (Yellow). Beyond lies a forbidding combination of dense jungle, treacherous mountain ranges, and meandering waterways.

- In the far west lies the convoy's destination, a small port (Green) on the Andaman Sea. From here a ship can be chartered to bring the convoy to the Chola lands in southern India.

- Knifing through the middle of the map is the fabled Chao Phraya River. Although finding a means of safely crossing it can be difficult at this time of year, the ports (Grey) operating along its eastern bank may be of assistance.

- Scattered around the map are countless bands of hostile troops. Whether they are simple brigands or servants of enemy powers, they would be all too glad to get their hands on the treasure destined for the court of Rajendra Chola.
key_value.86206: + The envoy and the chariot (trade cart) laden with gifts must reach the Andaman port in the west.
key_value.86207: ‹AQUA›Envoy: Sailor! Book me passage on the nearest ship bound for Chola lands.
key_value.86208: ‹AQUA›Aide: The envoy has fallen! Our mission is doomed to failure...
key_value.86209: ‹AQUA›Envoy: The grand chariot has been destroyed! Rajendra Chola will never ally with us now...
key_value.86210: ‹YELLOW›Suryavarman I: The road west is perilous. You may have your pick of as many of my troops as you can afford to pay with the gold that I have given you.
key_value.86211: + Recruit any two of the four companies of soldiers camped nearby by selecting their leader (elephant archer, knight, cataphract, and light cavalry). Each company costs 100 gold.
key_value.86212: ‹YELLOW›Captain: The ballista division is at your command, sire!
key_value.86213: ‹YELLOW›Knight: This company of infantry is yours, my lord.
key_value.86214: ‹YELLOW›Cataphract: This mercenary force will accompany you on your journey west.
key_value.86215: ‹YELLOW›Captain: These elephants will crush all that stand in your way!
key_value.86216: ‹AQUA›Envoy: We have the men we need. Onwards! The bridge west has been repaired for us.
key_value.86217: - Scout the map in search of any potential assistance on your way west to the Andaman port. Beware of enemy forces attempting to waylay your convoy.
key_value.86218: ‹GREY›Harbormaster: Our last ship is...not fit to sail. These scouts will help you find another way to cross the river.
key_value.86219: ‹GREY›Harbormaster: I see that you have already acquired a fleet. These scouts will serve as your eyes on your journey west.
key_value.86220: ‹AQUA›Envoy: With these ships, we will seize control of the water and send any enemy vessels to the bottom of the river!
key_value.86221: ‹GREY›Cataphract: A bridge spanning the Chao Phraya lies just beyond here.
key_value.86222: ‹GREY›Halberdier: An enemy outpost lies to the west. I would advise you to take the southern route.
key_value.86223: ‹RED›Swordsman: Here they are! Do not let them reach the port!
key_value.86303:
1. The Tambralingas control a pair of bases in Khmer lands. Once those are dealt with, the entire northeastern landmass will be under Khmer control.

2. The majority of the battles in this scenario will be fought at sea. Invest heavily in a navy and organize your economy accordingly.

3. Conquering the central islands will give you access to numerous mineral resources (gold and stone) as well as a springboard from which to take control of the water.

4. Most of the land on this map is within range of the sea, making cannon galleons an attractive option.

5. Stay apprised of events occurring across the sea - without aid, the Chola fortress will not hold out forever.
key_value.86304:
Your scouts report:

- The Khmer army (Cyan) is stationed in the southern, coastal portion of the Khmer Empire, preparing for the conflict that is sure to break out in the Gulf of Thailand. It should be capable of dealing with any initial land-based threats, but the Khmer fleet will need to grow rapidly if it is to take the fight across the sea to Tambralinga and Srivijaya lands.

- The Cholas (Green), allies of the Khmer, have conducted an impressive amphibious assault of the Kingdom of Tambralinga, seizing a powerful coastal fortress and establishing a foothold on the Malay Peninsula. Their elephants, swordsmen, archers, and light cavalry make for an impressive army, but they will require aid if they are to survive the Tambralinga and Srivijaya onslaught.

- The Tambralingas (Orange) recently suffered a defeat at the hands of the Chola arrivals, but are far from broken, having struck out and established two military bases to the northwest of the Khmer lands. Their light infantry and javelineers will harass their enemies by land, while their navy will attempt to keep the Khmer and Chola forces divided.

- The Srivijayans (Blue) command a vast thalassocratic empire from their power base in the south of the map. Droves of elephants, swordsmen, archers, and onagers will provide a staunch resistance to any land-based incursions, while their fabled navy has hitherto ruled the seas with an iron fist.
key_value.86305: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: Our Chola allies have established a foothold in Tambralinga lands. It must be held at all costs!
key_value.86307: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: The feeble Tambralingas are no match for our glorious armies!
key_value.86309: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: Even the Srivijayan thalassocracy is no match for the Khmer-Chola alliance!
key_value.86310: + Do not allow your Chola allies to be defeated.
key_value.86311: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: Our Chola allies have been driven from Tambralinga lands! We cannot oppose both the Srivijaya and the Tambralingas now...
key_value.86406:
1. Although the majority of the combat in this scenario will be land-based, control of the water can be used to deadly effect.

2. It is monsoon season in Southeast Asia. The turbulent conditions make it impossible to launch and maintain hulking siege ships.

3. The northern, western, and eastern sectors of the map will soon become a battleground. The southern portion, however, is a relatively safe area to build your economy.

4. Mineral resources are relatively scarce. Fortunately, you can rely on the recently-defeated Srivijayans for supplementary income via tribute.

5. The military tactics of your enemies differ greatly by region. Be prepared to invest in a wide variety of troop types.
key_value.86407:
Your scouts report:

- Suryavarman I (Cyan) controls the heart of the Khmer Empire, based primarily in the center of the map. Though initially in a powerful position, adversity will come swiftly in the form of numerous enemies, including a rebellion in the northern region.

- The Hariphunchai (Red) hold two citadels to the northwest, and field an army composed almost entirely of horsemen.

- The Lavo Kingdom (Blue) is based in a mountain fortress in the far west of the map. Their forces consist of infantry, javelineers, and monks.

- The Northern Cham (Green) control the coastal town of Indrapura to the northeast. Archers with rattan shields, elephants, and spearmen comprise their land forces, but they will also build a small navy.

- The Southern Cham (Purple) are based in a set of bastions on the eastern coastline. Their army of infantry and archers is complemented by a large navy.

- The Khmer Rebels (Orange) have seized two military bases guarding important river crossings north of the Khmer Empire. Their military consists primarily of swordsmen, ballistae, and elephants.

- The Dai Viet (Yellow) hold a fortress to the far north, watching the conflict to the south with much interest. Perhaps their army of cavalry and javelineers can be persuaded to attack some of Suryavarman's enemies...
key_value.86408: Choose one of the following two objectives:
key_value.86409: + Defeat three of your five enemies (Hariphunchai, Lavo Kingdom, Northern Cham, Southern Cham, and Khmer Rebels).
key_value.86411: - The Srivijaya will periodically pay you installments of tribute.
key_value.86412: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: Bountiful lands surround us, ripe for the taking. We shall build an empire to last a thousand years!
key_value.86413: ‹RED›Hariphunchai: Your military might forces us to our knees, Suryavarman of the Khmer.
key_value.86414: ‹BLUE›Lavo Kingdom: You have broken our armies, Suryavarman. Lavo is yours to command.
key_value.86415: ‹GREEN›Northern Cham: We have been bested on the battlefield. Indrapura bows to its new ruler.
key_value.86416: ‹PURPLE›Southern Cham: A conqueror of your likes has never before entered these lands, Suryavarman. Our coastal citadels are yours now.
key_value.86417: ‹ORANGE›Khmer Rebels: Our rebellion was a grave mistake! We yield to Suryavarman, the one true ruler of the Khmer.
key_value.86418: ‹YELLOW›Dai Viet: We wish to make war on the Champa, but our coffers are depleted. If you pay us 1000 gold, we will be able to pursue this campaign.
key_value.86419: - The Dai Viet will attack the Northern and Southern Cham if you pay them 1000 gold.
key_value.86420: ‹YELLOW›Dai Viet: A bargain well struck! Our armies are mustering as we speak.
key_value.86421: ‹AQUA›Khmer Official: A Srivijayan envoy has arrived, bearing 500 gold in tribute.
key_value.86422: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: Defend the wonder from the enemy onslaught!
key_value.86423: ‹AQUA›Suryavarman I: Under my rule, Khmer hegemony spans the lands from the Mekong to the Chao Phraya!
key_value.87004:
1. You are restricted to the Castle Age and your starting population limit is 75. Every village you capture, however, increases your population limit by 5 up to a total of 125 units.

2. You conquer villages by destroying the towers within them. Once a tower is destroyed, one of your towers will replace it.

3. Battle Elephants are great for taking down enemy towers.

4. You can find Mongol and Javanese equipment scattered around the map. It will help you boost your technologies.

5. The Mongols cannot be trusted. Their ultimate goal is to subdue all of Southeast Asia!

6. The castle in Kediri gets regular supplies over land which are used to train more soldiers. Blocking these supplies will be vital for victory.
key_value.87005:
Your scouts report:

-Our great ruler, Raden Wijaya (Orange) fled east to escape Singhasari after a failed rebellion against them. Here in eastern Java he now plans to build a new kindgom.

-The Mongols (Green) had sent diplomats in name of Kublai Khan to demand tribute from the Indonesian kingdoms. However Singhasari killed their diplomats and now a Mongol army has arrived south to punish them. Since we're both enemy of Singhasari they might be willing to from a pact against them but once Singhasari is weakened we should be smart and break the pact at an opportune moment to gain the upperhand. The Mongols have brought their horses and will raise an army of Light cavalry, Cavalry Archers, Mangudai and siege units.

-East, right next to our starting position is Singhasari (Blue), our former overlord. They have the support of many of the nobility which makes them a very strong opponent. They'll be very aggressive and attack us with Crossbowmen, Cavalry Archers, Elephants, Long Swordsmen and Mangonels.

-To the west of us lies the fortified castle of Kediri (Teal). It's in a very strategic position and Singhasari can control the surrounding villages from here. If they have the supplies, they'll train Knights, Crossbowmen, Pikemen and Elephants.
key_value.87006: ‹ORANGE›Raden Wijaya: Both the Kediri and the Mongols refuse to talk to my diplomats. I'll show them.
key_value.87007: ‹ORANGE›Raden Wijaya: You must conquer as many villages as you can and defeat their petty armies in the field. Only then will they realize the mistake they've made and beg me to spare their lives.
key_value.87008: ‹RED›Soldier: This dense jungle can't provide supplies for many people. Luckily, conquering enemy villages will help us support a larger population.
key_value.87009: ‹RED›Soldier: The Mongols and Kediri have been fighting quite intensely and everywhere there's abandoned equipment to be found. We can use it to speed up our military advancements.
key_value.87016: ‹GREEN›Mongols: The enemy of our enemy is our friend. What do you think of making an alliance against our common enemy?
key_value.87017: ‹GREEN›Mongols: So we are friends, for now...
key_value.87018: ‹GREEN›Mongols: You'll regret your decision. Our great horde will crush your little army!
key_value.87019: ‹GREEN›Mongols: You dare to betray the Great Khan? You'll pay for your insolence!
key_value.87020: ‹GREEN›Mongols: Kediri signed an agreement to accept our Great Khan as its overlord. Now you must do the same!
key_value.87021: ‹RED›Soldier: The Mongols have run out of supplies and fear the coming monsoon rains. They're retreating to China! We can take what they have left behind.
key_value.87022: ‹ORANGE›Raden Wijaya: With Kediri conquered and the Mongols fleeing to China like cowards, it's time for the Majapahit to become the one true Indonesian empire!
key_value.87024: + Wait for instructions from Raden Wijaya.
key_value.87029: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment your base supports 75 population.
key_value.87030: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment one captured village supports 80 population.
key_value.87031: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment two captured villages support 85 population.
key_value.87032: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment three captured villages support 90 population.
key_value.87033: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment four captured villages support 95  population.
key_value.87034: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment five captured villages support 100  population.
key_value.87035: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment six captured villages support 105  population.
key_value.87036: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment seven captured villages support 110  population.
key_value.87037: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment eight captured villages support 115  population.
key_value.87038: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment nine captured villages support 120  population.
key_value.87039: - Capturing villages will give you a higher population limit. At the moment ten captured villages support 125 population.
key_value.87040: - The Mongols are offering a temporary alliance against Singhasari. Change your stance to them to ally to agree.
key_value.87105:
1. Losing Gajah Mada will not make you lose the scenario.

2. The population limit in this scenario is 150.

3. There's still a lot of support for the king in this region so it's a good idea to explore the area and look for it.

4. King Jayanegara doesn't have a lot time so you must hurry to his rescue before the rebels can kill him.
key_value.87106:
Your scouts report:

- Gajah Mada and his army (Red) has arrived north east of the city. You have to trust on the help of the locals to set up a strong camp to siege the city.

- North of your army, the prime minister Arya Tadah (Purple), has also arrived and is awaiting your support to commence the attack.

- King Jayanegara (Yellow) is trapped within the city walls, surrounded by hostile rebels. His royal guards are pretty tough but eventually they'll succumb to the rebel attacks.

- The city of Trowulan (Orange) is occupied by Rebels. The more stronger units are assigned to the walls to fend of our attacks and consist of Arbalests, Champions, Elephants, Onagers and Halberdiers. The rebel army under the command of Rakrian Kuti (Blue) himself will attack our king. He has Sword Infantry, Karambit Warriors, Light Cavalry and Crossbowmen available at his command.

- Outside the walls other Rebels (Cyan) are guarding the southern part of the city, making sure no one can escape. They have Skirmishers, Sword Infantry, Light Cavalry, Siege Units, Cavalry Archers and Elephants.
key_value.87108: ‹YELLOW›Trowulan Refugee: Our king is trapped at his palace in the city. You must save him, Gajah!
key_value.87109: ‹RED›Soldier: The rebels have a strong grip on the city but we can still count on the support of the people. If we go to them, they will give us what we need.
key_value.87110: ‹PURPLE›Arya Tadah: I'm here to save my king and I'm glad to see you here to aid me in this difficult task, Gajah Mada.
key_value.87111: ‹RED›Elephant Rider: We've heard of the treacherous uprising and are here to fight for our king!
key_value.87112: ‹YELLOW›King Jayanegara: I knew you'd come. Take me out of here before these rebels get to me.
key_value.87113: ‹RED›Soldier: Gajah got wounded. He'll have to count on us to finish this mission.
key_value.87114: ‹YELLOW›King Jayanegara: I'm safe now. I owe you my deepest gratitude, Gajah Mada.
key_value.87115: ‹PURPLE›Arya Tadah: Our king is dead! What a disaster! We've failed!
key_value.87118: + Bring King Jayanegara to the flagged area in the south.
key_value.87204:
1. The population limit is restricted to 150.

2. Once a colony manages to build a market they'll start sending you resources.

3. Sending wood and food to your colonies will help them grow faster.

4. If a colony is destroyed it will try to send more colonists later.

5. Because of the restricted population limit and resources available it's a good idea to rely on fortifications to defend your land against enemy ships.

6. Sunda won't be very aggressive unless you attack them first or expand in their territory so instead of destroying them immediately you can also choose to expand your naval empire first.
key_value.87205:
Your scouts report:

- The Majapahit (You) control the eastern half of the island of Java, while Sunda (Blue) controls the western half. The Majapahit royal family has good ties with Sunda so they will not attack at first but it might be in our interest to assert control over the island before expanding to the other islands. Sunda will train Skirmishers and Knights.

- Our colonies (Teal, Purple, Gray and Orange) will start colonizing Bali, Sulawesi, and Borneo. These islands are to the east and north of our starting location and are rich in resources.

- West of Java, on the island of Sumatra, lies the kingdom of Dharmasraya (Green). The kingdom wields a strong force of Swordsmen, Crossbowmen, Ballista Elephants, Galleons, and Fire Ships. Dharmasraya is the most likely to aggressively attack us.

- To the north lies Malaysia, part of the Asian continent. Here the Tumasik have broken free from their former overlords and have built the mighty city of Singapore. They compete with us over the control of the sparsely inhabited islands which we are trying to colonize. It is unlikely they will attack us directly before they have destroyed our colonies. The Tumasik will train Arbalests, Champions, Cavaliers, Bombard Cannons, Galleons, Demolition Ships, and Cannon Galleons.
key_value.87206: ‹RED›Majapahit Official: Our villagers are setting up a colony on Bali.
key_value.87207: ‹RED›Majapahit Official: Settlers have arrived in Sulawesi.
key_value.87208: ‹RED›Majapahit Official: Majapahit people are trying to set up a colony in southern Borneo.
key_value.87209: ‹RED›Majapahit Official: Our settlers have reached northern Borneo.
key_value.87210: ‹RED›Majapahit Official: The Majapahit Empire is larger than ever before thanks to Gajah Mada! Long live the Majapahit Empire!
key_value.87211: ‹RED›Majapahit Official: I am sending colonists to the nearby islands. If you can protect them from our enemies, they can provide you with resources.
key_value.87212: ‹YELLOW›Sunda: You have defeated our armies and we're ready to sign the peace agreement that acknowledges you as the major power in Java.
key_value.87213: ‹GREEN›Dharmasraya: We ruled over Sumatra for many centuries and now you've come and ended it. Does your greed know no bounds?
key_value.87214: ‹BLUE›Tumasik: You've torn down our mighty city walls and destroyed our fleet. We surrender for now but beware, Singapore will rise again!
key_value.87216: + At least 3 colonies must exist and have a market.
key_value.87304:
1. Because of the limited resources and space on your starting island, it is very important to expand quickly to the other islands.

2. Fish is probably the best way to get food in this region. It saves the wood from building farms and that wood can instead be used for ships.

3. The enemy has a strong naval presence. Building fortifications on the islands can help defend holdings and let you concentrate your ships in fewer locations.

4. Some enemies have Sea Fortifications. The best way to deal with these is with a lot of Cannon Galleons. Using other ships to distract the fire coming from the buildings will also work.

5. Population limit is set to 125.
key_value.87305:
Your scouts report:

- Your navy, or what's left of it, arrived north and made landfall on one of the islands.

- Nearby there's a village which already pledged fealty to the Majapahit. We just have to find it in order for us to use its docks.

- To the east the Kutai (Blue) control many of the smaller islands. They are mainly pirates and rely on small but fast ships. They will also use rafts filled with gunpowder.

- The Makassar (Green) live on the other side of the eastern archipelago and southwest of our starting location. They are well-fortified and better equipped then the Kutai. They mainly rely on War Galleys and Fire Ships to deal with enemy vessels but also possess feared archers for land battles. We definitely can expect them to try to raid our islands.

- Farther to the south are the Luwu (Yellow). The most technologically advanced, their island will be very difficult to capture because of the large towers defending it. They are also very accustomed to gunpowder so they will employ their vessels and towers with cannons.
key_value.87306: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: Damn these islanders and their blasted gunpowder ships! I guess we'll have to continue on foot now.
key_value.87307: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: A village loyal to the Majapahit. Here we can rebuild our fleet and bring the fight to the islanders.
key_value.87308: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: We've crippled the enemies' naval capabilities. Victory is ours!
key_value.87309: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: These islands on themselves are too small to provide enough resources for our fleet. We'll have to conquer many to get sufficient supplies.
key_value.87310: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: The first of three island nations has surrendered. The rest will soon follow. For Majapahit!
key_value.87311: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: Two enemies have submitted. Nobody can stand against our glorious navy!
key_value.87312: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: Ships have arrived to help us deal with the enemy!
key_value.87313: ‹RED›Majapahit Sailor: Our king has heard that we're having a hard time against our enemies and has decided to send us more resources.
key_value.87406:
1. You will not be defeated when you lose your main hero.

2. The Majapahit's population limit is restricted to 125.

3. Near the capital are Indian traders who will let you trade with them. They will also sell you three War Elephants for 300 gold in tribute.

4. The bandits in this region can be a real nuisance. Getting rid of them before attacking the Sunda in the city might be a good idea. Destroying their camps will stop their raids.

5. Sunda will be able to train more units using Trowulan's infrastructure. We need to capture these buildings by putting soldiers next to them.

6. Gajah Mada won't allow the usage of Siege Weapons lest we destroy the city. On the other hand elephants are great alternatives for taking down buildings.
key_value.87407:
Your scouts report:

- Gajah Mada (Red) is sitting in a small fort south of the capital waiting for his envoys to return. The fort is small and lean in resources and cannot withstand many attacks.

- Trowulan (Yellow) is the capital of the Majapahit Empire. King Hayam Wuruk has his palace east of it. The city is well fortified but not hostile to us.

- The Sunda (Blue) who arrived in Trowulan were here for a royal wedding, but, upon realizing they had been betrayed, took up arms and consolidated their position in the city. If we want them to capitulate, we must break into the city and destroy their army.

- Outside of the capital, to the west and north, are several Majapahit villages (Purple) and army bases (Green). When we reach them, we take control of them.

- Because Gajah Mada spent much of his time campaigning, the Bandits (Cyan) in this region have become very powerful. They have also been bribed by the Sunda to help them so they are very likely to attack whenever they can.
key_value.87409: ‹RED›Majapahit Soldier: Gajah Mada demands the subjugation of Sunda to the Majapahits!
key_value.87410: ‹BLUE›Sunda Warrior: That's not what we agreed upon! We'd rather die as free men than live under chains!
key_value.87411: ‹RED›Majapahit Soldier: The Sunda have the audacity to defy us! We must find a way to break into the city and kill them...
key_value.87412: ‹RED›Majapahit Soldier: We can't risk destroying our own capital so we can't use siege weapons. If we want to take down buildings, we'll have to rely on elephants.
key_value.87413: ‹YELLOW›King Hayam Wuruk: Gajah, I'm hearing some disturbing rumors. Since I trust you, I won't look further into it.
key_value.87414: ‹YELLOW›King Hayam Wuruk: The Sunda are our guests! I will not tolerate any harm being done upon them! Cease your activities now!
key_value.87415: ‹RED›Majapahit Soldier: The king does not know what's best for Majapahit. We support you, Gajah, but we must hurry!
key_value.87416: ‹BLUE›Sunda Prince: We go down with honor!
key_value.87417: ‹PURPLE›Villager: Our village is at your service.
key_value.87418: ‹PURPLE›Villager: Your wish is our command, lord.
key_value.87419: ‹GREEN›Soldier: Our military camp can be of use to you. It is yours.
key_value.87420: ‹GREEN›Soldier: You can use our docks however you please, great Gajah Mada. They are yours.
key_value.87421: ‹GREY›Indian Trader: We're on good footing with the Majapahit. Feel free to trade at our docks.
key_value.87422: ‹GREY›Indian Trader: Before I forget: we also sell War Elephants for gold. They're stronger than the South East Asian variant and can take more arrow fire.
key_value.87423: ‹RED›Majapahit Soldier: We've killed the Sunda princes! We've won!
key_value.87424: ‹YELLOW›King Hayam Wuruk: You better come see me now, Gajah, lest you want to be declared an enemy of the state.
key_value.87426: ‹RED›Majapahit Soldier: We've destroyed a bandit encampment and found loot.
key_value.87427: ‹RED›Majapahit Soldier: Gajah Mada has been wounded in battle and has to recover. However sad it may be, he wishes that we continue this fight.
key_value.87428: ‹RED›Elephant Rider: There are more bandits on the path to the next village. Let my elephant and I help you clear the way.
key_value.87429: + Kill the Sunda princes in the capital.
key_value.87430: + Kill the Sunda princes in the capital before the timer runs out.
key_value.87431: - Find a village to support your economy.
key_value.87432: - Take control of a military base closer to the city.
key_value.87433: - Tribute 300 gold to player 7 to receive three War Elephants.
key_value.88003: ‹YELLOW›Scout Cavalry: There are many villages in the area currently under control by Ming forces.
key_value.88004: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: I see... We ought to avoid open confrontations, yet we need to liberate our brethren!
key_value.88005: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: We'd better steer clear of Ming encampments...
key_value.88006: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: We've liberated the first village from the Ming!
key_value.88007: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The second village is now under our control!
key_value.88009: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Four villages are back in our hands!
key_value.88010: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: All villages in the area have been liberated. This is the first step to winning back our lands!
key_value.88011: + Liberate the Vietnamese people by destroying every Ming tower in the five villages marked on the map.
key_value.88012: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Le Loi has been wounded in combat. Let's take him back to the camp for him to recover.
key_value.88013: ‹ORANGE›Nguyen: Our family has always cared for the fate of our people. We will help to drive away the Ming!
key_value.88014: ‹RED›Trinh: Our men will fight for you, Le Loi. Together we will free our people!
key_value.88015: ‹GREEN›Monk: We have been robbed of our holy artifact! If you'd manage to recover it, we will stand by your side forever.
key_value.88016: - Capture the holy artifact and return it to the monastery in the mountains.
key_value.88017: ‹GREEN›Monk: You are the real protector of the people. We will stand by your side!
key_value.88018: ‹GREEN›Monk: We thank you for this relic, but it is not the one we are looking for.
key_value.88019: ‹RED›Trinh: The forces of the Ming are too numerous. Fighting against them is foolish! We must accept defeat!
key_value.88020: ‹ORANGE›Nguyen: We are no match against the Ming. Our country will remain under their rule.
key_value.88021: + The Trinh and the Nguyen are two powerful Vietnamese families that support your cause. They will put up a decent fight against the Ming, but are reliant on you for protection. You will lose if one of them is destroyed.
key_value.88028:
1. As your army is still just a bunch of guerrilla fighters, you are restricted to a 100 population limit and cannot advance to the Imperial Age.

2. You start without a Town Center. It would be wise to carefully observe your surroundings and look for the best spot to construct one.

3. The Ming have many fortified camps in the region. It is not advised to attack these.

4. The Vietnamese unique unit, the Rattan Archer, is very effective against the many Chu ko nu the Ming will produce.

5. Be careful while venturing on the roads. Ming patrols are abundant!
key_value.88029:
Your scouts report:

- Le Loi (yellow) and his few men have a small camp in the east. They will quickly have to prepare to face the might of the Ming forces.

- The Ming (blue) have several powerful fortresses dotted across the map. Their vast array of elite soldiers will give their best to quell the Vietnamese rebellion.

- Vietnamese Villages (green) have a number of villages, many of the being under control by Ming forces.

- The Trinh (red) are a powerful Vietnamese family located in the north and are fed up with the Ming oppression. They will fight vigorously against enemy attackers and train a combination of Rattan Archers, Pikemen, Battle Elephants, and their elite Trinh Cavalry.

- The Nguyen (orange) have a fortress in the southern mountains. Their focus will be Rattan Archers, Two-Handed Swordsmen, Battle Elephants, and Crossbowmen.

- Ming Patrols (cyan) have a great number of troops wandering about the countryside and in the villages. They will have to be dealt with in order to secure the region.

- Malay Pirates (purple) roam the seas and attack anyone they come into contact with.
key_value.88103:
1. Le Loi is restricted to 150 population because of the lack of supplies.

2. Make sure to defend the gates at all cost. Once they are breached it will be much harder to defend the fortress.

3. Most resources can be found out east so try to clear it for your villagers.

4. Due to a shortage in supplies, the construction of siege units is impossible.
key_value.88104:
Your scouts report:

- The Vietnamese are held up in a mountain fortress together with commander Le Lai (green). He will try to keep the Ming at bay but time is running out.

- The Ming Army (blue) are besieging from all sides. Their strongest presence is in the west over the river but they have also started moving into the eastern highlands. It will not be long before they completely surround the fortress.

- The main assaults from the Ming Army (cyan) will consist of Chu Ku Nu, Long Swordsmen, Pikemen, Crossbowmen, Rams, and Knights. Once more supplies arrive, the Chinese will upgrade their units and have trebuchets to tear down the fortress walls.
key_value.88105: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: Enemy soldiers are trying to breach the walls!
key_value.88106: ‹GREEN›Le Lai: The Chinese are surrounding us and soon there will be no way out.
key_value.88107: ‹GREEN›Le Lai: You should clear the eastern side so our army can still escape before we are trapped here.
key_value.88108: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: Our brave commander, Le Lai, has been wounded but I'm sure he'll return to the battlements as soon as he is healed.
key_value.88109: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: One of the gates has been breached! To the walls!
key_value.88110: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: The road east lies open. Soon our soldiers will start leaving the fortress, we must cover their retreat.
key_value.88111: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: Some of our soldiers are heading east!
key_value.88112: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: Half of the soldiers made it, we're almost there!
key_value.88113: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: Most of our soldier have made it out! When Le Loi makes it east, we'll have succeeded!
key_value.88114: ‹GREEN›Le Lai: I will hold off the enemy while you escape! Good luck Le Loi!
key_value.88115: ‹GREEN›Le Lai: I die for Dai Viet!
key_value.88116: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: Our fortress has fallen before our army made it out. The rebellion is lost...
key_value.88117: ‹GREEN›Vietnamese Soldier: Le Loi has fallen in battle. Without him the rebellion has no chance of succeeding.
key_value.88118: + At least one Castle in the fortress must keep standing.
key_value.88120: + Twenty allied soldiers must escape east.
key_value.88122: + Destroy the two towers guarding the road east.
key_value.88203: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: Before we can attack Hanoi we will need to secure some resources. There's a rice paddy to the west under Ming control. Let us take it back.
key_value.88206: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: We will need to take out those towers or else our troops won't be able to pass here.
key_value.88207: ‹GREEN›Farmer: We sincerely thank you my lord. We are now free from the Ming oppression. We will supply you with food from now on.
key_value.88209: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: The gate into Hanoi is too well defended. Let us find another way in.
key_value.88210: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: Watch out! Sink these ships before they destroy us! Then get that dock!
key_value.88211: ‹ORANGE›Soldier: We fight for mighty Le Loi!
key_value.88212: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: There's been an attack here. Hopefully the farmers are still alive.
key_value.88213: ‹GREEN›Farmers: Le Loi has come to save us! Please save our brothers in the prison camp north of here. If you need more help, there are Ming deserters nearby.
key_value.88215: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: There are prisoners locked in those huts. Let us free them!
key_value.88216: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: The bridge is broken. We will have to find another way across the river.
key_value.88217: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: We can use these transports to cross the river.
key_value.88218: ‹ORANGE›Loyalist: We fight for you, mighty Le Loi! Now you only need a healer. Seek out the one called the Turtle Monk.
key_value.88219: ‹GREEN›Turtle Monk: Blessings upon thee! I am the Turtle monk, healer of the mountain rebels. Bring me to the lake in Hanoi and I shall reward you.
key_value.88220: ‹GREEN›Civilian: We will help you. Use this building as you please.
key_value.88221: ‹GREEN›Turtle Monk: Thank you for bringing me here. In reward, take this mighty sword and some gold.
key_value.88225: + Destroy the towers on the cliff.
key_value.88226: + Capture Hanoi (Destroy all castles within the city).
key_value.88231: - Bring the Turtle Monk to Turtle Lake.
key_value.88232:
1. The enemy's grip outside Hanoi is weak and you will only encounter small pockets of resistance.

2. Take care of your troops as reinforcements are rare. Effective use of unit counters is important.

3. The jungle is thick so watch out for ambushes.

4. You have access to the Imperial Age.

5. Major enemy buildings will give much needed resources if they are razed.
key_value.88233:
Your scouts report:

- Arriving from the south, Le Loi plans to trap the Ming in Hanoi city and destroy them against their own walls. But, first, he will need to free the local population from Chinese oppression (green).

- The Ming (blue) control Hanoi and its countryside. Most of their troops remain in the city itself while the countryside is weakly defended.

- Some Ming soldiers have deserted from the army (orange) and have hidden in the thick forest. If they believe Le Loi's army is large enough to take Hanoi (30 units), they will help him.
key_value.88234: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: We've found a map which shows us were to find the Turtle Monk.
key_value.88305: ‹YELLOW›Vietnamese Commander: The fortress of Cam Banh isn't far away. We will set up a camp here where we can cut off his reinforcements.
key_value.88306: ‹AQUA›Tribesman: Help us build a mill on this hill and we will show you how to stop the Ming fleet from reinforcing the fortress.
key_value.88307: ‹AQUA›Tribesman: Thank you for helping us. In reward, we will show you a secret path.
key_value.88308: ‹YELLOW›Vietnamese Commander: Now we must hold this fortress so that Le Loi may travel on safely. Erect a Wonder here to claim this fortress.
key_value.88309: ‹YELLOW›Vietnamese Commander: Le Loi will now be able to travel south! We are victorious!
key_value.88310: + Destroy the wonder within the fortress.
key_value.88311: + Construct a new Wonder in the captured fortress.
key_value.88312: - Stop the Ming reinforcements by destroying their base in the north.
key_value.88313: - Find a way to destroy the Ming ships before they can reach the fortress.
key_value.88314: - Break the Ming trade by destroying the market in the north.
key_value.88315: - Construct a mill for the locals.
key_value.88317: - Construct a castle on the hill across the river.
key_value.88318:
1. The Vietnamese start in the Castle Age with access to the Imperial Age.

2. Beware of counter-attacks from the Ming.

3. Try to control the road to the enemy fortress.

4. The Ming walls are almost impenetrable except for the gates.

5. Try to be as swift as you can when finally sieging down the enemy's fortress.
key_value.88319:
Your scouts report:

- The Ming fortress, lead by Cam Banh (blue) lies south of the Vietnamese camp. It is heavily defended and well supplied. Troops arrive constantly from both sea (purple) and land (green).

- The Vietnamese forces (yellow) must try to prevent the enemy fortress from receiving reinforcements. Thereafter the Vietnamese must take and hold the fortress until their leader Le Loi arrives.
key_value.88406:
1. Dividing the resources between the different bases is very important. In the beginning, you will not have enough to support all three of them.

2. Losing one base does not mean defeat. You will still be able to recover as long as you have a town center left.

3. Defeating the Ming reinforcements is very important as General Wang Tong (purple) relies heavily on them.
key_value.88407:
Your scouts report:

-Vietnamese commanders have set up camp in three different locations. Le Trien is in the north, trying to stop the Ming from sending more reinforcements south. Ding Le is in the east, in between the two remaining strongholds of the Ming. His position is dire as he will be attacked on two sides. Bui Be and Luu Nhan Chu are to the west preparing for an assault on Nghe An's western gates.

-Nghe An (cyan) is to the south and very well defended. The defenders have strong walls and have stored gunpowder which gives them access to bombard cannons and hand cannoneers.

-General Wang Tong (purple) is defending the city of Dong Do (green). He has Cavaliers, Chu Ku Nu, Elite Skirmishers, and Halberdiers.

-General Liu Sheng (blue) was sent by the Ming to reinforce the Chinese army in the south. He will occasionally send supply carts and troops to general Wang Tong so it is very important to stop these reinforcements or Wang Tong could become too strong.

-Ai Lao (grey) are not directly involved in the conflict but will not tolerate us trespassing on their territory. Their armies have elephants and infantry.
key_value.88408: ‹YELLOW›Vietnamese Soldier: General, we must prevent Liu Sheng and his reinforcements from reaching Wang Tong so our troops can siege down Nghe An and Dong Do.
key_value.88409: ‹YELLOW›Le Trien: The Ming will learn to fear Le Trien's skills on the battlefield.
key_value.88410: ‹YELLOW›Luu Nhan Chu: My bolts never miss their mark.
key_value.88411: ‹YELLOW›Bui Bi: Our greatest glory is not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
key_value.88412: ‹YELLOW›Dinh Le: We will ride, either to victory or defeat. Either way we ride with honor.
key_value.88413: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: My Great King, Liu Sheng has been defeated and the Ming army coming to aid Wang Tong has retreated to China.
key_value.88414: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The enemy has lots of gunpowder stored in Nghe An. Their cannons will prove to be a real challenge for our Rattan Archers.
key_value.88415: ‹YELLOW›Vietnamese Soldier: We've managed to succeed in our mission! The Ming now find themselves with their back against the wall!
key_value.88416: ‹YELLOW›Vietnamese Soldier: Liu Sheng will keep on sending reinforcements south unless we stop him.
key_value.88417: ‹YELLOW›Vietnamese Soldier: The Ai Lao are hostile to us. We don't have to destroy them but with them gone our armies can attack Nghe An from the west.
key_value.88418: ‹YELLOW›Le Trien: I die for Dai Viet!
key_value.88419: ‹YELLOW›Luu Nhan Chu: I've shot my last bolt!
key_value.88420: ‹YELLOW›Bui Be: Sadly, the revolt will have to continue without me...
key_value.88421: ‹YELLOW›Dinh Le: Charge on without me my fellow brothers in arms!
key_value.88426: - Prevent reinforcements from reaching Wang Tong.
key_value.88427: - Defeat the Ai Lao to get access to Nghe An's western gates.
key_value.88502: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The Ming are attacking us! Hold your ground!
key_value.88503: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Attack them in the flanks, men!
key_value.88504: ‹YELLOW›Le Loi: Fight with courage in your hearts, men! The Ming are all but defeated!
key_value.88505: - It might be wise to defeat the Ming Vanguard before starting the assault on the fortress.
key_value.88506: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: The Ming vanguard is no more. Now we can fully focus on the enemy fortress.
key_value.88507: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: Le Loi has been wounded in combat!
key_value.88508: + Defeat the Ming by destroying all castles in their fortress.
key_value.88509: ‹YELLOW›Soldier: All enemy castles in the fortress have been destroyed. Victory is ours at last!
key_value.88510:
1. Prepare yourself! The Ming know where you are and will not hesitate to attack.

2. It is advised to weaken the Ming Vanguard as soon as possible.

3. Siege engines are your best friend when facing a more numerous enemy.

4. Le Loi will be fighting in the front lines. If he gets taken down, he will return to the camp in order to recover.
key_value.88511:
Your scouts report:

- Le Loi is preparing his final push to repel the Ming once and for all. He will be in control of two bases in the west and south.

- Vietnamese Allies (orange) represent the allied countryside.

- The Ming (blue) are in control of a vast fortress atop cliffs. It will take a while before they go on the offensive, but when they do, be prepared to face the full might of Chinese power. They will construct a lot of dangerous and unconventional machines to give a last ditch effort to suppress the Vietnamese uprising.

- The Ming Vanguard (cyan) possesses two military camps guarding the entrances to the fortress. They will pose the main initial threat and will send hordes of soldiers against the Vietnamese.
key_value.88512: - The Ming have constructed a secret weapons facility outside their fortress. Destroying it will be a good way to weaken the enemy.
